vMAzFxBtv8eotZW8tG3kEA.text: I stopped in last night for dinner and ordered the Asian Chicken Salad. It was the best ACS I've ever had.

FX9dpjzTQQgpcDqAmiKAhA.text: Totally remarkable food and service.  Better than restaurants anywhere else on the strip.  The most tender meat ever in the spicy ginger beef, and the Asian Chicken Nachos are to die for!  Servers never let our drinks run low even though we only drank water, and we felt like royalty with the amazing service and superior quality food.  They deserve better than 5 stars!

TeRs-uoVc5HpplLEaBb13Q.text: Debating what we should eat after a long 6 1/2 hour drive to Vegas, my wife and I decided to go to the Grand Lux Cafe because she wanted one thing and I wanted another. The best way to compromise was to pick a restaurant with plenty of diverse choices on its menu and the Grand Lux Cafe had fit this bill.   To wind down from this road trip, we needed some booze. I had originally wanted a beer but this was one area of the menu lacking a lot of selection, so I opted to go with a glass of Chianti instead. My wife drank the mojito which she absolutely loved. In fact, she wanted to go back here for the mojito alone.   For starters, we decided to go with the crabcakes along with an order of house salad. The crabcakes were fried lump crab meat and came with a side of mustard aioli sauce for dipping. I thought these crabcakes were alright. I normally like them lightly fried and these came out extra crispy from the fryer. It was not my idea of a great crabcake but it was not bad either. My sentiment was the same for the house salad.   The pepperoni pizza was oval shaped and cooked on an artisan flatbread in a wood fire stove. Just like the crabcakes, it came out extra crunchy from being slightly overcooked. And just like the crabcakes, it was about an average pizza. I would have liked more cheese and tomato sauce to counter balance this crispiness.   My wife's trout was unexpectedly great. We were worried after the pizza and crabcakes this would come out dry from being overcooked.  However, they did a terrific job seasoning it and grilling it to perfection. It was very moist and flavorful. The trout was served with a side of white rice and some broccoli.   The service here was awesome. Rating the service alone I would give our waiter five stars. He was delightful and attentive the entire time.   My wife struck gold with her entree and drink and maybe I do the same next time by ordering different items from the menu. With that said, Grand Lux Cafe definitely deserves three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piccini Chianti
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Salad with a side of Blue Cheese Dressing

3bX_t7zXuaI0YxM1QmZvrA.text: This is one of the restaurants I visit EVERY TIME I'm in Vegas, bar none!  What I like about this place is that it's open 24 hours, and serves DELICIOUS FOOD, something I find is very rare in a 24 hour establishment.    There's a long story about this restaurant, a sister-restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory (another favorite of mine)!  Apparently, when the Venetian was being built, they wanted to put a Cheesecake Factory there.  But, due to the fact that there's already a Cheesecake Factory "a few blocks down the strip" at the Caesar's Forum Shops, and the Cheesecake Factory wouldn't allow another location just blocks away from another Cheesecake Factory.  So, the developer of the Venetian negotiated a deal to open a very similar restaurant, but with a different name and menu.  I'm so glad they did that!    Favorite items here include the fried chicken and waffles (ask for regular maple syrup, instead of the "maple butter sauce" that normally comes with it), and their Indochine chicken and shrimp, amazing flavors and ingredients make this a delicious choice!  Oh, and order a box of their freshly baked chocolate chip cookies, they run circles around Mrs. Fields or any other cookies I've ever purchased, they taste exactly like the Tollhouse cookies my mother used to make from the recipe on the back of Nestle Chocolate Chips, so delicious, and tastes like they use real butter and the same ingredients you'd use if you were making cookies from scratch (not the preservatives, high fructose corn syrups, margerine or other "crappy ingredients" in the ready to bake cookie dough in supermarkets.  I get these every time I'm in Vegas!    Definitely one of, if not the best, 24 hour restaurants I've ever been to!  And I've probably tried this place a dozen or so times, food is always excellent!  I haven't found any other 24 hour restaurants in Vegas (or anywhere else, except maybe Los Angeles) that are worth eating at!  Try this place, I'm sure you'll be glad you did!

nXd1NVXSY5VpUCeVxbYqrw.text: This was my first time visiting this restaurant. I was in Vegas for a family reunion and it was my night to buy dinner. 9 of us, all adults. I had one of the best meals we have ever had in Vegas. More food than we could finish for under$250!! For 9 adults!! Highly recommend. American food with a little Asian fusion. So good.

FXwqtGLlXqbS8JGmjLUTAA.text: This was super good! Went for a birthday dinner, food was amazing.  Definitely came in handy for drunk food later that night after being on the strip LOL.  The only weird thing was the birthday dessert.  Looked like a toasted cracker with whip cream.  Nobody at the table really like it.  I had the Baked Rigatoni and a side of asparagus!

uW0WxOom_SSrvs26jddHTw.text: Amazing service and food. I highly recommend the breakfast buffet, it was amazing. Get there before I be for quick service.

-MSkQAbeqBr69w1yDWy2FQ.text: Do not go expecting a good breakfast buffet.  It was a cut and dry nothing exciting. Half of the serving platters did not even have food in them. Do not waste your time!

yaNwV9XCL3GL2Kl8L4kVIQ.text: Grand Lux Cafe has a very cheesy name and suffers from a Cheesecake Factory type menu.   However, they do not suffer the curse of "so many options - nothing most be good".   Grand Lux prevails with sensational services - my group in fact dined at two locations during our stay- due to the positive experience- both Palazzo and Venetian. Both times we received diligent and personable service. Happy hour drink and app specials are worth visiting for. A number of cocktails go from $12 to $5 during happy hour. Drinks were stout. We sampled menu items from mega dinosaur sized salads to fall off the bone baby back ribs. Consistent and tasty options that doesn't suffer from the gratuitous inflated prices of most restaurants in hotels in Vegas

3NrsXnvsKIYB6J_JhunOyQ.text: Lisa was our server and she was great. Will be dining here again. Food was tasty and served on time. Was a pleasant dining experience

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k3L6DmfzfYauTUb5WVSRcA.text: We ventured over to the Grand Lux Cafe from our hotel across the street. I had eaten here when I used to live in Las Vegas and I wanted my friends to try it. Our experience was outstanding! From the time she stepped up to the table through closing us out, Amanda K. was exceptional! She gave us great recommendations for our coffee drinks as well as several menu items and she was right when she said get the short rib grilled cheese when we asked because it was on point! The Belgium Waffle and Chicken and Waffles were to die for too(it was probably the maple butter syrup). Amanda was very professional, efficient and personable and kept the Diet Coke flowing as requested. She made our experience the perfect start to our day!

Slgpo8YIAISGHYwUFzMlRA.text: The Grand Luxe has excellent service and fantastic food. Had the parmesan pork chop on a recommendation and ... wow! Can't believe I said "wow" about a pork chop but it was great! Veggies were cooked perfectly. Will go back.

ntyp3hm0qk1OHfvDL4UPKg.text: Came in for the first time in a few years. Nikki our server was great , very personable. We had a few cocktails - Super Yummy! Our apps were good but our entries were def great!  We had the chicken Parmesan and the spicy beef. Big portions and great flavor. We will def be back on our next trip to Vegas!

ilsWmICZAzJDPAPyph2Rrw.text: Came for buffet it was mediocre & small. Staff was fairly nice. Nothing really special about this place.

69dt3AulirAuIurcumQUSw.text: Cory AKA handsome was awesome. Sense of humor but efficient but sad to say the end of his shift. Great food, big portions and great drinks. We had a relaxing time and enjoyed a variety of food for dinner. Two can eAsily share a meal.

0idjjyart0SIQHdfNo_7vA.text: Great service! Host is great and accommodating, so was the service. I loved the noodles and the extra broth. The shrimp pasta to die for.

ABQDZhVdto4nNBn1npYF1Q.text: Grand lux is the best restaurant to eat when staying at the Venetian or the palazzo it's almost like the Cheesecake Factory, but way better in my opinion, food is always on point, service is great No dress code, no appointments necessary! Always a returning customer when I happen to stay at the resort.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cHT67qQu0y_5GslRT06WHQ.text: This is owned by the same owner as Cheesecake Factory and it shows the signature through the decoration.  Food is very fusion and pretty tasty.  My fiance and I dined here for dinner on Saturday night and thought the food was decent and very reasonably priced so we came back again on the Monday of Labor Day to have breakfast.  They have a breakfast buffet with the usual scramble eggs, hash brown, bacon, sausage etc and omelette station with a choice of regular eggs or egg white.    Excellent service!  Did you know that you can have your coffee/drink to go?  Neither did we.  The wait service asked us if we wanted our drinks to go and we were like oh..sure. She went and got a new batch for us to go!  Awesome!

4GzRQcOj2-NESWKZ3VRETg.text: I give the Grand Lux Cafe 5 stars. 1st star... Service was fast friendly clean. 2nd star... happy environment and atmosphere. Date night for me and my guy. We start off with an appetizer the beef empanada. Great by the way landing Grand Luxury Cafe there 3rd star...  For the main course our choices were chicken and shrimp jambalaya and chicken pardanara. 4 stars...  The raspberry lemonade I ordered was a little on the sweet side. The check came probably, the total for 2 ,1 appetizer, two main course and 2 drinks hold up to 55 dollars and some change. 5stars...  I recommend that everyone of all ages should go check out the Grand Lux Cafe at the Palazzo.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 beef empanadas and the love of my life. Lol
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One beef empanada,delicious.In the back we have chicken&amp;shrimp jambalaya. last but not least.My all time favorite.chicken pardanara. $15.00

hLOU70XBZvTNl2-h8UqCuQ.text: This place is on the pricey end but my friends and I wanted to eat on the strip on a Sunday morning.  The dishes are pretty big and heavy on calories.    What we ordered: 1) Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato and Mushrooms (Tossed with Sun-Dried Tomato, Fresh Mushrooms, Garlic, Cream and Parmesan Cheese)  2) Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich (Grilled Chicken Breast Topped with Avocado, Pepper-Jack Cheese, Corn, Lettuce, Tomato and Black Bean-Mayo on Our Grilled Flatbread)  3) Thai Fried Chicken (Crispy Breast of Chicken in a Spicy Thai B.B.Q. Sauce. Served Over Steamed White Rice and Sauteed Vegetables)  All the dishes were pretty good.  We were happy with our orders and the fact that this place carried sriracha; I guess it's becoming more popular.  Our waitress was nice.  She did everything that was expected.  Only thing she had forgotten was the bread.  She never would have brought it out if we didn't ask for it.

q-o7_tdNNg6uuRVt0m0DLg.text: Grand Lux has been a go-to spot in Las Vegas for years, maybe even since I turned 21 and started going to Vegas. Ever since the new nightclubs and new hotels were built on the other end of the strip (Aria, Cosmopolitan, Vdara, Hakkassan, Marquee) I haven't had a chance to hang out in the Venetian or Palazzo. For almost two years I skipped out on eating at Grand Lux and went to Wicked Spoon or Secret Pizza in the Cosmopolitan.  Last week I came into Vegas to celebrate my best friend's birthday. We decided to revisit Grand Lux. I ordered two of the mini meals and enjoyed the warm bread as we waited. The service was as great as it was before, and the food was as great as it was before. I even tweeted "Grand Lux I will never cheat on you with a wicked spoon."   If you're ever in Vegas I highly recommend spending breakfast, lunch, and dinner here.

dBIOpVEhmKkRGnCO8dfv5g.text: We had an awesome time there today. Our service was amazing. Special thanks of appreciation to server Brian S. The food was definitely good, but our service, we wont forget how polite professional and humble of a waiter we had. If you do go there, definitely ask for brian s as your waiter..

x2L_dAReJ_bLJKNbpdPZKA.text: Service is great and menu is amazing! I get the kale and  avocado salad for lunch quite a lot and add chicken. They always make my order correct and I've never had any complaint about the food not meeting my standards! Deliciouso!

zOHBiQv9ffDIndwL0SVNNA.text: mmkay well im only writing this review because of how delicious my Chicken Alfredo was here. Can't believe nobody has posted a picture or written anything about it thus far (or at least the reviews I read didn't mention it).   Yes, it's a pretty generic dish to order. You're probably asking, "How tasty could it be??" I was very surprised by not only the speedy service but also how thoroughly cooked/seasoned the chicken was, pasta were perfect in length and the entire dish not overwhelmed by the Alfredo sauce.  I could go on an on, i guess just look at the picture I post and imagine it to be 3 times as delicious as it looks??   p.s. portions are huuuge

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Alfredo I&#39;ve eaten this year (2011) =p

zdNoGvDAvonSLBHuONgnrg.text: I dropped by the Grand Lux Cafe around midnight, after arriving at my hotel about an hour earlier by car. For the people working a graveyard shift, the wait-staff was surprisingly spunky. My server was courteous, fast, and helpful in deciphering the large and overwhelmingly tantalizing menu.   I finally settled on a salmon steak, and was not disappointed. It was well cooked and tasty. That said, the dish could hardly be described as a religious experience, but, then, I think my taste-buds were probably already half-dead from too much driving and not enough sleep.  This is definitely a good place for a classy late-night bite.

5WORvMa2zTPBg8ZpNTMJ2A.text: This restaurant is owned by the Cheesecake Factory, as you can see in some of the decor and plates/silverware. It was a good place to go after a show, since we could not eat at LAVO Italian Restaurant at the Venitian.  Too bad for them, huh? The wife and I both enjoyed our meal and we did not have to wait long for service or the food. Good times and we would go back for sure!

nrHTu03sQ_1HYHGG7Sfw3g.text: Its like the cheescake factory (theyre the same company), but in my opinion cheescake factory is better lol. more menu options.  Anyway,Grand Lux atmosphere is almost identical to cheescake factory, dimmed lights, marble floors and walls, nicely structured place. I think the one in palazzo has better food .. or chef than the one at venetian. Better service too.  We ordered th ceviche, which was fresh and delicious, and I ordered the jambalaya. not bad! It definitely isnt the best restauarant in town, but its good, i'd go back if im staying at the palazzo or venetian again.

GjrOAWa4jjb_McWrsvjJOg.text: I normally don't write reviews but I had such an awful experience, I felt the need to share. I am staying in the Venetian as a member of the media. My stay has been fine, but the way I was treated at the Grand Lux is one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever witnessed. Not only were we disregarded by the staff entirely, but the food was delivered over an hour after order.   When our bill arrived, no one asked if we were even guests of the hotel - which, we are.   A conversation with the manager over our concerns did not help. He only put the blame back on us.  All in all, I was given the least amount of respect as a human being deserves.   Food is chain-level. Would give negative stars if possible.

cSwq2-YEhBofMmlY9nS1Vg.text: Ok so we got here for lunch the other day got seated right away.  BUT!!!! When were taken to our table the server was sitting on our table taking the order of the couple next to us. I was pissed off and didn't even offer to clean it till I said something. Then he ends up our server.   We order and the food was great I havent had a real good chicken Picatta in a while. But the noodles weren't evenly cooked half hard half dry have soft. The soup was really good cream of chicken with mushrooms.   But when we needed or looked for our server he was nowhere to be found. The place had more bus boys then servers and they cleaned up faster then serving the food.

CNcH2zys1FnH0vJK3peMwg.text: Omg... the absolute BEST waffles I have ever had.   Crisp. ..tender In the inside.   A lil maple syrup and it melts In your mouth.   Craving for it already

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EqE0P86X5-5F22MtPsaISg.text: Read  the reviews and we were looking for somewhere for dinner so we decided to give it a try. It did not disappoint.  We went at about 6:30 on a Sunday night and were immediately seated.  The menu is very reminiscent of Cheesecake Factory in it's size Anne variety. Among the family we ordered three pasta dishes, fish and chips, and fried chicken.   We also had the calamari appetizer which comes with fried shrimp, onions, and zucchini (the latter only nominally, buy if I am ordering calamari I would rather they skimp on the zucchini than the calamari). It was really tasty and the portion was large enough that my family of five was all able to get a decent portion.  Back to the main courses, I had the fried chicken, which is usually what you will find me ordering if I is on a menu. The seasoning appears to be a simple  salt and pepper base, and it was done to perfection. Crispy on the outside, moist in the inside, not too much batter, and good flavor. It was half of a chicken with the breast deboned but the other pieces bone in. Mashed potatoes were reminiscent of CF.  All of the rest of the family loved their dishes as well. The only problem is that we didn't have a refrigerator at our hotel so we couldn't take our leftovers!

E85q0YvOiD5YnlmwEkzenw.text: Note: this is cheesecake factory's sister chain.  This was a definite turn from all the fast food and buffets in Vegas. After the club, early in the wee morning.. we stumbled drunk into the Grand Lux in the Palazzo since it was closer than walking to the Venetian. The waiters seemed more than happy to assist our drunken selves which was good.. hah. The group had burgers and salads and it was delicious.. or it could have been because we were all tired and drunk and any food was good food. Nonetheless this was the place to be at after a long night of drinking and dancing in Viva Las Vegas.

AqoalBfIrBpmrN87DVXfew.text: I believe this is the one on the Palazzo side, as they are the ONLY ones who offer breakfast beignets. I can't even go in to words how wonderful their beignets are! Order upon arrival because they take awhile to prepare. They are RIDICULOUS good! The only stop I demand when I am in town. GO!!!

fnlHKuhnA3ZNqAWVtqdi-g.text: One of my faaaaaaaavs!!  Their hamburger melt is to fackin' die for..oh mah gahd.   Delicious crunchy fries, and good ranch. I'm a ranch fiend..and always love me a good tasting ranch.   It's even delicious when it's cold. Haha.

MmYXIiYYpnfq6tsT54HxEg.text: Headline: Avoid breakfast.  While I was attending a conference at the Sands Conference Center, I came here twice - once for a quick lunch and once for breakfast.    Let's start by saying that the food is the same as every other Grand Lux I've been to - it's good, but not spectacular, and they have options for everyone.  What makes things stand out (or not) is the service.  Lunch - we had good service - our waiter was very attentive.  I opted for a soup and salad plate -the salad, as normal, is reasonable.  The soup was a nice creamy chicken soup - overall pleasing.  Breakfast the next day - seriously? A queue?  ANd thats just to get sat - expect a 20 minute wait once you get sat.  Service sucked the big one.  However, they do have a buffet, so at least you can skip the waiting for your food as well.  We went in for a quick breakfast and ended up being late to the show.  Prices - good, even in comparison to non-Las Vegas places.  If you are looking for cheap eats in the hotel, this is the place for you.  Sorry - I can only give this an average grade - it's good but not spectacular, and breakfast service drags it down.

Y5wis_SEgRukgG0crsSFOw.text: Large menu, large portions.  Probably one of the few places where the prices aren't outrageous.  Something for everyone and the food is great.  Love the location and love that it's open 24 he per day with a take out area cuz the food here is better than the room service.  Ate for breakfast and dinner and both were great, a great go to.

b7jprL71Cj_dCtJKe5aN2Q.text: They seem to have a Management/staffing problem.  Came during a non rush at 2:30 and have been waiting 10 minutes for 4 coffee beverages to be made. People in front if me (only one couple in front) weight forever for their food.  Something needs to be fixed here if they can't handle two customers.  Should have gone to a Starbucks, would have saved time even with the walk.

ul3EqxaGwTrniWeftIS7Gw.text: I heard this was a sister store to the Cheesecake Factory so I decided to give it a try . The menu was quite extensive and affordable . We got the lunch sandwich special that comes with soup and a salad and the chicken flat bread sandwich. I would visit again.

UayDXS4bUez6Aq1X4eH3sA.text: Had the lunch special of lunch size pasta carbonara and organic green salad with their house dressing.  The pasta was VERY rich.  The salad was refreshing.  This place is just like another cheesecake factory.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of salad with house dressing
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch portion pasta carbonara

MLiqwsyGErzF_7aM4pqSow.text: CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!!! Need I say more?! I think it tastes better than roscoes... The waffle is thick and buttermilky (not a word). The chicken (strips) are crunchy on the outside and juicy in the inside. Oh I can't wait to go back and try again!!  Highly recommend!!!

9ogVRQWyaJCug6bxWsjI7w.text: It's nice to have a restaurant like this in your hotel, which is close enough to drop by anytime, but not too expensive to poach your already near-empty wallet. They have all different types of food to satisfy your tastes and the portions are large enough to keep you full for most of the day. We came here for Sunday lunch and the staff here were quick to accommodate a large hungry party. The waitress was very nice and even made sure to bring out my friend's order first because she wasn't feeling very well. A few downers included items that weren't available because they ran out by mid-day, which is pretty inexcusable. The nice thing is that lunch prices are very cheap compared to dinner. A lot of people opted to get the salad, soup, and sandwich combo, which gets you a lot for cheap. I got the chicken jambalaya, expecting pasta, but got white rice instead. it was still good, but tasted more Asian than anything else despite the spiciness.  I had my eyes set of some beignets that I saw go to another table, but like I said, the portions are enough to keep you full so I passed when it came time for dessert.

e75twOQervMYez9GYBZKfg.text: My opinion : Avoid at all costs. The food was pretty bad, and we tried their pizza and asian nachos. It was pretty gross, no need to elaborate. When in Vegas and surrounded with many options, this should not be one of them.

uCNqv7IV0ErSON1T6glayA.text: good breakfast great lunch specials and awesome mojitos plus it's right downstairs so it's very convenient! i always go to grand lux @ venetian or palazzo and i'm always satisfied after my meal :)

whma6x9L6juFy5coFNX9Ww.text: Even though this is just an upgraded Cheesecake Factory, the food is so much better.  We eat here every time we are in Vegas.  The chicken Cesar salad is always a must.  They usually seat you pretty quickly, the service is always good and the food can't be beat for the price.

bRwe__g3WkyGCcIADhul4w.text: This was our second time at this restaurant and both occasions have been very good. We didn't have reservations, but were promptly seated. The service was very friendly and efficient. There is a huge menu and everything we have tried there has been great. It reminds me a lot of The Cheesecake Factory, but I think the quality of food is slightly better. The portions are very large and we never leave hungry. It terrific place for lunch if you're down by the Palazzo or the Wynn.

PN4uOzkBzH3FlKSSv0GAbg.text: I used to frequent Grand Lux Cafes no matter where they were located because of earlier experiences with the restaurant at the Venetian/Palazzo. I had a less-than-favorable meal at the Chicago Grand Lux but thought it was just a fluke. Wrong! Last week I had a meal at the Grand Lux at the Palazzo which was worse. We both ordered Salmon Picatta which took 20+ minutes to be served (tables after us were getting served faster). When the meal was finally presented it was cold, so I asked to speak to a manager. A rotund man approached the table and asked what was wrong, so we told him. He then said, would we like him to take back the meals and heat them up for us? Are you kidding?! Yeah, right, like we want our two cold meals zapped in a microwave. He should have offered to remake the meals; unfortunately, that was his only solution. That trip was the last one I will ever make to a Grand Lux Cafe ANYWHERE! This chain is owned by the Cheesecake Factory and should have much higher levels of service, quality and management. I hope the Venetian & Palazzo don't renew their leases when they expire--the restaurant doesn't speak well for the hotel which is one of the best on the strip. Oh yeah, one more thing: Get rid of that lazy, obese, ineffectual manager. He is doing the place a lot of harm!!

o3jY--36kCy3lX8i-Y7E6Q.text: Went By here based on a recommendation of a guy we met in line while buying tickets We have had all three meals here, I highly recommend the place for Lunch, the food was great, and the portions were large. We went here four times over the week we were in town and will be going back. The only down side was the perfume the Casino uses in the Venusian to hide the smell of smoke.

XlKoenZPStTBomc6vdiunA.text: I heard that there's a Grand Lux in Vegas. But I don't think this was the one. Simply because it's very small and I heard that the one in Vegas is really "Grand" topping the one here in Beverly Hills. Anyway, my friend and I dined here for Brunch and the food as expected was delicious. I had the 3 Way Salmon and I enjoyed each one. The customer service was excellent. Our waitress was very polite, attentive and accurate. Anyway, if you guys get a chance while you are in town, definitely check them out. They might not be the big fancy one, but they give that big fancy service.

rQ2eIa4JsPPKp0fjrpPk0g.text: I ordered some burger with bacon and short ribs and onions and mushrooms. There were no short ribs on it at all. But even without it, the burger was awesome.

wuyS7pXnZqSLzYSxWM3KWw.text: If you're staying at the Venetian, whether you like it or not, you will be eating second dinner at the lovely Grand Lux. Like a snazzier version of Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux will give you everything you want at more at any hour of the night. The Ahi Sushi Roll is something I always order, Caesar Salad is a classic and the Fried Calamari hits the spot when you're craving a basket of fried. Hard to compare to some of the more opulent dining experiences in Vegas, but Grand Lux is reasonably priced, yummy and most importantly the few places on the strip open 24 hrs.

sQ1CHKTxoOJSc_38n4TdUA.text: We stayed at the Palazzo, so this restaurant was a convenient stop for some of our dining as its within the Casino. I really have no negative comments here as all components of the meal were really good. Our server Marie M. was excellent...very friendly and made great suggestions. I ordered the Sunday Night Pasta per Marie's recommendation and it was fantastic and it takes a bit for me to say this for a Pasta dish but it was delicious. The other meal was the Lemon Chicken Picatta as this was very good as well. We ordered the Beignet's for dessert as you need to order these 30 minutes prior. These were great as they came with 3 dipping sauces. So overall the whole dining experience was great as I would recommend it  very highly!

P2nBm0kXA07TSnJJhyRNWA.text: While staying at the Palazzo, I ended up at this place on more than one occasion and it grew on me.  The food is pretty good, and in big portions, but what I liked best was that it was open late and this ended up being the nightcap coffee and dessert spot for my colleagues and I.  A great little place to go to in the late evening.

BzU0VL0f0VnaWE6hAnlDrQ.text: Their ribeye steak was way yummier than Bouchon upstairs! I'll be back.

JG8qBG1tb1QpPZm7yq0n0g.text: Although I've only gone a couple of times, my experience at the Grand Lux Cafe has been enjoyable.During my recent trip to Vegas, we stayed at the Venetian and ate at the Grand Lux everyday.  I like the one in the Palazzo, we didn't have to wait in line, it was quieter and seemed much nicer.  The service was great, our waiters were really friendly, and would check up on us every so often to make sure our glasses were filled. The food comes in big portions. I can never finish it.  The Grand Appetizer Platter is good for big groups, the spring rolls were delicious! I forgot what its called but they had some sort of Asian soup there, it was surprising really good for an American place (The soup is great after a night of drinking)  The kick up chili was a little to salty. Fried Chicken and Waffles was too sweet. My favorite was the Warm Homemade Chocolate Chip Pecan Cookies. Yummm Chicken Royale was good also.  The only down side is the wait, I think we waited 30 -40 mins for our food. (We did have a big group though)  Prices can be high. Their menu is HUGE! I had a hard time deciding on what to get. They have a little bit of everything.   I can't wait till my next Vegas trip so that I can try something new.

-hxdiLvgAAezNeKVk0VzqQ.text: noms:   1. Seared Ahi Tuna wrapped in seaweed served with wasabi mayo and a bean sprout salad, cucumber salad, and  carrot salad - thinly sliced seared Ahi Tuna complemented with a thin wrapping of unsalted seaweed. A perfect light appetizer to start your meal.   2. Shrimp Scampi with linguini served in a white wine sauce.  -  This dish was really delicious, albeit a bit on the heavy side b/c of the white wine cream sauce. The shrimp were huge and flavorful, and the white wine sauce had a very tasty citrius flavor to it.   3. Pinapple Mojito - pinapple was not overly sweet, or tart. However, they did not muddle th mint leaves enough to bring out the flavors commonly found in a mojito. After a few minutes of mashing up the decorative mint in the glass the mojito tasted a LOT better.   On a side note the sourdough bread served prior to ordering is quite tasty. I love how crusty it is and it serves as a great tool to sop up the delicious white wine sauce for our scampi dish. YUMMMY! I'd definitely eat here again. :D

nXnaTdh-GCZ7srFdYAQ9TA.text: You know, I really want to hate this place because it's so chain-y and mass produced and they have so damn many menu options that are all over the board.  But, I just can't hate it.  In fact, I kinda like it.  I've been here a few times for breakfast (a la carte, not the buffet) and it's always solid.  The omelets are good, and so is the French toast, hash browns, coffee, toast, everything.  I also recently stopped here for drinks (their fancy drinks are pretty good) and a late dinner, and I was very pleased, too.  Dinner is tougher because they do have so many different options.  It was hard to decide but I was pleased to see a large selection of salads, sandwiches, appetizers and smaller entrees as well as larger specialty entrees and pastas.  We were a party of six and everyone's food looked great, and everyone seemed to enjoy their meal.  I had the chicken flatbread which was well-seasoned, tasty and HUGE.  It was way too much food for one person.  I was also thrilled that they substituted tasty mashed sweet potatoes for the fries that were supposed to come with my meal and there was no additional charge.  The service is very good here.  I think they are very well-trained and they execute well, and they're friendly.  The prices are pretty reasonable, especially for the amount of food you get.  I am pretty certain I will be back here since it seems to be part of my normal Las Vegas repertoire.

_9HAGbNTpXJFUYPX56K1eA.text: nice strong coffee and great eggs benedict. all for around 18 dollars

cP_p2DnIMdNgY52lb-2J-g.text: Excellent place, great value, good food and large portions. Our favorite place to eat in Vegas. Good breakfasts, kids can split entrees, they are huge. You can get out of here for 60 bucks for 4.

RLAKuLtaULhEYLoyDfrFyg.text: If you like eating at Cheesecake Factory you will definitely feel at home in this restaurant. Service is efficient, servings are very adequate, food is not bad but not excellent,the menu selection is humongous and the ambiance and decor is good.

2FdZlf3Ly2UFJPTNixU-Bg.text: The staff was very attentive and personable.  We ate there twice during our 3 night stay.  It was delicious.  Our party had the 2 BLTs, short ribbed grilled cheese, and slow roasted pork sandwich.  If you love chocolate, you have to order the molten lava cake....mmmmmm!  Prices are very reasonable for Las Vegas.

EMGAlFzaDyVVRlFOODKGdg.text: We ate breakfast here twice... I ordered off the menu once, and tried the buffet once. Both times the service was just ok, but, notably, we were a large group of at least 18 on both mornings. We did not have to wait more than 3 minutes to be seated either day, even though only half of our group had arrived... and they continued to wander in throughout the meal.  I enjoyed Joe's Scramble on my first morning... delicious and so much of it! I felt like I had just as much food as on the buffet the next morning. In fact, most of my group ordered off of the menu on that first visit, and everyone commented on the huge portions. While the buffet does offer an omelet station, I wasn't impressed with it, nor the buffet, especially not for the price of more than $20. The omelet line was very long & I was rather hungry so I found other things to eat from the buffet instead of waiting in line. The available buffet food was very good... but simply not much of a selection. If we'd gone to breakfast for a 3rd time, I would've ordered from the menu again... that Joe's Scramble was fantastic!

Ptc9DgmwUy__Qmw9vhq7Kw.text: Hands down the worst meal I've ever had the displeasure of experiencing. For the prices for a plate the quality was mediocre. Sent my plate back twice and the " make to order dessert" according to the Manager was simply dry and unappetizing.

As4uRyjU-AtkIP9EMPO2SQ.text: During my two recent family stay cations on the Las Vegas Strip, there was a dining experience in the Grand Lux Cafe. They were grand luxury dining experiences that were reasonably priced.      Before reporting on my two recent dining experiences in The Grand Lux Cafe back in late March and May, I will bring up a few facts about the glorified cafe of the Palazzo Resort. First, the menu is large covering a selection of food ranging from baguettes to salmon and from $6.95 to $33.95. Second, the Cheesecake Factory is the parent company. That is not surprising considering how large the menu is. Third, Grand Lux Cafe features a bar plus an in-house bakery. And fourth, Grand Lux Cafe rocks. I will elucidate why on the preceding paragraphs.      The two times that my family and I dined in the Grand Lux Cafe were before a show. The funny thing is that in its own way, Grand Lux Cafe is similar to a show. The stage is an elegant restaurant and the delicious menu items are the stars. The Grand Lux Cafe dining environment compliments the elegance and luxury of the Palazzo. The marble floors, textures, fabrics, silverware, handkerchief napkins, and interior create a sense of dining in an elegant restaurant. In reality this is an upscale Cheesecake Factory. The first time we dined here we sat deep inside the restaurant with a view overlooking the bar. On the follow-up visit, we sat in the indoor patio overlooking the Palazzo casino.      On the first visit, I enjoyed the lunch special salmon piccata with a creamy lemon sauce with capers, artichokes, and mushrooms over a steamed rice. The entry for this meal was around $15. I ordered a Coke that added to the price. This meal left me satisfied.     On the second visit, I ordered the chicken parmesan. The guarguantium portion of chicken breast covered with parmesan bread crumbs, melted hot Mozzarella cheese, and tomato sauce over pasta put me on cloud 9. The amount of quality food that they served me was really a two-parter. If I wasn't on a stay cation, half of it would of gone to my refrigerator and warmed up the next day. The entry to this dining experience was around $20. Like last time I ordered a Coke that added to the price. This meal left me very satisfied.     Proceeding both meals that I had in this Grand Lux Cafe was a basket of complimentary warm house bread. Also on both visits, we had a friendly and attentive server.      When I review restaurants on the touristy Las Vegas Strip, the question is, "would I patronize the place if it was off the Strip?"  This leads into the question, "If Grand Lux Cafe was off the Strip would I patronize it?" Absolutely! The food and the amount they give you at a reasonable price inside a restaurant environment that blends the grandeur of European cafes with the American restaurant makes it competitive to many of the local restaurants in Las Vegas. Until and if they build an off-Strip Grand Lux Cafe, I anticipate patronizing this or its sister location at the Venetian in the future.

c-zgwcjhelIQM2xjYdsjhg.text: I've been to Grand Lux Cafe a handful of times now, so I think a review is in order.  Whenever my friends or family are stumped about where we should go out to eat and don't mind heading to the Strip, Grand Lux is our default option. It's one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. They have a HUGE menu. I admit that it can be a little overwhelming, but if you have picky eaters in your circle, this cafe is a great option. The price is decent for what it's worth. We've always received great customer service. The cafe is clean and the decorations are beautiful. It has a good vibe around it. There are a few options on the menu that are pretty unique. If you're looking to try something new and a little different, I recommend the asian nachos. I get them every time I visit and am never disappointed. Just about the only thing I can complain about though is the noise. It's not the cafe's fault, but they are located on the casino floor so if you came to have dinner and chit chat, it can be hard to hear or hold a conversation because you'll be contending with the sounds of slot machines and tourists.  I can't say enough good things about Grand Lux Cafe. I will keep going there and recommending them to everyone I know.

avITdz9pu3VKNVxQpjVNHg.text: Now the restaurant needs to talk to me but does not apologize on YELp?!   Seriously? You want me to waste MORE time on your website because you don't like my review that tells people you are RACIST?!

MfaIJNe3TKx1_Z7WU_3sKA.text: When Gluttony is acceptable but of course the divine Brunch at Grand Lux Cafe is the choice all for a mere  $19.50.   Just do it, so many bountiful selections of fresh lovely sweet pastries to hearty meats of Bacon, Sausage, ham and so much more. Endless bread options as well as fruit and fresh made Omelette served.   Fresh squeezed orange juice and strong bold Coffee with attentive service always has me revisiting Grand Lux Cafe for a feast, and don't worry no one will ever know, as "What happens in Vegas Stays in Vegas"

O8eVjM_95BooAKnnMJU95A.text: Located in the heart of the beautiful Venetian hotel, Grand Lux Cafe is definitely a spot to check out. It was fairly busy during 7PM on a Friday night and I got seated right away. Our server was friendly and attentive. The menu was extensive, and there was so much to choose from. I ended up ordering the chicken pot pie and shared the Southwestern salad. The food came out quickly and the salad was delicious. My chicken pot pie was very filling and I didn't manage to eat the entire thing. There was the filling on the bottom, and a layer of flaky crust in top. It had good flavor, but I think the filling could have been cooked a little longer to make the vegetables inside a little bit more tender. Overall, I had a great time at Grand Lux Cafe.

GoyDBCEeblLb530xY6JtUw.text: My husband and I hit up Grand Lux during a lunch break from the SHOT Show. The wait was super short!   Our server was punctual and answered all our questions - and didn't mind my ketchup fetish.   Bread and REAL BUTTER were so fresh - Salad was so tasty!! We also had the club sandwich with fries. Everything was so fresh and tasty.   Can't wait to go back!!

yR32ky2cvWeRESLsJ48eXg.text: We came here over Memorial Day weekend. It was our first time here and our server " Kevin" was AMAZING and very friendly. He recommended the house special and favorites which was all delicious ! But the one that stood out most was the beijnets. MUST TRY AND REQUEST FOR KEVIN AS YOUR SERVER !

tsXaJ0eEqCbfaS_M_dz1gg.text: Ordered chicken pot pie for lunch today, server Laurie K was very helpful and prompt. I asked her about the crust and she accurately let me know it was a pie crust not puff pastry. Thank goodness! Just what I was hoping for!  The chicken pot pie was good to great. I'm not a big meat fan in pot pie and it had very little chicken in it. Some others might be disappointed by that, but there was enough chicken to have some in every few bites. The chicken it's self was sometime a bit tender and mostly a little bit tough. But the veggies were quite tender and the sauce had a fantastic flavor. Mild hint of white wine, not overpowering. The peas tasted especially fresh and green so I appreciated that a lot. Potatoes soft and well done, not firm and dreadful like 70% of pot pies have. The pie crust was good for a restaurant. Flaky, tender and firm at the same time. Decent flavor on its own. Not excessively buttery or dry.  Im glad I came back because I tried this place a couple days ago and the food wasn't as good so I was nervous. It's in the Palazzo where I was staying and I'm glad laziness won out because I was happy with lunch!

9xlNFSKMeAhbsRHgsF5_7A.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place, since expectations were low for what I thought was" just another casino cafe." Luckily since Grand Lux is in the Grand Canal Shoppes of the Venetian, there's no fee to park. Taking Yelp's suggestions, y boyfriend and I made sure to come during Happy Hour. $6 appetizers and drinks! Appetizers were much larger in size than we had expected. We got the Buffalo chicken egg rolls and fried spring rolls. These and the bread offered to us was already enough to fill us up. We still had two more plates of pasta coming our way- garlic Parmesan and a lemon chicken piccata. Each was delicious!! This place reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory, but maybe even better. Prices were good for a casino, and service from our waiter Pierre was amazing. He made useful suggestions and was kind enough to look for us at the slot machines outside the restaurant when we forgot our credit card on the table. Nice place to come for a celebration- or just happy hour :-)

The chicken and waffles are a safe bet. We came here a few years ago and it was good. They've improved even further unlike other buffets that have only gone downhill. 5/5 stars for everything.

I was blown away by the classy-look and warm atmosphere and when i looked at the menu, the prices were definitely affordable! For starters, hubby and I had the duck the triangles appetizer (crispy wonton wrappers filled with minced onions, garlic and seasonings.) It was delicious! For the main dish, I had pasta with chicken, sun-dried tomatoes & mushroom... Love it!! The garlic cream sauce was really good! I ended up dipping the complementary bread to the sauce and it was satisfying. Like eating for two, it's meant to be shared. Meanwhile, hubby had the grilled salmon sandwich filled with Fuji Apple slaw, lemon aioli sauce, tomato & onion. He too was pleased with his order. Definitely coming back! Thanks Palazzo!

ZIZAonYW88_R0131M2m-jg.text: I brought my cousin here for the brunch which actually turned out to be an omelette bar and a nice Linner (Lunch/Dinner) option. There was a choice of salad, mini cheeseburgers, jambalaya, omelette bar, and a few other items.   Our waiter was nice but had a large section to wait on but she kept my Diet Coke class filled. I would say this is nice if you can make it for the earlier breakfast which I believe ended around noon? It's $20 and more of a brunch-type special.   Overall, it's good!

8bPl3r0iZX1ibXbvFud0DQ.text: Beware! They hook certain people up. We had same number of people and they didn't have to wait  but a few of our groups did. I saw one of the lady talk to a manager. Very shady.   I re-rated. Even though the wait was a little shady. The food is really good. Great prices for Vegas. Large portions. And well cooked. Almost everything we tried as really good!

uZaz6jS-AOLcumTCLEMNDA.text: I'm a little torn about this place now. Had I reviewed it a couple years ago, it would have been all positive, however, so much has changed. I've been dining at Grand Lux Cafe consistently since they opened until a couple years ago (I had previously frequented the Venetian location). Granted, I didn't frequent as often in the last 2-3 years since Las Vegas' local restaurant scene has stepped up and I found new, better spots to obsess. But, it was my visit in September 2013 that turned me away. The quality has diminished significantly and dishes that were once favorites, are now very disappointing! Also, food portions have gotten smaller and prices have remained the same (or increased). Where's the money going? One of my favorite sections of their menu is the Grand Salads. Large portions for around $13-17. My favorites are the Southwestern Salad and the Manhattan Salad. They've changed the Manhattan Salad a bit since I first had it a few years ago, but it's still good. I like the fresh beets and the large assortment of fresh vegetables and legumes; plus, the house vinaigrette is great. The last time I had this salad, however, it was oddly NOT chopped. Maybe someone got lazy that day? I'd hate to think that it's just served like that now. View photos below: Exhibit A: Manhattan Salad in August 2014 (What a chopped salad should look like). yelp.com/biz_photos/gran... Exhibit B: Manhattan Salad in October 2014 (This is what I was served just two months later). yelp.com/biz_photos/gran... I haven't tried a lot of their newer Small Salads, but they used to serve a really nice Spicy Calamari Salad. Delicious and crispy calamari and fresh greens with these two wonderful sauces/dressing. It's a shame that it's no longer on the menu. Other dishes that I've enjoyed: Empanadas, Buffalo Chicken Bites, Double Stuffed Potato Spring Rolls, Buffalo Chicken Rolls, Crispy Thai Shrimp & Chicken Rolls, Pasta Pomodoro, Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Jambalaya, and Indochine Shrimp & Chicken. Oh, their New Orleans Beignets are fantastic! They're made to order, so you'll need to order in the beginning of your meal. They have a great batter and I love the sauces: Jack Daniels Creme Anglaise, Raspberry, and Chocolate. The creme anglaise is magic and I love mixing it with the tart raspberry sauce. It's divine. Their burgers are good (or at least they were good the last time I had them). Thick, juicy Angus burgers that are cooked to order (medium rare, yay!). I've also enjoyed their sandwiches. My go-to sandwich used to be the Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich. I ordered this staple again during my visit in December and it was TERRIBLE. I just don't understand what's going on! I've had this sandwich multiple times and there have never been any issues. The sandwich was messily assembled and there was NO flavor. I think they may changed the mayo (website shows black bean mayo?) because I'm pretty sure it used to have a spicy element that gave it zing. They should probably rename the sandwich and take out the word 'spicy' because now the only "spicy" ingredient is the pepper jack cheese. More disappointment: Their fries used to be so great and now they're horrible! Also, I recently tried another one of my go-to favorites, Chicken Pot Pie, and it has strayed so far from what it used to be. Such a shame. I just had the Kale and Avocado Salad (Fresh kale, avocado, spicy roasted poblano chiles, black beans, feta cheese, onions, toasted pumpkin seeds, and citrus vinaigrette) on my most recent visit last month and it was fantastic! I couldn't believe how great it was after so many disappointments recently. It has restored a little faith. I doubt I'll attempt any of my old favorites again in fear of more disappointment, but I do still like GLC's salad selection. I'm just hoping the next time I order a Manhattan Salad, that it is indeed chopped.

LaCcikrPnDjRvYH8muUtJQ.text: Service was terrible.  Seated in a booth in the back, and forgotten.....  Tables seated after us were served well before us, asked for the manager and given the excuse that that our order choice caused the delay; which was a breakfast sandwich...really!!!   Apparently two slices of bread and eggs is difficult....  not happy.

lb-2xYhnjhsXnpSNBZiZ2A.text: Date night? Yass!  I came here on a date with this awesome sweet guy! We were seated and our server came and took our drink order, Our server was super sweet and lovely and he recommended apps and gave me feedback on the entree choice.   I ordered a strawberry lemonade that came with a sugared rim. The lemonade was very tasty and refreshing. For and appetizer we had the buffalo chicken egg rolls, because they were out of wings! Our server said they were yummy, and he was right! The wrap itself was light and crispy and delicious and perfect! The inside was a chicken breast mix with hot sauce and maybe cream cheese mixture... sooo stinkin good!!!  The entree I ordered was the Madeira Chicken which was basically sauteed chicken breast topped with asparagus (which I subbed green beans bc my date is allergic to asparagus!), mozzarella and their mushroom-Madeira sauce, think Marsala.  The side was mashed potatoes, and they were just ok. My friend got the Chicken Royale  which is lightly breaded sauteed chicken breasts served over a white wine butter sauce w/ mashed potatoes, green beans and carrots. He said it was very tasty... plus he ate it all up! LOL.  We were stuffed so we did not opt for desert. Haha!  The food here is just ok, I feel it needed a little more seasoning, but our server was super sweet!  Yay!

mcus2l4EbHFt5LJjn1Pf4w.text: Awesome service here.Portions for breakfast excellent.Save your money no need to eat at buffet.Order off menu.Server was very attentive.Sorry didnt get his name

8vYJFHeu2cASqLUYTNkUPw.text: We booked our stay at the Palazzo through American Express travel, and as part of the deal we get $60 per day dining credit for breakfast at the Grand Lux.  We went this morning and were very impressed not just by the food, but by the service as well.  We had the breakfast buffet.  All of the items seemed so fresh.  The omelet bar was great, with plentiful ingredients and customization using oil or cooking spray, eggs, eggs pre-scrambled or egg whites, even eggs cooked to order.  The hash browns appeared to be freshly shredded.  The oatmeal looked like steel cut.  The fruit was great quality too.  Our server was great.  Even though we had the buffet, he went out of his way to make sure we had anything we needed.  When I was looking for oatmeal in the buffet area, it was out.  Our server brought me a bowl when it was ready.  He went above and beyond!  We get to return the next two mornings, and I hope the experience will be just as great!

Yl_hUFuEI1Dea3cjBa_c0A.text: This is like the 4th time here, every time we visit Vegas we come and enjoys the delicious dishes. I like that is open very late and they have a great extensive menu, atmosphere is very nice, great for groups because they have very big booths. Shrimp scampi was exceptional and omg the carrots are so delicious cooked to perfection, we'll every veggie is cooked just right. Really recommend the Royale chicken and the shrimp scampi.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chicken Royale and shrimp scampi

js3IFtOXFLsVRCCmmbAlQQ.text: Zen noodle is a must here - taste similar as Vietnamese chicken noodle soup but with a slightly sour distinguish taste ..love it!  This restaurant starts with warm and great bread, kid meal (grill chicken) is really good - very nice family restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S0m8CrmA1XSukaU1G1IzJA.text: Tasty food. Nice staff. Kitchen made several mistakes including forgetting several ingredients of a salad. No issues to fix it. Prices are fine for Vegas. Salmon sandwich great.

JNxU2U1--1bPzA6E20tc-A.text: Came in with a huge appetite, but left unsatisfied.   My friends and I left the place feeling disappointed because none of us enjoyed any of our actual entrees. We had ordered a Burger, Omelet, Pasta Dish, and Salmon Dish, which all ended up in to go containers because it was just not tasty (especially for a 4-star restaurant).  Food 2/5 Service 5/5  BEIGNETS - 5/5!  DO ORDER THESE. sossoso good! Especially their homemade syrup.   Their beignets are the only reason I would ever return to Grand Lux Cafe.

vQIcC6Rcyi9wgxyrI95fnQ.text: This place is really wonderful!  It's deceivingly huge, so they get you in quickly. Very efficient and very friendly service! It's very affordable for Vegas! And the food is phenomenal!  It may not have a TV Chef's name attached to it, but I highly recommend it.

Q0zAz1x57WigjZmR-lMZLw.text: We had breakfast this morning and we loved it!  Walked up to a bit of a line around 10:30 but waited less than 5 min. I ordered Eggs Benedict and it was cooked perfectly. The hash browns were crispy and no greasy!  My husband had an omelette with a red chile hollandaise that he loved.  We also split a Belgian waffle with strawberries.... I don't care what else you order but add a BELGIAN WAFFLE to your order.  The syrup is a dolce de leche with butter concoction that is indescribably good!!!! It's the best waffle I've ever had and we're going again tomorrow morning for another.  The strawberry mimosa was yummy too.  The restaurant is very busy but service was still good. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belgian waffle with strawberries

NI2SPh2OdGJJd4-0R1Z5fw.text: You can NEVER go wrong with Grand Lux Cafe. Morning, Afternoon and Night I could have this place. I love the food! The portions are hugeee and just delicious! We ordered red velvet pancakes one morning omg I couldn't even eat the whole thing, they were beyond amazing especially with the cream cheese frosting, drooool!  The omelette was good however we have had better and the hashbrowns were average, you even get toast and a bagel.  Another day we ordered the chicken jambalaya with noodles, damn they were good a bit on the salty side but delicious.  This is an absolute must for me every time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet chocolate pancakes. Mmmm yummy
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rPxpSI2cKJjoE3AipvuPSw.text: Meh.  If you're a tourist on a budget looking for a good place to eat at a relatively low price this is NOT the place.  If you're a tourist looking to eat at one of Las Vegas' renowned dining establishments this is NOT the place. If you're a local on a budget this is NOT the place.  If you're a local looking to splurge this is NOT the place. Fairly mediocre food prepared in a decent fashion.  But it's about $2 too expensive for a sandwich and about $5 too expensive for a dinner entre.  I do enjoy their short rib grilled cheese sandwich and patty melt (it's called something else but whatever). But every time I pay the bill I wonder why the hell I chose this place.   Still...the food quality is fine.  Fries could use some work though - they are pretty brutal over there.  Stale maybe?   My advice?  Pick someplace else.  If you want something cheap go to the Venetian food court which is literally a 5 minute walk away from the Palazzo.

Q_7BiCnju2Ms-6KzeB557g.text: Grand Lux is a solid place to eat.  The service sometimes lacks but it is made with the food that you get.  The portions are big and I have yet to have a bad experience with the quality.  Now it is more of a casual place to eat considering it is in the Palazzo and they have a bevy of high quality places to eat.  So if you wanted a high end place, take it somewhere else in the Venetian or Palazzo but if you want something to cater to a lot of people with different tastes and what not you can take them here and they will find something to their liking.  The menu goes from Asian to Italian to your regular meat and potatoes.  So if you are in the mood for something that you can't exactly put your finger on, stop by here and I'm sure you find it.

EswKENCRXoFPZ6Xa81cOCQ.text: I have been here for late night dining (4am) and brunch. What I enjoy are the generous portions. What I like -- design your own omelette and the clam chowder! I can not say enough of the clam chowder! Unfortunately, it may only be a "soup of the day selection".   If you are going only for the clam chowder, then you should call ahead to see if they have it. You don't want to waste any valuable time walking there while you could be throwing dice at the Bellagio or wherever suits your fancy.

uHBTR_Rkdvakx9odqx34lA.text: Yummy, finally spaghetti, with roast.  So much food, with Bobby and Annie.. Vacation for. Whole week here, hopefully we will be winners.

nJILoCL1QLUo2fPvP4A9yg.text: Grand Lux is the bomb for late night eating! Hugh menu featuring almost everything for everyone. My favs are the Fish and Chips, Prime rib sandwich! Portions are huge so be careful!!!

uJHurkDmmqkspHVKIFtmmg.text: Delicious food. Great atmosphere.  Huge menu selection. 2 locations, one at Venetian, one at Palazzo. VERY reasonably priced. Same owners of Cheesecake Factory, need I say more?

yTkm4KE9gvcnd8tJUiYDSg.text: Good for large parties -- they only took 5 minutes to seat our party of eight, and we had no reservations (this was a Wed night).  Entrees were about $15-$20, and were huge -- enough to feed 2. Comfort food, made somewhat healthy.  People were generally pleased with the dishes they had, but there was no wow factor.  This is a crowd pleaser though -- if you have a big group or picky eaters, they'll find something on this menu, be served relatively quick with good service, and you'll be happy with your meal.  I'd go back.

sfuQvpaSknd_Vk36V7EP6A.text: Ate here twice during my stay in Vegas because the price was good and there was a good amount of food given. I haven't been to the cheesecake factory but this place is pretty good.   Ahi tuna salad - was just okay. It was wrapped in seaweed, and the tuna was seared just right. However, the accompanying sauce wasn't memorable. The greens were plain greens. I expect some color and flavor but it was rather plain.   Short rib sloppy joe - delicious!! The only problem with this dish is that a clogged artery or a massive heart attack may occur. The meat was really tasty but really salty. It's served with butter bread. It's basically bread saturated in butter. Very bad for you but oh so delicious.   Spicy buffalo chicken flatbread - very delicious but isn't spicy. This is a great dish because it's healthy and very filling.   Burger - their burger really hit the spot for me. I love burgers and was definitely satisfies with my angus burger with added sauteed mushrooms. Excellent!!  In general, this is a great place to go to when you want to watch your wallet and still leave full. It can get a little pricey but a tab foe four people today at lunch came to only $51. That's exceptional for being in Vegas.   Is definitely come back.   P.S. Their limoncello lemonade is really delicious.

O_yKBhE9V5MhCaMHGPFigQ.text: Mmm, the breakfast was amazingly good and fairly priced. The omelettes are huge and filling. Chicken and waffle are yum. Spicy bloody Mary to die for. Perfect breakfast.

5XpK8TRDB-Rz9yKqX4rGyg.text: I'm a fan of the Grand Lux and actually had a dinner party here several  years ago. It is of course owned by the Cheesecake factory so if you like their cuisine then  you will be in for a similar treat.  This place could easily be a 4 or 5 star place for a casual/nice eatery but it seems as if they try to turn some of their food into the food of a much more upscale establishment. This isnt bad necessarily but its often executed not quite as great as they probably hope! Maybe i'm too simple but when I order a salad I expect to be able to eat lettuce their caesar is large leaf lettuce, nestled onto each other with sparse dressing and two pieces of cheese and no croutons.. really.. REALLY... its a salad.. cut me some slack. Plus their food isn't as flavorful as cheesecake factory, which I dont consider their food super seasoned soooo... its hit or miss but generally not bad..  Id go again, but I wont go out of my way to return!

qeNtlZqmZeVmENGqH6oPLQ.text: I ate there w/my family... it's great for families, groups, and couples... very similar to cheesecake factory. It's probably not the best place to order Filet Mignon, but they do have some great pastas. If your a meat lover go for the sunday night pasta. If you want something that's light then go for the Pasta with Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella.... or you feel something creamy Pasta Carbonara is really good too.... I really enjoyed my dinner there even tho the food was pretty average, i just loved the fact that my whole family was there and enjoyed our dinner together..

ZHIBjioJJsykTY4v7kkH_w.text: I really like the Grand Lux, and I am so peeved that we don't have one in the Bay! Even though this is a chain I think the food quality is superior to most chains. Upon entering you do get the "Cheesecake Factory" feel, but the food in my opinion is much better. When I visit a Grand Lux I try to go for lunch, prices are great. One of my favorites is the grilled salmon with mashed potatoes and veggies at $13. To top things off you must get the box of cupcakes to go, moist chocolate cupcakes with decadent frosting....mmm...mmm..good!

s7rGzU5b67mMEn-SQb0bzw.text: Located in the Venetian hotel, this is their coffee shop and it's much better than the average coffee shop in a hotel. We normally get the buffet breakfast for about $16.  We got there later and decided to try a lunch menu.  I had the burger medium which was very good.  Good seasoning to the meat and it was pink in the middle.  Didn't have my camera.  The fries were crispy good too.

uqBTiBUq1vMUnHfCikg0Vw.text: pricey for a breakfast spot, and food was not spectacular.

wSRi4q2WTOMfY0qObnR9vA.text: Not bad! My friend ordered an artesian margherita pizza here and it was simply divine. No qualms about any experience here. Can't wait to come back for a quick bite. Definitely will be my choice for a quality but non-frou frou place to munch at while in Vegas.

U2TZId1VSrYXBFj_RObfog.text: 1st time eating here & I'm impressed!!! Both of Aunties work @ Grand Lux Cafe (Venetian & Palazzo side) so their recommendations were right!! Ate the mini tacos (only @ Palazzo) & it was DELICIOUS!!! Waiter was friendly & knew his menu.. The setup of the restaurant is nice & huge.. Love it!! Will definitely eat here again..

FriDWPWU3jhkARCtdZDATA.text: Staying at The Palazzo, stuffing your face with delicious hearty-portions of take-out doesn't get any better than Gran Lux Cafe. This particular location is a bit smaller than the location at The Venetian, but they share the same exact menu.  Grand Luxe Cafe at The Palazzo is about 50 steps from the guest elevators...so phone in an order from the room, take the elevators down to the casino level, walk for a minute and BAM your food is handed over to you right off the bat.  Given that the pricing was great for such huge portions of food and the convenience of its location, I ate exclusively here during my last Vegas hop. It doesn't hurt that I tried something different at every meal session (Breakfast, lunch, dinner) and everything tasted GREAT. The blood orange mimosas here are pricey ($9-$11 for a champagne flute sized glass), but the PERFECT way to start off a lazy hung-over morning.  Highly recommended items on the menu: duck pot-stickers, pasta carbonara, calamari appetizer, and four-cheese pizza. Hell, I'm going to assume ANYTHING on the menu is worth a shot and won't disappoint.  It's too bad this location closes at midnight as opposed to the 24/7 location next door at The Venetian.

2vvOlyBcCjA_Pi9T_y1D0w.text: I've eaten here several times when in Vegas, and the food is consistently good. This place is related/linked to the Cheesecake factory, so if you've been there, you'll find the Grand Lux menu and pricing familiar.   When on my home turf, I wouldn't consider the Cheesecake Factory an expensive eat, but I wouldn't call it a cheap eat either. However, by Vegas standards, the Grand Lux, for the quality of the food served, is quite moderately priced. And I love that it's always open. In Vegas, when you're out late and hungry at 2am or later, that's awesome.  I've tried a few things here and everything has been good, but most memorable was a grilled cheese/short rib sandwich I had for lunch one time. It was literally the best grilled cheese sandwich I'd ever had in my life. It's the only way I ever want to eat a grilled cheese from now on.

LYYjmAJKIms5OLK6EncpYQ.text: First, I want to say that the food is good.  I'm a fan.  Never had a bad meal.  We had such bad service that they lost points on that.  The Palazzo location is rolling out some new menu items--test marketing if you will.  My friend and I ordered off that special menu.  I ordered a couple of tapas and she ordered the Bourbon chicken (I think that's what it was).  I should also mention that our server was lovely.  Very personable and courteous.  So, we ordered.  We waited about 20 minutes while chatting and out came the manager with my tapas and said to my friend, "We're out of the chicken.  You'll have to order something else."  First of all, our server didn't even know that they were out of that dish.  Secondly, and this is a big second, almost everything on the menu is chicken with just a different sauce so I have trouble understanding that but maybe they ran out of sauce.  So, here's the problem:  I now have my food and my friend doesn't.  I offered to wait but then my food would get cold.  I offered to share with her but she's not an adventurous eater--no eggplant croquettes for her (but, boy howdy they were good).  So, she watched me eat and I watched her eat.  Our server came by and was shocked at what happened.  We didn't ask for any consideration but no service recovery was offered.  I just thought it was really bad form to bring my food out and then tell my friend she wasn't getting hers.  I am told that this little girl was just promoted to manager from a position as server.  I spoke to another restaurant manager during my stay in Las Vegas and I recounted this experience.  She responded that it was wrong on all levels.  Grand Lux, you may want to offer some training when you promote people.  I'll be back because I like the food but I'm sorely disappointed here.

TubEeYQVNkSaoykkwqWALg.text: First off let me say that I had a to-go order. The 3 stars may be a little on the harsh side for their overall service since I've never experienced the regular dining areas.  I had two simple orders. 1 Chicken sandwich (bun), 1 Chicken flat bread sandwich. Both orders came with fries. As I was told the wait would be 20 minutes, I ventured back out into the Casino and signed up for Palazzo's Players Card. I came back in 15 minutes on the dot to ensure I'd be receiving my food nice and hot (or so I thought).   My flat bread sandwich was pretty good. It had nice flavor and a generous size. I was told the other sandwich was good, however the fries for both were not only cold, but chewy and dry. Whether they typically don't take much consideration for take out orders, or because their organization in the kitchen needs work: I'm not certain because I've only eaten here this one time. For such a basic order, I can't see myself rating them any higher. I might eat there again one day because of convenience, but if that experience doesn't turn out better, you can bet this place will never get my money again. Plenty of other options in Vegas.

688BSnS127k_vrstxPRrFg.text: Here's an interesting fact:  Grand Lux Cafe is owned by The Cheesecake Factory!  This makes sense as the menu is very expansive and they have a large dessert case in the quick serve station up front.  The food quality here is very good, I had chicken lettuce wraps and a side salad, both which were very good!  Prices are a little more expensive than Cheesecake Factory, which is understandable considering its resort location.  I can't say I'd go out of my way to come here (hence no 5 star) but it is a very plausible option on the north end of the strip.  Careful though, a lot of times there is a wait here.

dQPCUADRBDY4euydrZLLdQ.text: I went to the restaurant last night. My husband and I were very disappointed. We ordered Soroma salad Kobe burger as usual. There are so many spoil lettuce inside my salad. We tried to take them out while we're eating, but it's too much. Then we stopped and let the server know about that. They sent someone to talk with us before they took it out from my check. The first thing this guy question us is if we know the lettuce. ( of course! We knew the lettuce and we also know fresh and spoil vegetable). Next, I started my burger. I cut and eat my burger. I suddenly saw the blue green chemical stain on my plate where I just cut my first bite. I stopped again and asked for the check. We didn't say anything until we paid. Then I told the server about the chemical stain. I felt very pissed this time when he reply me. "I think it might be the dishwasher chemical", he said. He doesn't seem sorry or any thing about my food was sit on the chemical and I ate it. In my opinion, i own 4 restaurant in town.  I don't think the dishwasher wouldn't leave the stain like that. I think it might be some cleaning product or something when they spray nearby the plate because my lip and my cheek feel numb right away while i's driving back home. In short, this cafe wouldn't be my favorite restaurant anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chemical stain on my plate where I just cut the burger!

NIWbam5Gx4-K7zkkQd79eA.text: 2 stars for some halfassed service. It was 5am and the place was empty.... the server seemed a bit off too... dragged his feet as if he was half a zombie. Food took foreverrrrrrrrr, asked for straws 3 times, needed napkins, bill took forever, omg.   On a brighter note, the chicken lettuce wraps were good and filling. Didn't feel so guilty for eating at 5am :)

n089_Nb2igBN1EaW4m5LgA.text: Vegas always has so many places to eat so its rare to find a place I would go back to. I am happy to report I would go back to Grand Lux Cafe which can best be described like a CheeseCake Factory. With a large menu containing a variety of items you are sure to find something to eat.  I went with a bachelorette party of 12 and all 12 items coming out of the kitchen looked really yummy. From their pizzas, to the pastas to the Asian Chicken Salad I had, I heard nothing but good remarks from all the girls. The portions were huge and the girls had a lot of food to take back to the room but it turned out perfect after a night of clubbing! I really enjoyed the cocktails too. My carmel apple martini was devine and just perfect tasting. Good eats, good pricing and good service!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Chicken Salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carmel Apple Martini

Pjp4aTGHrJwZgJ4H-QfS4Q.text: Excellent food and great service which isn't always what you get in Vegas. One of the few restaurants in the Palazzo with a kids' menu.

whkVlKkDKLNAj_EexSaWbA.text: If you like Cheesecake Factory then you will like Grand Lux....Similar food and same owners.   On my most recent Vegas trip my friends and I stayed at Palazzo Hotel. Since Grand Lux was located there it was a convenient place for us to go for some food.  I came here for breakfast with my friends. For breakfast they offer a breakfast buffet, which is a pretty good deal and they food is good too.  I went here again for some late night grub and their pasta dishes were really good. My friends and I got the Chicken Alfredo and the Pasta with sun dried tomatoes.

aavb_MngWcOvhzdOR8jLIg.text: ate here twice while staying at the palazzo due to consistent yummy food and convenience. we had a great lunch when we first arrived on saturday.  i ordered the bbq chicken rustica pizza and side salad and mr h ordered the southwestern salad. we were satisfied with our meal and the service.    the following day we enjoyed the breakfast which was called grand lux express breakfast. it's not as extensive as the buffets on the strip but a perfect variety.  the cost is 15.95 and it includes: fruits, granola, croissants, mini danish, muffins,assorted breads, omelettes,eggs, sausage & bacon, potatoes, fresh juice and coffee.  overall solid food and great peach bellini.  unfortunately i did not take pics of the breakfast since my phone was down but i did of our lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H5-1csvRMSk_H5kr-rDqiA.text: Update: I did go back and had the sandwich again! It is just fabulous! Food and service was awesome again.  Also tried the key lime pie, which was delicious.  Great cafe.    Must try the turkey and Brie sandwich! FABULOUS! Also had mashed potatoes and Mac & cheese. I know carb heaven. Food was delicious and the service was outstanding! Would definitely come back.

5U32GKJvEL4rnP5j5qlLag.text: The first time I went here was for my 21st birthday, and I returned for my 22nd!  The waitress I had was amazing.  She kept a genuine smile on the whole time and made us feel very welcome.  This time nothing was wrong in the kitchen so we got to pick from the entire menu.  They added new things such as a menu based on portions and I ordered the salmon picotta.  It was one of the best tasting dishes I had while I was in Vegas.  This is really a 4.5 review but only because I wish they had something more for the birthday dessert.  It was a delectable flaky snack, but a kind of cake would have been nice.  It was free though, so I can't complain too much!  Will definitely be back next time I return to LV.

OLRZY-dItAumadkF3dyjxQ.text: I was going to skip on reviewing this place, but it keeps popping up on my front page and the more I think about it, I'm like OK, OK. It deserves some attention.  I didn't eat in the main restaurant. We picked up an order to-go since we were just upstairs and did not feel like getting dressed for dinner then having to change to go out. We ordered a pizza (tried to order Hawaiian but they were out of ingredients for a Hawaiian..WHAT? Who runs out of that stuff on a SATURDAY?) and pasta. We thought it'd be enough for 5 girls. It sort of was not...so order more! Pizzas aren't giant and round. They're oval and not enough for my canyon of an appetite. Anyway, they said it'd be ready in about 20 minutes. I went downstairs after 25 to, you know, play it safe. WRONG. I waited another 30-40 minutes after I paid for our order before actually getting it. There were people waiting ahead of me too so they were probably waiting even longer!  The food wasn't awful or anything. I think I was severely put off by the fact that I sat there waiting for an eternity when they told us 20 minutes. The food is okay, not SUPER pricey, but I felt a little underwhelmed with the non-giant pizza. (I'm just greedy.)   It definitely is convenient if you're staying in the hotel and want take out though. I'll give them some credit there. Next time, I'll probably order elsewhere unless they can guarantee their pick up times.

9AydQyBORrtXSItw6c3lgw.text: I really enjoy eating here.  The prices are very reasonable and the food is good.  I recommend the protein breakfast in the morning.  Very good.  When staying at the Venetian or the Palazzo, I nearly always have breakfast(s) here.  Lunch and dinner meals are nice also.

V_gvRqvHqHReh1htE06UCg.text: I had an unpleasant experience. I was with my parents and we asked for the table. They said we should wait for 5 mins. There were so many empty tables...but They did not tell me why we needed to wait. I assumed they needed to set up our table. two Caucasian women entered into the restaurant after us and they asked for the table. And the server came to them and she got them a table... I told them we were here earlier than them but they told me they walked in blah blah... To me, what she was saying was nonsense... Doesn't make sense to me. They did not say sorry to us... What a service they said.. And The server showed the table and we set. And I told her again about this matter. And she did not response.. So I asked two ladies were having a bar seat. They got the dinning table not seating in the bar... We were upset so we left the restaurant.. Their excuse was not even clear. If that is their mistake and accepted their mistakes, then i would understand. But they did not accept their fault and apologize to us at all. They stared at us when we left the restaurant. Horrible experience I had... I was here to enjoy my vacation....

lUFEBK4Fo7qexcCv9tI87g.text: Palazzo Grand Lux Revisited"  Seems like Grand Lux (whether Palazzo or Venetian venue) is up and down. This time it was up. All six of us enjoyed our meals.
