Portions are large enough to share, and two of our group did share a salad and entree. So large, they didn't come close to finishing it. Service and food were both good.

_Cbwmvynp0oHudXwNrDo8Q.text: We went here for a quick lunch for my friend's Bachelorette. The setting reminds me of Cheesecake factory.  We got a large table and I ordered the Corned Beef Hash that isn't necessarily hashed and the hash browns were cold and a little stale. The eggs were done okay and over easy as I asked. My friend ordered the Chicken Parmesan and had to return it because there was a hair in it. My other friends also ordered the Corned Beef Hash but returned it because the meat was not edible. The waiters and waitresses served our food promptly but also forgot our bread that we ordered.   The food was less than mediocre and did not satisfy us at all. We walked away paying for overpriced brunch items that could've been found in a run down diner away from the strip.

rOpu4YweRvJ1cB-oo922VA.text: Omg I love this place. Whether you're in Palazzo or Venetian, Grand Lux Cafe is a safe bet - open 24 hours, reasonable prices, and the food is great! My absolute favorite appetizer to order is the baked potato spring rolls, combining two of the best possible appetizers together. Crispy skin on the outside, cheese and potato on the inside, and lathered in sour cream and green onion. Simply delicious!  Tip: If you're ordering to-go, they have a cafe adjacent to the restaurant. You have to order through them, the hostess in the restaurant won't take to-go orders. Try to phone-in your order because the wait is pretty long.

Y-KPWFhZJVtoRDJunYiWhQ.text: It feels like you're eating in a slightly-less overrated Cheesecake Factory.  Huge menu, no standouts, nothing bad either.  We have tried a few different dishes and really, I don't think you can go wrong (or be very impressed, either).  Three stars is a pretty accurate description.

wUk3nnPgSbf3Zh1ZXrT8uQ.text: Do you like The Cheesecake Factory?  Yes? Ok, well, take the Cheesecake Factory, put it in the Palazzo, and make it a little fancier and add top-notch service.   Voila! You got Grand Lux Cafe.  Yeah, so this place was really good. When I was able to finally getting over my hangover, I headed down here for a very late lunch.   I ordered the Seared Rare Ahi Tuna Salad and it was probably one of the best ahi tuna salads that I have never had. It came with romaine lettuce, radicchio, frisee and avocado mixed with a ginger miso dressing. It hit the spot and I was totally satisfied.  Service was fantastic. I got seated right away. Waitress was super nice and attentive.   I would come here again next time I'm in town for sure.

SJWeEHyR9c_dbOiwO9KmBA.text: I love this place. The best cafe in Las Vegas. This location is located in The Palazzo, which is a lot less busy, but closes "early" (at least 2am). The other location is in The Venetian, and is primarily the same, but open for 24 hours.  Most Vegas cafes suck. Maybe a tad better than Denny's, but for those prices... It better be freaking better than Denny's.   The quality of the food here is fantastic, and I haven't had a bad meal once. They have everything from salmon, burgers, short rib grilled cheese... You name it. Great lunch prices. Good drinks. Complimentary bread.   If you're looking a restaurant without paying $40/person, this is the perfect place.  I heard it's the same owners of The Cheesecake Factory, and if it's True, I'm not surprised. Similar quality. Nothing wrong with it!

lKEosKPr82ijI4iBwzy3Og.text: When the Grand Lux in our mall in CO closed, we lost our favorite happy hour place. Now we fly to Vegas once a year to enjoy some Asian Nacho goodness and Potato Spring Rolls. We love being able to enjoy a date night dinner of delicious food for under $15! Check out their happy hour times and menu online. There's also another location in the Venetian.

j--WXfhUC9uymmMewYorsQ.text: We went for dinner, but was able to order from the lunch special because it was before 5pm.  The lunch portion for the Chicken piccata is huge.  I don't know how one person can finish it all.  Since you're at Vegas and you're most likely a tourist and don't have a microwave for the leftovers, so it's better to share one dish.  They give a lot for a good price.  The bread that they give you is warm and soft from the moment you get it from the basket.  it's not the typical french bread.  It's like a wheat bread with a sweet taste.  I constantly would ask them, "more bread, please."  Definitely need to try the New Orleans beignet, the sweet and puffy pastry with some powdered sugar.  Along with it, they give you three sauces to dip: chocolate, raspberry, and jack daniel sauce.  The service and atmosphere is very nice.  Our waitress was attentive.  There are two Grand Lux Cafe, one in Venetian and one in Palazzo.  Only the one in Palazzo has the New Orleans beignet.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken piccata
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets

JAH0E10aLZIw8ABNh-4LTA.text: Hanging out with a couple of buds and they swore by the waffles at Grand Lux. So we leave our hotel at the Wynn walking straight toward to The Venetian. We approach the Grand Lux that was no wait time at all the waitress was nice and courteous she took our order and we ordered none other than the waffles for the first time. It was my first time but my friends swore by it. So I try the waffle and oh my God it comes out its golden brown right amount of crunch on the outside but clean and moist on the inside. We sprinkled some pecans on the top with some maple butter syrup it was like a desserts. Although it was very delicious I felt the texture to be a little weird in the mouth. But it did not take away from how absolutely delicious is was. So the pair with his waffle we had the battered shrimp it was okay it was more Brady earlier than I would have expected it to be but nonetheless it was delicious. Now my friends waffle came with chicken strips which were delicious however the skin kept falling off of the meat but it also did not take away from how delicious it was minus the fact that it could have used a little more seasoning. Now what I recommended absolutely. Now what I drive another four hours to get here and no. Whichever you decide I hope you will enjoy the chicken and waffles at the Grand Lux or the shrimp have a blessed day.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle

KbKzcV0NkRUNauZyL12YOQ.text: Another great meal at the Grand Lux Cafe. Was surprised that the restaurant was full at 9:00am on a Saturday morning. Our waitress, Sara S., had great energy, was knowledgeable, and extremely courteous. I will definitely return to the Grand Lux Cafe!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits with Gravy, Scrambled Eggs Whites, and potatoes.

F8gjNyQ7LHQH4WF8lQndDg.text: Great foods. I believe they own by cheese cake factory Corp. we love their breakfast buffet, cheap and easy to get your morning fix.

Qn9OXdxeaSN91FS_BNyM1A.text: Everything I've tried here is so good. Good, reasonable priced restaurant with a variety of choices. I come here every time I'm in Vegas.

saSi19onqakyMehOmh0lkw.text: We always make it a point to visit the Grand Lux Cafe whenever we're in Vegas as it never disappoints.   They have a very extensive menu with something for everyone (but not nearly as overwhelming as the Cheesecake Factory), the service is always solid, the quality of the dishes are good and the portion sizes are hearty. They also offer free bread, which is amazing, so that's a plus.  The restaurant itself offers a slightly more intimate vibe as it is dimly lit and if you're sitting towards the back you totally forget about the chaos of the casino outside.   Some of our favorites include both the salmon piccata entree, zen noodle soup, the chicken lettuce wrap appetizer, and the chicken madeira although I doubt you can go wrong with anything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zen noodle soup - lemongrass chicken broth with rice noodles, chicken breast, bean sprouts &amp; Thai basil.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon picatta lunch special.

FwNhiH_cjj3_C7fvswpsCw.text: Such an amazing dining experience. Very knowledgeable, attentive and extremely polite waiter. Best place to eat in Palazzo casino. Huge menu to choose from. Portion are huge and food was phenomenal.The price is fair for  The amount and quality. We had Asian style grilled salmon and apple walnuts salad and calamari,  everything we ordered cooked so perfection so fantastic. The food was incredible delicious. We will definitely return.  Highly recommend .

Mju62iDPwAcdCn78sXJj_w.text: This place is situated inside The Venetian and they have two locations inside. This place is great for breakfast between 6am-11am. There are better options elsewhere for lunch but the Grand lux takes the cake for breakfast. The staff is friendly and wait time is usually 5mins which is pretty great. Food is fast to serve.

XhyNcLV0L4jTPMdaRVPlIA.text: While staying at the Palazzo we came to Grand Lux for breakfast and lunch. This place reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory. I was told that this is a sister company to them but they don't have the Cheesecake although outside of the restaurant I seen a place connected which sold pastry and other desserts. Anywho!  We arrived for breakfast about 8:30 a.m. and walked right in but a hour later there was a line. I'm not a breakfast food person but I did get hash browns, bagel, cream cheese, chicken sausage and a coconut pineapple cream spritz. Everything was excellent! When we returned for lunch another day there was a 5 minute wait and our waitress tried to put us at the tiniest 2 seater table in the restaurant which was located between 2 families where we would be bumped by people squeezing around us. I immediately told her to find us a booth. She stated we would have to return to the hostess station to be reseated. Another 5 minute wait... No biggie but I could tell the hostess was agitated by my request because when she did seat us at a booth she just put the menu's on the table and walked away. Soon after a waiter came and I ordered the bbq wood planked salmon with mashed potatoes and fried Brussel sprouts... This was a amazing meal... I stuffed myself. The best bbq salmon I have ever had! I will always come back and order that dish when I am in Las Vegas. I had a 5 star meal and great service but the hostess needs a customer service attitude adjustment.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QqeHmjKTIwS7lFH76dB94w.text: The grand Lux is a great place to grab breakfast and some chicken and waffles. I always stop by here at least once on my trip to Vegas. Same a Cheesecake Factory. But feels like a much better quality.

yiabXGGBmK-Fce6Dhte7yQ.text: I'm a lot happier with this visit this time to the grand lux. The service was great. The food came out looking amazing and I was satisfied with how the food tasted. Grand lux has an amazing menu, I always have a hard time choosing what I want but this time I went with the bbq salmon. The salmon piece was huge. I felt like the bbq was a little overwhelming but the mashed potatoes and corn on the side were great. I also ordered a side of fries which came out fast and was great as well. My whole family loved all their dishes! I am excited to come back again sometime.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9AEyHUckiWIBmGL4h0YzeA.text: Horrible salad. Seafood salad wasn't fresh and the manager even said salad looks fine for him. 4 star restaurant but service is 1 star or they should get no star for service. Manager and server not helpful or give a s*** about how customer feels.  See the picture of shrimp.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad. The shrimp wasn&#39;t fresh.

E7BYA9qJboRMZ3KWfU4yBQ.text: Keto or low friendly? (I'm not a dietician)  Yes. Massive menu. I think it's related to Cheesecake Factory.  For entrees they comes w mash potatoes, I asked it to be replaced w steamed veggies.  My mom loves rice so for her Lightly breaded chicken dish, I asked the mash potatoes to be replaced w steam rice. Shrimp scampi served with linguine (by request) is a great dish!  We were in Vegas and was too hungry... didn't get to take pics :)

N-xNEoClO1RwO8USaoG3Nw.text: Worst customer service experience ever! The waiter just wanted a tip and we had an item that wasn't fresh or good. We orders a seafood Salad and the lettuce was soggy and the shrimp had some mold. The waiter then says we didn't do it early enough. We then talk to the manager and he said that's normal. Look at your food and don't let them lie or intimidate you in ordering another item. I was furious with the service and won't be coming back.

bdHLQzJM5ofZy4jefAatfw.text: Such good service here! The food was also good. I had the shrimp scampi. Noodles were okay but the shrimp was delicious! I'm very picky about seafood but this hit the spot. My friend had the Nashville chicken which was great. However, only get it if you can handle tobasco type of hot sauce. The fries were delicious! The ranch that came with it was soo good.

pqCDjz9aHJvlJmup3RJpiw.text: Good service, friendly server. Our hotel accommodations got us a free American breakfast that was plentiful. Very close to Palazzo if you are staying there. Nothing exceptional in what we ate but nothing uninspired. Service was quick. There can be lines, saw big lines at 9:30-10am.

1GkxeYNIUnoqRQdMhBxfZw.text: Very disappointed with breakfast buffet:  - Poor choice of food (scramble, bacon, ham and some fruits) I would never expect a "Motel 6" type of breakfast in the 5 star hotel - shame on you! - The quality of omelette ingredients (Not fresh, looks like it was cut couple days prior) - The person at the front didn't know what to do with a coupon Palazzo provides (Turned out you can only get a coffee and couple pastries) which is useless for someone who's Gluten Free...  Im sure they have great items on the menu, but this review is for their BREAKFAST BUFFET ONLY

MpmHnOlf6mNwLYs1DDAneA.text: This is the place you want to go for breakfast if you are staying at the Palazzo. Not much more expensive than Denny's, amazing food, and you don't have to leave the hotel. Biscuits and gravy were incredible, delicious juevos rancheros, and you can't miss the beingets.

5T9d5nLmpi_EYTZH0tmEnA.text: This is a happy medium of the highest order. The breakfast food, from bacon to omelette to waffles to pancakes, to orange juice, is outstanding.  The service:  always perfect.  Surprisingly, the pricing is 20% less than its competitors, places such as the garden terrace at the Wynn, cafes at the Paris and Bellagio, and most notably, Bouchon at the Venetian.    The strawberry waffle with whipped cream at the grand luxe coupled with the truly hand squeezed orange juice, were every bit as good, if not more pleasing, than the equivalent items during my last several visits to Bouchon.  The orange juice is $7.  So, I'd abstain from that next time.  Las Vegas offers 2 breakfast categories:  off strip "down home" diners and elite, casino eateries.  The former are generally heavy, semi-unpleasant truck stop sorts of experiences.  The strip ones, both at the Wynn, Cosmo, Paris, Bellagio, etc., are outstanding, but grossly overpriced.  I cease enjoying my vacation when I have to spend $35 for a basic breakfast.  No thanks.    The last 4 trips of mine to Bouchon were met with arrogant staff, good, but not extraordinary food, and ridiculous pricing, each time getting my order screwed up.  The pomp is so pervasive there that I decided to forever boycott the place. You get tired of apologizing for your clothes, ball cap, or small luggage items brought.  You grow weary of begging the host/ess for a table near the windows.  Once seated, you're perched on this odd velour pad that's sliding all over the place and inches away from other hip cool elite diners.  No privacy. No thanks.  As for me, I'll continue coming to the Grand Lux.

Cuv6WVLSNJDo697G05zthQ.text: If you're from California, don't eat here. This is our first time here and we all find it to be a big disappointment. I was expecting similar quality as Cheesecake Factory (which is the parent company that owns this restaurant) which is OK, but the culinary here is definitely several levels below and it is subpar.  We ordered simple sandwiches and they were so bad. I didn't think it's possible to make a bad sandwich. I'm pretty sure they doctored these reviews in order to produce such a good rating.

LZlx7WiApCPwGh69cO48Jw.text: Excellent, wonderful, awesome is all I have to say.  This place is the  From the eggplant fritters to the water they serve you cant go wrong with anything on menu. Everything is always good and the best beignets in all of Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best @#$%en beignets in all of Las Vegas comes with sauce raspberry, chocolate and creme anglaise.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmesan
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The family favorite Eggplant fritters wonderful

k_RdTBZruCS8hdfqt5zRYA.text: I stopped in for lunch and didn't know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance and attentive wait staff. I ordered a club sandwich and salad, both were very good. A guy at the table next to me ordered chicken and waffles, that looked amazing as well.

9-oaRTSbOzVJQYpeAkglSQ.text: Price is right, food is expected, service is remarkable. We will end up eating here more than any other location because of the value.   Had the enchilada special and oofdah it felt good to have something I love to eat that wouldn't break the bank.   Suggest to have the server order for you. Great items and fun to explore the menu without having to make a choice!

Ib6IMpE3rstU7NxY_DVqrQ.text: It was very busy but we were seated right away, our waitress was extremely friendly I had a brisket grilled cheese and it was AMAZING. My boyfriend had a burger and he thought it was great. Complimentary bread and butter always sweetens the deal and the price wasn't bad, it's about average for most restaurants. Overall great place to eat!

54Cc8SjVSdyMil9sD5X27g.text: Comfort food--Eggs to order, fresh fruit, bagels, etc. in their breakfast buffet always make me happy.  I love the tall chairs at the bar.  However, their is something about their wonderful shredded hash brown potatoes that I truly love, and of course their thick cut bacon.  I also cannot forget their coffee and fresh OJ.  If they had a location in Manhattan I would need to work nights!  Grand Lux Cafe is part of the formula that I love about the Palazzo/Venetian!  Venezia!!

HMTHbJkp7m2042WMzbc_kw.text: Food was good.service was great.i loved their strawberry smoothie most . I wish it would be better if there is candy on the table.

PeGe18TmI6wGciLKhRJ_sg.text: How many appetizers can fit on one table? We aimed to find out. Between the three of us we ordered:  Grand Calamari Potato Spring Rolls Pastrami Reuben Eggrolls Short Rib Tacos Buffalo Chicken Rolls  We tried ordering the Duck Triangles, but they were out. Too bad. They sounded really good.  I probably won't order the Grand Calamari again. It wasn't bad, but there is so much more that is scrumptious to say the least. This is Cheesecake Factory's cousin and there are some cross over entrees, but most of the food is different, but somehow familiar if you are a Cheesecake Factory devotee.   My favorite by far were the short rib tacos. Very flavorful and I love the tortilla which seemed to be homemade. They weren't thin little floppy things. Second place were the Pastrami Reuben Rolls. So good!!! I love that they used pastrami rather than corned beef. Pastrami has a deeper flavor that was needed. The Buffalo Chicken Rolls are better here than at Cheesecake -- less breading/shell and more chicken filling.  As if we didn't punish ourselves enough, we ordered two entrees. The ginger beef is tender and tasty. It's even better as a leftover. Normally there wouldn't be leftovers, but seriously. There is no way we could have eaten it all. The other entree was the Cafe Beef Wellington. I liked the dish, but since it isn't the traditional beef Wellington, why not experiment with different, more flavorful cuts of meat?   And for dessert ... we are such pigs ... we couldn't make up our minds so we got the butter cake and the apple pie/tart. Get them both, even if it kills you.

J6LeF1i89lE4_q7SanW13w.text: I don't usually write reviews but their breakfast is delicious. Personal favorite is the breakfast quesadilla. You will not be disappointed. Didn't experience a long wait time since my gf and I went there early.

YCEd9lEryAb7ORnAKYGsvA.text: Food:  Lots of options. It's owned by the same company as CheeseCake Factory so they have really similar menu options. Overall my party did not have any complaints with their dishes.  They also offer all you can eat breakfast options.   Service:  Our waitress was great! She was very energetic, outgoing and funny. Quick and tentative.   Atmosphere: Beautiful restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with chicken and garlic cream

I6jx1xBJmuox00x2vtuH9A.text: We had the Short Rib Tacos and French Fries w/ Ranch... These were really good and i was sober so you know its True. A must try!

haCk9uELU-RNl7eutqajtw.text: Love love love this place.  Huge portions, prices are  low .   Spicy flat bread chicken sandwich !!  Awesome!!  Buffalo springs rolls !!  Yes please!!   BBQ chicken salad.  Why yes I will have a bite!!   Plus they are 24hrs !   Can't say anything bad!!

O3qNICZoPc7AVQUKbBMTfw.text: We've been in Vegas for two nights and we've already eaten here three times.   This is an absolute excellent place in the Venetian that's open late (maybe even 24 hours) and has an expansive menu that's got something for everyone. The food is pretty high quality and fairly priced.   We're always seated quickly and served immediately. The service is always friendly and cordial.   Tonight, we came here after a horrible experience at Homestead Steakhouse at Ceaser's (don't go there if you want steak, ever) and we were satisfied, just as we were the past two visits.   I'm on a no-carb diet and they were accommodating every time. I ordered a burger with no bun and they even wrapped it in lettuce for me! Same with the chicken sandwich, which was phenomenal. Plus, they've got a great happy hour menu!   At the Grand Lux, you get pretty damn good food at a low price. With all the places to eat in Vegas, it's gotta say *something* that we've eaten at least three meals here.

DZvfEMrrZAnlYoXNYNvLPg.text: 5 dollar happy hour wonderful sliders,double stuffed potato rolls Thai chicken and shrimp spring rolls pork tacos  and drinks, wow great it's a must

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 dollar happy hour

nQb80pCQYdY9YJPKME8h5Q.text: First off, our stay at the Palazzo was excellent.  I've left a separate review for the hotel itself.  We dined here because it was so conveniently located for hotel guests.  It's basically right around the corner from the guest elevators.  But since it's off the beaten path from everything else, it's not as busy as the Venetian location.  We took quite a while to pick out what we wanted and place our orders.  A few minutes later, we were informed that they did not have the baked rigatoni that my wife ordered.  Sigh; fine.  In the end, she went with the beef wellington.  Since she's pregnant, she sadly decided to order it cooked medium (hey, better safe than sorry!).  Unfortunately, when she cut open the meat, we realized it was practically rare.  Now I understand we're being a bit paranoid as any bacteria would be on the outside of the meat, and as long as the outside is cooked, it should be safe.  But c'mon, we even made a big deal about asking for it medium and the waitress got the message loud and clear that it was because of the pregnancy.  And then you just sear it?  So on top of not having her first choice, this blunder exacerbated the poor experience.  Not being in the mood to wait any longer, we asked that the beef wellington simply be returned and removed from our check.  My wife did order a fruit bowl to go.  A manager came by and apologized on behalf of the restaurant and said he'd make sure the chef got the message.  I wasn't necessarily expecting the fruit bowl to be comped, which is good because it wasn't.

Yiry45cpQXcTcQvuTVW99A.text: Unfortunately, the highlight of our meal was the drinks (although ridiculously overpriced) and the Asian Nachos (appetizer). Seriously, that is the only thing that salvaged this potentially 0-star review.   The Crispy Calamari & Rock Shrimp were very chewy and tasted undercooked. I could literally taste the batter and immediately sent it back.   Entrees: I ordered the Korean Fried Chicken "Burrito" which was the epitome of lackluster and bland. And to top it off, the only side pairings for this dish was the choice of a house side salad or fries; not complimenting at all for an Asian-inspired dish.  My boyfriend ordered the Bourbon Street Chicken which turned out to be BUTTER fried chicken topped with mashed potatoes. He immediately ran to the bathroom to regurgitate just a few bites of it because of the ridiculously high butter content of this dish.   To make matters worse, the manager never even made it a point to visit the table to offer an apology or even "check in" with us are having sent TWO items away.   Definitely our biggest let-down of a dining experience in our 6 days here.... And we even had to ASK for bread halfway through our meal because none was ever brought out to us.  Moral of the story, looks can be deceiving. (See pics)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland Korean Chicken Burritos w/ generic fries and my boyfriend&#39;s Bourbon Fried Chicken, swimming in butter
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty but overpriced Blood Orange Margarita (about $13.00)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undercooked Crispy Calamari and Rock Shrimp Batter :-(

NNluIznqWCwE05lzjTFjcA.text: The draw to the GLC is its convenient location, its variety of offerings and its reasonable price point (for the Vegas strip).  I ate here twice while staying at Palazzo in early March -- breakfast and a late lunch. There are a few zones to this huge restaurant, a "terrace" that is on the casino floor, a bar area, a main dining room with buffet. Mostly booths for seating options.  For breakfast I wanted something light...so naturally I ordered biscuits and gravy. The portion was massive with two biscuits, two eggs, breakfast potatoes and lots of sausage gravy. The biscuits were a little dry, but the gravy was good. Fresh squeezed OJ and decent coffee. Mom got a traditional egg/bacon breakfast that she thought was decent. Similarly huge portion.  Lunch was equally decent. We both had sandwiches. I had a tasty Reuben. With some crispy yummy fries. Don't know if it was that I really needed to eat but that combo hit the spot. Again, massive portion sizes.   It's not a restaurant that I'd seek out, but it's definitely a more quality option than most of the strip's standard buffet or cafe offerings.

3_Khzf6ljqZ3YwRH50whwQ.text: Had dinner here before Baz show which is next door, fast service. we had a variety of appetizers that are tasty and more that enough: ceviche , mini tacos, mini calamari. The Chicken royal was excellent if you're hungry and want something filling

kMpuuSkJBU8Ss9364kxlKA.text: Tried this place while visiting Vegas and the egg Sandwich and waffle were amazing! We enjoyed it so much we went again the next day!

4s5akDjRHcprlqnSFxy3YQ.text: DO NOT EAT HERE! A roach crawled on my feet while dining. The manager had the nerve to offer us free pastries to make up for it...and tell us an exterminator was scheduled for the upcoming Tuesday. It was one of my worst dining experiences, and I was appalled at their inability to try to right the wrong by offering breakfast pastries.  The apps were lackluster and cold, the mojitos barely had alcohol in them, and the whole roach thing made me not even want to finish what I'd order. This is very basic American fare with not much flavor or excitement to it.

o5-tO5WJosaRZdLa6JcQHg.text: This place was recommended to me twice this weekend - once by someone who worked at the Palazzo when I asked for a to-go restaurant to get takeout, and a second time by friends when they last stayed at the Palazzo. They stated that Grand Lux is owned by the same company as The Cheesecake Factory, so it's essentially the same.   My friends and I ordered takeout on a Saturday night on a holiday weekend. They have a separate little space for takeout orders and pickups. I ordered the chicken pot pie for dinner. Our group order took about half an hour, which wasn't too bad considering we had six or seven orders. Since my chicken pot pie was a to go order, it was essentially deconstructed, with the contents of the pie, the crust, and the bread separate. The portions are huge and way more than what one person can consume in one seating. The taste of the pot pie content was very distinct, almost like how cream of mushroom or Alfredo tastes from the jar. It was decent to me because I was hungry, but embarrassing to say I still prefer Marie Callender's chicken pot pie over Grand Lux Cafe. My friends ordered a variety of items and my one friend who ordered the kale avocado salad liked the portion as well as the taste.   Overall, it seemed like Grand Lux Cafe was just OK. If it is the only option, I wouldn't dread having it again. However, I probably wouldn't seek it out.

SLkEx-p2mTdVehyvpK-NTw.text: Grand Lux Cafe is an upscale coffee shop. They have a wide variety of food selection and alcoholic drinks. We decided to have dinner here with my cousin in town and we all can't decide what to eat, so where else to go but a coffee shop!  I ordered my usual miso glazed salmon and this time it came with a heap of brown rice. My husband ordered the pasta with grilled chicken, tomato and mozzarella. My cousin ordered the rib eye and her husband ordered salmon three ways.  And for dessert we ordered a few to share, New Orleans beignets (one order came with 6 or 8 pieces), warm rustic apple pie and warm butter cake. They were all so good.  The reason for the four star was that their floor is always slippery. I don't know if it's oil on the floor but definitely not water. This is on both locations inside Palazzo & Venetian.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The desserts...New Orleans beignets, warm rustic apple pie and warm butter cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon three ways
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak with asparagus

NEmlSnnKqbYUD2zhbX7qCw.text: Been there 3 times...had the salmon dish that is cooked 3 ways.  I asked for it medium rare and it was perfect! Delicious and will go there again!

x6rAkcDw3TqThrlBLFP6mA.text: Had a decent breakfast - ordered scrambled eggs, replaced the Hash Brown with sliced tomatoes, bacon and toast ($11.95). The eggs were decent and the bacon was crispy. The white toast was a bit burnt and dry. Overall, it was a bit pricey for such a basic breakfast but we are in the Palazzo. Service was pretty quick. Okay place for breakfast, I wouldn't come running back.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. eggs, bacon, toast and replaced potatoes with tomato.

OpVtvq5mfyISwo10WT8Weg.text: it was slow glassware had water spot the silver wasnt polished went for late night dinner i wasnt feeling well.just got married first dinner out with my wife. i took 2 bites out off a ribeye i order as i tasted it it didnt taste right i had to go to the restroom couldnt find one i threw up a little as i came in i was kick out by the bald bearded manager instead of asking me if i was ok or offering anything to help my upset stomach, he was really rude i was taken by surprise by his attitude for a hospitality professional than he tryed to make pay for something i didnt eat in a to go bag. i refused to pay since he kicked me he threaten me by saying he will call security if i didnt pay in other words worst service ever this will never happen at omni or any other 4 diamond resort i recommend you let him go or transfer him to work security or complete retraining as he followed out off the casino trying to security for help for his lack of training ticket number 2284 server ahmet time 23:52

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K-HRXuxPgHkx494kLfTQhQ.text: The food was great! I had the Thai chicken, which was delicious. The wife order the fish and chips which she liked and it was plentiful. We will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Thai Chicken!

cHnNOPE5rlugQ9rF8byEHQ.text: If you haven't experienced Grand Lux Cafe you are nuts!! Every single time I come here, I've had an excellent experience.   Here is a list of my favorites:  1. Asian Chicken Nachos.  Fried wontons, Wasabi sour Cream, and more!! 2. Buffalo Fried Chicken Tenders- Chicken that is shredded in a crispy shell! 3. Any dessert, GLC is owned by the Cheesecake Factory except its ten times better!!  So that's saying something. Last time I had the Molten Chocolate Lava cake.  I had to order it in advance since it takes 30 minutes to make! YUM!!  And Yes I rather go for appetizers than anything else but my bf had the cornbeef hash for breakfast and it was not the fake "from the can" crap like other diners.  This was the real sfsdjafo!!  Hope this helps and I LOVE VEGAS!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Molten Chocolate Cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front view

05-9EPAOiM98gYBRohXgYA.text: Thank goodness there are TWO GLs.  The Palazzo location is much quieter and no lines!!!    Yums: Duck Potstickers Max Burger-a MONSTER, can fill 2-3 adults!!! Zen Noodles-White meat Pho, I like healthy versions of anything.  Hours: They close about two hours earlier than the Venetian location.

Fm4SynUYoYVK0hSvts7jFw.text: If you are looking for a quick and relatively cheap meal this is the place for you.   We went after a long night of drinking to soak up the river of liquor we consumed. The menu was extremely diverse and reminiscent of their father company - The Cheesecake Factory.   We ended up getting a burger and their spring rolls. Yes an odd combination! Refer to the drinking heavily note above. Both were fine and hit the spot.

k8_bC2NZVmoeScv3Kx6TOA.text: More impressed than I thought I would be. The food and salads are great, nothing fancy. I also did the buffet for breakfast one morning, and it was good. No complaints about this place overall.

7QioxlDDt9n0aIdcVS-RzQ.text: The only reason I only gave it 3 stars is because the wife and I only stopped by for dessert.  We ordered the Molten chocolate cake and coffee. Are you kidding me?????? I know its only a molten chocolate cake, but damn this was one extra tasty molten chocolate cake.  It took them about 20 minutes to finally come out with it. Which was a good sign that they did not just heat up a pre made one.  It was so warm and a bit crispy served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Your taste buds will moonwalk with joy.  As far as dessert goes, this place did not disappoint.

-duhH-3l_LT8IC8HoLsddg.text: Since we stayed at the Palazzo, we had our last meal at the Venetian Location. This is definitely one of my favorite places to eat now since the service, location, decor, and food is so bomb. The waiter and waitress helped us out alot by giving recommendations, making sure we were good on drinks, and getting our orders right, ahha. Didn't give us bread though! But it's okay, can't be too picky.  Got the Chicken Jambalaya with the jalapeno Cheese cornbread on the side. SO GOOD. Chicken was juicy, rice was well cooked, and the sauce was so bomb, the cornbread was super good too! props on presentation in a tiny skillet. I definitely recommend this dish.   Seriously an overlooked place to eat, I'm all about it. I think they also have Sunday buffet. Maybe next time!

VBa9ulYf1BKDyRdfd3TA6g.text: The food here is really good. It is reasonably priced. The service is very slow. It's not that they're moving slow. They're actually moving pretty fast. Everything just took a long time. From bread to water to drinks, etc.  Good for a nosh if you're not in a hurry.  Upturned face

_RTZD3ElqYj28AW0ggZGtA.text: I LOVED this Grand Lux! It was fabulous. We actually went because the one at the Venetian was closed at around 11PM so we walked across to Palazzo to get here.  I was very impressed with how pretty this Grand Lux was. It didn't even feel like a Cafe at all.  I had the tomato soup with small sandwich and it was a delicious combination =) We also got their chocolate cupcake with vanilla ice cream dessert which was super delicious, but a little too heavy to have at night.  Prices are right and ambiance is high-end - wouldn't give it a second thought to come here again while in Vegas!

Cy8O9sS29XKNDGpwKqC4OA.text: I heart this one soooooooo much moreeeee than the one in Venetian!!  It's the same great atmosphere and great food, but it seems to be much quieter and less crowded. It's also humongo inside too.  I got the shrimp scampi, and those shrimpies were HUUUGE!! They were also breaded, which I didn't like too much, but after removing the breading, it was quite tasty. My friend got the short rib grilled cheese, and OMG soooooooo good!! I want to go back to Grand Lux just so I can order that. Their bread is the best too, I seem to fill up on that alone. FOr dessert, we shared their creme brulee duo and nutty chocolate caramel cake thing. I think I may have come close to getting a cavity, because they were soooo sweet. So sweet in fact, that I only had a few bites of each. They were delish though!!

IFUb0von2yNP2FBCfW3PyQ.text: Love grand Lux cafe the menu is exceptional there breakfast is divine if you have trouble picking something for breakfast you can also try their buffet what a great variety of well prepared food service is excellent their chicken Madeira for dinner doesn't get any better

rmPEMPW-ThcjalY8fnXiiQ.text: Food took forever. Good bread hot n soft w delish butter. They ran out of lemons and took 45 minutes to bring us ...three salads and a soup. On Saturday. Also we had to ask for bread after 20 minutes. When we asked about our food, the waitress gave us attitude!!! I mean, yes you are pushing 50 and you have too many tables but suck it up! You're at work!   Food was ok tasting, not delicious, the crab salad has occasional specks of crab. Oh chain restaurant in one of the most heavily trafficked casinos in Vegas, WHY CAN'T YOU GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER????

Qzv7L2jLG6QUXQsj4PSxjw.text: First time at the Palazzo location.  Sat at the corner table in the bar section.  The waiter seemed overwhelmed and no smile.  Ordered white toast to go with the omelette but toasted sourdough bread came instead.  Told by waiter they don't have white toast, instead toasted sourdough bread was served now.  Doesn't sound like something should happen at this location.  Decent food, not impressed this time though

tYmDvqGPPhR03kxNrD3Ljw.text: Came here for a Friday night dinner with a group of 10.  As a registered guest of The Palazzo, it was a convenient option.  We were seated quickly, less than 10 minutes. Food selections and ambiance match that of The Cheesecake Factory.    Grand Asian Chicken Salad was average.  For a chain restaurant, I prefer the salads at California Pizza Kitchen.  My husband had the Zen Noodles, which we both thought were tasty, but insufficient for a dinner serving size.    The plus side of the evening was the quick and friendly service, even with our large group.

AxFU6oSkLbnxPy2f4MxrkQ.text: Ok, so this place is in a casino/hotel. I had family in town and they stayed here this past weekend and I tagged along. We visited this Grand Lux on a Sunday after a night of drinking and dancing... So that results in 3 tired, hungry and hungover females.   Decor is real nice, what do you expect? It's at the Palazzo! Their menu is just like the Cheesecake Factory. A gazillion pages to look through. Yea, maybe when I have time but it's too early and I just wanted something simple so can I get straight to the breakfast menu?   Our service was slow. I understand, it was during a time when people are checking out and getting ready to leave Vegas so they were pretty busy but most of these people were eating at the buffet, why the heck did it take 45 mins for us to get our food?!?!?!   Anyway, I order the Eggs, Hash Brown & Sausage Links thing, yea I don't remember the name. When we finally got our food the eggs were tasteless, hash browns were so salty and the sausage links were OK. Food did the job for me, considering I was hungover and just needed something in my stomach but it fell short of my expectations.   Would I go back? It's convenient because it's in the hotel but I don't know, still thing about it...

62-Rq3k1T97nVOyQWM-2Gw.text: Yup, yelp is right. Pretty much a scaled down Cheesecake Factory, but a bit more sexy (if that's possible).  The menu wasn't as overwhelming as CF, but had just what we needed. Kiddo got the BBQ pork sliders.  It came with 3 and were really pretty good. Tangy sauce and cool cole slaw on top and perfectly priced at $6.50.   Dinner for me was the short rib grilled cheese sandwich. This too was satisfying, and the arugula was the perfect addition to the sandwich.  Service was great: efficient and quick, and I do believe I had 3 refills, none of which I actually had to ask for. That's how it should be done.  +1 for the soundtrack during our stay. I heard Maxwell, India Arie, and John Legend for starters: my own personal playlist on repeat.

UCaOimqtr01Bf8S6iWL5gA.text: We stopped by Grand Lux Cafe to grab some breakfast right before my gf headed back to the airport to fly back home and so that I can get serious about the real reason for coming to Vegas, the first day of my work related conference.  I ordered the typical breakfast... Eggs, Sausage, Hash Browns with Toast and a coffee. The was food is what you might expect... average. Not bad and not good. Just plain and ordinary. That isn't a bad thing on its own except for the fact the service is slow and prices are steep for what you are getting. Yes, I get that this is Vegas and you are going to pay Vegas prices for just about everything, but having had an awesome breakfast the previous two mornings for the same price.... you start to ask yourself why did I come here?  It isn't surprising that Grand Lux appearance wise looks nice but the food just bleh when you consider that the concept for Grand Lux came from the same person that thought up the Cheesecake Factory; yet another mediocre joint that I would rather not visit. Overall,  I think you have to pass on this place. Plenty of other places in the area where it will be worth your money. 2 stars!

m66x1HCHT7DCct2cox8WKQ.text: Its unfortunate that this is the cafe in the Palazzo. We went twice on our most recent trip and both experiences were terrible.   Their breakfast buffet is a pretty good deal, $16 including juice and coffee. The food for the buffet was completely average. I ordered a hot chocolate in addition to my juice and while it looked absolutely amazing it had absolutely no flavor. The worst part of the experience was the incredibly slow service that we had to endure.   Our second trip was a late night trip for something in our bellies to sop up everything we had been drinking that night. My eggs were predictable, but my husband's sandwich was so incredibly salty that he could not eat it. In addition, the saltiness combined with the copious amounts of alcohol did not make for a happy scenario the next morning.   For breakfast or brunch head to Morels. For late night eats go over to Noodles Asia in the Venetian or dare I say it...walk down the street to Denny's.

Y2ZZZlkfg8a1IdFVssAAiA.text: Dined her three times this summer for breakfast, just love this place.   Love the energy, big comfy booths, the omelets are to die for, coffee good too.  Prices for Vegas are reasonable and service has always been spot on!    They do have a breakfast buffee but we never get that, just order from the menu!

3mgHy-0Nh9OG7uVeZfGnGw.text: If you have a craving for pho then I highly recommend that you try their Zen noodles. It was fantastic! They make sure you get plenty of lemongrass soup broth, which wasn't salty at all. Definitely cheaper than getting pho at Zine!

YYftGOjykKTqQDHioNvQNQ.text: 4.5 stars.  I love this place! It's awesome.  I came here twice for lunch before, and the food is GREAT quality, GREAT price, GREAT portion size!  I got their carmelized thai chicken?  It was amazing.  For about $13 too!  The service is really good, and the setting is really nice (but it's also Vegas in The Palazzo, what can you expect?). It's good for both group outings, and a dinner for a couple.  I will definitely come back again.

GxrVExIVr3ighhinmVUIBw.text: The first night we were in Vegas this past weekend we settled in our rooms & headed straight down stairs to Grand Lux which my friends said was almost like a Cheesecake Factory. We sat down & I looked at the menu the prices are decent for Vegas. I ordered the spicy flat bread chicken sandwhich with a side of fries & a white wine sangria.  The flat bread sandwhich came with  pepper jack cheese, lettuce, chicken, avocado, & the flat bread was doughy & soft yummy! The fries were ok but not so great & the sangria was really good & refreshing. The food came in handy because of the huge portion for late night port partying eats.  Also the last day we were there after all the damage done to our livers I ordered the lunch salad & pasta special...the salad was light & came with balsamic vinaigrette & the pasta I chose was the pasta carbonara. It came with carbonara sauce, cheese, pancetta, & peas it was soo tasty!!! It even tasted even better when I got home that day for dinner that night..for sure I will come to eat here the next time I take a Vegas trip.

vNs4fb_k9dlOBxL8opggKA.text: Love the Carrot Cake!! Have had good meals and bad here. Have had good service and terrible service. It is a toss up. But more often than not it has been good.

OM5vu_I6KN32lT13lzcjiA.text: Take away: Great variety of food at reasonable prices; looks and feels like it's sibling, The Cheesecake Factory. Recommendations: The BBQ Chicken pizza is pretty good, but it really just depends on what you're in the mood for. DETAILS: Atmosphere: It has the familiar Cheesecake factory decor. It's not a fancy restaurant, but for what you pay, it feels like you're going to a pretty nice looking restaurant. Ambience is pretty relaxed and can be great for couples and a small family gathering. The tables, linen, and dishes were all clean as well. Service: For the several times I've been here, the service has been pretty good. The servers have generally been pretty quick and checked in from time to time. It does, however, feel as if they are slightly understaffed. A few times, we needed service but couldn't find our server for over 5 minutes. During my last visit, we had a party of 8 and our server handled our order fairly expeditiously. She was very friendly as well. The wait for a party of 8 was about 15 minutes, while the smaller parties (2-5) got their tables immediately (just an FYI). Food Quality / Selection: Huge variety of food from pastas to sandwiches. Take a look at their menu here: grandluxcafe.com/menu.htm. The presentation is above average. The look and feel of the plates is similar to most other full service restaurants (especially the chain ones). The food is above average for the most part (see details below). Pricing/Value/Convenience: Great value; above-average portions. This place is a great place to share an entree, an appetizer, and a dessert if you want. Dishes that we ordered: Buffalo chicken rolls (eh, wouldn't recommend it; it has a little spicyness to it though); BBQ chicken pizza (this thin crust pizza was pretty flavorful); Pasta with chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, and mushrooms (not bad, but not great); Pasta Carbonara (flavor was good, but it just wasn't creamy enough and felt a little bit dry); Artichoke dip (was a little bit dried/overcooked - a part of it was actually burnt; wasn't creamy enough also).

2m6TN7tvYkeFMFrHyVK5-g.text: This cafe is nice. It sits in the corner of the first floor of the Palazzo. It is my first time coming but it seems like this is setup like a Cheesecake Factory. I did come here two times while being in Vegas. Both time different because the first was during a late lunch and I chose to get a chicken sandwhich which had mushroom and avocado. The sandwhich was nice. The price wasn't too bad considering it was vegas. I spend about $25 with my raspberry lemonade. The lemonade was kinda sweet for me though but good nonetheless.   The second time we came in for a brunch/latedinner thing. It was like 1130. That time it was a great deal for 15.95. They offered eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, orange juice, omelets, waffles, danish, yogurt, cereal and many more. It was enough to get me full for a great price.

l7fz6WiHAzWm-n3LigsMJw.text: This place is definitely on the top of my list when dining in Vegas.  During a previous trip, we came here three times.  This time we only came here once since we were staying at the Mirage and didn't want to walk in the hot, sunny weather.  We ordered the lunch special - half sandwich, soup and salad for $13ish to share.  Enough for two people if you're not hungry but just need a quick bite.  Great service although it might be slower if it's during peak hours.  We went around 12-1pm so service was fast.  Try the pastas!

-vvP26ra25tC38Ogl3tJxg.text: When it's 100 degrees outside and you've been at the pool all day, the last thing you want to do is go down the strip and look for delicious food. Luckily, I stayed at the Venetian and Grand Lux was in the hotel. I've been here many times and I'm always happy with the food I get here, ESPECIALLY after a Vegas night (you guys know what I'm talking about). One of the best things about Grand Lux is that they serve breakfast at night, so anytime you're craving that omelette or hash browns late at night, this is the place to go. The food is a bit pricey (though everything in Vegas is pricey... unless you're a girl, then almost everything is free!), but the quality of the food makes up for it. They also have a lunch happy hour type menu where everything is around $10 or less, which lasts from the afternoon until dinner time. It's also good to note that the food is similar to Cheesecake Factory because the owner of Cheesecake Factory created Grand Lux as well. If you like Cheesecake Factory, or you're craving some late breakfast foods, Grand Lux is the place to go.

Q2p6UWBGQTwkXIbDTWKDKA.text: Grand Lux Cafe at the Palazzo has over 200 items on the menu, but everything tastes great and is made fresh daily. Their drinks come with mouthwatering garnishes and taste great. I have had the luxury of trying almost everything on the menu and will attempt to describe everything I have tried.  New Orleans Beignets: This is a bake-to-order dessert that is available for breakfast as well as throughout the day. The beignet is a French-style fried doughnut that is light and fluffy and comes with four sauces on the side: Jack Daniel's Creme Anglaise sauce, Raspberry sauce, Chocolate sauce, and Cinnamon Sugar.   Jamaican Pork Tenderloin: This dish comes out with two fried wonton chips looking like pig's ears to identify the dish and comes with the pork in the middle (chili-rubbed) over sweet mashed potatoes with white rice and black beans sitting over a black pepper sauce. The black pepper sauce is the only thing spicy in the dish, although not too spicy for my taste. Bring on the spicy!  Pasta Telephono: Penne with melted cheese that creates a telephone cord (who has landline phones with curly cords these days?) when you pick it up with a fork, yum!  Sunday Night Pasta: Short rib, chunks of beef, and ground beef go into the mix of spaghettini. Although surely inspired by leftovers, this dish doesn't taste like leftovers at all. It is truly yummy and especially when it came out piping hot! It is served all nights of the week.  Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad: This dish has pistacchios in it but I love it for that and the goat cheese as well. The beets are seasonally different in colors, so they may come purple or yellow. It's served with a hazelnut-citrus vinaigrette.  Belgian Waffle: The waffle comes sprinkled with powdered sugar and hot maple syrup on the side. It's simple and delicious, almost purist.  Express Breakfast Bar: A selection of yogurt, granola, wheat or white bread (there's a toaster for people to toast their own bread), English Muffin, or Bagels (ask for the cream cheese, it's not at the bar...boo), fresh fruit, a made-to-order omelette bar, bacon, scrambled eggs (probably made from powder), hashbrowns, and some small breakfast pastries like scones/croissants/cheese danishes/streuseled pastries. It includes juices and coffee and some other drinks, possibly milk and fountain drinks.  Hot Chocolate: Probably the BEST hot chocolate I have ever had in my life, with no sediments, made with whipped foam on top and some rich whipped cream and a swirl of hot chocolate, but the drink is not too sweet and not too bland.   Wild Mushroom Burger: Not a burger with mushrooms as I first thought, but a patty made of mushrooms and tasting so good that I almost would turn vegetarian (almost!). Sesame seeds come on the bun and there's a side of bibb lettuce, tomatoes, and onions with an avocado cream sauce, or was it basil aioli? Anyway, it was good!  Vietnamese Chicken Summer Rolls: eight pieces comes with Thai BBQ sauce and Peanut sauce with the chicken, slivers of carrots and lettuce throughout the summer roll (rice flour wrap) and ready to be dipped! I would ask for some hot sauce, but that's just me.  Island Cooler: non-alcoholic, made with pineapple, mango, and some other juice, tastes really yummy and comes with an edible garnish of strawberry, pineapple, and lime.   WARNING: PORTIONS ARE GARGANTUAN!~ SHARE SHARE SHARE!  I gave this place a five because I feel that it is a very caring place with the servers not upselling anything and being honest about portion sizes. I also think that the atmosphere is very grand but still casual and the food is of great value. You get more than what you paid for.

dbpsO-QcYQEZalXz3kA4Ew.text: I love this place, I always go here when I go to Vegas.  The restaurant is like Cheesecake Factory, but better.  It's not as pricey as the other ridiculous stores in Vegas, either.  It's open late/early too, which makes it a perfect place to grub after the clubs.  I've never had to wait too long, especially since it's massive inside.  But out of all the buffets (though I'm not much of a buffet girl) and random eateries, I'd have to say this is my favorite.  What do I recommend?  Anything, really.  The pasta, pizza, salads, sandwiches...just go with a big group (which you'll probably be in when you're in Vegas, all crammed into that nice hotel) and share everything.  Family style is the way to go, after all.  The service is also always good, but that's pretty much a given in this city.  The workers are always so cheerful, from the concierge to the bartenders (well, minus the security at the clubs).  Check this place out for a reasonable price and some pretty good food.  Then go to Tao Beach after and get your tan on.

Kh3d_I5X3utaOupqPyXMCQ.text: Good food, a variety of dishes to choose from and large portion! We come here every time we stayed at Palazzo.

9JcJR-lliX9erv0MdAX_0w.text: This place is less crowded than the one in Venetian. Yet you get the same quality of food.   The restaurant looks spectacular with the high ceilings. Servers are nice and quality of food is great.  We ordered pan seared salmon and Polynesia salad. Both came like art pieces. The portion is big already. We are fortune that we did not order items under 'large' plate.  Otherwise, we will never be able to finish them.  This is really fine dining with the prices that will not break your wallet. Both of our dishes run lower than $15. With restaurants in Las Vegas inflate the prices so much, finally there is a place you can eat and rest assured you will be able to afford the meals .

AY-_VWUH9Zbp0YGxXc10vg.text: Was craving pasta in Vegas...  Came to the Grand Lux to get my fix and got so much more! Portions are HUGE, ended up eating less than half my pasta and saving the rest for later. My recommendation: The Sunday Night Pasta!  Service was pretty good. Attentive when needed, but not overly attentive. I hate it when I'm bombarded with questions like "how's the food" and my mouth is full.... awkward moments, but none of that here!

35loPPZ_d-vfLhFJjaT1FQ.text: We had pasta carbonara and a melt burger.  Found a peanut in the burger (?), fries were good (even better dipped in their blue cheese dressing).  The burger was pretty good, don't think I'd get it again.   I'm finding I don't like Grand Lux pasta sauces.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ROyznsZYzPCk4Y63FglYog.text: I've reviewed the other one before, but Grand Lux Cafe (by the maker's of Cheesecake Factory) never disappoints.  They single handedly own some of the best (in the entire world): spaghetti carbonara, caramel chicken, cheesecake, rasberry mango smoothies, braised ribs, chicken pot pie (so i've been told by many sources).  I opted for another combo platter $21), as I always do. This time trying two new items: chicken royale (very plain and boring battered chicken pressed) and short ribs (amazingly tender, melted in my fork, an absolutely delicious dish). Topped with some of the best, softest sourdough bread, and you have yourself a great Vegas meal. I highly recommend this spot to any tourist looking for that perfect dinner under $25/30. And it's open 24 hours!

0Upwa9Q4HwXbQFmh2J0MYw.text: We do a lot of work in Vegas, often with a focus on conventions. When we're working at the Sands Convention Center, the Grand Lux is our standard choice for meals. The food quality is always good, the meals are a good size, the prices are very reasonable and the service is typically fair. The menu is HUGE so there's always something you'll find to eat and you can eat 2 meals a day at this restaurant for a week without having to get the same thing twice.  We find this to be an easy choice when in Vegas and eat there several times during every trip. We've had many large parties there (never with a reservation) and many business meetings as well as quick lunches for two, all with equal success. Their lunch pizza and salad are YUMMY!

ripG4Ycy9qpVqrvI1QPNiQ.text: We go here very often when we're in town.  I love that we can get good eats at any hour of the day.  We tend to come in the early morning hours after going to the clubs.  I really like the variety on the menu as well.  Everything from breakfast foods to burgers to steak, pasta and desserts.  One of my favorite things to order is the pasta carbonara and chicken mushroom soup.  I've ordered quite a few things on the menu but I honestly can't remember the names of everything because I'm usually inebriated.  But really, I definitely recommend this place!

IwSdvTLglaS_evXHqwJyaw.text: Service was nice. Every time I've gone here, I've ordered the Fettuccini Alfredo and I must say that it never disappointed me, esp. when your on a good one. The rare ahi salad was scrumptious. Good for 2-4 people.

audUCcDiOH4TepmjrySz7Q.text: Let me say, if I could give 0 stars, I would.   After an amazing experience at the GLC in the Venetian, I thought the Palazzo would be equally awesome. I was in for a terrible surprise. For the epic of all epic birthdays, I had planned a weekend in Vegas and invited 25 of my closest friends (for my 25th birthday). 2 weeks before my birthday, I called the Grand Lux and made reservations for the 25 of us knowing they'd need an early heads up. They were ok with it. 2 days before my arrival, I called to confirm my reservation with the restaurant.   Then comes the night of. I rally my 25 friends, we head to Palazzo and walk in. I go to check in and give the server my name & party size.  "Um, we only have you down for 15"  then they ask me my name "Um, actually we don't have you on our reservations list at all" (so I go from 25 to 15 to nothing!?) I then check to see if I had made the reservations at the Venetian instead. Nope.  Then I ask them to check their call logs and voila, 2 days ago they had a call w/ me and confirmed my 25 person party. In a panic, they throw together tables and split my group in 2.  No one likes splitting their group across tables on their birthday dinner. That's LAME.  The manager assures me they'll 'make it a special night for me' as it was my birthday and they had already messed up my reservation.   So, how did they make it special?  1. they neglected to bring me the BBQ sauce I asked for. 2. he then brought me 6 passes to Tao (to use with my 25 person party!?!? what!?) and he also knew we already had plans to go to Tryst and had a car arriving at 10:30 so we had requested to get our orders in as fast as possible (we had to run out the door when the car arrived).  3. my friends had requested a birthday cake for me. they brought a plate out with 2 squirts of whipped cream and a cracker that said 'have a grand day' - WHAT!?!? is this really supposed to be a dessert? (I will attach a photo when I get home) That's just insult to injury at this point - might as well not bring a dessert at all.   To say the least, this was a terrible experience for a night that had been planned 2 weeks in advance. And the food wasn't even that good.

y72ASMm1R06M_YPqC1-bTw.text: BREAKFAST BUFFETTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT.  Thats all that is needed to be said.  JK!  I've been here a few times and service is always great.  They can get packed so it's really a hit or miss when you come.  They have a decent selection on their menu and the waiter or waitress is always willing to suggest their best dish.  I personally like the Mediterranean mahi mahi.  BEST MAHI EVER.

T2m52cRiGoehCz-6ctEFnw.text: Everything was great. We came here twice while in Vegas, once for breakfast and once for dinner. The Sunday Night Pasta was amazing and it was a HUGE portion. The breakfast buffet was also amazing because they had an omelet bar and the orange juice was DIVINE. It was fresh squeezed and the refills kept on coming. Overall, this place was a tremendous value because the food was great and the prices were great too. Will come back when we are in Vegas.

MSwui4Sl-JRAq4cSf8yB2Q.text: Great food. Portions are huge! I always eat here when staying at the Venetian Hotel. Open late night too.  What's good: Chicken & Waffles Chicken Parmesan (pasta) Creamy chicken & mushroom soup  Their pasta/salad lunch special can feed for two people. Try not to eat too much of the free bread they give out because you'll get too stuffed.  The chicken alfredo was gross. Too heavy and too doughy .  Good service. Our waitress was funny and made us laugh. Definitely will come back.

mKONTJsE7129WYM9Ijbj5w.text: Even though this place is from the makers of the Cheesecake factory it is by far superior to the C.F.  If you are staying at the Palazzo and are looking to eat, but not spend that much money then the Grand Luxe Cafe is for you.  Not only is there Menu enormous, but their food is also really good. Your plate prices range from 8-15 dollars. That is really good considering some of the other Palazzo restaurants are extremely pricey!

OGn5nz1CKJ82jxtRkB7SQQ.text: I wish we would have had breakfast there EVERY day! We were staying at the Palazzo and popped in for breakfast on our last day. I had never tried Chicken and Waffles so I thought, "What the heck!" OMG!! SOOO good! The chicken is NOT greasy and it's all white meat. The waffle itself was perfection but then you put a few chopped pecans, some powdered sugar and some chicken on it and it's DELICIOUS! It almost didn't even need syrup! The other people in my party had the pancakes and french toast and both were amazing. The prices are very fair, especially for the amount and quality of food you get. I did discover that Cheesecake Factory runs this place, so how can you go wrong? Two thumbs up!!

FuNiHA-iV7tzq3bVM6fUXg.text: The food here is pretty consistently good. Good enough to deal with the pretty consistently horrible service anyways. The first time I went it was just un enthusiastic service. I can forgive that. We all have our off days. The last time our server had all the panache of someone trying to sell week old hot dogs. I just felt vaguely in the way of his running around and like a nuisance for wanting any kind of refill.

vLZP1OPSMYvEJ6Rs8oeJvg.text: When I stay at the Venetian in Vegas, I always have breakfast here.  Great coffee and omelettes! It's a bit pricey breakfast.... but then again, you're in Vegas!

-3tR3x7Uvih02vKiN5pwGQ.text: It was okay, went for breakfast, meal was decent, service acceptable. Coffee was horrific, waitress changed the cups and resolved that. Just not that great.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hPWA5f-WNmO84xggbgaFSQ.text: I love this place! I'm from the Los Angeles area and unfortunately our location closed.. So everytime I'm in Vegas, I have to come here! I also prefer this location over the Venetian location because the desserts are different! If you ask me, the palazzo one is the better of the two. The food is good! Relatively close to the Cheesecake Factory (& they have the same owner) and a little bit more upscale. Also, the DESSERTS! My all time favorite dessert is at the grand lux cafe! It's the molten lava cake! Now, I've tried molten lava cakes nearly everywhere and nowhere does it as good as the grand lux cafe. It's the most richest, chocolate-iest, most delicious dessert! It has soft and gooey but has a bit of a chewy crunch to the outside. They also are very generous with the fudge! It literally will lava it's way out once you take the first bite! And to top it off, served a la mode! I wish they would bring back the Los Angeles location!

i6G5Z6i18DN8rUIRDCAk1Q.text: Big place so I can always get seated fast, big menu so everyone will be happy and I have yet to have bad service :-) This is my go to cafe when I have friends wanting a good meal on the strip.

2jDJaRtxUtwooRP7xAPMVg.text: This was a really good restaurant for a "nromal" meal in Vegas.  Great menu and the food delivered.  Everyone at my table was happy with their food.  I had a burger on sourdough with a really good side salad instead of fries.  other dishes were a pizza, an omlette, and a bufflao chicken sandwich.  the service was good and attentive and the ambiance and decor is really nice.   i was told this restaurant is affiliated with Cheesecake Factory.  I wodul say it was better.

GRP-WD-MMexWp9GN_ew47Q.text: The morning after (a night of intoxication that is). The early bird gets the worm indeed! While the majority of our group were still sleeping, me and a couple of girl friends woke up early and experienced one of the most delicious breakfasts in Vegas.   First of all, the service was remarkable. Our waitress was very friendly and assertive in catering to us. Throughout our entire meal she was always with a smile and an upbeat attitude.   I had to start off with a mimosa. Its Vegas! For my entree I ordered the Eggs, any style, Hash Brown Potatoes with Toast. Sounds so simple and common doesn't it? But it was ridiculously amazing. Great portion size to fill me up but not to the "food coma" extent. The hash browns were so cute! You gotta go there and order some to understand why I'm calling fried potatoes "cute." I'm not sure if it was because it was the "morning after" breakfast or not, but this was one of the yummiest!   We also ordered the Red Velvet cake in celebration of my friend's birthday. Red Velvet. Enough said. It was to die for. Mentioned to the waitress that it was indeed for a birthday and asked if she could put on a candle. She gave us a wink and said she's got something special for us. Out comes the cake (slice) with a special message written in powdered sugar on top of a crisp sweet cracker and a candle embedded in a swirl of whipped cream.   If you're like me and can't really do buffets in the morning, this is the place to be!

PKBCjxPMK5nrwui1GIkxnw.text: We didn't know what we were getting ourselves into until we saw the menu. Yes it looks just like a upper scale cheesecake factory with fancier food on the menu.   But then with that low of an expectation we were surprised. The kobe mini hotdog.. pass on that defiantely lost the feel of the kobe beef. The friend chicken was a big ass plate of chicken strips. Tasty? yes, meager portions? nah uh there is plenty there.   The highlight was the dessert, we avoided the cheesecake to try something different. The bread pudding was spectacular warm mushy sweet and chocolately. talking about it now is making me hungry.   The service was surprising to me, the server was awesome he let us mess around like we were high school kids. I'm sorry for all the crazy antics we pulled of snorting horseradish and gravy, to the loud outbursts we had. I hope i made it up to you though.

EJI5bnmrbcojlRyeKQoy0A.text: I'm so sad that I have to update my review to a horrible one. I recently went to Vegas and came here since it is my go to. Unfortunately, I had horrible service every time I came here. Since I am a loyal Grand Lux customer, each time something bad happened I decided to give them another shot and yet was let down time and time again. I had several problems with service where my server was not attentive multiple times, mistakes in food ordered, and most importantly dirty utensils. I picked up my glass of water and the whole glass was completely sticky, I sat on a seat full of salt, and my utensils looked used. My food came out incorrectly a couple of times but when you order "over easy eggs" please make sure they're runny... my eggs were unfortunately completely hard. It's sad seeing this place go down the drain. I wasn't even here during a busy weekend, and was visiting during the middle of the week. Unfortunately, I'm not completely sure if I would come back here during my next Vegas visit.

aljl7UTTXR1oKKfFjb5mwA.text: The resort was packed and this spot seemed popular.  The table wait was minimal and the service was great (2 times).  Waiter had a great attitude and made sure that we were comfortable without annoying us.  The food was very good, but a little overpriced.  This is a good choice when in the area.

w9wB5dQPOJbujQ8G7G56IA.text: Oh Grand Lux.  When will you move to the Bay Area?  Yes, it is very Cheesecake Factory-ish.  I love the variety here and the food is actually pretty darn good.  We came here for lunch after a very long crazy night.  Amongst five girls, we ordered a bunch of different items:  1. Stacked chicken quesadilla 2. Seared rare ahi 3. Asian Noodle bowl (I can't remember the exact name) 4. Tomato bisque  Do not go for the noodle!   It's a very very poor attempt at rice noodles.  I think I'm gonna give up eating noodles at non-Asian places.  I am always hugely disappointed.  The ahi and the quesadilla were good tho.  Tomato soup was a nice large bowl and tasty too.  Portions are very big so always a good idea to share because it's very unlikely you can finish it.  Prices are great.  Service is down to earth and quick.  You will definitely leave full and happy spending about $20!

m_Rs9cAd2x9zoGkTkrq_0g.text: This place is a like a higher-end Cheesecake Factory while being priced the same. The ambiance is classy and the variety is endless. They also have a late-night menu so you can go here after partying hard at bars/clubs or gambling.  I remember trying the salmon dishes [cedar planked salmon, miso salmon] and they were both scrumptious. The bread you get before the meal is warm and fluffy, great as a free appetizer.   This place is one of the best priced restaurants in vegas and worth it because of the portions, quality, ambiance, and service you get. I always try to pay a visit here whenever I'm in vegas even if I'm not staying at Venetian/Palazzo.

xnelO4WGPzWr0jBCcC_beQ.text: Damn! Someone beat me to it! Haha.  I ate at the one inside Venetian. If you've eaten at Cheesecake Factory then it's pretty much the same thing.   Portions are pretty big. Pricing is the same as Cheesecake Factory. The lunch special is pretty well worth it. I got the sandwich special and it came with half the regular sandwich, house salad and a soup for about $10. Strawberry smoothie was delicious.   4 people came out to be about $70 including appetizers so it's not the cheapest spot to eat if you're looking for quick bite. I think our drinks (soda, smoothie and iced teas) alone came out to be about $20!

H4hDOcJQ5hzX6ug3e-CAGQ.text: This place was surprisingly good!  At first my husband and I were hesitant to go there because we were worried that it might just be another chain restaurant with mediocre food.  We stayed in Vegas for 4 days, and this was by far the best meal we had!  I got the penne alla vodka, and it was delicious.  The pasta was comparable to a lot of Italian places we would go to when we lived in NYC.  The prices are very reasonable too.  I highly recommend trying this place.

dxsYElH9YoxzNDEXxXGsGQ.text: Checked this 24/7 place out after arriving in Vegas late Friday night. Came in at about 3:30AM and was surrounded by lots of exhausted barefoot clubbers with heels in tow. From what I remember, we were seated promptly and greeted by a friendly waitress. I wanted a Long Island Iced Tea, but was instructed that "Texas Tea" was an ample substitute, and that it had "spurs". Intrigued by the spurs, and wondering if they would kick my night in the right direction, I decided to order one.  I was a little disappointed, as It tasted like sweetened Nestea with a splash of vodka and lemon.  I sent it back, and ordered a more appropriate vodka martini with 3 giant olives.  Excellent.  I also ordered the seared tuna which was excellent.  I don't really recall how much everything was, but I do remember the sun was up when we left later that "night".

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Ahi Tuna.

vLSKfxquToSdB7NL09XRUQ.text: Yea, it's pretty much what you'd expect: A Cheesecake Factory without all the Cheesecake Factory gluttony you're used to. Menu is smaller, portions are smaller, and they managed to "class is up" just a notch.  Our server was annoying; like, he thought he was funny when he wasn't. (For exmaple, when I was slightly confused with the menu he asked me that I "Stay with him" when he was explaining it.) I guess he couldn't really help this personality trait of his, so for that I won't deduct stars for that. I mean, you can't really punish stupid people for being born the way, right?  Food was great. As other yelpers noted, the chicken and waffles is superb! Light, airy waffle and deep fried golden poultry deliciousness?! *gaahhh!*

iKonP38Oxo-_SahM3GLL2Q.text: When we stay at the Palazzo, we eat at the Grand Lux.  Great food, big portions, and reasonable prices.  I love the Miso Salmon and Caramel Chicken combo.  2 nice pieces of salmon, crispy pieces of caramel chicken all atop some stir fried vegetables and  served with steamed rice.  A deal at 19.95 because 2 people can easily share it.  Their desserts are also delicious.  Their Red Velvet cake is the best ever!  My sis and I consider ourselves Red Velvet junkies.  We try that cake everywhere and the Grand Lux wins hands down.  They also serve a pretty mean Banana Cream pie and let me tell you, I can't stand bananas but I can eat this.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Market Sandwich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pie
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet

JAvq81XZ1JECof4URNAydQ.text: Where do I begin... I've been to grand lux so many times in my 8 years in Vegas. I prefer the newer palazzo location to the Venetian mainly because of convenience. Parking and walking from the Venetian is such a hassle, while if you know where to park at palazzo it'll take you up right by grand lux.  The restaurant is appropriately named - the decor is both grand and lux especially for what is basically a casino coffee shop. High open ceilings with lots of mirrors and other shinies, comfy seats and always very clean w great service every time.  I don't think I've ever had anything I didn't like, but I usually stick to my favs. Its hard for me to resist my sunday night pasta - its spaghetti with a meat sauce made up of a lot of different things. Meant to be like a dish where you throw all of the week's leftovers together (but made fresh) its packed with short ribs, hamburger, sausage, mushrooms and I'm sure other things I forgot about. The portion's huge, easily 2 maybe 3 meals especially if you fill up on their warm crusty bread and butter. I'm embarrassed to admit that our basket always needs a refill :) Other things worth mentioning - duck pot stickers, shrimp w pasta, short rib grilled cheese, their burger w short ribs on top. We're usually too stuffed to get dessert but I finally remembered this time to plan ahead and order the warm rustic apple pie. It's baked to order so takes 20 minutes, I'd suggest putting it in with your dinner order. Even if you forget to order ahead of time, it's well worth the wait. As you can see in the picture its really more of an apple tart. Warm flaky pastry crust, sweet but slightly tart apple slices, topped with vanilla ice cream and finished with powdered sugar. I'd go back just for that pie.  Give grand lux a try if you've never been. Their massive menu is guaranteed to have something that everyone will like.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi mmmmmm!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm rustic apple pie - baked fresh!

8McYYmfj7AnKWmm1kRzS7w.text: I came to this place on my lunch break and arrived around 11:15. There was an akward crowd waiting and staring at the hostess while she proceeded to jack around with one of the waiters. We waited until 11:23 to be seated... for no reason.. it was empty.   Next, we wait over 10 minutse for a waiter to stop by... any waiter at all. When the waiter finally showed up he asked "sooo anyone stop by yet?" "NO".. "oh ok".... how about an apology jerkoff since youve passed our table for 10 minutes now and could see we were the only table in an empty section! Geez  I ordered the chinese chicken salad. I guess it's ok if you really like rice noodles. Basically I had  a salad that was 65% edible styrofoam. YUM. not.
