Nothing good or redeeming about this salad.. yuck  With so many amazing places to eat in Vegas it disgusts me how many tourists waste their money at this chain crap hole. Seriously walk 10 minutes and you'll find 50 better options.

UODRFWhqP8CgHF_6KZOX1A.text: The Grand Lux is a great casual restaurant to eat at when staying at Venetian or Palazzo. They have a plethora of food to choose from, and they are open 24 hours, so you can get whatever you want, whenever you want it.  During this past Vegas trip, we had breakfast here twice. Their breakfast is really good. The service can be slow at times, because they do get packed, but if you aren't in a hurry, it's nice to sit and relax and enjoy your food.  The first morning I had scrambled eggs, hash browns, an english muffin and a honey vanilla latte. The portion was huge and I didn't finish all of it.  The next day I had eggs benedict florentine with my honey vanilla latte, sooo good. Their hollandaise sauce is very flavorful and the portion is just right.  The food can get pricey, especially with drinks and sides of bacon and such - orange juice here is $5.50 (what a rip!!). The second morning BF got the buffet for $15, which comes with as many drinks as he wanted, so he got OJ and soda for other people at the table so we wouldn't have to pay.   Our bill averaged $65 both mornings, and that was for 3 people...so it's about $20 per person, which is a bit much for breakfast, but you're in Vegas, live a little!

BevTQmef3lBVs1YIz21Diw.text: Not fully sold on a different version of the cheesecake factory.  Food came out cold and then dry because i think they just threw it under heat lamps to warm it back up.  Im disappointed just because i was expecting a bit more with the restaurant based of how busy it is every time i walk by.  I figured they must be busy because they are good but apparently its just the strip foot traffic.  Management just gave me a disgusted look when i informed them that our food came out cold and was not good when it came out. I left more then half my plate and he acted like  we were trying to get out of our bill.  Debating on if i would ever return, I have friends that actually enjoyed this place so debatable at best. Oh well we live and learn.

TAltyGgJ2fXtaT0ukQ7LHg.text: Food was decent.  I had a Ruben and husband and chicken alfredo.  Chicken was a bit dry for his taste, but overall ok.  Two stars is for the bad service.  The only thing our waitress did was take our order and bring our drinks.  Someone else brought our food and our bill.  That was all the interaction we had.  Nobody stopped to see how things were, if we needed anything, etc.  I saw her look at our table at least twice, like she was thinking of coming over, but didn't.  There were four tools sitting next too us, better dressed, ordering shots, who she was very attentive to.  If only she knew that we had both been servers in a former life and tip very well....when it is deserved.  But she shouldn't have to know that....I believe you should treat all customers with the same respect.

bcJNQTckOlWdH2G1d17BJw.text: Solid choice for breakfast.  I had biscuits and gravy.  Very nice meal.  The coffee was the only disappointment.  Ideal if you are staying at Palazzo.

S1SgqOY5erudA4A2P_FM2A.text: Came here for a birthday. The cocktail was good and the red velvet cake was a bit too sweet and good in flavor.

wtcArHtpjWpBeXJOYDFJ9g.text: I love how this restaurant opens until 2 a.m.! The menu is incredible! They have so many mouth-watering selections just like The Cheesecake Factory. The ahi tuna ceviche was not that good though... it lacked flavoring! The miso salmon I had was amazing, plus it tasted even better because I substituted white rice for mashed potatoes. The pasta carbonara my bf had was a little dry and the pasta noodles were still tough. Overall, I would give this place another chance whenever I'm in town again.

uN1RoBkrfclkB9BOTk7rkQ.text: Grand Lux... the go to at the Palazzo (Venetian has one too, but more cafeteria style.  Palazzo is rest. style) .  Great Food.  .(Cheesecake factory, you know). Wonderful variety menu ... for everyone.  I go every time i'm here at the Palazzo...... You will not be disappointed.

hiZAXN87e5oEeEWehuBjHQ.text: Kobe meatballs on polenta...it was really good, however, there was barely any polenta. It was like I got the very last little bit they made.  They weren't busy when we were there, but service was very slow. My friend had southern fried chicken (& added Mac & cheese). It looked really good-she loved it.  My other friend had a burger-was slightly better than "good" & the other friend had a salad that was fresh and just right...

bHez88FNvofTa4uxWcb25w.text: I come here probably once every trip home to Vegas. I don't know why..it's just a SOLID place to go. The last two trips home I've really enjoyed this particular location.   WHY? ....drumroll....  Because they have BEIGNETS! It is the ONLY Grand Lux in Vegas to have Beignets. My bff Ame and I absolutely love them here.   It's a generous serving with about 8-9 beignets and three sauces: Raspberry, chocolate, and creme fraiche.   Ame and I always end up mixing the raspberry with the creme fraiche each time. I recommend you do the same. It will change your life.   As for their regular food, everything here is average to delicious, so you really can't go wrong.   Their salads are divine, as these are SERIOUS salads with great combos of ingredients. I particularly recommend the Asian Chicken Salad and Polynesian salad (the jicama and macadamia nuts with mango..yum).   Chicken Lettuce Wraps are yummy as well, and their volcano shrimp is delicious.   Over the years it seems like they've changed the coating to their Grand Fried Calamari.. it used to be rock shrimp, zuccini, and onions fried in a thin coating of batter, but now the coating is a lot thicker and more tempuralike. Ame and I are not fans of the new formulation. Still tasty, but not the same.   Love the place for a quick bite. Service is always fantastic 100% of the time. Ame and I typically come here to catch up on girl time, and the servers are always gracious to keep pouring us water and refilling my tea/coffee when they don't have to (we always take care of them, of course for their kindness :). Seriously - they're always the nicest servers I've seen in town.   Prices may seem a dollar or two higher than your average diner, but this isn't your average diner, and plus it's at the Palazzo. Duh.   Come. Get the Beignets. Be happy. And mix the creme fraiche and raspberry sauces.

PAniuTgMjhBCyGjn_dXFFw.text: Winner Winner Chicken Dinner!!  This place is awesome!!! Delicious (and large) menu, very reasonable prices and huuge portions. The interior is very nice and wide open. The extremely high ceilings make the dining area enorous. Ourserver was very prompt, polite and accommodating - the exact characteristers you would look for in a server.   I had the Indochine Shrimp and Chicken and it was supper tasty. The shrimp and pieces of chicken breast were big and plenitul. The sauce was also very good. It had a great balance of sweet and savory as well as the combination of the meats and the sun-dried cherries and apricots.   My wife's Sunday Night pasta was amazing! The meat sauce was very meaty and combined well with the mushrooms, onions and garlic. It was very tasty and all served over a huge portion of spaghettini! The portion of this dish was definitely worth it.  My only regret was only coming here once! As if it couldn't get any better.. the Grand Luxe located in the Venetian is open 24/7..... 'nough said.

FUViuCgQ2rasTRCEXeXtaw.text: The Grand Lux Cafe is by the same creator of The Cheesecake Factory, but my experience at this location in the Palazzo was better than any Cheesecake Factory that I have been to.  Yum!    From eating at the Wynn Buffet, Lavo, Suger & Ice, to McDonalds, Table 10, and other eating adventures in Vegas, this place was a nice happy medium.  Although the service was a bit slow, the food was noteworthy!  I personally had the sandwich lunch special for about $10 which included half a chicken salad sandwich, soup, and a salad with their amazing ranch dressing.  The bf had steak and shrimp scampi, which was MmMmMm and OMG MmMmMm!  The steak literally melts in your mouth with tender juiciness while the shrimp scampi was breaded with loads of wonderful flavor.    Thumbs up to Grand Lux Cafe!  I shall return! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2W7V4RGTPmAyL01uLRjGjA.text: I was so impressed with the speed, quality and size of my salad. The server and staff were very friendly. When I come back to Vegas I am sure I will come back to the Grand Lux cafe.  Smoothie, HUGE Salad and I had to ask for a box to take 85% of my key lime pie home. Still tasted great in hotel room.

SIcWxkKqCOxFA93E0-ocrg.text: Oh my. My BF and I arrived slightly after breakfast was over, so we chose the buffet. I'm not a big buffet person, but the WAFFLES were to die for! I ate there the previous morning and had the chilaquiles which were superb. I will definitely revisit! Service was a little slow, but overall a good experience.

fhObgyP9E7DhhIRPHSeauQ.text: We ordered a few appetizers here to snack on before dinner.  First of all, how do you run out of Sticky Hot Wings?????  Stacked Chicken Quesadilla: It was average, nothing unique.  Chicken Lettuce Wrap: Meh....  Double-Cheese Mini Burgers: It was a bit dry and tasted average.  Buffalo Chicken Rolls: Yum, this was good.  I could eat a few more pieces of this.  Nice and crispy and drool.......buffalo sauce.  I might come here again just to try out a specific item.  Yes, I'm talking about you - sticky hot wings.  I need to know what's so good about you that you ran out!!!!

VddWveJH_MQ9CKAMeylGwQ.text: NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM with a side of NOM. So good....and the waiter Marcus (if you have the honor of getting him as your waiter....is so awesome! love him!)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3K4cRlcDPKAxv63gO1oWPw.text: Our place of choice whether it was for early breakfast, (gotta get those hashbrowns before it turned 11AM) or smoothies any time of day or a post-club steak & eggs and zen noodles, Grand Lux Cafe has it all.   It was also conveniently located near the elevators to the rooms.   The prices, though initially may seem high for a Cheesecake Factory offshoot, are matched by the sizes of their entrees. I ordered a $14 omelette and could barely finish half of the omelette (and I can eat a healthy amount).    There is a buffet option for breakfast, there is a separate bar space, a takeout side spot, a more high end and quieter separated dining space as well as the general dining area.   I definitely recommend the hash browns (go big like me and order a double order of hash browns!), the smoothies (they taste extremely fresh and it is a big portion - halfway to a Fat Tuesday) and the steak & eggs.   Grand Lux Cafe definitely knows how to cater to the variety of Vegas-goers!   Will be back when I'm back!

m_eI68JRrDX3MmHl5V8WSA.text: The upscale Cheesecake Factory! It's nice because it doesn't have a line and I was starving. Ended up having some drinks and a burger and fries.   The service was fast and friendly, so there wasn't anything to complain about here.

URGBBEn-PkW0M6FKWR-5SQ.text: I LOVED this restaurant! I found it on a whim on yelp, just looking for a Vegas restaurant diverse enough to satisfy 9 people- and Grand Lux did not disappoint! Everything is very reasonably priced as the portions are HUGE. And so good!  I had the chicken royal and it was fantastic. Well seasoned and tender. Everyone else at the table, who got everything from the pot roast to the club sandwich, raved about their food. And the total was about $240 for nine people, with 3 appetizers and shared salads. Our server-- I don't remember her name, I think it was Kiko or something like that??-- was absolutely delightful. All in all, a definite must try! I can't recommend it enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken royale! So good!!

G8Eb08_hH_y_WoPh_OO_Hg.text: At the grand lux the service is always really good and the food too . They , however , do not specialize in burgers .   Appetizers that I've had and love - spinach and artichoke dip, hummus dip, ahi tuna ceviche, and egg rolls.   Plates I've had - chicken and shrimp jumbalya , chicken Parmesan , seared ahi tuna salad , salmon three ways , miso salmon , shrimp Alfredo , avocado burger . All were amazing except the avocado burger - it came well done when I ordered medium rare and they forgot the avocado . When I asked for it they brought slices that kept slipping out of my burger -_-   All in all a great place for food ! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Over cooked burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus dip - so delish !
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna ceviche

lLygm8NIRIZs3qWFhjyl9w.text: I ate here three times during my stay and the service was spot on each time. The waiters/waitresses refilled my soda promptly without me having to ask. The pricing was decent too relative to other Vegas pricing. It's conveniently located right next to the Venetian elevators. I never had to wait very long to get a table. Recommended.

PfXxtSbLAmIGhc8ZN40EsQ.text: Wasn't expecting much but everything we had was absolutely wonderful. Has the buffalo rolls and a couple sandwiches. Completely exceeded my expectations, great place to stop for a quick lunch or late night grub!

ZETGqe2XvPEedHHYaBLywQ.text: A large group of us stayed at The Venetian and during September, 100+ degrees outside, best to eat somewhere inside the casino. Open 24 hrs and was amazing. I ordered the Chipotle/avocado burger with cheese, crispy fries, and thousand island sauce. Also ordered The Dux burger, classic American style. Both burgers tasted like 80/20 meat to fat so amazing sear and crispiness. Both came out to $28.00

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle and Avocado burger with fries.

Hd4X1bzpPqF7GcdHaOmFAg.text: Omg!!! This place is Amazing!!  From food to service you won't be disappointed!!  We are here every chance we got which was every breakfast, lunch and dinner (not kidding)!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet steak, potato, asparagus
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceiling
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy with sausage eggs and potatoes  Was sooo good but definitely bring your appetite!

FSSQvAAz2voxfElpDjP0lQ.text: It's large, has an extensive menu and is always loud and busy but for a cafe it's not bad. We went one night because we couldn't think of any place else and were near the Venetian. I had their version of pho which was sort of close but missed the sauce to pour into the soup so there wasn't a ton of flavor.  Hubby had fried shrimp which when they came looked like a huge amount until we found that under the shrimp,was bread so it looked like more.  Still he said it had good flavor. When we've been there before I had the house made veggie burger which I'd have again, it was better than the soup

HCB78KDQXmALxmlvwQhLFw.text: I am forced to rate this place with one star but I would rate it with NONE!! Horrible service!!!! We waiting for an hour for our food and then got told they forgot about us!!! Have in mind there were only 1-2 tables dining...busy...I think not!!! Would not recommend at all!!

8sgE4BQ7oz-8dFHWhyXRlA.text: It was the best fried chicken and waffle combination we've had! Super crispy skin and juicy insides paired perfectly with a fluffy waffle that was not overdone at all. The maple pecan syrup added a layer of magic on everything.   The service was fast and very on point. We have nothing to complain about. Would definitely come back to try other dishes.

87D-9RM-ixDfbTz968Rl7g.text: This is my go to place whenever I am in town. They are open 24 hours and have good selection of comfort food and spirits!!

Yc_9V0SzF4_-08sBs-t32Q.text: All though the rest of the staff is not properly cross trained and not a single member of the parking staff knew of the buffet the Grand Lux offers; The breakfast was good and hospitality is ok.  @dabvandamme Justin-

WdmDLkDN5HyDFQxB2_mbtA.text: We usually go to grand lux for breakfast when in Vegas. We've never had to wait or worry about reservations. We went to other breakfast places and the wait is usually over an hour. Food was good, service was decent, and the prices reasonable. I was shocked that orange juice was so expensive. I believe it was like $8 for a small glass.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CXZAH2iKZCRSMXU4332nKQ.text: I went here with a few friends while we were in Vegas. We were greeted immediately. We chose to dine at the "patio" which was nice. It had a nice ambiance. Besides our waitress taking 15 minutes to take our order, the service was good. Our waters were refilled quickly, like several times. Of course when you're in Vegas and water is like $10 a bottle, getting free water at the restaurant...thirsty much? I ordered the jambalaya and ribs and it was bomb.com Their jambalaya was the best I've ever had. It's been awhile since we went here, but sometimes I still dream about their jambalaya.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm mmm! Best jambalaya ever! #sogoodnofilterneeded

lAKsHMJHs8CfQLEkK8Pq4w.text: I usually show up for the French Toast with strawberries and banana slices during brunch; however, late last night I showed up for Joe's Scramble which is ground beef, spinach, onions, and eggs.  I think I'll stick with the French Toast.  To drink, I ordered the Tahitian Pineapple which was soooooooo good.  It was Reyka Small Batch Vodka with Stoli Vanilla, Pineapple Rum and Fresh Pineapple.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cWTnEYomlGJcslJOij2FIw.text: I went here about 3-4 times during my stay at the Aria.   It was the only restaurant that I could get seated at lunch time. The food was surprisingly good for such a large restaurant and menu has a ton of selections.  I had the Salmon Three Ways which I recommend. Service was great.

qj-zBJF0ln7XH_io0J7-pg.text: Another Dessert Adventure in the middle of the night, I was feeling hungry, again. My wonderful friend Careline V. was willing to eat here to try their desserts, yay! It was really late and there weren't a lot of people so we got seated right away. We got a basket of warm bread and melted butter. Then ordered the Strawberry Fruit Smoothie and the Molten Chocolate Cake. ::Drinks:: The Strawberry Fruit Smoothie had strawberries, orange, pineapple juice, coconut, and bananas. It was thick and very flavorful. (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) ::Dessert:: The Molten Chocolate Cake was served with vanilla ice cream. In the center, it had warm melted chocolate that flowed out when we sliced it in half. It was rich, chocolatey, and very sweet; we couldn't finish it. (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) ::Customer Service:: Friendly ::Tip:: The Molten Chocolate Cake takes 30 minutes to prepare. I suggest ordering it when you are almost done eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Molten Chocolate Cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Fruit Smoothie
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Bread and Butter

Svq5FyVdDrscF4m-57SSXg.text: Note: ate here yesterday and then today realized there were two locations and I had placed this review on the wrong one. This this review is finally I'm the right place, a day later.  A yummy stop! The interior reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory. We came here for a late breakfast. My the food was pretty tasty but not the most amazing. Though I must say, the ingredients were very fresh and it showed.   Today service seemed to be lacking. Our waitress was nice but brief and appeared to be in a hurry. She clearly seemed overwhelmed by all the tables. She never had the time to ask is if we needed anything. We asked for a condiment but it never came (had I waited for it to arrive, in order to eat, I would've gotten hangry).   Either way give this place a try. The ambiance is pretty nice and the prices are reasonable. The also have gluten-free and other healthy options.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized omelette with mushrooms, asparagus, peppers. and spinach. Side of hash browns and while wheat bread.

-ZCL3g0L_gk4necMbZv9zg.text: It's really tasty. However, what turned us off is that we were chqrged $1.50 for add-on like a tablespoon of corn and a few sprigs of spinach. The menu boards are pretty vague in the way they tell you that add-on are extra. I guess if we SPLIT an $18 pizza, I wouldn't be quite as disturbed.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow. The Cuban sandwich and Chicken Lettuce Wraps were delicious! Great flavor and very generous proportions.

3YhtDqsGouzY_Ku3u-g2GQ.text: Extremely pleased with the service and quality of this restaurant. I ordered some food for take out & the young girl there was professional and friendly. I believe her name was Kathryn according to my receipt. I even had a complicated order and everything was done properly. I will be returning for my dinner take out more often.

oIMPp_ZWNLvGpkhP3hbuSg.text: Another favorite in Vegas inside the  Venetian hotel.  Chicken parm & buffalo chicken rolls. Fun atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QoxwkSc9l2xT7ttu7b2tDw.text: Went here for brunch while staying at the Venetian. There wasn't any wait so we were seated right away. They have a breakfast buffet that our waiter encouraged us to look at before ordering. They have many options including eggs, bacon, waffles, fruit etc. ultimately we decided to order off of the menu instead. My husband wanted the French toast but they were sold out. I didn't know that was possible!! He opted for the peanut butter pancakes instead. I ordered the chicken and waffles. It took probably 20-25 for our food to come out. I was impressed with the portion size! The pancakes had 3 big ones on it. The waffles was average size with probably 5 chicken strips. The chicken was very crisp but still juicy inside! The syrup had a True maple flavoring to it. I ordered some orange juice as well and loved the freshness to the taste. Not giving 5 stars due to the extremely high price!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut butter pancakes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

gu-LbzjBQrN_5kf94acFeg.text: We only went in for dessert which was memorable and tasty.  Totally plan on splitting one.  Portions are hefty!   Excellent cappuccino and great wait staff! Only compliant was the congestion we experienced after from casino cigarette smoke.

jpz-Vz7DHbEyg0OySoy8BQ.text: My to go place for breakfast when I'm at palazzo. I always go with their buffet option which is quick and has a lot of choices, sweet and savory, also including station where they make you fresh omelets and waffles. Everything is really tasty, baked pastries are fresh and delicious, you can't go wrong with any item

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet round 2
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet

zok5zDkWH4Z26qfx22uVlQ.text: We stayed at the Venetian and kept noticing a lot of people dining here when we walked by.. We arrived after 11am and thankfully there was no wait. The place looked busy and almost full. The full breakfast menu stopped serving at 11am but you can still order some simple breakfast items such as breakfast quesadillas, waffles and omelettes.They also had the breakfast buffet and the juice and coffee were included. The server (Amanda) was friendly, helpful and upbeat. We decided to get one breakfast buffet and one from the menu. Love their coffee and the fresh squeezed juice and the food was delicious. Unfortunately, when I went to the buffet area, I could not find a piece of chicken to go with my waffles. I got the omelets instead. We really enjoyed the food and service and looking forward next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadillas
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My brunch
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It reminded me of Cheesecake Factory.

yG1wb40Bxyfn8M_H7pHaUg.text: Great place for all kinds of appetites. The menu offers small bites/tapas, appetizers, and a large selection regular menu. My husband and I shared the pot roast fries, poke tacos (3 come in the order) off of the small bites menu and an order of the Buffalo Chicken rolls (6 come with the order) off the appetizer menu. All were delicious! I also had their Crafted Mojito. We enjoyed our meal & drinks and will definitely eat at Grand Lux Cafe Palazzo again during our stay. We ate in the bar area and didn't have to wait to be seated. Service was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Rolls
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot Roast Fries

YEMQ2pJJgqeHYJhBjiQpaw.text: Whole egg omelette was good. You get to choose 4 things in it, including veggie, meat and cheese. It's a pretty big size, comes with tomato or hash and toast on the side. Steak and egg was good too, steak was cooked properly, although it was kinda weird that they put the steak on the side, but not hash.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omlete

FU_GJuvn9wmwjPctzOrSPg.text: IMPORTANT! There are 2 grand lux locations, make sure you go to the one inside the Palazzo Hotel the one inside the Venetian has terrible service and the food I'm going to recommend is not served at the Venetian. This is the second time I come to the Grand Lux Cafe inside the Palazzo and once again their service is amazing! My manager recommended this place and now it's a MUST when we're in town lol. We always order the lemon chicken picatta because it is so delicious. I'm not a fan of chicken but this dish is WOW. We also ordered the Filet Mingon with loaded potatoes and French fries OMG! To die for! The steak is so tender and their ranch is AMAZING! My boyfriend got their pot roast with broccoli and he also loved it. If you're in town make sure you come here, again INSIDE THE PALAZZO (grand canal shoppes) NOT THE VENETIAN. ENJOY :D

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken picatta. SO DELICIOUS!!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot roast with broccoli instead of original veggies
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon served medium rare with loaded potatoes. SO DELICIOUS! If you love steak GET this plate.

H8cD_DfXycuRleCbGSGgpw.text: A huge pleasant surprise inside Palazzo tower. I am pretty sure I am addicted to Starbucks and the coffee at the Grand Lux not only was better tasting, it was consistent each day! The pastries were divine. I'll never stand in line at this resort for Starbucks coffee again!

UFHFPv2IDduWvm1p8PVWqw.text: Great food reasonable prices! This restaurant is from the family of Cheesecake Factory.....we had leftovers because big portions! Their lettuce wraps are so good

ROtU3xH_XZKpsuIdkJsH9A.text: If I can give it a zero I would. We've had a horrible experience there and I'd definitely think twice before I attempt going there again.  So we had a late show tonight and we took a nap before and ended up sleeping late and not having enough time to have dinner before the show.  We come back to the Palazzo where we're staying for our honeymoon and we walk to this place. The hostess takes us to the outside area and seats us there. Right next to us was a big table with very loud people so we go back inside and ask if we can sit in the bar area instead.  Very rudely the hostess says we have to wait for a table even though half the tables were empty! She was very rude and obnoxious. When we pointed to the empty tables she said we still have to wait as she can't seat us there. We ended up leaving and trying to find another open restaurant at this late hour. We didn't. So it's almost midnight. We haven't haven't had any food since breakfast and we have to wait till tomorrow to get something to eat. My husband is diabetic and can't go without food that long.  If you make it to this place watch for this unprofessional rude hostess.

BPaTwto4J7WlI4PqBnpUxg.text: Had lunch at the bar on Thursday. Ordered Burger, which was very good .  Bartender/Mixologist greeted me as boss, which I think is  Insulting . Throughout my lunch and as others sat down he was slamming drawers and making a lot of intentional noise while grabbing drinks and other things that served no purpose. Not sure why this was happening . My only conclusion was that he was a union worker and was very unhappy with his shift or some other issue. Couldn't wait to get out of there.

ySuK_Vd_yFY2RIe_tQ5rXg.text: We stayed at the Venetian and ended up dining here a few times. Good portion sizes, quality food, the service is Ok. Their location was excellent for us because the elevator was literally a few steps away. My husband really enjoyed their cobb salad which was big enough for two people.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar inside

VYGJn_MkIwUdwzFta9V-6A.text: I've been here many times and I've never had a bad meal!! Food is amazing! Tacos, pasta, fish, Cesar salad and you must get the butter cake!  Service is typically great! The last time I was here, we were served by Anthony (James) and he was the nicest waiter ever!! He went above and beyond! Give the guy a raise!

sQR8qMkqIGi25M4DgUIk5w.text: Great food! The espresso martinis were amazing!!! Our waiter Kevin was awesome as well!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food! The espresso martinis were amazing!!! Go order one! Our waiter Kevin was awesome as well!!!

_TEGeBXC4Hgsh08plOZMZw.text: Good food, great selection, large portions, and open late! I frequent the Grand Lux Cafes every time I stay at the Venetian/Palazzo because it's easily accessible and open 24 hrs! It's essentially the go-to spot when I'm hungry and can't figure out where to eat or when I'm with a group who can't agree on a place.  There is rarely a wait to be seated (especially at this location), but the wait comes with getting your meal. Service is so-so, sometimes they don't even bring bread to your table while you wait for the main course which makes me hangry. None of the dishes were memorable to me, but I always come out of this restaurant full and content.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso glazed salmon
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian short rib tacos

DM_sw5RbNzVmsH85edYH8Q.text: Highly recommend this place. Huge portions of high quality food for a decent price. Everything we had was excellent. We ate here three times during our trips. Which is a first. If you are taking kids or teen girls I suggest splitting a plate. Seriously a lot of food. My favorite was the beef Wellington. It was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos!! Amazing
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian chicken

IABd1Nn7Kw03f5jEaIYZ8Q.text: I normally enjoy picking up breakfast from Grand Lux while staying at the Venetian so thought I would try the same while at the Palazzo.   While the food was good, I can't say the same for the service.  It took 3 phone calls for someone to take my order.  Then after standing in line to pick up my order in the bakery, the person behind me was helped first, even though I politely said I was next.  I'm not one to be rude to servers, but neither will I accept poor business practices.  Grand Lux, you just lost a customer.

uWOEMJJ8SVCLjroiD3ZfOA.text: Friendly staff. Lovely establishment. Good food...Eating from the "late night" menu: Calamari and Shrimp spring rolls.

YOeakS44nV6VmLeNMJX2Aw.text: Best for breakfast no large crowds good service and good food always a must stop every time we come to Vegas

idgVh_4mycXtZUZUcSBagw.text: For a quick bite after a day of shopping, this mostly hit the spot.  Service was not very attentive, but was friendly. We ordered off their Small Bites/Tapas menu which is such a fun way to munch.  Pros: The Asian Short Rib Tacos - Fantastic! Reuben Sliders - I would have been happy just with this  Cons: Edamame - Better pretty much every other place I have had them, no flavor Duck Triangles - Not too exciting Cocktails - A whole page on the menu dedicated to them, but no prices listed.  On the bill - $10.50, about what I would have expected, but the drink itself was quite a let down.    Next time I would stick with beer or wine since that is harder to mess up.

LPeZoHpkDKFHSNgBSvZWnA.text: Really good coffee - try the Honey Vanilla Latte. Yum!   Angel, the barista, was an absolute delight. She took very good care of my business partner and me.

0ppW3fnmgz85AqQCEQoj0w.text: Lousy food. The made my first burger totally rare when I asked for medium well. The second one burned and dry. Finally they got the head kitchen guy to cook me a proper burger. The fries were also lousy.

zw6EOlpAdOyirL2Vr8qhAg.text: Phenomenal food and great price!!! Had some of the best meals with my girlfriend here!

Lv0P0AOag4uw0O21Ctnx4A.text: The best place in the world.. they have the best nachos and the most amazing breakfast

XZxz8zivsEsrWPmdQIY1nw.text: while staying at the palazzo, the grand lux is an easy stroll from the room for a quick bite. i went here twice to pick up lunch to go. i got the spicy buffalo chicken sandwich one day, and the chicken and waffles the next. i liked the chicken strips and waffles more. the portions are pretty hearty even their salads, which my friend got looked pretty filling.

UHnbA6TImaonAjV5t05yKg.text: Perhaps my best dining experience in 5+ visits to Vegas.  The food is amazing, prices are totally reasonable (especially given the massive portion size), and the service is GREAT.  We ordered off the Tapas menu since we're not big eaters.  We ordered 4 tapas total, for about $7 ea, and that was plenty of food for us.  We came back for dessert to go and were extremely pleased with the bar service.  The baked dessert we ordered said it would take 25 min and it ended up taking 35 so they gave it to us for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata with Tomatoes and Basil
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Tuna Tostadas
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet Chicken Meatballs

D_BfJUCNC3RtwHdSzvC3lw.text: This has quickly become a go-to location for my friends & I because of their wide-open hours, affordable prices, breakfast buffet and pretty top-notch service. You wouldn't even be able to tell they were a chain until you looked at the take out bag and realized it looked eerily familiar to the Cheesecake Factory's design ... oh hey, that's their parent chain.   Food? Right on and HUGE portions.   - Their salad & lunch pasta deal is perfect for a big helping of delicious pasta and a nice small side salad. -  Even their non-alcoholic drinks are delicious, I got some berry fizz thing blended with 3 kinds of berries and mixed with Sprite and soda. It came to my table flaunting itself like a giant blended tropical drink with skewers of strawberries and pineapple.  - Asian wonton nachos were decadent but I could only stomach one or two. Deep fried pieces of wonton are smothered with chicken, peanut sauce and wasabi drizzle. Intenseeee.   Shout out to our lovely waiter (can't remember his name anymore) but after politely asking why we were in Vegas for the weekend, he came back with two birthday plates of a simple but elegant dessert. Big birthday "cards" of crispy sweet phyllo dough were presented to us with a dash of whipped cream and sprinkles complete with a lit candle. Absolutely unexpected, especially in the middle of the day and he really made us feel special for being there!   Thanks for having a great selection of food and such wonderful service, especially for a chain restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome little birthday platter of phyllo pastry and whipped cream

U5dgpkFrRNKP7qJeANStnA.text: Waffles with a side of strawberries were delicious.  Also try their housemade veggie patty on a hamburger bun.  It was not bad but not the best either but I did enjoy it after adding a little BBQ sauce on the sandwich.  Fries were crisp and not greasy. Will go back as I would like to try other items on the menu.

O9R5LVegsPJCitv_HcSjNg.text: I used to visit the Grand Lux in Beverly Hills when I lived in Los Angeles and its Palazzo location is just the same - which is expected with chain restaurants.   The Grand Lux is conveniently located near the base of the hotel room elevators and is almost never crowded. The portions are huge, the prices are decent and the menu is extensive. After a couple of visits, however, you tend to get sick of the food because its so heavy and rich.   Visit before 3:00 p.m. to take advantage of their lunch prices and portions, which are about half the size of their regular portions but still pretty big!   Three and a half stars.

GkooCeTEQmpd_6VMA8dQSA.text: Looking for food at 1:00am in the Palazzo and this restaurant was open.  Placed the take out order at bar and was told the wait would be between 18-20 minutes for a burger and fries. We got the sandwich in 20 minutes and went Back to room. Got ready to eat and the fries were cold. I guess we should have eaten in the restaurant for hot food.

Qig7IFKIGpx7YZgxRJAorA.text: Great service & food. Went for breakfast, buffet was $18.95 pp. Buffet had a lot to offer, egg, bacon, fruit, waffles & more! It's located inside the Venetian by the casino.

Lf28-OF3nTqKpk3CnJwtvA.text: I came here twice this past labor day weekend.   The first time was for brunch on Saturday and I was craving breakfast after a long night of drinking. This place was perfect since I was staying at the Palazzo. I got a breakfast brioche sandwich that came with some potato grits. It was huge and delicious! I even  had trouble finishing the sandwich. I highly recommend this sandwich, its only $11.   The second time here was on Sunday like around 5am. After a long night of club hopping and partying we had to make a stop here. My friends and I were all starving and some of us were even drunk. This time I ordered the DeLux Drive-In Burger, it came with an order of fries. The burger was tasty and the fries were good. The place was full around this time, I guess its a popular place after being up all night in Vegas. We even started talking to some girls that were sitting next to us... haha!   I highly recommend this place for either breakfast or lunch. It is very affordable and you feel like you're dining at a super expensive restaurant. I still need to go back to try their dinner plates. I will be back!!

I5QVwMzfbjrDxCQcQlHpag.text: I ate at both of the locations inside the Venetian and Palazzo - both for breakfast.  Very good breakfast at a price that was more reasonable than I had expected.  the service was fantastic.  I had the buffet one day and ordered off of the menu the next day.  Both times, the food was very good.  The atmosphere reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory, but toned down just a bit.

0LgBycB8mTEF8P5TTnMvkQ.text: Pleasant breakfast, I would recommend. I had the buffet, pastries were good, coffee was okay. Not too expensive, good value for the money.

yKMgOrMPwuiFGFO2kXP2Pw.text: The House Favorite Slow Roasted Chicken was really good.  The meat was moist.  It suppose to come with mash potatoes, but the mash potatoes masher machine was broken when I was there, so they waiters allowed us to choose a replacement side.  We got the clam chowder.  Surprisingly, the clam chowder was really good too.  The portions are pretty big for one person, but a good size for two people.    The look and feel of the restaurant is similar to Cheesecake Factory, but the food is way better at Grand Lux Cafe.

zXaSSya5js9jSzWM63KB9g.text: I've eaten here the last two times I was in Vegas. Great service and great food. Everything is good. This time I got the empanadas and the crispy Carmel chicken. Both were amazing.

qXYlDLpvfUL05N8vWZt7eA.text: This restaurant is located in the Palazzo. This place is owned by the people who own the Cheesecake Factory I believe. I love eating here because there's so many choices an the portions are huge. I like rating at this location better than the Venetian because there are more tables and the ambiance is much brighter. The breakfast items are delicious and the appetizers are too. I suggest the seared ahi! I love the salads too, very fresh ingredients.   The only bad thing is service is a bit slow and this place has always been busy whenever I have came here.  ^_^*~

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seared ahi appetizer, dinner salad 2010

Ro24u32zkgSJ6Lr5nYTX3g.text: Food was good and service was good. I had the Huevos Rancheros and it was really good, highly recommend it.

VVv2D7i5-jQx9xYgTeNQqg.text: Still slightly jetlagged and tired from a night out, we came to the Grand Lux for lunch. The waitstaff were super nice and joked around with us since we were a big, (slighty loud) group of girls.   We had been told the portions were big, but we didn't realize exactly how monstrous they were. I had the Grand Lux Burger Melt, which came in parmesan crusted bread (not a burger bun I should add, it was like Ciabatta bread) with a sauce, and fries on the side-- DELICIOUS! One of the best burgers I've had though I would probably call it more of a sandwich since it was not a burger bun. You also get free soda refills which is awesome.   Since it was my Birthday-- and they knew this because we were all wearing ridiculously awesome Carnaval masks at the table and they asked us the occasion-- they brought out a Birthday desert which was basically whipped cream and a cookie of sorts with a candle.   I should say that serve wasn't always on point, we had to ask a couple of times for refills, and for a place setting. But well priced and good atmosphere.

U-QwiK3rsDfqRD-8vpVyPQ.text: I used to really love this place...but the service killed me last time I went there. We went twice on our most recent trip to Vegas because my sister loves the bbq pork sandwich. So this review is not about the food. The food was good. The first time we went, our server just came to our table with total attitude and asked us if we wanted drinks. No hello, no how are you, just attitude. The second time we went we probably had to wait around an hour for our food. When we walked into the restaurant, I was pretty tipsy, bordering on drunk, but by the time our food came, I was stone cold sober. And I even had a drink while I was waiting for my food. That's how long it took. I wish the server had apologized or something for the long wait, but no, she said nothing. Oh well. I probably won't go there again.

K2cjmCYKKop5ihKQaiY4jg.text: The Grand Lux Cafe at Palazzo is the easiest place to grab a good, quick bite.  The food is always good at both the Palazzo and Venetian and the Venetian location has the best steak and eggs in Vegas.  I've had breakfast, burgers, pot roast, drinks and various appetizers and have never been disappointed.    My blog has way more specifics, but the Grand Lux is great.

BGDnlGUdEzTKIX7GgrpQjg.text: Love this place!  It's the people from Cheesecake Factory and 24 hours!  And, even though, it's in the Palazzo, the prices are not that bad.  Nuff said!

VBNwcTt-CD9FBVvwtZvjOw.text: This was our restaurant for the past two bachelorette parties I have been to in Vegas. The girls and I ate here 2-3 times both visits. They are open late, so it is convenient to eat here on the way to stubbling back up to the room. Only complaint I have is that the service is quite slow, especially late. But, the food isn't too pricey and it is high quality. I will definitely be back here next time I'm in Vegas!

T0GvwOSvkB2itG9REMBVJw.text: Almost crusted fish with mashed potatoes was excellent. Rib eye ok. Reasonable prices and huge portions

maq6CFjdwnoCt9imYWBOvA.text: one of the best places in Vegas, open 24 hours. Every dish is great! Highly recommend it! worth the walk thru the Venetian!

o1okHRJMsk5CVos60a1zsQ.text: I've been here more times than I can count, and I also like to get take out. The portions are huge. Some of the yummy highlights: Mongolian Steak, Spicy Chicken Flatbread Sandwich, Shrimp Scampi, and the Beignets. Not a huge fan of the Shaking Beef (I don't like cilantro) or the Chicken Pot Pie (looks better than it tastes - too watery). Service can be a little slow, as it is usually pretty busy.

cnWna3MuMViyop37ufBEsA.text: Soooo out of all the Grand Lux locations this has the WORST service and food is good...if it comes out right. For some reason its just not as great as the others. Brought friends here after bragging about it and was embarrassed. I'll stick to the one next door in the Venetian.

wE7PDWHJI6S13zmuktVZyA.text: The service is so bad that I didn't even get in for dinner instead I just went to the grand lux at Venetian !!! we were waiting for 20 minutes until the they called our name and found out he took us to the bar which we cleared stated we don't want  Then we wait for another 10 minutes and another waitress lead us to a small table ...we always order large portion of food so obviously we need bigger table and there's tons of empty tables but they insist we have to wait again for who knows how long so I just told them I'm going to Venetian  When we got to Venetian the wait is only 5 minutes and the service is way nicer

GoxrQE23qiPNrBIIFa37zw.text: My husband and I heard this restaurant was the Cheesecake Factory's sister restaurant, which is one of our favorite places to eat, and were very excited to eat here. Boy was our thinking way off from the truth! We sat down in the bar area and our booth was right next to a glass wall. You are sitting on the other side of other diners and it was very uncomfortable having them stare at your food and you while you ate. Of course it was hard for us to not look and stare as well. The set up was very poor. We both decided to order the same meal, the lunch portion of pasta telephono and salad. Everyone around us received fresh bread (as we saw everyone next to us through the glass wall) I guess our waitress decided we didn't need it. Our salads arrived and i got the house salad with ranch, which was pretty good. My husband order the caesar salad. It came with whole leaves and spicy caesar dressing, so spicy my husband couldn't even eat it. And who wants to cut their salad with a knife and fork? When we got our pasta it was completely dried out on the top and the pasta sauce was runny. The noodles wouldn't even hold the pasta sauce. In the middle of my husband eating, he immediately said he didn't feel well, went to the bathroom and got sick. For the rest of the day he was so sick to his stomach! This place is awful and the food is really poor quality. If you're looking for an extensive and creative menu you might as well hit the real thing and go to the Cheesecake Factory.

ptIY4KIVqkbiy3Uh1mQEpQ.text: Went here before catching our flight home. The food was brought out timely.  I had the breakfast sandwich, it was good but the hash browns was plain. The GF had the eggs/hash brown/toast. She says eggs were alright, but hash & toast not really good. Service was decent til we had to go, then server was no where to be found.  I would eat here as a last resort.

ZmpyivkXpiWpF_VuN-Wsvw.text: If nothing else is open, you can get airport food served to you by people who clearly wish they were somewhere else. If anything else IS open, go...literally anywhere else.

K7HwqC67_XJNviphGCi94Q.text: It's vegas and I expect excellent service and excellent food choices.  This place never disappoints.  Portions are huge much like Cheesecake Factory and the food was divine.  I had the breakfast buffet which I loved.  Was not too over the top but the food quality and choices were a plenty.  I love the sausages they have here which I never know what they are called.  I think I had at least one of everything and that include the pastries.  Coffee was really good and everyone's food on the table looked and tasted :) awesome.  There is really no complaints and you can't go wrong here.  A welcome change from just eating at a normal vegas buffet.

S2yWFPP5baj62qGLsDGDKg.text: No wait, great service, very good food, esp seafood salad and shrimp scampi

M_2zQPtQpBzjZeIigloLqA.text: They took the only thing off the menu that I ate.  Short rib sloppy Joe.  It was amazing (tear).

LaHRpiruvWECeMCrluvymA.text: Grand Lux Cafe is basically a slightly fancier Cheesecake Factory. The menu is very similar but some of the items have different names. Our server did a great job and the food was very good overall. I highly recommend the Chicken Royale but beware....it's huge!!!! Make sure you bring your appetite.

Ebaiho7w7RshNtr--c_ZxQ.text: I've enjoyed the food and service at  the Venetian's Grand Lux and expected the same experience at this one in the Palazzo.  Our group of 8 people decided a good meal was in order to start the New Years festivities.  Unfortunately this place could only provide a lousy meal with service to match.  The beer that I ordered tasted bad and when I mentioned it to our server, he informed me that the glasses aren't always rinsed as well as they should be.  When my daughter informed him that her sirloin was inedible, the server told her she should have ordered the filet.  The beer was removed from the bill but the steak wasn't.  Some in our group commented they remember receiving better food and service at their high school cafeteria.  The experience was so bad I thought it should be brought to the attention of the Palazzo's management and contacted the front desk.  I was informed that a manager could be summoned but the answer would be the same; as the GLC was a tennant, complaints will be referred to the cafe's manager.  When he called a short time later, an apology was offered along with a gift certificate to be mailed.  My companions questioned the logic; after what had happened we were to receive a lure to return?  Well, it's now 25 days later and nothing has been received.  I've spoken with others about the incident and have heard similar stories; the GLC at the Venetian is great, the one at the Palazzo....not so much.  One person went shortly after it opened and thought it just needed to iron out the kinks -- and then realized at his next visit a year later that they still didn't have it right.

svlgAGrUB8RQvNzQn3CwEA.text: Our party of 4 all ordered different dishes: calamari salad, polynesian salad, short rib grilled cheese, and fried chicken with waffles. The sandwich was probably the tastiest of the bunch.  I thought both salads were really doused with dressing which made them soggy and inedible. My fried chicken with waffles was basically a pile of chicken tenders on a dry belgian waffle--Roscoe's does a better job, albeit with much less ambiance.  We pre-ordered the beignets with 3 dipping sauces because the waiter said it would take at least 20 mins to prepare. They arrived as soft, airy, puffy balls of pastry. While they were not half-bad, that these were not even trying to be the real thing.  All in all, decent place to take a group because the menu's got something for everyone.

OyPRI9WpJX-55uuNbSBVRg.text: Consistently good food with huge portions.    The chicken royale is very good and I was not able to finish the meal.

1TyKLADGba-9w5PgKH-QjA.text: Like seriously... the chicken and waffles. THE CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!!!! We stayed in the Venetian and walked by this place several times and didn't even consider it... no idea why, but I'm ashamed. On the last day before we left for the airport we needed somewhere quick and in our hotel. Ended up here, ended up with friend chicken and waffles, and ultimately ended up smuggling some of the chicken in my purse for the plane ride. I have no regrets.

NB-Esh2zJkP0-mohpoi17w.text: If you're staying at the Palazzo or the Venetian, you've most likely eaten at Grand Lux. It reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory or a BJ's. And they're pretty much open at all hours, so whenever you get back from the club or whatever, or whenever you wake up, whatever you're craving, they've got it. :) The end.

Kvx25qBTi8eZNjdHgZ-6UA.text: Checked in with my wife yesterday for desserts. Were seated for 20 minutes with no server to help us. The tables were not even full, and they did not even bother to ask us for water or drinks!   Then I saw servers leaving in groups to end their shifts. I guess they were more interested in going home than serving us!

1sgbp_WrJgX5bsosvyMe3A.text: We were looking for a place that had great food, and we found it!  The atmosphere was cozy and a little on the dark side, and we were seated right away.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  When she gave us our menus, I almost passed out- holy cats!  There were almost as many items on the menu as The Cheesecake Factory- no joke!!!! I'm thinking to myself- how can this little restaurant possibly do all of these items right?  I mean, there were so many, and they were so varied!  Salads, pasta dishes, soups, seafood, meats, vegetarian and vegan dishes....the list was overwhelming!  My hubs ordered a salmon dish, and since I'm not a seafood lover, and I had a not so fun night the night before, (food poisoning), so I needed to keep it safe food-wise...I ordered the carbonara  without any chicken.    We didn't wait too long, and we were having a good time listening to the two young dudes next to us trying to pick up these two beautiful women that were way out of their league- seriously, Vegas is so much fun to people watch! :)   My husband said his salmon dish was beyond amazing.  He tried to get me to try a bite, but I wasn't having that- no matter how great he said it was.  I could tell by the look on his face he was in salmon heaven.    My carbonara was ridiculous!!!!! It was THE BEST I've ever had!!!!!! The pasta was so perfect and it tasted like it was maybe cooked with garlic and cream.  The sauce was not too buttery, but just right.  Savory. Creamy. Perfect! I love bacon, but usually not chunks...but this bacon was chunky and so tasty!  No chewy fatty pieces either- just crazy flavor! :). The peas were nice as well.   I was only sad because I couldn't eat all of it, and I don't have a refrigerator in my room....so sadly I had to leave the rest.    Overall, the server was awesome and the salmon dish and carbonara was amazing.  This is a must stop.  Don't be fooled by the lack of fanciness...It will very pleasantly surprise you!

In_EMuavhKTKZuV2osbhMQ.text: This is one of the more solid choices on the Strip. If you're looking for quality food at a non-resort price, this place is one of your best choices. Service was a bit slow out of the kitchen, but that's my only True complaint. Our server was excellent.   We stopped in to show some out of town guests the Venetian and Palazzo over the holidays. We decided to get dinner and I recommended the Grand Lux for its wide ranging menu. We had a couple kids with us and were really impressed by the kids' menu--quality and quantity were outstanding. The food was delicious and I like the ambience, although the music was a tad loud.   All in all a great experience and I will return.

hQ8wa-SXAgRW_2mH31HiKg.text: No wait for breakfast, good service and great food. We enjoyed this grand lux cafe much better than the one next door at The Venetian. Portions were better and food was tastier. Overall, easy convenient spot for a bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg sandwich

kFxcPtNnKE1WWmtNEGn4cA.text: I like the location at the palazzo because they have more options. The tapas are good. My favorite dessert is the beignets, which are only at the palazzo one. Service is good. Food is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets with Chocolate , raspberry, and whiskey vanilla sauce. Delicious. Order with meal, takes a while.

SCDLLDuOvFlg37aUdPngYw.text: There are 2 Grand Lux Cafes - one located at the Venetian; and this one, loated at Palazzo.  Difference between the 2:  This one offers Beignets.   My go to spot for Breakfast only.

UuYYK8hUtji_q1XiTZ0FNA.text: I always frequent the Grand Lux location at the Venetian, which is 24 hours.  First time staying at the Palazzo and we got hungry and went here.  Service was prompt.  Great food.  It's similar to Cheesecake Factory, but I feel like Grand Lux has better menu offerings.  Great place to grab some food and share.

dXF2lzgbYFCcCIEcAdS1kw.text: Shopping can be so exhausting at the Palazzo. I know....life is tough.  There are a plethora of places to sit down and eat. Actually it is quite overwhelming to pick a place. Something persuaded me to enter the Grand Luxe Cafe.  I was not too thrilled at first because I've been to one at Beverly Center (back home in LA). It was late morning and I had left my friends at the hotel to venture off on my own. With that said I didn't need to wait in line like the rest of the folks, I got seated right away at the counter in the bar area.   My server's name was Chris (he remembered me when I visited again the second time a month later). We had a few great conversations and I even chatted with the folks who sat next to me.   I love breakfast so I opted for just plain old eggs and toast. Then I wanted orange juice.....just a little kicked up.....got myself a Clementine Crush (Clementine Orange Vodka and Cointreau Shaken with Fresh Orange, Lime, Passion Fruit and Pineapple Juice). Let me tell you, that drink was the perfect way to start my morning at Vegas. It was so freakin' good even my neighbor got the same order. Maybe it's the way Chris makes it....who knows.....but this shit is good. I was a little tipsy so had to stay a little bit longer than I expected, lol.  The service is outstanding. The atmosphere is relaxing. And the Clementine Crush is to die for. And yes I came back here again for breakfast a few months later.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clementine Crush
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. over medium
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast of champions

3tIiUwnBHPKoghi0h_ujiQ.text: Located inside the Palazzo Hotel & Casino.  Owned by the same people as the Cheesecake Factory. It's evident the moment you walk in. The menu is as diverse as you would expect at the cheesecake factory, but just a little better IMO. I've never really liked the Cheesecake Factory, but for some reason I like the Grand Lux Cafe.   This location isn't 24 hrs. For that you'll have to walk across the casino floor through the corridor of shops and restaurants and make your way to the Venetian. There you will find the 24 hr Grand Lux Cafe. Food and service is the same at both so it's just a matter of convenience in choosing which location to dine at.  If you're having a hard time choosing what to order out of the hundreds of menu options, I've never regretted getting their chicken pot pie. Full of comforting goodness. They also have some decent steaks considering they aren't a steakhouse.

Wq99OoaRoAz-1n92Q2tGpQ.text: Very quick service, went there for breakfast for two. Place is open 24 hours, very convenient if you are staying at The Venetian. Only reason why I nicked a star is their breakfast sandwich and their breakfast quesadilla is extremely greasy. You either love grease or you don't. I can't stand insanely greasy food and both of these items were very greasy. None the less I would come back here to try some other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Sandwhich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Quesadilla
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Sandwhich

Z0j6Pa-5bp2xSjIar2yPkw.text: I am always in search of a good happy hour deal, and a friend has raved about the Grand Lux Cafe for years, so I when I decided to finally try it out, I was pleasantly surprised to find that they offered a happy hour--and a pretty decent one at that. But while the prices were great, the food was just OK.  Draft beers were $4 (regularly $7), and there were a myriad of appetizers for $5.50 each. Because the normal app prices are in the $9-$11 range, I thought these would be smaller portions. Nope. They were HUGE! I ordered the Asian nachos (my friend's favorite), and my husband ordered the potato spring rolls. Both items were visually appealing but sadly lacked flavor. The nachos had a tasty peanut sauce, but the fried wontons tasted a little like Styrofoam and there wasn't much chicken to speak of. And while the spring rolls were topped with cheese and crispy bacon, the mashed potato filling was pretty bland. I'll give them points for creativity, and I can't complain much at $5.50 a pop, but I wouldn't pay full price for either item.  Grand Lux has a pretty extensive full menu, so if you choose to eat in the restaurant (happy hour is at the bar only), you might have better luck. But if you're on this part of the Strip and you're looking for a great happy hour, walk a few blocks down to The Yard House at The Linq. Beer is a little more expensive, but the food is better and the view is killer!

LoAWE2ZMGJssv58Vi6NagA.text: This was the last of the three lunch dates that the No1DP and I had on our most recent Vegas trip. We wanted to have a meal but not have the meal overshadow what we were going to have for dinner, so we opted for classic comfort food without going to a fancy schmancy place that offered a lunch menu or a restaurant owned by a celebrity chef, which is a lot of restaurants around the Venetian/Palazzo area.  I had a feeling that the wait times were going to be long come lunch hour so around 11:45 I claimed my table for two, which took around ~5 minutes. This ended up being a good decision because when the No1DP left workshops to meet me for lunch around 12:10, the line was out the restaurant.  No1DP and I sat in a table that was so small it could barely fit ourselves and our drinks, plates and silverware much less what we ordered. As there was another pair sitting to the right of the waitstaff couldn't put any extra food there (to the left was the main walkway and kitchen area) and we wondered how they were going to manage our orders once they were ready.  No1DP had a beer while I had these morning cocktails. Strawberry Bellini ($10.95): Fresh Strawberries, Champagne and Triple Sec. The fresh strawberries were the star of this cocktail. Strawberries were still sweet enough to eat afterwards.  The Grand Mimosa ($10.95): With Mumm Napa, Grand Marnier and Fresh Orange Juice. I've had better mimosas for cheaper, balance between champagne and OJ was a bit off.  We had the following dishes a la carte. Seared Rare Ahi Tuna Salad ($16.95): romaine, radicchio, frisee and avocado tossed in vinaigrette. We were warned about how big these salads were - when the dish came out we thought the salad could serve 3! There were plenty of greens and ahi on that plate. Vinaigrette was tart and light. Ahi was lightly salted and quite soft though a little more firm than sashimi ahi.   As we were eating our salad the plates containing the two other orders were brought forth but the waiter noticed that since we had no room on our table he promptly brought the dishes back to the kitchen. As we finished the ahi the waiter passed us by without checking up on us to see if we were finished nor asked us if we would like our other entrees next. It wasn't until we prompted him about ~15 minutes later to take away our salad plate to make room for the other dishes.   New Orleans Shrimp Saute ($14.95): shrimp, tomatoes, roasted peppers and cajun spices, all simmered in a delicious tasso sauce, served with steamed white rice and grilled bread. The best dish of the three, sauce was buttery, smokey and a bit spicy. Long grained rice suited this dish well as it absorbed the sauce, as did the thin and crunchy bread.   Housemade Pierogies ($13.95): potato dumplings with slow roasted short rib, mushrooms and onion. garnished with green onion and sour cream. Both of us had pierogies before and we both agreed that this dish more resembled a gyoza than a pierogi. Pierogis can be heavy but are not supposed to be deep fried and heavy as this. As we were already stuffed by the previous dish we struggled to eat even one "pierogi".   Supposedly they are more known for their breakfasts so I'll have to check that out one day but I'll explore other options for lunch and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Grand Mimosa 10.95 With Mumm Napa, Grand Marnier and Fresh Orange Juice
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Rare Ahi Tuna Salad ($16.95)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Bellini 10.95 Fresh Strawberries, Champagne and Triple Sec

VP9hcEsx8aHPm0354-fLCw.text: We go here for all of our special occasions. We love the southwestern salad, buffalo chicken rolls, jambalaya and more! Mmm and that peach Bellini is so good! Definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Graduation dinner at Grand Lux with the rents!

VZ4QE52g_sQqTtmXehDxeA.text: We ate here yesterday and today. Our waitress Amy was outstanding. The food was great. We also ate by Maks from dancing with the stars which was amazing. We are planning to eat there for happy hour and breakfast tomorrow again. So many choices. We had the buffet, chicken and waffles, and crab and asparagus omelette. They also have the most enormous english muffins.

aqKgoQk-v2ftGo_S2JkDwQ.text: I used to think I was a fan of Grand Lux Cafe, just because I guiltily love Cheesecake Factory (same corporate owners), but the last three times I've been here have been really underwhelming.  The best thing about this place is that it's opened 24 hours, but unless other 24 hour cafes at other Vegas resorts, they don't serve oatmeal 24 hours. Boo. They make one giant batch and stop serving it after breakfast.  Since I wasn't in the mood for anything else, I got a salad and soup for $10. Salad was good, the soup, Chicken Tortilla, was mediocre. The one over at CF is way better. The complimentary bread was really good though! Fluffy and soft, with really tasty butter.

Tn-BfzSUXp0Y2I2XboAY5w.text: Tip: SIT @ the bar!  It's faster and you get better service I think.  The food is excellent here!   I always get the same thing, buffalo chicken bites as an app. & the lettuce wraps for an entree even though they are on the app menu they are a meal in them self!  If you're an adult beverage consumer like myself, try the blanco sangria!! It's delish!  The atmosphere is super chill and it is a nice place to get away from the Las Vegas Heat in the summertime!

wsTG6hRIWIkcDuEiPsJHqg.text: The goods: Open 24 hours day; you can charge it to your room, pretty big and plenty of items on their menu.  The bads: Way too greasy  So, apparently these guys are related to the Cheesecake Factory. I had an unfortunate incident on my last CF experience that I was pretty much traumatized for a few days...not really a big deal, but the food at the time was was too buttery for me to handle.  Anyways, even though I knew walking in that these guys were related to the CF, it didn't really register in my mind of my past experience so without thinking, I ordered their breakfast sandwich.  But reality came to me right away after the first bite since the bread was just soaked in butter. And I was thinking...no no not again. It was way too much butter for me to handle and I just ate everything else except the bread.  I had to wash it down with a nice frosty brew since I was sitting at the bar, it made sense for me to have a beer to get myself back to equilibrium.  They have two Grand Lux Cafes to choose from here at the Palazzo and Venetian.  Note to self: Be careful of greasy foods at the CF.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich

cblcxg0ITZmvQhk0-F-pJA.text: After looking for a reasonably priced restaurant that serves pasta we chose the Grand Lux cafe.  We were surprised by the nice ambiance and ease of getting a table quickly. Our pasta dishes were delicious even given a thumbs up by our Italian relatives. Our waitress Samba not only gave us great service but was very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely return when in LV.

tl_TmR5F8QFcLn1LBfmzEQ.text: I eat lunch here at least once a month. Sit out in the indoor patio area where it's quieter if you want to actually carry on a conversation or in the bar. The trout and salads are always great. Salads are very large portions, Great fish n chips and crab cakes, too. Staff is usually pretty attentive.

TeUC5VDs2ZV3m_xWGlzPTQ.text: Same owners as The Cheesecake Factory, so you can expect a similar menu and same size servings. Best part of this place is the staff - they are all super friendly and helpful. Every dining experience here was a pleasure. Great place to grab breakfast!

lD5Txr73pFKcSaMd3OJyng.text: Considering that most of the restaurants on the strip are overpriced and overhyped, I was very pleased with Grand Lux. I had The Max burger which was HUGE. It came with a generous helping of fries on the side. I couldn't finish it at all, especially since it was lunchtime and I was saving my stomach for dinner at Bouchon (yelp.com/biz/bouchon-las...). The burger was loaded with lettuce, tomato, cheese, bacon, and shortrib meat. There may have been sauce, but who knows. There was so much flavor and juice and ohhhh yummm I'm drooling a little on my keyboard. Sorry for the vivid description, but seriously, get this burger. And to top it off, all of that for 14 bucks! My mom had the lettuce wraps which were great, well seasoned with chicken and veggies and some light sauce. The only complaint I really have is that the service was pretty slow and the waiter didn't even bring us bread until we asked for it. I know it was really busy, but come on! Bread is not that hard to remember, especially when every table has some except us. Of course, the fact that it's open 24 hours is also great, especially since there is pretty limited real dining 24 hours in Vegas (ironic, right?)

25BoSItrJyXNvPmqIES8OQ.text: Even though they have one at the Beverly Center in California, I've eaten here the last two times i've been to Vegas. I think if you're looking for a nice, decent, comfortable, affordable place to eat after you've spent a good amount of money gambling, this is the place. The portions are huge and we all couldnt finish all our food! I had the salmon thats prepared three different ways and I LOVED IT! We also ordered the beignets(sp?) for dessert and it was waay better than the ones at Disneyland. I highly recommend this place if you dont feel like eating at any of the other high end restaurants in Vegas. The only thing is that our server messed up on our bill by charging us twice for gratuity or something (my friend figured it out, I wasnt paying attention) and he barely came back to check on us or refill our drinks. We also ate here on a Sunday night around 10 so it wasnt too busy.

I_hmQlky_WpU8fLEvCZq-g.text: So ive been to this Grand Lux and the one in LA several times. The food is usually OK. I mean its good. Not great, not "oh my gosh i can't wait to get back," just ok, i ate. So this place lost 1 star because both locations are pretty inconsistant. One day the food is really good, and the next time your like, did i order this last time? the next star is because i waited an hour for my food when everyone seated the same time as us were leaving when our food arrived. I really wanted to give it a 2, but in fairness i've had more good experiences than bad ones.

iQ2kNQ6XFmYnFYcZ8MB5XQ.text: Waffle was just ok.  The batter they use is more heavy than the light waffles I prefer.

BqPk2HAnNM72CTGI2-g-Pg.text: Okay my review is a little biased because of the awful service we received. First let me say i have been to grand lux in houston several times, the food is delicious, low prices and the portions are huge. It was also highly convenient, open 24 hrs and in my hotel the Venetian right next to the casino tables, whats there not to love right...the service it was awful during the day, we waited over an hr for a turkey sandwich, no apologies from the manager it was like this was a normal thing i am very dissapointed at this level of service....i will only order to go next time.

39erB1oJEw3UWSBKnbbREg.text: This cafe is pretty much the same as the one at the Venetian but it's not open 24 hours.  I went here for breakfast and loved it.  Way too much food to eat.  I was exited to see orange marmalade for the toast, but the bread was so hard I couldn't eat it.  It seemed more like a french baget than regular old fashioned loaf bread.  I know they are trying to be fancy but if you can't actually eat it, what is the point of serving it?        Do not order iced coffee here, it's not good and they don't know how to make it.   I ordered an iced mocha and it was not stirred, or blended or melted.  Stirring it before every sip and then getting huge chuncks of chocolate from the bottom of the cup is gross.  (Even if it's Godiva.)        Service was great even though the place was pretty busy.  I liked that this one has windows, even though there is not much a view.  I'd go back to eat here again, it's a decent place.

FsKdUFtZlgHXp3JaEXErWA.text: Came here on my first trip to Vegas, this place has a great variety of food so plenty of choices and the prices are decent. If your in the Palazzo looking for a casual not ridiculously priced dinner this is the place...my spicy chicken flatbread was ok nothing special

8-awPdTTF50P-_ArKGENYw.text: Two weekends ago, we went to Las Vegas for JC's birthday. For the record, best birthday celebration ever!! We stayed at the Palazzo, so, partly out of convenience, partly out of curiosity, we did dinner at Grand Lux one night. JP got the Jamaican Pork Tenderloin, my memory tells me JC got the reuben but I can't find it on the menu, not quite remembering what JL got, KL had the Asian Nachos, BT went for the Chicken Pot Pie, and I had the Madeira Chicken. I only got around to trying JP's and BT's dishes in addition to mine. The Jamaican pork was really good. It comes with rice, mashed sweet potatoes, and mango salsa. Hearty. If there's one criticism, maybe it was a bit salty. The chicken pot pie was the biggest. pot. pie. EVER. The area of the crust was as big as both my hands together. Ok, so I have midget hands. But still! Creamy. Delish. My Madeira Chicken served with mashed potatoes and asparagus was perfect. I'm always a fan of any creamy wine sauce. Mashed potatoes equals comfort. Asparagus equals love. It's nothing super fancy, just exactly what my taste buds were asking for.  Fast forward to one day later. We had been up till 9am playing blackjack and were running on no sleep. Slightly dejected after losing a fair amount of money, but mostly needing showers, we went back up to our room to shower and get ready for checkout, then JP, JC, JC2, BT, TC, and I had our last lunch at Grand Lux. Not remembering what everyone had this time. I'll venture to say the DeLux Drive-In Burger, Grand Club, and the Santa Barbara Chicken Sandwich were among the choices. Definitely not remembering what JP got. She was too preoccupied with getting back to the blackjack tables. so JP is huddled in the corner struggling to stay awake, conflicted between her desire to take a nap and her significantly more urgent need to get back to the tables. I ordered the Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich, which was excellent. A chicken sandwich with lettuce and tomato, kicked up with pepper jack and avocado-corn salsa. I want to say it was one giant sandwich cut into quarters, but it was really four still-giant sandwiches. Before I got to my second sandwich, JP had already finished whatever she ordered, threw her credit card down on the table for us to pay with, and ran back to the casino. By herself. Addict.  In the past, I've also had the Crispy Thai Shrimp & Chicken Spring Rolls, Lemon Chicken Piccata, and Banana Cream Pie, all of which I would recommend. I've always had great service, the atmosphere is great, and it's just the kind of place you want to be. Comfortable and consistent. Unfortunately there aren't as many pictures as usual, as I was too preoccupied with my meal companion or we were too concerned with getting back to the blackjack tables, but there are a few that will hopefully suffice. In summary, it's simple, nothing absolutely crazy gourmet, but definitely hits the spot and more than satisfactory. Huge portions and so good! Yummers!!!!

VURnfepnq5lSn5hASHT1Vg.text: I've eaten here probably a dozen times at my frequent stays at the Palazzo. It's a step up from the Cheescake Factory which I hear it is owned by? The chicken and waffles are good, and I love the ahi tuna rolls. I usually eat here for brunch, lunch, or breakfast. I guess whenever I get up. It always hits the spot, and the portions are huge. I'm definately a FAN!

MEUVB67BkAU_i7nQSVsyTA.text: One of my top three places to go when I visit Vegas. We went two times this trip alone. Try absolutely anything on the menu, it'll be awesome. On our first day, we went for lunch. I had the pasta telefono, with a salad off the lunch portion menu, my husband has the miso glazed salmon lunch portion. Both were huge lunch portions, we left so satisfied and full. The pasta was al dente, with a homemade sauce. The combination of cheese, cream and crunchy baked crumbs were memorable and addictive. The salmon was fresh and briny, the miso glaze complimented and did not overpower the delicate fish. The salmon was served with fluffy white rice and stir fried vegetables. Yummy.  Went again, late night, I had the waffle with strawberries and my husband had the crunchy chicken. HUGE portions, very reasonably priced. The server was welcoming, offering suggestions off the menus based not on upping his check, but on his favorites. Can't wait until my next vacation to go back to this place.

PW9NmdsgEqN6tlcDwLIs6A.text: Ate here today and just loved it! This was our 3rd visit here and I'm always impressed at how busy they are and how well they handle the customers. Waitress provided great service and had a great personality.  Food was excellent as usual for all Cheesecake Factory restaurants.
