I had the corkscrew pasta w/sundried tomatoes and chicken and that was excellent. My husband had the Southwestern Salad which was also excellent with a lot of flavor.  My daughter's chicken picata was cooked perfectly.  We had a party of 10 and everyone left happy.  They have a lot of parking and it's close to the restaurant which is good for families like ours as we don't need to drag the kids very far to eat.

JCDLTlbIKDTnhFXouiDGhA.text: My husband and I were at the Palazzo to have afternoon coffee.  We were directed to the Grand Lux Cafe.  We ordered the beignets and grand coffee.  The beignets were totally reminiscent of Cafe du Monde in New Orleans, except these ones had chocolate sauce, raspberry sauce and another one I can't recall.  It came in a basket of 8 or 10 (we ate them  so fast, we couldn't remember exactly how many).  The server was very nice and attentive.  Overall a great experience.

omVRdQnHiSm9XrygUlcDQg.text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our hearty lunch at the Grand Lux Cafe, which is also owned by the same folks of The Cheesecake Factory.  The menu and offerings are slightly different, although you can still get the same cheesecake for dessert.  We shared a lunch combination of a rustic barbeque chicken pizza and green salad, ahi tuna ceviche, and the recommended chicken pot pie.  The ceviche came in generous portions and was served with crunchy strips, greens, and chips.  I would have liked it to be less salty, though.  The pizza was delicious and served on a large crisped flat crust.  We also enjoyed the chicken pot pie, with its rich and creamy sauce, tender chicken pieces, cooked vegetables, and buttery thick crust.  Be prepared to share dishes as everything comes in large servings.  With a huge menu, plenty of seating, and friendly service, this is a great spot to dine at anytime of day.

IqKcikM01BID89wvBDFiOA.text: Stumbled into this place while playin the slots! By the way, the Indiana Jones slotmachine is awesome! The food here is good and they have a alot of selections. It's not too expensive and the portions are huge. Very Cheesecake Factoryish. These thai and vietnamese spring rolls were delicious!! I'll come back again for some cheap, good and fast food!

5dQqi8sk7Bri_AnyJuPSJg.text: greatest service i ve ever had, they have those awesome ppl. all kind of food there r recommended, i m not a dessert person, but their desserts r really good

h6FMTOiIlZKVaq5hpaUVmg.text: one of my favorite places to eat at when in Vegas.  great variety and nice big portions.  they have a chocolate lava cake that rivals the cholocate soufle at Roy's! a good second choice dessert is the strawberry shortcake.  it's huge!!!  the burgars are great there too. it's a must try if in Vegas!

4mABhbaH-4htdXKQXIlt7g.text: After an hour of walking around the Shops at Palazzo and looking at the various menus, we came back to the Grand Lux Cafe after yelping "lava cake." Don't make the mistake that we first made by going to the Grand Lux at the Venetian, as they don't serve lava cake there. So once we found the right one, we ordered from their tapas page at the front of the menu, basically a variety of small plates. We tried almost everything: calamari, ahi tuna ceviche, and the short rib asian tacos, macaroni and cheese, buffalo chicken bites, mini pastrami reuben sandwiches.  And of course for dessert the lava cake. Our favorites were the ceviche and short rib tacos. The calamari and pastrami dishes were very good too. The macaroni and cheese was not good at all. In the menu it's described as creamy, but the cheese on top was rock hard. When I decided to take it home for the kids, I found all the creaminess had separated and was at the bottom of the little skillet that it's served in. Best thing about the little plates are the reasonable prices and you still have room for dessert. And you MUST save room for dessert. The lava cake here was to die for, and dare I say it, the best lava cake I've ever had! The presentation was beautiful, on a rectangular platter, the cake, scoop of vanilla ice cream, garnish of strawberries all in a row, with a sweep of chocolate ganash along the top. They have a selection of baked to order desserts, including this one, that you have to order at least 30 minutes in advance. It had a perfectly chewy, brownie like consistency on the outside and once you poked a hole in it, the piping hot ganache comes flowing out like.... lava. So perfect!  Also, they had a great service. Our server in particular was amazing. We noticed that he didn't write anything down when we ordered and we asked him about it later. He said that he's taken orders for parties of 12 and remembers everything.   So if you don't know what to eat while in Vegas, come here because they have everything and they do it really well.

08i3dR3gX2tyfuXP5udc9A.text: This place is just as good as the one in it's partner hotel, The Venetian...  So, if you wanted to eat at this restaurant, you can go to either and have the same great food...  My favorite is the Miso Glazed Salmon...  Total best...  But if you like having more than one item, they have combination dishes...  Two of their regular dishes, just a smaller version paired together to be one dish.  Service is done with a smile and a friendly attitude... and their desserts if you can get that far are cheesecakes from the infamous Cheesecake Factory...  SOOOO YUMMS...  So, even if you don't go for dinner, go for the desserts...  Enjoy...

UW86F0bn67oCeciYxpV4SQ.text: Excellent food. Reasonably priced.  Three of us had a bunch of small plates and a couple drinks for $60!  Server was attentive and very friendly!  Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ps37Ei0pLUxuz6SgvzLJBQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in vegas, it's laid back and has a large selection of foods whatever you're in the mood for

LBFp0jPTn2BNmsm4GoYdeg.text: Good food. Okay service. Good ambiance.  When we went in, the sign said it was 24 hours. Towards the middle of our meal we felt rushed, as they had made the end time midnight.  The meals were not memorable but for me to remember what either one of us had. We just knew that it was satisfyingly good.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Grilled Cheese--go for the fruit, as these are frozen fries
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Tacos
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesear Salad: too much fresh garlic made it taste like horseradish

RKM7kMEcwMtPKw9r2iQ2ew.text: Two of my coworkers and I visited this restaurant the last night of our conference. We were staying across the street at The Mirage and needed some fresh air. The restaurant is inside The Venetian and is about a 10-15 minute walk from The Mirage. It's located downstairs in the casino area but secluded enough for the smoke to not interfere with your meal.   Food was delicious and reasonably priced for Las Vegas. For appetizers, we got the chicken lettuce wraps and the Asian nachos. I could have almost just ate these two dishes and called it a night because the portions are so big.  For entrees, my coworker and I both got the Salmon 3 ways and the other got the Seafood Salad. If you want your money's worth and you can't pick a Salmon, get it 3 ways. You'll thank me later and leave happy. The seafood salad looked just as intimidating because none of us were able to finish our plates and enjoyed every bite. They also have a happy hour that ends at 6:30 but you have to sit in the bar area.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Lettuce Wraps
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Three Ways

1otfpvT-JAlLxC09mFy9mQ.text: First and foremost, this location is located at the Palazzo (which isn't mentioned on this Yelp page).   This is a great place to have breakfast or brunch! Very similar to its sister chain, Cheesecake Factory. What I like most is their consistency every time I've been here. This is definitely better than the other location at the Venetian, especially in terms of service.  I usually opt for a basic breakfast here (the two eggs any style), and for $14 you get a pretty full breakfast. The french toast is also great, and it seems like they've recently expanded their menu-- I tried the breakfast quesadilla and it was delicious!  Also, don't pass up their freshly baked cookies. They're decently priced at around $8.50 for a dozen, but they are freshly baked and take around 30 minutes after you put in your order!

Y12TP1hz3KHUMUaaq9lZ8g.text: Our waitress was soooooooo soft spoken the other end of the table couldn't hear her. So we came here as a large party and the food yes is amazing however almost all of our plates came out we were short one. The waitress had accidentally put in for two chicken Parms and not not the chicken fingers for my son. So by the time his food came out everyone else had finished their food. By the time he got his food he wasn't interested in food and was just tired. Yes she apologized but then brought us our check not once asking if we wanted dessert. By the way we did. We felt like they wanted us out and we felt rushed especially when they started to bus around us. O well we can go find somewhere else to take our money in exchange for sweets. Side note the tile on the floor is super slippery be careful we were all sliding. The watermelon martinis are amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0lGrNqcdLo1LI1txiLAAkQ.text: Yes, the red velvet pancakes are bombdotcom. 10/10 would gorge again. I really couldn't stop eating these... and I don't even like red velvet. My view on red velvet foods is that they are just an excuse to eat the cream cheese frosting, but these pancakes definitely are not the case. These have redeemed the red velvet foods family! The pancakes are cooked perfectly, there are little scrumptious morsels of chocolate chips in the batter, and the cream cheese frosting complements the stack perfectly! Potentially one of the best pancakes to touch my refined palette. (Insert snooty facial expression here.)  If you want an instant cavity get the churro French toast (: I took one small bite and I felt the sugar pierce through every cell in my body. But, you know, don't let my review stop you. You do you.  Red velvet pancakes are only served for breakfast until 11am, so make sure you get here before then!! It was like my main priority that day LOL. These pancakes are srs business, I tell you.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Was like a whole loaf of bread in that churro French toast. Crispy sweet cinnamon sugar crust on the outside, sugary custard on the inside
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg breakfast, pastrami hash x3, red velvet pancakes x2, churro French toast. The red velvet pancakes were worth the diabetes omg THE BEST

0WMKupAPLZpr1IuQk_xx5g.text: My overall experience here was pretty great! Our waitress was very attentive and our food was delicious! I ordered the double lux burger with the meat prepared in medium so it was really juicy and had a lot of flavor. Our waitress was also really nice and attentive. i don't even think my water cup ever got half empty! The portions are really really big so everyone at my table got leftovers, which i'm not complaining about, i just have something good to eat for dinner now :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. uuum the picture doesn&#39;t  really do this filet mignon any justice, but it looked sooo much better in real life and it was really juicy
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. they serve some bread while you&#39;re waiting for your food to come
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. a double lux burger :)))

s-d9bsfPXCrBS1Rtr6_m7w.text: Grand lux would like me to give them everything short of my social security number, so they can give attention to my opinion. I'd rather not.

lc5_EVjuT5rDH_p4_g42Dw.text: We have always been fans of The Grand Lux Cafe' but the service has become unbearable. Today we were seated & despite the place being relatively empty, after 30 minutes we could not even get someone to take our drink order. This despite the fact that all the servers were talking & playing "grab ass" with each other. I went to the hostess station & asked for the manager. After about 10 minutes Cory the manager appeared & he did not seem that concerned with the subpar experience we were having. Do yourself a favor & steer clear of the Grand Lux Cafe. Patronize an establishment that actually cares about customer service.

n0l7ujGAkkK1NVk1TJC4Jw.text: Good food at moderate prices, tons of choices, BIG portions, plenty of seating, and pretty.   I have no complaints. Plus, if you are staying at the palazzo, it is so convenient to grab a quick breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Open 6am-2am.   For breakfast on a Sunday, my friend and I waited less than 10 minutes.   I tried and liked the chicken and waffles. My friend got an omelette that she liked as well.  I would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

PnKCT9zuhjLrCTVPm4hxrQ.text: This is a 3+ stars but not quite 4.  I have never been a big fan of the restaurants that are part of the Cheesecake Factory conglomerate. My past experiences at Grand Lux have been average.  However, yesterday's breakfast was a pleasant departure from previous experiences.  The egg white omelette with all the fixings was delicious. The breakfast sandwich was well put together using brioche bread. Both came with yummy hash browns. And, by the way, in the grand tradition of the parent company the servings were huge.  The service was slow and that has always been an issue at the Grand Lux, whether at the Palazzo or other locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is half of what I got. Huge portion and tasty.

D8FwVQsOeRvwV1P-HisfeQ.text: The breakfast is amazing!! I had the sticky bun French toast and my Husband had the steak and eggs. It was all delicious!

Lvbpj-lRT1-Jm85DbhR2Bg.text: Loved this place so much, I literally ate here at every meal during my short trip to Vegas last weekend.  Of course, 25% of that reason was because it was so damn convenient and was open late night.  I honestly refused to dine here at first because it is reminiscent of the Denny's type restaurants desperate 20 somethings would go to after the clubs closed and the taco truck lines were just too long to suffer through in a dress.  However, that is not the case at all.  There is a long line for a reason and it is not because of desperation.  1st night - my gf & I scurried off to find some place to eat and more importantly sit after our bfs decided to gamble away a few hundred dollars at the poker tables.  Neither of us wanted to watch the debacle so we ended up here.  At first there was an intimidating line and we considered going with a few of our other friends to drive thru Mickey D's but 1) I had already suffered through Burger King at LAX earlier that evening and 2) we were planning to bikini it up at the pool the next day.  We were seated after about a 10-15 minute wait, not too tragic.  Once seated the wait for service and food was longer than anticipated but we managed to amuse our slightly drunk selves with conversation and people watching.  Another seemingly drunker group of girls proceeded to shout and bang their tables until a waiter came by.  I know the wait was long and it's hard to wait for bread when you feel that you're slightly past your limit but come on... you're still a lady (assuming) and there's no reason to act barbaric.  Caveman just doesn't look good in a cocktail dress.  Now the good stuff.  We ordered three appetizers to share between 2 ladies: the ahi tuna, mashed potato egg roles (whaaaaat?  Yea, I know... we thought that too but when you're intoxicated anything sounds good), and the volcano shrimp.  ALL WERE EXCELLENT.  We enjoyed ourselves immensely, happily pigging out and re hydrating for more shenanigans to come.  I have to say that I was simply happy for the moment and even had leftovers for our men who seem to have forgotten about us.  Two hours later, we got our check - happily tipped our obviously exhausted waiter, found our fellas, and went back to our respective rooms at the Venetian.

gpAvUxhtfoS7sNPpCZM9wA.text: Wonderful service and great food. The burger was to die for. Very pleased. I would definitely recommend to anyone staying at Venetian or just visiting.

_wks_fmUMjsWL_lV0DzdJg.text: My fiance got food poisoning from chicken... fair warning everyone! Be careful when eating here.

mKGlP7DDmRgP6JQ6xldMpQ.text: My sister and I needed to eat so we came here.   It's not easy to find for some reason but it was okay to just kind of wander around The Venetian.   We walked in and got seated immediately.   I ordered the lunch special salad + pasta. I got the carbonara which was good but got very heavy really fast.   My sister got the salmon with rice which she enjoyed.   Service was good and the ambiance was nice.   Would come again and recommend to others!

gLNWF088P0pxnQJzeIbqvQ.text: Stopped in for a bite after seeing BAZ which is also conveniently located next door to each other(Palazzo Theater.)  They have a very extensive menu where  there is definitely something for everyone here. Our waiter was very helpful in helping us narrow down our choices. Wifey went with the Shortrib Grilled Cheese, and I got the Korean Sriracha Burger-Bulgogi piled high with onions and mushrooms on a beef patty(perfect medium rare like I requested) and sriracha mayo on a brioche bun. Both of these were winners!  Another suggestion by our waiter was their  made to order Beignets, and people have raved on their reviews about  this dessert, so we decided to give it a shot, planned ahead and boxed up half of our entrees to save room. The Beignets came with 8 pieces and three sauces-chocolate, raspberry, and vanilla anglaise. So wishing it was love at first bite, we couldn't get past that fryer grease aftertaste even with the sugar on top or the three sauces. Barely three pieces were eaten, and I kinda regretted not going with something else..  Will definitely be back for their savory stuff and be more careful if and when ordering a dessert.  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  4

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets...fried to order, but tasted like fryer grease and the sauces didn&#39;t do any justice...you have been warned
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect Medium Rare
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi Burger

r1TqkhHPGtBHqCmsvHalVg.text: We were walking around trying to find a good restaurant for dinner where we wouldn't have to wait and we came upon Grand Lux Cafe.  We had been to the other location a few days ago and we knew they had a large menu of lots of options so we decided to check this location out.  It seems bigger than the other one and it's more of a wide open space.  We were seated at a half booth, half table and would be fairly close to our neighbouring guests if there were any.  A family arrived midway in our dinner but they were too busy looking at their phones so I didn't feel like I was listening in on their conversations.  They also had large booths to accommodate groups of at least 6.  Because the menu is large, it takes a little while to go through it.  But they also provide complimentary bread to go along with the large portions.  Our server was alright and took our orders, and got us our food.  He told us about a Thanksgiving special but we weren't in the mood for turkey and pumpkin pie.  I ordered the ribs, peanut coleslaw, cornbread, and fries.  I really liked the coleslaw with the peanuts and it wasn't drenched in salad dressing.  The ribs arrived with extra sauce.  Too much food for one meal so I bought ribs home to eat the next day.  The price was reasonable too as it was less than $20.  I like the food here and wouldn't hesitate to come back next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs dinner

O3XYNY8MmDdW-l6lVYnmOQ.text: Ah trade show week! My coworker and I recently came here for a lunch break during the Agenda/Offprice trade shows. It's definitely worth the walk to eat here rather then the other over priced show options.   I ended up ordering the soup and salad lunch option which was huge! The salad itself could have been my entire meal alone. It ended up being only around $10 which is not too shabby for the strip. The flavors were great too, simple soup and salad but tasty.  I'm really happy we ventured out to this place. I highly recommend it for a lunch break or to take advantage of their happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch soup &amp; salad- Caesar salad and chicken tortilla soup

3lwk9Z55FOAQoFOXl40QNw.text: Came here for the first time since they closed down the branch in LA and this is not a restaurant I'll miss.  We came for brunch and while they have a decent spread but this is just another upscale chain restaurant.  The service was hit or miss. It started off great but once we got our food we had to keep asking to get refills, to add another order and for the bill.    I think this would have been at least a 3-4 star restaurant if I ordered something else.  Both my friend and I got the corned beef hash which we did not like.  We both had the same complaint that the meat was dry so and with a bit of potatoes mixed in.  The dish was just so off balance with the lack of potatoes.  Both of our eggs were also overcooked.  The hash browns were decent.  The best part of my meal was the OJ which for the price they charge it better be good.

39Etw91_pwMelNIPGWL2-g.text: Nice place to stop by when you want to eat at the Venetian/Palazzo. Waiters are very courteous and try their best to accommodate you. We got:  Breakfast combo (scrambled eggs, hash brown, sausage links): The eggs were aplenty, as were the sausages...the hash browns were spread very thin and not fried enough so it wasn't crispy. Actually, it was borderline chewy, and the bf did not appreciate that at all.   Sonoma Salad: I wish I had more avocado in my salad, but it wasn't bad. The chicken was very moist and seasoned very well (may be a bit salty for some of you). The corn is really fresh (none of that canned stuff!) and may have been my favorite part of the meal. Not bad at all :)  Overall they give giant portions for a good price. I think the food (the breakfast) may have been better, but then again we did go fairly late to eat. I'd come back; this is a very convenient place.

KyfOJmhdwq1_cvFRGe7AHw.text: As a local, I brought some out of town friends here that were staying in the Palazzo for dinner. Fast, commercial food quality at best! Unfortunately, I had a patty melt that caused me to be sick all night long with nausea.  One member of the party ordered a well done burger.  It was not well done it was completely burnt.  Not even a hungry dog would eat this burger.  Unprofessional staff, untrained staff and sleeping management.  I'm amazed how many reviews are positive for this establishment.  Does not deserve one star but could not post a review without it.  Never again!

Fl5D6aG6o6hWNtHQSkx7iw.text: Pretty much Cheesecake Factory re-branded for the Venetian/Palazzo.  The Grand Lux is an expansive restaurant decked out in marble and usually a go-to option for most people staying here. The food here is standard American fare with a couple of unique dishes. Portions are pretty big and there is usually something for everyone. The Grand Lux has plenty of seating and I've rarely seen it to be busy.  The menu is huge featuring a wide array of salads, sandwiches, and unique entrees from a variety of cuisines. Alot of dishes (of course the desserts) are ported over from Cheesecake Factory and bumped up a little on the price. I don't really mind CF so Grand Lux is fine with me but there are a lot better places at either resort.

6JO3bjOtR3CnlTeV0r4FtA.text: Consistently great food & huge portion that great for sharing!  They have the best home made blue cheese dressing.  The only negative is the breakfast buffet - they use that skinny, fake bacon (microwave bacon?)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wide selection of food!

VHFRvZHrXUnDh0-sk8Du4w.text: I STILL HAVE NIGHTMARES OF THAT GAWD AWFUL ZEN NOODLES!  Over the years, I've been to Grand Lux Cafe 8 times out of convenience; 4 times at the Venetian (open 24 hrs) and the last 4 times at the Palazzo (closes at 3 AM on weekends). The most recent visit was on Sat, 2/19/11 for brunch.  I've walked into GLC Hungover, Smashed, and Belligerently DRUNK (thank goodness for my guy friends who will yank me out so that I have some sort of dignity left). Although my other senses may be shot, when it comes to food, I still oddly have a keen sense of taste.   GLC is a sister restaurant of Cheesecake Factory. I can see the appeal of GLC; huge portions at affordable prices for the Strip. Call me a food snob, but I'm not a fan of food chains since they tend to have a "quantity over quality" mentality so you can take my review w/ a grain of salt.   W A I T  T I M E: Weekend Brunch: 15-20 mins w/ a longer wait for larger parties.  Dinner: Never more than 5 mins.  Since I tend to stay out till 4 AM, I've never made it to this Palazzo location since they close at 3 AM, however, the wait times at the Venetian has never been more than 5 mins.  If you get late night take-out it can take up to 45 mins.  F O O D: TIP: STAY AWAY FROM THE ASIAN ENTREES!!!  Growing up in SF, I'm fortunate to be surrounded by Chinese, Vietnamese, Japanese, Korean, Thai, etc restaurants so I hold a certain standard for Asian food that simply CANNOT be found on the Strip. For any taste of authenticity, a quick 8 min cab ride to Spring Mountain Road will satiate your Asian food cravings.  *ZEN NOODLES: DISGUSTING!  This is GLC's rendition of pho ga (Vietnamese chicken noodle soup) and it's poorly executed. Chopped up rice noodles are placed in a bowl and topped w/ slices of chicken breast. Upon serving, "Swanson" chicken broth is poured over. Bean sprouts and Italian Basil (not Thai basil as stated on the menu) are served w/ the noodles. The bean sprouts were not fresh as they were brown.  My friend's bf had ordered this dish and mind you, he EATS a lot and is ALWAYS hungry, but after one bite, he spit out the Zen Noodles and decided to sleep instead. I was curious and took one bite and it was disgusting; the noodles were mushy, the chicken dry, and the broth tasted like watered-down Swanson's broth. GLC is better off serving an instant pho bowl from the local Asian market.   *CARAMEL CHICKEN & SHAKING BEEF: MEH!  I know better than to order Asian food at American chains, however, every time I'm in Vegas, I have this weird ravenous craving for Asian food on the day we're about to leave.    The CARAMEL CHICKEN is obviously from a frozen bag as the pieces are overly battered and then slathered w/ a slimy sauce. The chicken was so heavily coated w/ the syrupy sweet sauce that it was like eating thick syrup with fried batter pieces.   As for the SHAKING BEEF, the beef was tender but was more reminiscent of eating beef fajitas (w/ the grilled onions and bell peppers) b/c it was missing the tangy and pepperiness from the lemon pepper sauce that authentic shaking beef is normally served with.  The long grain rice was too dry and a little undercooked as if it was made from a box of Microwaveable Uncle Ben's.  If you have certain standards for Asian food, STICK w/ AMERICAN CLASSICS like Pancakes, Omelets, Burgers and Sandwiches which I've never had a problem with. Nothing mind-blowing or note-worthy, just standard diner fare kicked up a notch.  I have tried the FRIED CHICKEN & WAFFLES which Yelpers have raved about but it has scarred my vision of what Fried Chicken & Waffles should be and taste like.  One would think it would be combo of sweet, savory and crisp and soft...  The belgium waffle lacked a crispy exterior and was more soggy than anything. It was topped w/ over breaded fried chicken tenders that was very bland. Unless I drenched the chicken and waffles w/ the pecan honey butter sauce, it was like eating dry fried batter (chicken) and wet cardboard (waffles).  S E R V I C E: Slow and inconsistent.  The times I've been during brunch, it took about 15-20 mins to get our food which is fair, but during late-nights it can take over 30 mins.  What grinds my gears is the service we encountered during brunch last Sat, 2/19/11. Half of us wanted to order from the breakfast menu and the other half from the lunch menu. It was 10:53 AM and we asked the waitress if we could place our orders in for the lunch menu and she said, "No, you have to wait until 11:00 AM". Fine, so 11:02 AM rolls by and we placed our order.   3 mins later, I see other waitresses bringing out entrees from the lunch menu so clearly they were allowed to place their orders in but we weren't. This may not be a big deal, but if you let some patrons do it, you have to be consistent and let EVERYONE do so. And when you're hungover, starving, and in need of food to absorb the copious amounts of alcohol in your stomach, every MINUTE counts!!!

h5vmXolSpy56tsOfel1hGQ.text: This place has got some delicious food and at reasonable prices! My wife and I shared a Fuji Apple Salad and the Monte Cristo sandwich. The salad was very good, very fresh. The Monte Cristo was OMG incredible. If you are looking for a lunch spot this is the place. I'll be back tomorrow for breakfast

WmSnVmk0D6z2kwQo4aMKhQ.text: Ever since my friend and I tried this place years ago we made it a tradition to eat here each time we're in Vegas.  Everything here is really delicious. There is no substitute for flavor.  My friend and I always order the Pasta Telefono.  We just love it so much, and I never like ordering pastas at restaurant because in my opinion, they're always mediocre. I gave their pasta a try just because my friend wanted to split it with me, and to my surprise it was delicious!  I don't know if it's the pasta itself, or the sauce on it, it's just delicious! And if you save it for later to eat, it just gets even better because the pasta absorbs all the sauce lol.  I really like it a lot. Love their bread pudding as well, it's a must! Very dreamy!

4ywZ50fFAWQSbxf58B7YcQ.text: The service and food were excellent! From the greeting at the hostess stand to our amazing server Erendita, we felt welcomed by people that appear to love their jobs. Food was great too! Thank you for a fantastic meal.

o7gBdVIOSGF5K9Fk_JekMA.text: Stopped in for dinner. Prices were reasonable, service was good. We split a salad and it was loaded with dressing...to the point where it was not good. Given all the good reviews, we may have just ordered poorly...but I don't think we will be back.

UPGxHv075-Z1sHYcGro8_Q.text: Great quality breakfast. The wait for your food to be served takes a lil while but pretty well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do it yourself omelette with hashbrowns and wheat toast with a freshly squeezed OJ (not in picture)

3JqJhE7GgC6WzSJu56JhPg.text: I ate here the 3/3 days that I stayed in Vegas. Despite the convenience of staying at the Palazzo as well, the food and was worth coming back for more.   The calamari was my favorite! Both the mini sized ones and the larger portion one which came with an unusual yet bomb dipping sauce. Totally crispy and the breading was unlike anything I have had before. The corned beef hash, great for anytime of the day, was also good and twas a large portion! I would also hiiiiiighlyyy recommend the Asian BBQ tacos. Very tasty, enough to satisfy your hunger and is such a cute presentation. This restaurant feels classy and the decor is beautiful and pairs nicely with the delicious food.  However. I had to knock off one star for poor service etiquette! 2/3 days, I received poor service, they also seemed to hate their life because they had expressionless faces. I know you guys get busy sometimes, but a be right back or a thank you in reply would be nice.   Needless to say, I'll come back again for sure.

pmBvsnTZ6Ex1VxwpLxpkLA.text: As a sister restaurant to the Cheesecake Factory, they have similar ambiance and similar food. Everything from seating to the To-go boxes and bags have similar appearance. Everything ordered was delicious. We started out with the Reuben Eggrolls which are reminiscent of the Cuban Roll from Cheesecake Factory. Light delicious and all the components of a Reuben Sandwich stuffed into an Eggroll Wrapper. I ordered the Chicken Milanese which has a lemon based cream sauce. It was delicious and a reminds me of the Crusted Chicken Romano from The Cheesecake Factory. We ended with Beignets which we ordered at the beginning of the meal so it was ready for dessert. Definitely delicious, but condensed milk would have topped off the beignets well. The chocolate and raspberry toppings were artificial tasting to me, but I am personally not fond of those flavors on a normal day. The best one was the white sauce, which I believe was a Jack Daniels creme anglaise. Dessert was a different focus with fresh baked options that can take up to 30 minutes to prepare. I would do this again!

B8S5cgBSCZvbY8qkR1c9lg.text: One star for the friendly service. Food, on the other hand, was terrible! The ginger beef with rice was too sweet and salty at the same time! My boyfriend just ate the rice and left everything else. The butter lettuce in the butter lettuce salad was too bitter, but the tomatoes and topping was good. Pot roast cheese fries was ok. Pot roast meat was good, but the fries itself was salty. Overall the food was pretty bad, not worth the price! For the prices here you can get better food elsewhere!

5Qke246V5h4vrUHLuzsWMQ.text: Make the effort to walk to the Palazzo Grand Lux Cafe. Less people and cleaner than the Venetian one. Just walk past the Palazzo waterfall and before you hit the escalator make a right. Can't wait to go back. Great service and wonderful food. Nice plating and clean. This is so so so so so much better the Cheese Cake Factory. So much better! Loved all of it: grandluxcafe.com/menu.htm Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Jambalaya Sauteed with Peppers, Onions and Tasso in a Delicious Spicy Sauce. Served with White Rice. Never had such soft chicken. It was so tender and the rice was cooked right. I was so surprised that this was made so well. I felt like the kitchen was really serious about their food. Chicken Royale and Short Ribs So good. Short Ribs were amazingly tender, like moist, juicy, and meaty. It was one of the best short ribs ever. Chicken was ok. Molten Chocolate Cake With a Melted Chocolate Center. Served with Vanilla Ice Cream So good. What a good amount of dessert for less than $10! It was a really good dessert dish. I felt the kitchen was really good. I think they must have a really good chef. And the waiter was super nice. I was so pleased with this meal. This is probably one of the best cafes I have tried on the Las Vegas strip. Price was reasonable and food was delicious.

8yyptLGA_0wSKTJJAd1KSQ.text: The waffles are really good.  Came here twice on one weekend for the waffles but my husband had the corn beef hash and the meat was kinda gross. Too much fat and just too chewy. He did not enjoy it. Service is really good so I'm giving it 4 stars.

_SyT__rhSl1R2FO-asCpIA.text: They have breakfasts options 24 hours ! Love me some eggs at midnight! Pasta selections are so yummy and very big portions! Go to spot before or after the clubs when in Vegas!

LB7vPLHby94XAZ7IhIidQw.text: Ahh we love this place! Seriously a must visit when in Vegas! I ALWAYS order the stacked chicken quesadilla...I know what you are thinking but seriously go order it! My husband gets the buffalo chicken rolls...today we somehow hit it just right and they were on happy hour half off! Although they were out of tortillas so I got the burger on the happy hour menu and it was amazing! Elaine was our server in the bar area and she was so fast! Thanks for a great inexpensive meal in Vegas!

FQdatGy92PIvDhJ73Z1M_g.text: Best Kept Secret - Awesome Happy Hour Bar Menu! This location has a $5 Happy Hour Bar Menu - served at the bar only between 5 - 7 pm on weekdays. Great selections, large portions. Order 2-3 dishes, you'll have enough scrumptious food to stuff two people and the bill will be $15 plus tax/tip (more if you order drinks, of course). You can't get a better meal in Vegas for this price!

T_Dbmj6Ab4_KiBAmF-Xr-A.text: note: this review is for the restaurant in the Palazzo  We probably never would have come here for dinner, due to the fact that they have locations in both the Venetian(24 Hr) & Palazzo. That alone, might lead you to assume that it's probably a bit on the pricey side. Actually, it's surprisingly affordable & in the $$ price range.  Gold, marble & metal finishes, amber colored glass & faint candle-like lighting accent every inch of this palatial cafe. This place is the classier (& better looking) sister restaurant to The Cheesecake Factory.  If you're indecisive when it comes to ordering, I suggest you leave ordering to someone else, 'cause the menu is an extensive 12 pages-or-so of food, drinks & desserts. There is so much stuff here, that there has definitely got to be something on the menu to "Palazzo yo' azzo!"  From the "Things to Share" (or not) menu -  Asian Nachos - A scoop of Spanish rice w/ black beans & corn, circled by 8 oversized pieces of crispy wonton style "nacho" chips. Topped with chicken, peanuts, sweet spicy peanut & creamy wasabi dressings. Some pieces could have gone easier on peanut sauce, though. But the other pieces - Wow! An Asian fiesta explosion in your mouth!  Crispy Thai Shrimp & Chicken Spring Rolls - Served with a bowl of fresh lettuce, shredded carrot & mint sprigs. Wrap one of the 6 crispy fried spring rolls in a lettuce leaf with carrots & mint, then dip it in the sauce. So refreshingly tasty! A definite, "Get this!"  Double-Cheese Mini Burgers - There is no kids menu here, so my little one got this. "You call those mini?" Each one of the 4 sliders are enough for 1 little one, so share, if you want to. They each come with lettuce a slice of tomato & pickle.  Crispy Ahi Sushi Roll - These were okay, not so special, but did hit the spot. Each of the 6 spicy tuna rolls are crisp tempura fried, served with Asian greens & a spicy-hot soy-chili dipping sauce.  Sunday Night Pasta (served everyday) - Tender beef short rib & steak pieces slow cooked with mushrooms, garlic & Parmesan cheese then served on spaghetti pasta. Try to imagine large juicy pieces of beef tossed in pasta. This is a very generously portioned, hearty & meaty dish. The sauce is less tomato marinara, and more rich meaty-meat sauce. Did I mention, it's meaty?  "Baked to Order Desserts" menu - If you like freshly baked, warm cookies, order the Chocolate Chip Pecan. They will bake these on order, so order them with your entrees. They come boxed to-go, so you can bring up to the room. Other baked-on-order goods - Chocolate Cake, Beignet & Apple Pie to name a few. I love munching on warm cookies in the room... (the chocolate chip kind!)  Service was great. Our server Ronnie, was friendly, helpful & very attentive to our table. Even with a little-late cookie order & an extra order to-go, he did an excellent job accommodating our requests. An overwhelming selection & variety of items on the menu in an extravagant not-so cafe-like setting. I think I'll skip the sister restaurant next time, 'cause after coming here, that other place just seems a little "cheesy" now.

Wl0lntBnA81dAUCZIgJoUg.text: Searched forever to find the best beignets and they're definitely here. They come with sugar and sauces and are totally worth the price. It hidden away next to the palazzo theatre so it can be hard to find. Go to the one on the palazzo side NOT the venetian side.  It's nice and quiet here as well.

g-zTET1RPy-nUcAxfbgqLA.text: I love this restaurant! It's actually one of my favorite restaurants in town. Even though I work for another casino, I occasionally tell guests to eat here because it's so good. :-) I always used to joke that they add a special spice called "yum" to every dish. Every dish I have ever ordered here has been good and consistently good. They've never had an off day. I was told by one of the servers that every dish is checked by no less than 3 people before it hits your table to ensure it's right. My favorite dishes are: chicken pot pie, shrimp scampi, and the Baja omelet for breakfast. They have a breakfast buffet on Sundays that is also really good. Oh and order the COOKIES!!! Trust me, that come out all hot and chocolatey and buttery! They have pecans in it but you really can't taste them. So good!

AGIIfAW_PueLGycaf_9FDw.text: This was a great restaurant!  Loved the menu options, moderately priced, large portions and tasty food.  I think it's related to Cheesecake Factory so the decor looks exactly like Cheesecake Factory without the long line.  They start you off with some nice warm, crunchy sour dough bread.  I ordered a small portion of crispy calamari for appetizer.  Nice size for a small portion.  They do a really nice Chicken Caesar salad.  I had breakfast and the portions were so large, I couldn't finish.  I swear they must use five eggs for that breakfast platter.  I'm pretty nosey and love to check out what everyone else is eating.  Everything was so huge and looked fabulous!  They only down side of our dinner was the fries were served cold.  As soon as we brought it to our waitresses attention, she brought out a fresh batch for my friend  pretty quick.    We went to the one in the Palazzo hotel and I was surprised that it was so empty.  The bellman at our hotel suggested that one because he said the one at the Venetian is always so crowded.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would definitely stop in again on my next visit!

VzwHdmuj3VP8shLi1YHoyg.text: Excellent service, awesome food and wine. Everyone is super friendly, and I had the best Lemon Chicken Piccata ever!

GEHI1b-FDmfs9kHljsXgRQ.text: I enjoyed the Grand Lux Express breakfast here this morning, which is basically full access to the buffet, which has fresh fruits (a nice range) bread, chef to make your eggs, hot dishes and cereal (including hot oatmeal), with the waiter bringing coffee and juices. The service is very nice and the coffee is reasonable. I would come back here. Note one thing though - this one (in the Palazzo) is NOT open 24 hours, that's only the Grand Lux Cafe in The Venetian. This one opens from 6am to 1am daily.  Update: I had a delicious dinner here also - very nice Avocado and Beet Salad; Greek Salad and good bread. I also enjoyed their Raspberry Cosmopolitan. Totally enjoyable, thank you.

IwCMszPk-eu2hKg0M6yiZQ.text: We love eating at the Grand Luxe Cafe (aka Cheesecake Factory) @ Palazzo. We always purchased food here for our kids and family when we come to Vegas. Their gourmet food are delicious and so fresh. Their menu selection are so selective and diverse plus it's very kids friendly and their food is simple. I would highly recommend this place for family with kids.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pineapple mojitos was yummy although you can barely taste pineapple.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My nephew had the filet mignon, and he devoured it all. He said it&#39;s the best...worth it all for only $32.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My hubby had the salmon, and it was definitely perfect

iHIg_e0vJLqSl5chB0BD9g.text: This review only reflects desserts. We ordered the New Orleans beignets, warm butter cake and the red velvet cake, after lunch elsewhere. We expected to like the beignets the most as we have had them elsewhere, but we ended up liking the butter cake the best. We would get both the beignets and butter cake again but would likely try either the warm sticky bun bread pudding, key lime pie or "the best" carrot cake instead of the red velvet cake next time we are in town.  We used to the Grand Lux Cafe at the Beverly Center for dessert after dinner when it was still open. We would always get the beignets because it is one of the few places that do beignets well in Los Angeles. On our recent trip to Las Vegas, we stopped by to get the beignets which were again very good. They are a bit crunchy on the outside with a soft hollow interior, sprinkled with confectioner's sugar on top. I like them plain without using the sauces, but they do come with a vanilla custard sauce, raspberry sauce and chocolate sauce if you are so inclined. They take about 20 minutes and come out warm, so order them early if you know you are going to get them.   The warm butter cake was surprisingly good, probably on par with the butter cake at Mastro's. This one is served with fresh strawberries and vanilla ice cream. The butter cake comes out warm with a slightly crisp outside and a warm, soft, rich interior. This actually turned out to be our favorite dessert.  As for the red velvet cake, there is nothing to write home about here. It is served with the typical cream cheese frosting, but the cake itself was not that flavorful. You have definitely had better red velvet cake elsewhere. You should go right past this dessert and try something else.

vwWeKiN3J3lY37d45RCd3w.text: So despite what you might think many of the restaurants in Vegas aren't 24/7. One night during our stay in Vegas hubby and I were going on a wild goose chase for some late food. We walked around in a circle looking for an open restaurant only to end up being saved by this place which we originally passed by.   They are located inside of the Venetian hotel situated by the casino. The place itself is small compared to it's NY location inside of Roosevelt Field Mall which I've been to. Luckily it was very late so we  didn't have a wait to eat.   I had the potato gnocchi with vodka sauce. I'll be honest with you I did like it and I really enjoyed it but I didn't write anything down so I don't really remember much to give an accurate description of the taste except that it was delicious.   If you are by the Venetian in Vegas the Grand Lux is worth eating in.

RCUhZRLYSVYFQ1OAnu3ksg.text: The most consistent meal at The Venetian. Large menu, large portions, not too pricey. Good pour on recognizable wines.

rtyYLHC2FKejLJP5fyjkfw.text: This is a nice place to come for a meal.  I gave it four stars because it still feels like a big, well executed chain, like Cheesecake Factory (its owners), and the menu is so big that there are apparently several very average things you can order.  I was able to order well by reading previous reviews, so here are the menu items i experienced (below).  It is big, opulent, and modern, with mildly attentive service.  Asian Nachos: 5 stars, my favorite part of the meal.  Peanut ginger glaze, fried wontons, wasabi cream and mozzarella.  Full of delicious flavor, we nearly licked the plate.  Short Rib Grilled Cheese: 4 stars, moist meat with horseradish cream sauce.  The bread was toasted pretty crispy, the cheese was good.  Included was a house salad; the blue cheese dressing I ordered was good.  Turkey Sandwich: 3 stars, my friend got it and the thick baguette it was served on was too thick and too toasted, making it hard to bite into.

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Posh interior

bDlQ3jZ7XC4i534FnUNl-w.text: I was pretty satisfied with the food. I got the turkey and brie sandwich--bread was nice and crispy, and loved the mix of turkey, cranberry, brie, and arugula. They could've skimped less on the brie though.... Love me some cheese... The fries were ok. They had good flavor but were on the soggy side. Filling meal, good flavors, B+ overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey and brie sandwich with fries

EVxqdfGFD8QMFnUQE-ZHWQ.text: If you are a fan of the Cheesecake Factory, you should definitely check out the Grand Lux Cafe when you are at the Palazzo or the Venetian.   I came here for dinner with my parents last week. My parents don't eat beef or pork, so it was kind of difficult to find restaurants on the Strip that had more than one or two good non-beef-or-pork options. Luckily, the Grand Lux Cafe has a plethora of dishes of all sorts. The menu here has to be the longest I've ever seen. As someone who is not a picky eater, I normally hate long menus, but I was grateful for it in this case, because my parents could finally choose a dish they really wanted. If you have a large party of people with different dietary requirements or cuisine  preferences, I would highly recommend this place.  Our server was great. My mom ordered the jambalaya, and the server made sure that the chefs made it without the ham. She was also attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  The food was quite good. I had the crispy caramel chicken. The caramel sauce was a good balance of sweetness and spiciness, and all of the vegetables were fresh and cooked well. The portions are gigantic though! I have a healthy appetite, yet I was only able to eat about 3/5 of my meal. Unless you are really hungry, I would recommend sharing an entree with someone.  While looking at the menu, we saw that Grand Lux Cafe offers made-to-order desserts (which you order at the same time of your main dishes), so we decided to try the peach cobbler. While the cobbler was really good (not too sweet, lots of peach), it wasn't quite as spectacular as I thought it would be. However, I'm from Texas so I have pretty high standards for cobbler.   Overall, we all enjoyed our food here. I think the value you get is good compared to most of the other restaurants on the Strip too.

TSXoAXvbhyyV3SN8c9KthQ.text: For those who don't feel like getting food coma, or just being a glutton, at the many buffets in Vegas, The Grand Lux Cafe is perfect for satisfying your hunger.  No matter the time of day, all of the food here is freshly made and piping hot. I visited twice during my stay and thoroughly enjoyed their steak sandwich and breakfast platter (eggs, bacon, hash browns, and toast).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast!

PwTTqZRgdjEWZpxy0Uq9CQ.text: for you vegas folks, the grand lux is a staple at all hours of the day and night.    i've been to this place after clubbing in the middle of the night, for breakfast - ok let's be real, it's really brunch by the time i wake up, and for proper dinner.  the grand lux has almost everything you could possibly in the mood for.  the menu is many pages long.  the late night menu is more extensive than the day time menu, thank goodness.  they serve a bomb breakfast buffet until 12:30pm.  it has fresh fruit, fresh belgian waffles (so warm and crispy and delicious), omelette station, eggs, bacon, ham, sausage, potatoes, cereal, oatmeal, toast, bagels, pastries!  huge selection for $18.95.  totally worth it.  oh and includes a cup of yummy coffee.  i personally would write them to extend these hours.  again, it's vegas, who wakes up before noon?!  it's a great vegas staple and definitely worth a try, no matter the hours.  prices are very reasonable for vegas.

q57QakOUhuQ7kBigvvyJBg.text: Decent breakfast in Palazzo hotel if you're looking for something cheaper than the buffets.  Had the corned beef hash with eggs and it was a good-sized portion.  Saw someone get the fried chicken and waffles and it looked massive!  They also have a buffet option as well but I wanted to try something off the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs

1Ud0rJAe1ilZwxKL1ZP6JA.text: We went here past midnight on 12/25/2013. We were just waling around tired, confused, and hungry inside the Palazzo. The Grand Lux Cafe was one of the first signs we saw while walking in the casinos, so we decided to just go for it foregoing checking out yelp reviews because, at that point, we just needed to eat!  First, regarding the staff service... Even working that late (or early?) and on Christmas day, the staff were really nice and accommodating. The service here was really good.  Trivia: While waiting for our orders, I noticed a lady having a carry-out and the restaurant's to-go bag looked awfully very much the same as the Cheesecake Factory! So, after some googling, I got to find out that the Grand Lux Cafe is created by the founder of the Cheesecake.  So, for our food, we really enjoyed it and the servings are huge! My mom ordered the Garlic Shrimp pasta ($19.50). It was really good! It has lots of shrimp, heirloom tomatoes, and some veggies.. I forgot what it was but it was good! I think I ate at least a third of her dish. Hehe.  I ordered the Grilled Steak sandwich ($13.95), and you can choose your side of salad or fries. The steak was really savory and tender. The sandwich also has heirloom tomatoes, caramelized onions, white cheddar cheese, horseradish sauce and lots of yummy nutty arugula on a toasted artisan roll. Sooooo good!  My brothers both had chicken and waffles ($13.50). I didn't get to try it but their plates were all wiped out clean so I guess they really liked it too. Hehe.   My brothers also had orange juice, which came on quite a small wine glass. There was no price for the OJ on the menu, but we didn't bother to ask since we didn't think it's gonna be more than $3. The bill came and that small glass of OJ came out to be $5.95! Wow, that was almost half the price of my awesome sandwich! I wished they just had water since it was my turn to pay. Hmpf!  Overall, the dining experience here was good and relaxed. I would come back again if I am in the Palazzo and get tired and lost after playing from all the slot machines outside to help make me feel better! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak sandwich with caesar salad

9DQW3C6Nw7t3CdfbDvXhsw.text: We had the mini tacos and a chicken Caesar salad and it was amazing prices are very reasonable

KcifsrzEqGRMR1N8laUOmQ.text: Buffalo wings... were ALRIGHT can't get all flats so don't even ask! Calamari was trash...super weird sauce ask for marinara sauce ! Fries were bland to say the least , on to the butter cake... "pause" FIRE best part of my meal.. oh & the $18 1942 shots!!

HDOyTHrOoRnYedp799UDyA.text: Always good food and great service. Their pastas always burst in flavor and very generous portions. Can never get enough of them.

YeeqaUFXoFEJEC1_7bcCcA.text: We have been here for almost 45 minutes and 3 parties who arrived after us have received their food. We are still waiting for sliders and a salad. Really? When it finally did come, it was lukewarm.

nZ6B5C92gFfh11V6sStgFw.text: Open late Good for dates  Or friendly mates  Big portions. Fresh ingredients. Nice presentation. Fair prices. Nice atmosphere. Killer desserts.

czteRFfoCaq91euNNBLEcA.text: It makes me so sad that I have to give the Palazzo location of Grand Lux 2 stars.  I love Grand Lux, even though I end up leaving the restaurant overfull from all their delicious food.  Why 2 stars?  The service sucks here.  I came here like 5 to 10 times this summer as I was playing poker tournaments at the Palazzo.  With a 60 minute dinner break, I barely had enough time to eat my dinner, even though I ran from the tournament to the restaurant to put in my order.  Consistently, my food didn't show up until 40 minutes after I had ordered, leaving me 20 minutes to scarf down my food and pay.  Consistently they couldn't even get a basket of fucking bread to me in the first half hour of my arrival.  That's just ridiculous.  I came back once after the poker tournament series was over, thinking it would be better since it wasn't so slammed.  I ordered a salad and a main course.  I sat there forever, asking twice for a basket of bread.  First thing to arrive?  My main course.  WHAT THE FUCK I HATE THAT!  I told the waiter to cancel my salad, who wanted to argue with me that he tried to warn me that the salad would take forever.  No, I asked which appetizer comes out the quickest since I'm starving, and he said they all take the same amount of time.  So I got the salad instead, which does not take the same amount of time to make as the cedar planked salmon.  Oh, and the bread finally came after I had started my dinner.  Do yourself a favor and take a walk down to the Venetian Grand Lux so you won't be twiddling your thumbs with a grumbling stomach for a half hour.

abwXJALCM8RaEl0pi2rzWA.text: October 2014  Oh no. We needed a pre-midnight snack, just something to take the edge off. In doing so, I ate the worst "ribs" I've ever eaten in my life and I'm no kid. Wow. They had barely any meat, dry, tasteless, just the memory of some sauce.  Our waitress was nice, but those "ribs".....

GWghomKgrtAa2tslV9ymFw.text: I'll keep it simple.   The food is great and the service is incredible. The waitresses team up to make sure you have everything you need.    I had the shrimp scampi and the loaded potato wraps, both were excellent!

dLaqE_I0eSVBctTT7ctlXg.text: If your looking for superb quality for reasonable prices Grand Lux is the place. I was told it's an upscale version of The Cheese Cake Factory and to me that pretty much describes the menu. The decor and ambience is definitely Vegas but not so much a franchise experience.

xUmPnatmUBsKKOydh6cMCA.text: This place surprised me actually...... The food was really tasty and the staff was very nice. It's decorated very nice as well! I will be back for sure next time I am in Vegas! The spicy shrimp w aloi sauce was the Best I could have ate that all day!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy shrimp and Calamari
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty color theme...
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Walk in area

fGgrkwVcRyGeIh0aj_AIkQ.text: Worst service ever! Hostess was horrible, server was horrible, and manager was horrible!

Kfm9oK_b1LTG_jxYTKyaqg.text: I came here while I was in Vegas for the weekend. I've been to the Grand Lux Cafe that used to be in LA but that location has been closed down.   The customer service is really good. Our sever was really nice and attentive. My sister ordered their veggie burger but doesn't like onions, so she said she didn't want onions and the manager came out to double check she wasn't allergic to them because they add onions to the veggie patty, which was nice of them.   I ordered a veggie wrap and it was pretty decent. I added the buffalo sauce though and it made the wrap exceptionally better.   This is one of the places where I'd go back if there was nothing better. It's good but not amazing.

CnLBkjmauMOZRFQhzNudSg.text: The restaurant appeared nice and I thought being in the Venetian, a 1st-class hotel, that their cafe would be top notch as well.  The ambiance was nice, the servers were fantastic and friendly, but the food was just so-so.  I ordered the Chicken Royale which was 2 HUGE flat pieces grilled with a lemon butter cream sauce, I think, and mashed potatoes, green beans and carrots.  The chicken was tender & tasty, but only about 2 teaspoons of sauce for the huge amount of chicken, so I asked for more and was brought a small silver pitcher of it.  Made it MUCH better -the sauce was delish.  The potatoes & veggies were fine, nothing special.  This meal was very reasonably priced but kind of on the caliber of an average coffee shop. Enough food on that plate for 2 people.

KvqSmB8xccbBKCq5ZmZshw.text: Went here for brunch on Christmas day.  Did not realize that those with a Gracie card got priority seating (until it was too late).  Wait time at 10am was around 20-30mins for a party of 5.  Those that had 2-3 people were seated right away.  The restaurant was packed.  Their breakfast buffet was simple but seems to be a decent value at $18 ($9 for kids).  Came with Egg, bacon, hash browns, sausage in chaffing bowls.  There was a pretty decent fruit selection and pastries.  The omelette station was pretty crowded.  Wait time for an omelette was around 15mins.  The belgium waffles kept running out.  They had two stations for the omelettes (manned by 2 chefs)  but the chefs also had to make and stock the waffle stations.  Too crazy!  The fruits and pastries kept running out.  They also were running out of plates and were bringing piping hot plates (still soaked in hot water) to refill.  If you are in a hurry, go for the buffet. We ordered off the menu and it took a really long time to get our order.  I ordered the corn beef hash.  It was ok.  My wife got the chillaquilles (sp?) and that had a really nice flavor.  Only complaint was that it was hard to eat.  They used both chips and tortilla strips. Service:  Was pretty slow but I felt that the server was overwhelmed by the amount of people.  She was really polite and nice.  Just slow.   Value:  I think for vegas, things were priced pretty well.  My corn beef hash was $13 and a decent amount.  If you need a simple meal, this is the place to go.

5CIlbe69iZNWPZwx-s6A2w.text: Just can't go wrong with GLC.   I love the one in Houston, and this one was just as good. A nice Bonus that we happen to be staying in the Palazzo, so even better. I ordered to-go a few times, with little wait time.   A nice variety of brunch/lunch/dinner options. Definitely something for everyone. I'll be back at this location, or the one a few steps away in Venetian.

LekfY0b56pHzae1cFNSxlw.text: Our server did a great job. Food was delicious, good portion, and fair pricing. Very nice and relaxing dining vibe. The variety of food choices was great - from Asian to Italian and American dishes. Definitely recommended and will be coming here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy buffalo chicken sandwich with a side of french fries

yrhx46KVJaYxUU9h7BLDJg.text: Came here twice for breakfast. This place is always busy even off hours. Fast service and good breakfasts. I ordered eggs with hash browns, I didn't want any meat that came with the meal so they gave me an extra egg!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Having breakfast and watching the slot tournament going on

g7YofNqe9z1kSM0a1LZEHg.text: Stayed in Vegas for 5 days, ate at the Grand Lux 4 times.  Yes, it's that good.  Not only is the food scrumptious, but the menu is as large as the average American.  It's causal, flexible, and you can have whatever you like, however you like it, whenever you like it.  Poached eggs and a burger at 2AM?  The Grand Lux can make it happen.  The food at the Venetian location tastes noticeably better.  My recommendations include the miso salmon, the grilled veggie pizza, Chipotle avocado burger, the spaghettini with clams, and the calamari.  The calamari merits its own sentence--we're talking squid, rock shrimp (think mini shrimp tempura), zucchinis, and onions.  For the price, it's basically the best calamari you'll ever get.  Now, the Palazzo location has better desserts (the menu is almost entirely different).  I highly recommend the molten chocolate cake (see my pictures and you'll know what I mean).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pineapple upside down cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 poached eggs with tomato slices
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. margherita pizza + house salad (lunch special)

3Vz7uFYkA0kOcx6YMmsC4A.text: Looooove this place. I recommend the zen noodles. Soooooooooo tasty.  And the buffalo chicken rolls are yummy too.  :). This place is owned by the same people that own cheesecake factory. You can tell by the food and decor.

Uuf6MORD9DB3cUtdvFbJfQ.text: If you're staying at the Venetian or Palazzo dining at The Grand Lux is a must.  Our server Evelyn is amazing.  Very attentive very quick and just amazing.  The bread and butter so fresh.  The any style eggs, hash brown and toast is delicious.  The mimosas are amazing.  Key word in this review is "amazing".  Love you Evelyn you amazing girl.

jnHTqaDLJitV3EUoSjnfAQ.text: It's like the Cheesecake Factory, but with fewer cheesecakes and worse free bread. I mean really, why can't they have the same brown bread as the Cheesecake Factory??  Other than that, I really like this place. Service is excellent, food is good, prices are reasonable, what more can you ask for? After eating at the Studio Cafe at MGM last week and paying exorbitant prices for mediocre sandwiches and chicken fingers, Grand Lux Cafe was very refreshing. I had the Bistro Steak which was a small steak with polenta and brussels sprouts and it was the perfect size for me. A couple of my friends ordered pastas and they were HUGE - literally enough for 3 people. Like the Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux also has a variety of small plates and appetizers to choose from as well.  I would definitely come back the next time I'm at Palazzo or Venetian. No, it's not the most unique dining experience in Vegas, but open 24 hours and well priced for a hotel restaurant? Count me in!

xROUwttp5kQ0XUE2_E1pKg.text: Exactly what we were looking for at the Palazzo-Venetian.  It's probably the only dine-in restaurant in the resort with an extensive menu of comfort foods, with reasonable prices to match.  This place is essentially a Cheesecake Factory.  From what we were told, the Palazzo wanted to build a Cheesecake Factory but they had a non-compete agreement with the Mirage.  So they just changed the name to Grand Lux Cafe.  But it is pretty much the same food and concept.    The menu is extensive and has something for every taste.  The all-inclusive breakfast ($12.99) was the best deal, and was how I started my day everyday.  I'm typically not overwhelmed by breakfast, but the breakfast at Grand Lux was the best I've ever had.  They also have great sandwiches and burgers.  I'd consider myself to be a burger aficionado and theirs was right up there with the best.    If you're looking for a great meal, at very reasonable prices, this is where you should go.  It's a very casual and comfortable restaurant, and a refreshing change from the over-priced restaurants that surround it.

-eJOd7R_NlkogoxZPsmNBg.text: Came to the Lux in The Palazzo for breakfast. Not too long a wait to sit down. Had the breakfast buffet which was quite nice. Freshly squeezed OJ included (with refills) which was good. Saw other people ordering from the breakfast a la carte menu and wow... The portions are huge! I enjoyed it overall.

fnpg2H2vkgwe6lfpAqlRZA.text: Love, LOVE, LoVe!!!  I decided to go with a chain in an effort to relieve some of my worries of never having been to the restaurant that was going to be hosting my wedding reception.  And while it was part of a chain, it was nice to know (a little) of what to expect.  Because I used it for my reception I'm reviewing its private dining...  My then husband-to-be and I first saw this Grand Lux the day before our wedding when we went to pay off our balance.  (I didn't want to have to worry about this the day of.)  We met with the manager who was so welcoming, and not in the fake-y way (that I myself am often accused of :) We only had a total of 15 guests make their way to Vegas, and I'm sure that this size of private party is peanuts to this establishment but you'd never know it from the way the staff treated us.  After paying the remainder of our bill, I asked to see the room where our reception would be help, and the manager took us THROUGH the kitchen to reach the room.  The kitchen staff welcomed us, but also didn't seem surprised to see patrons off the street (and after 8+  hours of traveling) in the back of the house.  Says a lot about how the restaurant is ran.  Our reception was perfection.  We only had one server, I'm embarrassed I don't remember her name (probably b/c she made sure my hand always had a fresh glass of wine in it) but she was amazing.  She kept everything running smoothly, and everyone extremely happy.  The food was great, our guests had the option of a chicken madreidra, miso salmon, or pasta fresca, and I heard everything I never had the chance to try was perfect.   For the elevated level of service, quality of food, and sophisticated ambiance, as destination wedding bride, I feel that the Grand Lux Cafe went above and beyond in value.  Especially in Vegas!  Highly, HIGHLY recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate and Vanilla Creme Brulee with fresh berries

ctDdkSnAh7DRqleh5kw3pw.text: I am sadly posting this! I visit Las Vegas numerous times a year 10 to 15 times. And everytime I come my 1st meal is at Grand Lux. I order the same thing everytime, the Buffalo chicken blast appetizer and Shrimp Scampi! I have always had a great experience, however on Sunday Sept 1@ 7:30 PM I have never received poorer service and horrible food and lack of concern from the manager when bought to his attention! After a short dialogue a new entree was bought out and this one was worst then the first one ! I vow to get on here once a month to Express my dismay ! I will never return there and you have your manager to thank ! SHAME ON YOU GRAND LUX !!!!!!! POOR QUALITY OF FOOD AND POORLY TRAINED MANAGER!!

G_LG7y7crIIPbYYBul_6aw.text: We stopped in here after a cirque du Soleil show and exploring the Venetian and palazzo hotels. The sliders we ordered were good. Fries were just ok. Not good not bad. The asparagus was the problem. They don't explain that they are steamed and they give you so many. I asked for butter and used salt and pepper and pretty much had to doctor them up for them to be somewhat edible. Service in Vegas almost everywhere we've been has been slow so I wasn't totally surprised by that.

ovUMF3sQY0tBs2toTxcEhQ.text: We ate here for breakfast this morning because we had such a great experience last time. Sadly today was the complete opposite. We were seated right away and ordered drinks (coffee and waters). We both then ordered our breakfast (French toast for me and a sausage and cheese scramble for my husband). This is where the disaster starts. We watch 3 other tables seated, order and get their food before us. We ask our waitress and she tells us it's coming right out. It's now been 40 minutes and no food. We ask again where our food is after waiting another 10 minutes and we're again told it's coming out now. The manager comes over to apologize and promises our meals will be out in 2 minutes. He then tells us our breakfast is on him. Fine, as it should be at this point. Our meals come to our table finally and it doesn't taste good enough for a 50 minute wait. Our check arrives and sure enough, only the French toast was comped! I was so irritated at that point that I just wanted to leave. We paid and will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette with hash browns
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast

OR8OGUiKOmDbKAKybpaFGQ.text: We ate dinner here on Mother's Day. We were looking for somewhere low key, that served decent food, didn't require a reservation, and would allow casual attire. This place fit the bill.   We started with the double stuffed potato spring rolls. They were AMAZING!!!  They tasted like a cross between potato skins and potato blintzes. Order these!!!  They were my favorite part of the meal.   For our entrees, I ordered the Cafe Beef Wellington which was paired with mashed potatoes, mixed veggies, and puffed pastry in a Madeira sauce. The sauce was nice and the meat was cooked perfectly but the puffed pastry was weird. It was disconnected from the rest of the dish. It seemed like the pastries were just tossed on top and I had a hard time figuring out how to eat them with the meal. They were wet from the sauce, so I couldn't just pick them up and they were also tough to cut. This dish was tasty but I wouldn't order it again.  My fiance ordered the T-Bone Steak; again nice dish but nothing memorable.   The dishes are fairly priced and the restaurant is conveniently located right off the casino floor in the Venetian. If you are looking for a quick bite and aren't feeling the food court, this is a good option, it's just nothing to write home about.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key Lime Pie ($7.95)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. T-Bone Steak ($24.95)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cafe Beef Wellington ($21.95)

df8ch55_elk5-W5NRfdA7g.text: We came here for the buffet breakfast option on a Friday morning before heading off to the airport. We had a fantastic breakfast here. We quickly learned the express breakfast = buffet- so look out for that!  While the buffet is small, it's mighty. We started with some of the best hash browns I've ever had. For a buffet, I expected like warm and just ok potatoes but wow. I got seconds of these. I, then, moved to the omelette bar. Whoever is making those omelettes will NOT let you down. I got everything except tomatoes. The eggs were phenomenal, cooked perfectly, I had a nice cheesy crust, it was everything I wanted and more.  The buffet also showcases sausage, ham, waffles, normal eggs (although I'd just get some scrambled ones at the omelette station, personally), some very fresh fruit, Pastries, and a toast station with bagels.   I'd also 100% recommend the fresh squeezed orange juice. It was great! The service we had was a bit lacking but the food was perfection.

Zsg-dy_5IQVFCPqYRM6O0w.text: I was happy the Grand Lux was open for a very late meal. It is located at a great people watching spot, so sit on the "patio" area if you can. I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich and it was pretty good. The sandwich and the side salad were a very generous size. No one will go home hungry. Service was friendly and timely.

zdFajjeUkO9e4na3r_LLzw.text: Omg...so absolutely delicious. I can't believe that I am just getting in here to try this place out, but WOW, what a first impression. The Beignets....why are they so darn good? My kids and I LOVE Beignets and these border the Best. The chicken and waffles..different but awesomely good. Surprisingly, the Florentine omelette was 1 of the best I have ever had. EAT HERE

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bv9vblDH1C_bz5RGliPkqg.text: For those staying at the Palazzo, this is a convenient place to grab To Go late night food and take back to your room or have breakfast before heading back to the 15 fwy home.   We checked in after 11 pm and this place was the only convenient option to feed a family of 4 without having to drive somewhere.  The food options late night were plenty and can satisfy any cravings.  I highly recommend the turkey burger which came as an elevated sandwich with crusty bread and the fries were perfectly crispy.  For breakfast I recommend the crab omelette filled with real crab meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab omelette

Xy22QDPaNPYqVNWJnSjvDw.text: Food was good. Slightly on the pricier side. However service was prompt They have a lot of selections to choose from. The ambience here is phenomenal as it takes you back to the roots. Would definitely come back if there was more availability of their lunch menu into their dinner menu. Staff was very pleasant to deal with and they even remembered us from last time which is great knowing you are being acknowledged

x1WJKYb7XpIhqEH_r4HKeQ.text: My boyfriend and I came to Grand Lux cafe multiple times for breakfast.  It was so close to the elevators and, looking at their menu, we were impressed by the variety of options and how reasonably priced their food items were (i.e. averaged about $15/meal).    During our time, we ordered: breakfast quesadilla, chicken and waffles, huevos rancheros, deluxe breakfast sandwich (X2) and spring garden omelette.    Every time we ordered, the food was very good but found the portion sizes way too big.  We do not like wasting food so we would either have to pack it to go or simply finish and not eat anything else until evening.  I think the restaurant should consider giving slightly smaller portions so that customers wouldn't leave with doggy bags or a food coma.  My favourite item was the breakfast quesadilla as it comes with globs of sour cream and amazing chunky guac. The side of hash browns were delish! My boyfriend really enjoyed the deluxe breakfast sandwich.  My least favourite was the chicken with waffles.  The chicken was a bit too dry and flavourless. The sweetness of the syrup with the crunchy dry flavourless chicken did not pair well.   Their servers were courteous, smiley and attentive to our needs like coffee/water refills, how are doing, etc but almost too attentive at times that it became a bit bothersome.  The coffee was a bit overpriced ($4.50 for a cup) and it made more sense to order a latte/cappuccino/mocha since those drinks only costed $1-2 more.    Overall, we found the dining experience here "okay".  The food was decent and reasonably priced but portions were just too big and made the meals hard to enjoy.  The restaurant should put more emphasis on quality instead of quantity and take away menu items that aren't great (chicken and waffles for example).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QzC6huMyg_kUCHb536nT-A.text: Food was just ok.  The service below average. I went there after midnight. The restaurant was not full. The bar had about 8 people. And approximately 6 tables were occupied. Upon entering, the hostess was cold and unwelcoming. There were plenty of tables available in the seating area after midnight. I requested  to be seated in a quiet area. They seated me by the mop/ cash register/ dishes area room. I was extremely uncomfortable with waiters going in and out of that room, whilst brushing up against my table. I asked my waitress to move me to a quieter table away from the mop room. She said she would ask the hostess. She told me she couldn't move me. This provided an unpleasant dining experience.  I ordered the chicken picatta with a glass of white wine. The food was just ok. The chicken was dry and flavorless. The wine... well, it's wine! With wine, I don't discriminate... so, it complimented the unsatifactory meal and made it just bearable. I will not be returning to this restaurant. The customer service was lacking. The hostess was rude. The waitress was unaccomodating. And the food was mediocre.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken picatta...

DldyvNY8XB5vF-L17JTjPw.text: Really is "grand".  Plenty of seating, large menu/choices including gluten free options, friendly wait staff, AND reasonable prices.  Convenient and delicious!
