It came with fries and everyhing which made it hard to even finish such a giant burger.  I had asked for cheese, avocado, and mushroom...now how can that not be an amazing burger just already.  -Short Rib Sandwich ($16?) - There's a reason why there were two of us ordered the same exact thing.  It looked damn good on the menu and we didn't want to share.  And just as suspected, it was great.  Greasy, yes, but the toasty bread sandwiching short rib meat was phenomenal.    -Knowing this type of food exists around the strip, I'm glad to say I'll be looking forward to staying somewhere nearby next time I'm in vegas too.  btw, NO TO Imperial Palace

t8bSH7F5KWmedOk6IrCSyA.text: Great restaurant that stays open until at least 3am (for you late-nighters coming home from Tao or Lavo).   It's very much in the same style as cheesecake factory (they are owned by the same company). Lots of choices and huge portions. I think my pasta dish lasted me three mealtimes total! Loved the pasta fresca, though it got a bit oily towards the bottom. I also liked the carbonara but wished the bacon was a little less salty.

AcQFaqwcp_9Nrzw-azna1g.text: Great place for inexpensive fine dinner, fresh baked cookies the bomb  don't forget molten chocolate cake and stellar margarita

Ms4dgCvA1TTjBvbkNMpeQA.text: I adore Grand Luxe. It is one of my favorite restaurants in Los Angeles and one of my favorites in Las Vegas. I was very surprised that they opened one at the Palazzo, since they have one in the Venetian which is less than a 5 minute walk.   But regardless, my boyfriend and I havent' been to Grand Luxe in a long time and so we decided to go and have dinner there. We parked at the Venetian and upon entering the Venetian we saw a HUGE line at Grand Luxe. I hate waiting for a long period of time, especially just to eat. So I said, let's go try the one at the Palazzo. I was hoping not many people knew about the second location. I was semi-right!!!  When we walked towards the Grand Luxe location at the Palazzo, there were only 2 people in front of me. Once I gave them the number of my party, they sat us immediately. SCORE! No wait! I was a very happy camper indeed.  I ordered my usual Sunday Night Pasta. It was delicious. Slightly a bit too salty for my taste, but still good as I remember it to be. My boyfriend ordered the Lasagna and he LOVED it. I think it is his new favorite item on their menu. He just loved the sauce. I tried it and it was delicious!   Although we were stuffed, we saved room for dessert because I am a HUGE Creme Brulee fanatic and hadn't had it in such a long time. So we ordered that and it was also delicious. You get one regular vanilla creme brulee and one chocolate flavored creme brulee. When you eat it together, it's just so yummy in your tummy!!  Our waiter was also very nice and helpful. So service was good too.  I love Grand Luxe!! I had so much leftovers. Portion size is HUGE! So many choices and so much good food!!!

yLIGdrfTvjTd51pq17ln0w.text: Not bad comparing to the food at Palazzo...(room service is wretched).  TOP ITEMS: Chicken Pot Pie Chicken Enchiladas  *same people as cheesecake factory.

-vRXixmomw5jR0RVozCeuQ.text: I love cheesecake factory so no doubt I would also love this place. We had lunch here. The double stuffed potato Spring roll is divine. I ordered cheese enchilada and it was great. The service was  also excellent.  We actually came back for breakfast for the affordable price. My omelet was huge and the fresh squeeze OJ was great.   If you stay at palazzo they will deliver food to your room.

mGLN0plcFfKvAuN1K-mJSQ.text: I always stop here when I come visit Vegas. Located near the casino and elevators at the Venetian.  I looooove the shrimp scampi pasta (i think that's what it's called) Linguini noodles with GINORMOUS grilled and partially battered shrimp with a light white wine sauce and tomatoes.  we usually have to wait to be seated esp post club time... sometimes i get a little dizzy because of the floral smell -- i dont wanna smell flowers when I eat my shrimp!  -1 for slippery floors!!! I always fear that I'll eat it real bad when I walk around here.  YUM YUM YUM.   You get what you pay for and maybe a little bit more.

75vU44gFPkk5yXLzE8EssA.text: My boyfriend and I came here after his mom picked this cafe out and I'd have to say she made an excellent choice.   Service: Excellent, we arrived 15 minutes before 11:00 (when lunch starts) and our waitress let us know that we could choose from both the breakfast and the lunch menu as long as we let her know within 10 minutes so that she could get the order into the kitchen.   Food: I ordered the Sunday Night Pasta and it was excellent. It may seem like a ripoff since it's 17.50 for spaghetti with meat sauce but it was totally worth it. The meat sauce was so flavorful, it's made with chunks of beef short ribs and steak. Even after I was full, I wanted to keep eating to finish the rest of it.   What I didn't like was that despite the fact the restaurant wasn't that busy, for some reason the food took forever to come out or what felt like forever.

p3adYBSqNP3LILZX-WWMEA.text: My rating my be a bit off because I got my food to go.  So take heed of that warning when reading this.  But... the food was very, very forgettable (and it's not due to the huge consumption of alcohol that followed), but it just lacked anything worth metnioning.  The food was edible, barely.  Nothing was "good".  It takes forever for anything to come out (i think we waited about half an hour?)  Meh.

ZaONQvTlQteUUh7ReB72tg.text: Lunch Salmon piccatta with lemon butter all the way. Best value for money and so delicious!

vSINHlsLtRizDDvTEJiuWw.text: I waltzed into the Grand Lux Cafe after asking a random security guard for his recommendation. I tried the breakfast buffet after a night of drinking and wasnt too impressed. Pretty basic omelette section, hashbrkwns, sausage, fruit, ham, cereal, bread & pastry selection. I noticed it was quite busy & i truthfully have no complaints for a last minute $20 breakfast buffet. On a separate note, but in the same day I stopped in for dinner & a couple drinks. I ordered the mini brie and date pizza which was literally exquisite! The buttery, flaky crust complimented the tangy nuttiness of the brie and the sweetness of the dates so well. I enjoyed an heirloom and avocado salad that was so rich in flavor and texture. The heirlooms were slightly acidic and paired perfectly with creamy avocado and robust french dressing! I even indulged in a couple mai tais that completed my meal perfectly. I sat at the bar and was greeted by Joey. He was extremely friendly and attentive, i would have to say food and service here was awesome!

G2LJOPaXsebT98U2Vx9Aow.text: I guess I haven't been to a grand luxe in over 3-4 years cuz my favorite dish isn't on the menu anymore! I was raving to my friends how good this place is and how the short rib sloppy joes were to die for! Our waitress said that they did not have it on the menu, nor could they make it off the menu! I did see a grilled cheese short rib sammy and wondered how different it could be. I wasn't curious enough to try, so I ended up ordered the next familiar thing: indochine chicken and shrimp! it was yummy and came with brown rice. I highly recommend the asian nachos. I had little expectations and was surprised by the flavors! They give large servings as well, and ended up taking half of my food home.

WIsAaPnQluvMt8BMa39flQ.text: I wanted to not like this place because it's a cheesecake factory.... but after dinner, I must say I'm a fan.  There were plenty of options for an inexpensive dinner and while the dinner rolls were average, the pork sliders and margherita pizza we got were delicious!  The sliders tasted absolutely gourmet!  Plus the pizza was enough for two people while still maintaing a high quality.  This place not being named after a mass production facility and its much more tasteful decor made it much better than a cheesecake factory for me.

TZRrFlkxzcIIpDN0eHsRXA.text: First the hostess with the red bob sucks at her job. I approach your stand and no hi or hello. Next don't tell me you don't have something and then have me look over the menu and come back and say you cant make my substitute but now can make my previous order. Then when someone ask for a substitute don't bring out the food and say btw we don't have it but we assume you would like this instead. Are you a mind reader on top of a server cause that was a shitty prediction.

7oOCBdOHfwvE_c72FvznSg.text: Our server was great. However the buffet didn't have variety. The oatmeal station was broken and bread options limited. Too expensive for the price and hype.

3xyUjyUoH072paQbr0Gr5g.text: I really enjoyed this location... go to the Palazzo one - it's better. I never expected to find an affordable place in Vegas with huge portion sizes... but I found it here. Went here after a friend told us all about his good experience. We went with a group of 4. We had great service too. I got the shrimp and pasta dish ($23 I think). It had 6-8 giant shrimp plus a huge mound of pasta and we asked for some sauce on the side. It was just HUGE for the price (earlier in the day I paid $5 for a crappy hot dog somewhere else so this dish and price was thrilling). At our table someone got a big sandwich and another got a nice looking steak dish. Everyone enjoyed their meals and took some of it home. If I'm in the area again, I'll definitely go here again and I'd suggest you give it a try.

AOz61h8XLX9nSyxnHyza2w.text: One of the decent place to eat Italian food inside Venetian/Palazzo complex.  Fast, prompt service and waiter is attentive.  Price is definitely reasonable for Vegas Standard.  I like my Carbonara pasta alot.  Esp with the sweet pea and bacon.  The bacon taste actually infused within the pasta so makes it taste so delicious.  The waiter was very nice where he asks if any of us were allergic to Bacon, now that's what I called good service.  We were also given dinner portion for the price of lunch.  What a lucky day!  Tip:: Lunch portion is a better choice and if going there for dinner, order 1 main course is enough for 2 people to share.

2wkgIxw06djhpuj84oDxpw.text: The food here is really good. They're partners with the Cheesecake Factory so the quality is great. The Thai fried chicken was really good as well as the gnocchi. However the service was horrible. The manager was rude and she have my friend attitude when his rare steak came out medium and it took forever to come out in the first place. Then when we refired the steak, it came out cold and unsafe to eat and she didn't even care. The food was really good but the service was horrible.

qLJUhzn4qBrrkT5jluyFdA.text: Worst breakfast buffet in Las Vegas.  All the hot food bins were empty!  Server told me eggs would come out "later", but the whole reason I paid for the buffet was because I was in a hurry.

i6OluS9_bfj9PG-jZ8d1-Q.text: You have to order the beignets...they are made fresh when you order so it takes some time before you actually get it. We usually order it first and then get it for dessert. Yummy!

dIiTVPTsxKx151e0YNX53w.text: Well, I like this place. Or maybe I was hungry. Portions are huge! It's reasonable priced and everything was tasty; plus, it's open 24 hours for those drunken nights. We had the Lunch Pasta Telephono and the Sausage and Pepperoni Pizza. My friend had their home-made Chicken Pot Pie but said she didn't like it at all; the crust was too thick. Overall, service was awesome. The waitress was super attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Lemon Chicken Picatta
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Salmon Chicken Picatta w/ Brown Rice
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza

UhjOc2lzxG11Xrix6NrPuw.text: Have any of you ever had the feeling where you just can't stand another buffet in Vegas?  Or just simply sick and tired of looking at all the food stations with endless possibilities for a potential food coma? (Well I never had that problem but people in my party certainly had that predicament)  So I guess I will just have to follow suit and take in a regular dining facility instead of the glamorous world of buffet heaven.  I've been to a Grand Lux before so it wasn't anything new to me.   It is the sister restaurant of Cheesecake Factory's therefore I have no complaints here at all.  Just like any Cheesecake's you've been to it's got lavish decor, dim lighting, and of course, endless options on their menu.  It's a typical California (cheesecake factory) fare where you can pretty much get anything and everything.. so here are the dishes that our party have ordered!  Polynesian Salad!  Citrusy flavored dressing with a hint of sweetness all rolled into one drizzled upon a pyramid like salad concoction.  The veggie temple was build with a foundation of mixed greens and tiered off by giant wonton crisps!  It's pretty much the sister version of the Luau Salad at the Cheesecake factory... one of the most delicious salads for a nice sit down restaurant!  Grand Cobb Salad:  It's grand but actually not as large portioned as the Polynesian salad.  It's got all your typical culprits in a cobb (avocado, bacon, turkey, egg whites, etc..) All dressed in bleu cheese!  (I thought it was ranch..  Yuck!  I hate Blue Cheese!!!  However, when I actually gave it a try, the dressing as actually tasty and bearable!  (I simply cannot handle bleu cheese) So that's actually tasty as well!  Madeira Chicken:  Didn't get to try this out but according to our friends, it was tasty!  (I'm not a big chicken breast dish kind of guy so I never order these things)  I'll just take their word for it!  Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich:  Same as above as I didn't get to try the sammy, but it was gone from my buddy's plate so that's a good sign!  Gotta try that next time!  Slow Roasted Short Ribs of Beef:  Great BBQ flavor!  It's your typical BBQ flavor dish but definitely tasty!  (With BBQ you really cannot go wrong unless you overcook it which will make it super dry and gross)  But it was nicely flavored, juicy, and delicious overall!  (huge portion too! as it was served with veggies and mash Potato!)  Fried Calamari:  Highlight alert!  This is one of the best Calamari that I've ever had in many different places!  They fried their calamari along with veggies and rock shrimp to create the most heavenly dish (one of my all time favorites!) served with ranch and spicy aioli dressing!  I'm telling you, if you were to pick one dish to get at Grand Lux, this one is highly highly recommended!  Oh... did I mention the portion for this is huge?  Well you bet it is!  Totally worth every penny!  Lastly, service was awesome as it comes to expected being affiliated with cheesecake Factory.  They brought out wrong salad dressing for me and when I asked for it, 2 different wait staff came out with the dressing!  (Now I got 3!)  Great attention to customer's needs is definitely a plus!  So there you have it, Grand Lux Cafe, opens 24 hrs, in Venetian or Palazzo, and will serve your morning, noon, dinner, or late night dining needs in case you are totally turned off by the buffets of  Vegas!  A terrific alternative yet decently priced!

urd2aU4NVLNaDLeDjfYg_g.text: Vegas always included jumbalya at the Grand Lux. Sadly disappointed. Over cooked shrimp, too salty and no longer perfect fluffy rice. Like others mention, probably my last visit here. Grand Lux what happened?!

IEOslo4ga9MKywVI85Eflg.text: The last time we were here, my pizza was good but my friend found a long hair in his food but the manager took the price off the bill.

Yjcr8Gx_KOExHs7SfhwCJg.text: The service here was so speedy, we had someone to help us from the moment we sat down. We ordered our drinks, and then our appetizers and main course at the same time, before we could finish the appetizers the food was here, and we barely had to wait 15 minutes!  I would recommend this place to anyone, the pricing was fantastic, and at the speed they took to serve it, the quality of the food was exceptional.

wTBOQQko85ej-UPn1QFKxg.text: I had the twice baked potato spring rolls from the appetizer menu. They weren't what I was expecting (as I probably should have read the description a little more closely), but were really tasty and not like anything I've ever had before.

yzOPiqlmhjR3v2vdfwef5Q.text: So we came here for lunch. My friends have been here before. The decor here is gorgeous. The servers are excellent. They are all super friendly, helpful, and very attentive. We ordered a bunch of omelettes, sandwiches and salmon special. I, myself ordered a special omelette and it was delicious!!! Usually when I order omelettes at other restaurants, the ingredients inside do not fill up the whole thing, but every bite of my omelette here was filled with all the yummy goodness!!! The salmon was alright... a bit overcooked, but the sandwiches were deeeelicious as well! Overall, YUMMY!!! ^_^

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special omelette with hash browns!!!

Wxxa_EpZhd6Rat3VEtlVxw.text: I work at the Cheesecake Factory in Chicago so when I came in here every body was super friendly and I even ended up knowing a lot of people!   And just like back home, the food is great, the menu is vast and appealing to everyone so you will find yourself happy every time. I won't really go into details for the simple reason that you will definitely find something you would like [they literally have dishes of every kind of popular food]. It's also conveniently located next to the Casino at the Venetian so you can grub and gamble or gamble and grub.   The staff is super friendly, the atmosphere is romantic and trendy and the bill isn't as over the top as you may think. So go ahead and enjoy! I highly recommend it!

PqfYPf9bbnpxPM-2Bw6hxg.text: My go to when I'm in Vegas. They have some of the best burgers Vegas has to offer. If you are low carb dieting the the burgers can be wrapped in lettuce. The  Santa Barbra chicken sandwich and the Avocado chipotle burger are a must try ! Thanks again for keeping me fed well

xIfZrhCz2qZNjIFOfPdpJA.text: Grand Lux is one of our go-to spots in Vegas. Reasonably priced and a great variety of food. The Grand Lux accommodated our party of 20 and everyone enjoyed themselves. From the pastas, to burgers, and salads everyone left pleased.   If you're looking for a restaurant in Vegas that has good food at a good price this is the place to go.  Only downfall is there are two locations in both Palazzo and Venetian - make sure you know what one you made reservations at!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toscano

NU4c57S4q9kXyZXb5xxwlA.text: Would we have gone here deliberately?  No. I'm glad that Amazon had bought out the restaurants in the Venetian, which forced us to head over to the Palazzo.    Not much of a waiting area, so we kinda stood around in the bar area.  (That is why one fewer star.)  We were seated and our waiter was on point.  He had great recommendations.  He kept my glasses full.   He helped us navigate out of the place.  Separate checks, no problem!   Special requests, sure thing!  It was super late for me to eat dinner, so I thought, I will get something on the lighter and smaller side.   Grand Lux Cafe thought otherwise.  My mini pizza was enormous.   The small chopped salad would have been an entree on its own.   The salad was delicious and had a great presentation.  My pizza was perfectly cooked.    Prices were reasonable, especially considering the portions.   Service was excellent.   Atmosphere was kinda funky, but I liked it.     I would head back here!

oIHShGLKSKzvRsevO-iGhA.text: There are two Lux Cafe's with one each located in both, The Venetian and The Palazzo.  This review is for the Palazzo location.    First thing you will notice is an extensive menu which was created by the Founder of Cheesecake Factory, so if you have ever eaten at one of those you know what I'm taking about.  The menu gets 5 stars.   I would rate the food here as being in the 3 star to 5 star range depending on what you order.  The breakfast omelets are excellent as are the burgers, wraps and many of the sandwiches I have tried.  Things like the pancakes were average and nothing to write home about.    The service was a bit off the last two visits with me having to flag down a server to get coffee, creamer, water refills and even simple stuff like ketchup.  Despite that the food and meal was still good.    Overall this is a great place to "grab a bite" or perhaps also a drink as they do have a full bar.  However, this isn't a romantic experience or even a "real nice" dining experience that will be memorable for years.  This is a casual "fill my stomach" experience.   For something more, look to some of the 5 star rated restaurants I reviewed.    Enjoy!

Kh4XXBsz83YEy7nf5fuS0g.text: The Grand Lux Cafe in the Venetian serves fantastic food at affordable prices. I've dined here many times and always look forward to coming back. The prices are good for high quality, large portions meals! It is open 24 hrs a day and as such serves pretty much anything you would like.Their food is so fresh and delicious. They have the best waffle I've ever tried anywhere. The menu matches the atmosphere and there is something for everyone. It reminded me of the Cheesecake Factory setting.  It is a great place to hang out and see the world go by at the Venetian Hotel!

f9t9u8K1Ws8wKyiYRWmWoQ.text: Stopped here for a late dinner- the service is fast and the food comes out fast- from my experi ce with the other Luxe at the Venetian their service is faster at this one-than the Venetian Luxe- the poke tacos were delicious as well as the fried green beans.

pyzFpWqO3wzmQatwZ-1pHQ.text: Found this eatery through Yelp and glad we decided to try them out!   Loved the ambiance of the place--somewhat dark but cozy and very comfortable.  I just hate all the indoor smoking of Las Vegas!   Our waitress, Victoria, was wonderful!   She was so attentive, polite and professional.  Awesome service!    I had the Lemon Drop Martini which was perfectly sweet and had just the right amount of alcohol.    We ordered the fried calamari which included shrimp and some veggies.  A very generous serving accompanied by 2 dipping sauces.   The batter was not too thin nor too thick.  It wasn't greasy and was very tasty.    We also ordered the cheese and BBQ chicken pizza.  I didn't get to try it but it was all gone so need I say more?  Hubby and I shared the Beef Wellington.  We've never had this dish anywhere and were so used to seeing it prepared on Gordon Ramsey's Hell's Kitchen, so when they came out as medallions with a pastry puff sitting on top, we were a little disappointed but they were still really delicious!   I'm not a brussel sprouts eater but I loved the way they were prepared!  It was charred and topped with a sweet glaze.  Veggies and mashed potatoes were paired with it.    No room for dessert but I'd love to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half cheese/half BBQ pizza
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

qDKJCxq8WE5oAobTPkmvEA.text: They was a fly in my salad and flying around my sandwich I told the lady about it she said its just a fly to you want me give you a new salad or you want a new sandwich to

19nysvo6xnHZbbFhX1e_uA.text: I rarely go to Las Vegas without going to the Grand Lux! My husband and I have fallen in love with the Beignets we feel they're better than the ones in New Orleans from Cafe Du Monde! They're light and fluffy and made to Perfection. You have to order this wonderful dessert when you sit down because it takes about 30 minutes for it to be made from scratch. Otherwise the menu is vast just like their mother company The Cheesecake Factory. Most of the dishes are great but there are some misses. For example, I had a really great hamburger from the Grand Lux when they were in Los Angeles (unfortunately they're closed now) but when I ordered a hamburger, in all fairness it was not the same hamburger, from the Grand Lux at the Palazzo it was a miss; I actually had to send it back. But that is a rarity and the customer service is so good that if you do get something you don't like they'll be happy to give you something else. There is more than one location of the Grand Lux in Las Vegas but the one I tend to frequent the most is the one at the casino the Bellagio next to the Venetian. The Venetian is cool but it doesn't seem to have as much going on for it as the one at the Palazzo. This is also a really great restaurant to go to with your family because they have the ability to accommodate a large group. The bar is cool to have your dining experience because it's a good people watching environment and you can watch television as well but it is dark in there. If you want a more bright environment then you'll not want to sit in the bar. We don't mind the bar because my husband enjoys watching sports while we're dining so it's cool for us but at least you'll have options going in. Have a great time at the Grand Lux with its vast menu and amazing desserts you can't go wrong here!

kYFsALuM9LwY3lAfunv_XQ.text: This was the best service we've gotten in Vegas so far our waiter Kevin was amazing! Someone in our party had a severe allergy and he made sure to get everything right for us. He went above and beyond in service and really made our day. 10/10 would recommend and we're going back for dinner!

IvTO1ECC78yR1aVubzFjHQ.text: Jose' the morning bartender on a Sunday SAVED MY TRIP! Smiling and Kind ! Knowledgeable about the town as well. Being a native from Sin City his opinions were appreciated. Thanks  grand lux Cafe is ALWAYS A GRAND TIME

7utpwUvsJxUxIwWtv5uI8Q.text: We needed to find a place to eat that wasn't outrageously priced with decent food and good service and I am happy to report that the Grand Lux in the Palazzo hit all three points. Our waiter, Kevin, was attentive and gave us great recommendations. Very happy we came here.

TpL9dl_CI0Cx4mALW-zHxQ.text: My favorite place to come to in Vegas . The wait is never outrageous even when it's a line the most I ever waited was 15 minutes. Waiters are fast & attentive. I never had to wait for refills or ask for any extra butter or syrup the waiter was always on top of his job . Food is great I choose the omelette ( choose 4 items: cheese spinach bacon mushrooms)  & it came with hash browns and toast . My fiancee choose chicken & waffles. Best waffles I ever tasted in life.   The waffle is literally mouth watering. Can't wait to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mOdlkZj0_ZHfl9LZnikFfw.text: Our server Kevin was soooo wonderful! We had a severe allergy and he made sure to take care of us and he was so friendly! The food was so delicious and well priced! Will be back again

WjUq5w0WlR1S7Jj7YO2ZwA.text: Located inside the Palazzo, Grand Lux Cafe has a HUGE menu. Anything you want, they have it. Usually, I'm concerned about places like these because I like to eat at a restaurant that specializes in 1 or 2 items. However, Grand Lux pulls it off.  I got the Cajun Shrimp and Chicken Jambalaya and it was huge! There was plenty of shrimp and chicken and I didn't feel like I was getting skimped of the good stuff. The spices were nicely marinated and had a nice little kick to it. I was definitely satisfied. I feel like Grand Lux gives you the appropriate portion size for the amount you pay. If you think the price is too steep, just remember that the portions are going to be big so you can definitely share/to-go it.   The service was exceptional. The hostesses sat us down right away and Pierre, our waiter, was the man. He was very friendly and gave us honest suggestions on the menu (since it's too big!). He was very prompt and courteous.   My only knock on this location vs the one at the Venetian is that this one isn't open 24/7. But then again, when am I going to eat at 4 AM in the morning? Only in Vegas...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun shrimp and chicken jambalaya

3ca6QWPZ2giIXS-E85dGTg.text: The service is always good when we come here. Jaime and I got the Lunch orders of Chicken Parm and Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo. Man the food is so good.  I can't even imagine the gigantic Jethro  Bodine serving it must be for dinner.  If you get the dinner size, you can probably feed 2.  Stop by, you won't be disappointed.

zIXvf_AslGlJMWj0YuTAZw.text: Came here for dinner to use up my comp dollars on my players card.  I had what I wanted in mind, but changed it last minute. Go figure! Haha. I ordered the LUNCH portion of their chicken parm & I must say I was very pleasantly surprised. It was soo good! Seasoned very well & even the pasta was cooked right! Only suggestion I would give would be to not have so many onions in the sauce, but hey, that's just my own personal opinion!! Would definitely suggest to come here if u ever get the chance! :)

MkbG-Z2QmRJic_qmkm3lMQ.text: I'm surprised I haven't left a review here before.  I'm definitely a regular here.  Been here over 20 times over the years.  Just a solid 4 stars spot!   1. Food is tasty.  2. Portions are big.  3. Service is great.  4. Sofa and booths are comfy.  5. Windows on the north side provide sun and day light which is very nice (unlike the venetian location when you have no windows). 6. Affordable.   I usually go with: * Chicken avocado salads!  * Caramel chicken (kind of a orange chicken). * Omelets. * Smoked salmon scrambled.  Yummy and solid!  Great spot for a quick non formal and casual meal- breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Trust me, I know food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Avocado salad!

znP0ZJiOOt70wnuUvSX1NQ.text: Hmm, my 5 star rating is a little skewed mostly because I've had a lot of good times at Grand Lux! Drunken and non-drunken times! LOL  The best thing I love about this place is the huge menu and the price that they offer it at! I usually love short menu's because you know the restaurant does a few thing but they do it well but this is exact opposite! They have a huge menu and they do most things relatively well!   The chicken and waffles here is a must! The chicken flatbread i tried was great too! There serving sizes are bigger and the prices are reasonable. I think this is a solid dependable place to eat at any time of the day.  When in doubt where to eat, go to the LUX!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken flat bread!

SvX1Rm0brLdwJVe_znoGrw.text: We came here for breakfast and it did not disappoint. The restaurant is a sister restaurant to the Cheese Cake Factory so all of the portion sizes were HUGE and can easily feed two people. We had the biscuits and gravy which was great and the buffet. The buffet is the way to go, at $20 it includes coffee (which is $4 on its own) and the omelette bar was a nice surprise.   Over all it was a good breakfast and we ate there for breakfast all 3 days we were in town!

MSWnYHN8_HTEoYntnk3H_g.text: I was told this is the sister of Cheesecake factory, so decided to check this place out. There were 2 locations: one inside palazoo and one in Venetian. My boyfriend told me one of the locations has the fried beignets and it was a must have item.  so we tried to see which location has it.  so he asked and turned out it was in the Palazoo side and we had dinner here.  We shared the appetizer, entree, and dessert.  Portion size was huge, so glad we shared, or else we would have lots of left over.   We shared the pot roast fries, garlic shrimp pasta, and fried beignets.  OMG they were all so delicious.  out of the 3, I really enjoy the fries and the beignets, i would get them again when I go there again.    the pot roast fries: pot roast was super tender and tasty.  the fries were fried in perfection.  I was surprised it was loaded with lots of meat and we got kinda full from the appetizer already.    Garlic Shrimp Pasta: was very good, not super garlicky and it was just right amount of garlic flavor.  portion was huge and right amount of shrimp too.  Fried Beignets: delicious and melt in your mouth.  Love our server brought all 3 dipping sauce for us to try since we can't decided what sauce to use.  really like the white cream sauce and chocolate, not too much on the raspberry one.  will get this again.    service: great.  server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.   atmosphere: very romantic.  we were sitting outside facing the mall and it was nice actually.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried beignets
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp pasta
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot roast fries

4yB8MxY230dmSG6UGFW6kA.text: Came here for breakfast/lunch on the day we were leaving Vegas.. this place is busy!  Since we had a big group it took about 20 minutes for us to finally get a table.  BF got the beef wellington which overall was okay.. except the last piece (which I asked to try) was so soft it was obviously really old (bad) meat?  It was like.. mushier and softer than a hamburger patty, and had no texture hold at all...  Gross.  I got the BLT with sweet potatoes which was good.. so filling that I ended up taking half of it to go (yay, leftovers).  They provide some pretty delicious fresh sourdough bread and butter while you wait (you might have to ask for it).  Our waiter was slammed but managed to get through the service.  Overall a good place to chow down for a bite to eat.. was a little disappointed we missed breakfast since it took so long to get seated.  C'est la vie.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT with sweet potato fries

mNinCgKt35ghH4pQssQAEw.text: The service here not so good here tonight it's not enough staff tonight, i was waiting to order for a long time and the spoon was so dirty and they ran out of oranges for old  fashioned, I'm not that happy here tonight

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not great service tonight

Vaab7YpxvHgO2Oj-my-BMw.text: After we finished eating here, we kept thinking that it was very Cheesecake Factory-esque. Then we found out that the creator of TCF was asked to create a version for the Venetian! It's unmistakable.  Portion sizes are generous, three mains and a salad and an appetizer were enough to feed six adults. Everything we ordered was delicious and recommended to try!  Eggplant parmesan fritters - great eggplant flavor, deep fried to perfection and goes perfectly with the marinara sauce  Crispy fish tacos - lives up to its name, fish remained crispy even when we waited to eat them last. The sauce adds a nice kick  Cafe beef wellington - my personal favorite. A unique take on beef wellington, it's not beef wrapped in puff pastry, but rather of puff pastry  on top of beef medallions. Beef was amazingly tender, mashed potatoes were buttery and the veggies were delicious. The brussel sprouts were surprisingly everyone's favorite!  Roasted Pear and Strawberry Salad - great combination of flavors, if there's any salad to try here, get this one  Sausage, Pepperoni & Mushrooms Pizza - a long flatbread style pizza, pizza sauce is light and flavorful, crust was good  If you like The Cheesecake Factory, you'll enjoy it here as well, especially if you're staying at the Palazzo.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Pear and Strawberry Salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cafe Beef Wellington
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos, also comes with Nacho-Cheese Fries (not pictured)

g37dOb-RyPFi2IhCZgm1qg.text: Grand Lux is always my go to at the Venetian or Palazzo.  They have breakfast, lunch, dinner, and a late night breakfast.  Sometimes the breakfast foods are on the lunch menu if you don't wake up early enough.    There's so much seating in here that you should get a table within 30-40 minutes in my opinion.  I found out they offer a buffet brunch option until 3 pm for $24.95.  You don't even have to sit near the buffet, and not everyone in your group needs to get this option.  It's worth it if you want to try a bit of everything.    Service is good - Vegas style.  I know I'll be back!

cxYbB8BPXFswrEGpbEiSfA.text: I usually love this spot and every time we come to Vegas it's a must have. This time around however was a bit different. For starters, my drink tasted so sweet it was hard to tell if there was even any alcohol in it. Them, our salad had a hair (which they were nice enough to replace). Their utensils had a funky old water smell them so that was definitely Off putting.

IJkPYs_DGPqw62m7wdlELg.text: My family and I would have come here many times if we'd found it earlier. The menu is long, the prices very reasonable, and the food is absolutely delicious! I wasn't sure what to expect when Mom wanted to go to a cafe with a long menu and good pricing, but I sure am glad we trusted her. My tuna tartare was good, but everyone else's meal was incredible. Hubs had guacamole and queso. OMG I could have eaten all of his if he'd let me. Mom had pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza and it was SO flavorful. The mushrooms really stood out, which I enjoyed as a mushroom lover. Dad had a thai egg roll type dish that none of us could get enough of. The flavors were fresh and complex.   The server was great and the decor was really beautiful. Neighboring tables were also expressing how much they loved their food. Definitely a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best guac and queso!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartare
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lux decor

Ei2mTcweeFJRik55ZMOMAA.text: We were getting ready to head back to the Bay Area when i got a craving for banana pancakes. We Figured we'd hurry and have breakfast before heading to the airport. So with that said, we had about 2 hours total to be at the terminal ready to board. Once i got Dressed and finished surfing Yelp for a place to get good pancakes we only Had 90 mins. We decided if we didn't Make finish with enough time we'd catch a later flight. Best idea yet cause that gave us enough time to walk over to the Palazzo to try the pancakes. It was nice to Walk right in and be seated. After reviewing the menu fully I was a little bummed at first that there was no banana pancakes on the menu but the waitress assured us that the Lemon Poppyseed were her favorite and were Delicious. It only took one bite to realize that the Lemon Poppyseed pancakes were absolutely delicious and absolutely what i was looking for. The service was great, the setting was great and the food was delicious. I will definitely be back to try the waffles!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our breakfast spread
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Poppyseed pancakes... the best I&#39;ve ever had!!!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Poppy Seed pancakes

41r9k8SGCsI3vjR2uK_sBA.text: Good food that is reasonably priced. My ahi ceviche was very fresh and my husband liked his BLT, he only wished the Cesar salad was more lightly dressed.

rDj778EyefPCS8GfjjidUw.text: I have been coming to lux caffe for about 20 years and every time we visit Las Vegas we go to the grand lux caffe at least twice every visit. And I had a very bad experience of all days on my wife's birthday. Was there for early dinner and was not very busy But we waited for them to clean a booth because We didn't want to sit in the Barr being a special  Occasion . But we waited at least 15 minutes and they would Clean the booth for us so we decided to leave  And will probably be a long time if we even ever Return being that they semi ruined my wife's  Birthday by the way this was at venetian hotel

zdkuhx0rD_HCxi5WcAq6Ig.text: Mediocre elsewhere but great by Vegas standards. Las Vegas food never impresses me (unless we are talking about Michelin star places). This place is good enough for many reasons - 1) large menu so you'll always find something you like, 2) tables are almost always available, 3) they take reservations, 4) prices are quire reasonable, and 5) service doesn't suck as much as other vegas restaurants (I am looking at you Tao).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BVmObu_DJAXYY5WzFgKuGw.text: This place never disappoints every time I come here! I just had French Toast with strawberries and they're hands down, the BEST I've ever had! & I've had a lot of french toast in my time lol While being here, I also saw what looked liked the manager (he was in a long sleeve polo and tie) was helping clean tables and setting them up. I thought that was awesome cause you don't see that often at jobs. Loved it!

Jv8feHtn9kvpFdyinKA2Dw.text: Came here for dinner and sat at the bar. I ordered Roasted Pear and Strawberry Salad. The dressing tasted too vinegary that it almost hurt my mouth at the end. The appetizer bread was warm and soft but nothing special.  French toast was very delicious. Crispy outside and almost creamy inside.   The concierge and bar service was mediocre. Nice vibe and conveniently located for those staying at Venetian.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast take out
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted pear and strawberry salad. Dressing too vinegary. You might want to ask for light dressing.

OM4969JStqpvCth5Zp_AXw.text: Drunk and hungry? My boyfriend came here at 2am after a long night of drinking and clubbing! Upon arriving, we were greeted and seated right away! My boyfriend and I ordered the buffalo hot wings and the double lux cheeseburger ! As you wait for your food, they also give complimentary sour dough bread w/ butter! The buffalo hot wings were REALLY tangy compared to any other wings I've tried but if you dipped it in ranch, it balanced out. The cheeseburger also came with an order of fries! We got it cooked medium rare. It was delicious. Our server was great. Our burger took awhile to come out but he was very attentive and updated us every few minutes as we waited.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double lux cheeseburger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread n buttahhh
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo hot wings

pQYhD07m9xT8y8yJLh1GQQ.text: I wish I could give it 10 stars!  The breakfast buffet is AMAZING and definitely the best breakfast we had during our trip. Initially we didn't want to do any buffets while visiting but when the belly calls, it calls.   The food consists of traditional buffet fare (waffles, hashbrowns, breakfast meats, omelette station, fresh cut fruit, pastries, oatmeal, bagels/toast, perfectly rounded scoops of butter and cream cheese etc.) and I was most surprised by the hashbrowns. I've seen some gross/oily hashbrowns before and these were nothing like that. The potatoes are grated fresh everyday and cooked to tender and crisp perfection. The little waffles have a good crisp to them and their  perfect size helps reduce food waste.   The highlight for me is definitely the omelette and fresh fruit. Loaded with both chopped veggies and fresh greens it was the tastiest I've had in a while. The fresh fruit was vibrant and consisted of a wonderful assortment of berries, melons, grapes, etc.  I saved the best for last: the coffee and OJ. The coffee made me want to get a pot to go. 3 sips were not enough. I didn't ask what type/brand they brew bcz I didn't trust myself to not go on the hunt while the belly is still occupied. I literally snuck a fourth sip (shhhhh) when my coffee nazi wasn't watching. Try it. You won't be disappointed. And OJ is made from fresh squeezed Chilean fukomoto oranges and reminds me of Valencia oranges. It's absolutely delectable.   Great service with a smile and at only $20 per person this is, hands down, the best breakfast on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All three plates belong to me and I regret nothing!

t81SgUJvufN19BsETqYIqQ.text: anytime I come to town this is my first spot I go to no matter what you order on the menu you can't go wrong you have plenty of options from brunch to lunch to dinner the beverages alcoholic or non-alcoholic satisfaction guaranteed

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5nsw2PS8FDUCz1EaLqulvA.text: Grand Lux is a great option if you are near by and they offer many different dishes from breakfast to pizza to Jambalaya. The prices are reasonable, the food is consistently good and the portions are large. Over several visits I've had the Cobb Salad, Pepperoni Pizza, Build your own Omelette, Madeira Chicken & the Lux Club Sandwich . All which I enjoyed.   4 stars because service has always been average. Not terrible but, not great either.   I will be back & I do recommend Grand Lux!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni Pizza
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build Your Own Omelette

rjI5vojTex7k_Qs4ovzL3g.text: This place is awesome, a little pricey, but the freshness of the breakfast is worth it all. I got the classic one basic eggs with toast, bacon simple type of guy, they are fresh as it can be. My girl got the french toast and wow they looked amazing. I don't eat french toast often but I could not help but take a couple bites out of it. It is really fluffy and good. They have a buffet but we chose not to get it because we are not going to eat to much, but it seemed to have a lot of options from the menu that you could've tried it all. I would definitely come back here again.

yjARUZVLlzJgHGIoxTn8zg.text: Chris our waiter was super nice and gave us so much service!! Enjoyed our late night dinner after the show. This is one of the few restaurants that are open later in Palazzo. Most places seem to close at 10:00 PM but this place is open till 2AM or 3AM depending on day.   We ordered a late dinner after watching O. Salmon trio which had three different types of salmon and also poke tacos.   There wasn't that many people at the restaurant so the service was really nice. Overall I liked the many options they had for a late dinner.   Tip- If your trying to figure out a place that is open a little later this is a pretty tasty spot with plenty of food options.   Have fun in Vegas

YDrdCMkg1CoP7I7gg_cHEQ.text: Great food and easy location since it's right in the casino. Really liked the chicken avo salad and took a bite of the biscuits and gravy, which was to die for. Service was very slow and they were definitely understaffed for the lunch hour but good thing we weren't in a rush :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dc0YdtRWd9qlE_HxMgIk7Q.text: Owned by Cheesecake Factory. Steady paced service. Food is great! Love the appetizers like the buffalo spring rolls. Only problem I have with them is that they don't split the bills.. And they can't do partial transactions from card to cash in a total bill.. At this location

YjipkGvPk4cnZYGBv09Zlw.text: Lots of variety to choose from.  I wanted to avoid the burgers, pastas, and heavy dishes.  So I had the Zen noodle bowl.  It was delicious! Service is fast and friendly.   They also had a great dessert menu. Skipped it this time.  Would like to try the butter cake.

urQewIL9Ci0YOOvD8MOeRw.text: Service was good food was good and it's in a convenient location of your attending a show at the Venetian.

Din5km_eUomwy6IA6Vuy1w.text: We have only come for breakfast, but it's always been solid, with one exceptional standout menu item...the beignets! We NEVER leave Vegas without having the "dessert beignets" for breakfast. They are off the charts amazing. The breakfasts are huge, but you can order ala carte items to allow more room for beignets!

pq3a9EpbLj5qJfcUD98T8A.text: I had a pretty good visit at this particular location! I was pleasantly surprised because I generally go to the one that's located inside of the Venetian but little did I know the night I chose to visit the Venetians location they thought it'd be a good idea to have the kitchen being remodeled or something with the ovens I'm not sure I just know we were greeted with hi how many in your party? Oh and by the way we have a limited menu because or stove or something Is wrong so you can't order burgers or anything that goes on the grill? Well then.. That's how I landed at the palazzo location and I'm sure glad I have them a try! It's a more smaller location with the same full menu and great service! I ordered my normal grand lux burger made medium with the fries and clue cheese! I tried the half size calamari dish and it wasn't the best but it was okay enough to write about! I will most definitely return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

UEs5j6el5_TYAdZ4_JdtVw.text: I liked this place... you felt like you were eating higher end food in Vegas. It's pretty packed in here but they still manage to get you in in a reasonable amount of time. It did taste like higher end Cheesecake Factory, though some of the food you could tell was extremely unhealthy from the levels of salt and grease/oil in them.  I ordered the Rachel, a really great pastrami sandwich with coleslaw. The other dishes my party ordered all looked huge but nothing stood out quite like the chicken potpie. Huge chunks of veggies and protein, a perfectly baked crust, and a tasty, creamy inside... what's there not to like?!?  It's a nice place to take a detour from if you want to avoid the buffets for now.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rachel (Pastrami sandwich)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pot Pie
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup and Sandwich Combo (Tortilla Soup and Chicken Salad Sandwich)

OD-9TDYIOdwnLe7ryv3woA.text: Best waffle I've ever had. I got the crab and asparagus omelette and it was really good, but I got a waffle for my kid and I just wanted to eat her breakfast. It was crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. These waffles were not made with you ordinary mix! It's all I can think about today. I may have to go back for the chicken and waffles for dinner...

QGaHsPlBIR7o5LawzO7_Vw.text: Service: Amazing. Food taste: Amazing. Food portion size: Amazing. The Grand Lux Cafe exceeded our expectations in nearly every way. Our waiter was phenomenal - everything that a good waiter should be; he was personal, but not invasive - kind, but not fake - prompt, but not pushy. The food came in a timely manner. It was delicious, and the portion size was enough for two meals. We came in expecting Vegas food - over priced and underwhelming - but, instead, got a superior dining experience. Keep it up, Grand Lux. Keep it up.

wNG7orwJwwwGCxEKP57GEw.text: This is our favorite hotel cafe by far. Actually we do not consider this a cafe at all. It's not your typical cafe menu. The menu is huge and has something for everyone. We live in Vegas, and when we can't decide what to eat we go to Grand Lux. At the Palazzo only...it's just better than the Venetian. Everyhting is great...our favorites include the brie wontons, pot roast fries, Asian short rib tacos, all the salads, especially the manhattan & cobb. The burgers are great, kobe meatballs are fantastic! Truth is, I can't imagine anything not being good. When our family visits they beg us to take us there. Service is always great and Jeremy wrote Happy Birthday to my husband in strawberry syrup on our warm butter cake dessert!   Oh and yes they are owned by the Cheesecake Factory, but that does not mean they are anything alike...as a matter of fact, we strongly dislike the Cheesecake Factory and can't recall having a decent meal there--ever. The food & presentation here at Grand Lux far surpasses the food at Cheesecake Factory.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. love ordering ftapas &amp; small plates. Here we have Brie wontons, Asian short rib tacos, volcano shrimp &amp; BBQ pork sliders.

CblFoKEfIV9U-caBXlebyw.text: The Grand Lux Cafe at the Palazzo is one of our favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  It doesn't get nearly as busy and crowded as the Venetian location.  The smoke from the casino is not nearly as bothersome as compared to the Venetian.    All the food we've tried there are very yummy!  My favorite tapas are the Asian Short Rib Tacos and the BBQ Pork Sliders.  The Grand Lux burger melt and avocado chipotle cheeseburger are delicious!  There are other dishes on the menu that we've had, and we have never been disappointed with any of the choices.   Make sure to save room for dessert.  Our favorite is the New Orleans beignets which comes with three different dipping sauces (chocolate, vanilla, and raspberry).  Order the beignets when you give your entree order cause it takes about 30 minutes to make the beignets.  They are a bit pricey, but worth it and the staff is usually good also.  We will keep coming back here everytime we visit Vegas.

ZFiT1UTktIQe3gDfFuEGUg.text: Great food most of the time. Service is usually fairly good.

txxbUnfiiy0ffuZig4S3uA.text: Visited for breakfast. Krysina A. was full of energy and extremely interactive. A plus when servers r usually robotic and task oriented. Loved her personality. Coffee was good and hot. Hash browns crispy. Bacon crispy.  We ordered at the table.

hZQq-UW7adGIswbmUpaM_A.text: Dined here once during our stay Memorial Weekend. Husband and I shared the chicken enchiladas and it wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. Didn't help that our server had a boogie in her nose, either. My daughter had their bacon cheeseburger and she said it was ok, but a regular burger is just a burger, am I right? I'd go back to try their breakfast/brunch items and I'll save dinner for another location.   Tip to servers: Make sure you are presentable because I don't want to see your dirty finger nails or snot right before I stuff my face, thank you very much.

kacfN0G030HaebAWONdzAg.text: Went here for lunch and had a great experience! Each lunch item was around $10 which is cheap for Vegas! Sat in the bar area and had a very nice waitress. Chicken parmesan was really good! We were both happy and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch chicken Parmesan
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Blt &amp; soup

q-eD1LxHcSwbq0SYiJSHAg.text: This is the Venetian/Palazzo version of the Cheesecake Factory. The menus and style are almost exactly the same. I had the Delux Patty Melt at lunch once over the weekend and later I had the gnocchi for dinner. Both were satisfactory. Exactly what you would expect, nothing amazing, but totally great for a quick, no-nonsense meal.

u0RB23rth5BoEmtNy5FaGg.text: This is a very nice breakfast place; the decor is so European look. This place is clean and airy. I have scramble egg and hot coffee for my breakfast which are pretty good. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful decor

TpksozmKQkWkECfgN_Rb-g.text: Grand Lux Cafe is great if..  ...your group doesn't want to eat buffet but can't decide on what type of cuisine - Grand Lux has it all (their menu is insanely extensive) ...you don't want to step out of the casino for grub ...you want to confuse people (2 Grand Lux Cafe..same name, same appearance, same menu - but there is one in Palazzo, and one in Venetian. Make sure you designate which hotel you are eating at). The one in Venetian is open 24 hrs.   Grand Lux Cafe is good, simple and has something for everyone.  p.s. I read that they are closing the Grand Lux Cafe in Los Angeles.

PbiVDOic3RN_Zm3TOmoxvg.text: Decent food, and decent service.  After staying at the palazzo, and eating here 3x during our stay, we noticed a consistent lengthy wait time to get food after ordering... Each time taking well over 50 minutes to an hour. I could understand food taking that long during busy hours... But even when its not busy?!   Even the server kept apologizing for the wait... So 2 stars for her and decent food.  Why should it take 50 minutes to cook eggs?

_C8oXYMIfCqA1Mnm18wkWg.text: My favorite place to eat breakfast in Vegas! The freshly squeezed orange juice is out of this world! They also have a breakfast buffet on the weekends. I have yet to order anything that wasn't great. It is a little pricey but totally worth it and the service is amazing, so I don't mind paying a little more for great service.

BYy6sdoLgXf1euYyKrEbkQ.text: This place is a MUST try! Absolutely the bomb! They are part of the Cheesecake factory company. So I knew the food would be good. Well its amazing. From appetizers to their other menu of food is so good. We have never had a problem with the food or service here. Everything is so flavorful and a treat to have. We enjoy eating here, The prices are not bad either. I was thinking it would be really expensive and it is not.. This is a must try for your trip to Vegas. It really is top notch and very enjoyable!

nLtlP_Yp3615_wU-vSlo0g.text: This place was always packed and leaving from that horrible first dinner at Pho at the Coffee Shop at Treasure Island, we decided to chow down here.   Because the portion was huge and we were thinking of having a late dinner (try different restaurants and foods), we though we'd share a plate of spaghetti. We selected the Sunday Night pasta which included pieceso f braised beef and mushrooms (god, I LURRRVE mushrooms!). The appearance didn't look appealing but it actually tasted really good! :)   A must-try when in Vegas! I give it 3.5 out of 5 stars.

B6vrfTziskLkMHX5R2D3mA.text: Yes I know it's a chain, which is a 4-letter word around here, but I have always had a great experience at the Grand Lux.  The service is always EXCELLENT -- very fast and friendly and professional.  And every dish I've tried has been delicious.  Huge portions, too.  My favorite is the Caramel Chicken.  Get over the fact that it's a chain restaurant and try it!  You'll like it!  It can be a little loud, if you're trying to have a deep conversation, and it can definitely be a bit pricey... but you're down on the Strip. What do you expect?

AFFeuHxPHn5Y1Nd8JyI26w.text: Nothing more than okay, and prices weren't too wallet friendly. Skip the breakfast buffet

Z8DgUMUN5oxoiq7RCkvZ3Q.text: This restaurant is delicious, and so different from other in-hotel restaurants by the fact that it doesn't suck!   We had wonderful food and great service. It was seriously refreshing.   I've been there late night after the club, and in the morning for breakfast, and have always been impressed. It's amazing how there is such variety on the menu, and it all tastes so good!

zX5P7Jh4v34_aYfir6zkMw.text: A huge menu, open all the time, large portions, and plenty of seating. What more can you ask for. How about good food? A menu this large there is always going to be hit and miss items. For the most part what I have had here is pretty good. Nothing spectacular. But if you don't know what you want go here because they have just about everything. The location is nice if you attending any shows or conventions in the building.

N9k6DTHw66FaxCQt0U1NSg.text: I went here two times in the past couple of months, and I just adore it. It definitely feels like Cheesecake Factory, but the food, atmosphere and service are far superior.   The first time, I split a penne pasta dish with my best friend. It was tasty--excellent recipe. The second time, I split the mushroom burger with my mom. Even better. They combined four types of mushrooms and made a veggie patty out of it. It was a little messy, but totally worth it. We also enjoyed a fruit smoothie, which was fancy and delicious.  Notice a pattern? The portions are pretty generous, so you might want to split an entree if you don't want to take leftovers home. The hostesses and servers are very professional.   Love it! Will be back.

Yhb6erFSRvRvc43DTNCQrQ.text: $17 for a hot buffet breakfast of made to order omelets (or fluffy scrambled eggs), grilled sausages, crispy bacon, roasted potatoes, various decadent pastries, cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit and unlimited orange juice/coffee/tea?   Yes, plox.  If you're not a fan of omelets or scrambled eggs, they have an extensive breakfast menu as well. Still have yet to try their lunch and dinner menu, tho.

H3T9AD0G23n3n0xQAKpAUw.text: I seriously hate chain restaurants. I hate Cheesecake Factory the most. I knew this was an affiliate...But my friend (who is a very picky/simple eater) wouldn't go with us to any restuarant unless he recognized the name--note to self: don't let plain/picky eaters choose the restaurant... I knew it was going to be bad but I endulged him. YUCK! I couldn't finish a quarter of what I ordered.   My friend (the plain eater)ordered a club sandwich and fries.  My other friend (she shares my sentiments) ordered the Steak with Sweet potatoes.  I ordered the Chicken and Waffles (per a fellow Yelper's recommendation and the fact that I thought this is an easy meal to make).   My friend's $34 steak was so gross. Dry, fatty and tough.  My chicken was breaded chicken tenders. I had one. Gross. The waffle was average and served with sprinkled pecans but something I feel could have been cooked up at IHOP.   My other friend thought it was great. He also only eats at Fast Food restuarants and American food only.  The only upside: Our cute waiter Rudy Morales. Really nice. He was an MMA fighter and talked about his training, etc. Cool guy.

P6jElVYV_CIhUHgt_utp_g.text: Bad attitude server who snaps when ask for coffee refill.  Food order all wrong!  Husband ate by himself while I wait for correctly cooked food.  Poor service!

gyvxabKj7R__dFdqwghIXw.text: Good food, but for Las Vegas you can do much better. Encore's The Society Cafe is much better at the same price. My wife is a connoisseur of hollandaise sauce and theirs clearly was a big negative. A few other dishes, like the Huevos Rancheros was really good, but other dishes brought this down to a 3.

HX-xKrTVVdiMZqc2Nrg41w.text: Came after clubbing at XS. Ordered the Avocado-Chipotle Burger Big Portions/Good Price/Good Price Food: BOMB Theres two, the ones thats like 24-hours is at the Palazzo  Too bad I puked it all out five minutes after I was done... 4.5 stars!

iW6YSCu3YVI-SNPNi0I-xg.text: Hmmm..............free food? Yes please! Well, technically I lost more on the table then what I was actually comped, but still it was free.   Starter dish was a HUGE plate of chicken spring roll which was loosely wrapped, but the texture of the rice wrapper they used kept everything together. Moving onto entrees we ordered the chicken and braised short rib combination, spaghettini with clams, house chicken salad and the lasagna.   #1 chicken was good, but braised short rib was a little too salty to my liking! (surprisingly) #2 Spaghettini with clams was best bang for the bucks! Little bit of noodles and CRAP load of clams #3 house chicken salad was drenched in dressing, not a big fan.  #4 Lasagna........?????? must of been good because my boy ate every last bite of it without sharing!   I would say it's above average as far as cafe food would go.

b3Hp1880Q45adHqpujlOEQ.text: Haven't been here since 2008 but I remember the pasta carbonara being amazing.  Considering it has been 6 years since, it goes to tell how good meals can loom in the memory.

hw_D9wED1eUiLqawH-5hrQ.text: i rated this Grand Lux a 1 star because the service is horrible! The waiter was just okay as far as serving.. the thing that got me was he SOLICITED TIP to my party. JUST BECAUSE WE WERE ASIANS he probably thought we didnt know how to tip! hello we grew up here buddy we do know how to tip!.. But overall i love the food just a horrible waiter! 5 star on the food, hopefully youll get lucky on getting a good waiter!

qipJSa_x4WyZ__5gwdR5GQ.text: So you've got a picky party with you that just can't decide on what they want for dinner.  One doesn't like Thai, one JUST HAD a burger and CAN'T STAND it again, and then there's the guy who just sort of is grunting.  Where do you take this band of misfits before your stomach digests itself?   The Grand Lux Cafe has a very diverse menu that doesn't skimp on portions or deliciousness.   They have some amusing appetizers that taste great even if they sound like a weird idea (Asian Nachos!) and child-friendly favorites.    In short, it's the place to be when you can't decide what to do -- except eat a lot!

o6G_tRKbKTxj-bb-CcusQg.text: One of my favorite places to go to when visiting Las Vegas. I like going here late night for a great burger or the Buffalo Chicken sandwich which is a delight. The service has always been good and the taste is good too. They are open 24/7 so you can enjoy them anytime... The breakfast buffet is nothing special so you are better off just ordering an item from the menu in my opinion

jmaN_bBq1fztMadSGMO68A.text: like others have said, this place has a CPK kind of vib and menu. Unfortunately it came of more of the lack-luster cafe that every casino has.   Service was good, not great. We did seem to wait longer than we should for just about everything and the helps attitude wasn't perky, more along the lines of doing their job. We visited midday and they weren't that busy.   Food was good and creative enough but nothing I can really remember.

mW0jCYnGuIj_AvT8iwu6mQ.text: Oh my goodness, I dont even know where to start with this place. I worked in the Palazzo so Grand Luxe was visited frequently by me and the girls I worked with.   I have to say I've tried many of the items on the menu. For me, the appitizers are where it's at. The cheesesteak eggrolls are amazing! So are the Asian Nachos and Calamari. Hands down best calamari I've had anywhere. The batter is really light and this fish is so fresh!   Pretty much, anything you get is good. The pizza, burgers, main dishes are all amazing. I hate saying that this place is connected to Cheesecake Factory because cheesecake factory is so hit and miss, on the other hand I was never unsatisfied with Grand Luxe unless they forgot my ranch or something like that when ordering it to go! I will miss this place more than anything about my previous job!

5nqQjIhjl85sQ8qiGKifow.text: Pros:  1. Fast and quality service. We were seated immediately, and our waiter was freaking awesome. He was attentive, friendly and even packed up all our food when we decided we wanted to finish it in our room in our PJs. The Sunday Night Pasta wasn't on the late night menu, but when he realized how much my friend had been looking forward to it, he asked the chef to make it. That's great service.   2. Food. I ordered the Sunday Night Pasta to share with a friend. Short rib meat with a delish marina and mushrooms. Pasta was perfect and short rib meat was PHENOMENAL.

D0Mjxqzox_xJGb65-wydMw.text: This place is not too far from the guest rooms & this cafe has some tables and chairs to enjoy whatever you order. I got the iced blended mocha. Didn't expect it to be this good, so it was worth it! Prices are decent.

vTNOih7fzcUr10NhfoOIBA.text: The upside of having an insanely large menu is that there exists a choice of smaller bites. On this particular occasion, my friend was having dinner, and I just wished to have a small bite. I had the duck wontons, and they were a nice snack, without the typical huge price tag of a restaurant on the strip. I can see the appeal of this place, for sure.

5AenUmkr8mkgaNEUTVGbwA.text: Food is fine. Was handed a scorching hot plate that burned me pretty good. So that was not fun. Have you ever been burned? It hurts. Makes your burger not taste as good.

kKf9tnwvzM0bzRBOrYQ5Ig.text: My wife and I have consistently gone here with every Vegas trip.  Unfortunately, this is the first time I really have anything negative to say.  The chicken pot pie my wife received was poured very lightly.  It came with about half the food quantity that we are used to which, given the lightness of the sauce, significantly reduced the flavor quality of the dish as well.  My wife is bi-lingual and therefore understands English and Spanish.  Our waitress didn't think anyone around her spoke Spanish and used that opportunity while standing near us to complain to another waitress on staff that she was just going to do as little as possible so she could go home sooner rather than later.  While I do understand that people are tired, it's still a job that you are expected to perform.  Because of this attitude she had, we experienced poor service all around.  At one point we had to ask someone else to check on our food because we hadn't seen our waitress in more than 30 minutes.

uhh8rU5IMVD0qydn9Whh1w.text: I love the Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian. It's open 24 hours and their service is really great for as crowded and busy as it gets!!  This Grand Lux Cafe is fair. Took them a while to take our drinks, took them even longer to bring our drinks (water) and even LONGER to bring us bread. It was also my friend's birthday and I asked the waitress to do something for her, she said she would and never did. What a DRAG.  The ahi ceviche was pretty good except there wasn't much tuna in it. And what looked like tuna was actually tomato. My friend said the short ribs weren't too good either. This time around just wasn't the best experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib taco
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi ceviche

nQKPoX3kShTq_vn7T7pUaw.text: Another time, another place, I would have relentlessly made fun of anyone who wanted to dine at a high-end Cheesecake Factory while in the dining cornucopia that is Vegas, especially twice during a 3-day trip.  However.  When you're coming off a near-brawl on a redeye from Honolulu, an overload of coffee, the coldest conference room conditions known to man and a projectile-vomiting-traveling companion you just want something comforting and predictable. The thing about Cheesecake and Grand Lux is that it's consistently good. Is it going to be great? No. But it's almost certainly not going to be bad. My breakfast was good. My pizza was good. My fruity smoothie fizz drink thing was good. The service was good.  Good enough is good enough.

7b8y4bYVc7r-BQyjQK3whg.text: This place is elegant and the food was great, very hearty servings and service was prompt.

1V7xBD7KZKL5M2md3XRJSg.text: Ya, it's expensive.  But it's right by the room elevators at the Palazzo and perfect for when you just want to order some food and bring it back to your room so your hungover friends can become alive again.  Without going into too much details -- it's Cheesecake Factory but named "Grand Lux Cafe".  Looking at the grand scheme of things, it's not really worth it.  Unless you get the corned beef hash.  Corned beef hash is the only thing worth giving it more than 3 stars.  Everything else is average at best.  But I DREAM about their corned beef hash.  I order that at other places and pray that it'll be just as good but usually it isn't.  It makes me sad.  Yes.  That really is all I have to say about that.

rK0E0UomFZVTeK5y2Uaj5A.text: If you're wandering through the Venetian, and grow hungry, this is a nice choice for dining at a reasonable price.  While marching through on the way to an expo nearby, I'd stopped in here for an impromptu lunch. The waiter was quick and helpful and my chicken fettucini alfredo appeared soon after ordering. Almost too quick....  But it was tasty and the portions were large. Enough that I didn't need to eat dinner that night. And the price for this gargantuan portion was in the range of $13.   The menu appears expansive and the place is open until 2/3 am (and opens in the morning at 6). If I was staying at the Venetian, I'd see no need to eat anywhere else.

Tad2NdYvXbm259oAvh0zIg.text: Grand Lux is ideal for big groups since the menu is all over the place.  Everyone will find something to order no matter what they are craving.  Just like at its sister company Cheesecake Factory, I stick to burgers, sandwiches, and salads.  Who wants to order a pizza or an Asian dish from a restaurant that doesn't specialize in those things?  Normally I'd give this place 3 or 3.5 stars, but the Vegas locations get 2 stars due to one thing- the portion sizes.  I have a big appetite, and I can't even finish a sandwich there.  That is okay when you're at home and can take the food back home.  But nobody in Vegas is taking these leftovers back to their hotel room, so a ton of food (and your money) is wasted.

9K3Wrq4uJPvjSk87SXfB5A.text: Went to the Grand Lux Cafe while at the Palazzo. It's owned by the Cheesecake Factory - so the decor and menu are similar.   Ordered the club sandwich - it was good. Fries were good too. But our waiter was slow and forgetful. He couldn't keep our drinks full, and we asked the dude for bread at least four times.  Was a cool spot for lunch, food was a four, service a 2.5. Overall grade - 3.5 stars.

Utz3F3VqN96rPI7C1zgDyw.text: Pros: food is great, price is fair, and atmosphere is the best  Cons: long wait, busy but slow service  Another thought, there is another one right by the Venetian, will try that one

_Lspbj19cVrH0EzdYcOVvA.text: I just LOVE this place... I remember the very first time I ate here.... it was very good.  The last three times I stayed @ Palazzo, me and my family basically ate @ Grand Lux Cafe every meal (we were there for 3 or 4 days.)  This place has been consistent with their service, taste/presentation of food, and price.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan farm egg
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken piccata
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken piccata

APOdM4a3dScBMWj8pe959w.text: this place is so yummy ...the wait to get seated seemed a bit long but I felt like it was worth the wait, we got seated and were greeted by a very nice and talkative waiter really enjoyable. we were brought out hot hot okff right off the stove, I ordered some egg rolls and some pasta both delicious. I loved it for late night munchies ate here at about 2am...definitely going back here again when I make another trip out to Vegas :)

jJus09VJUWEFLpzKsPflFQ.text: Grand lux, I will always associate you with vegas.  The past 2 times I've been in vegas, we always stopped here because it was in our hotel. Huge portions, think Cheesecake factory.  I don't even recall the food I ordered, just remembered craving in the late night.  It's opened much later than the other restaurants in the hotel and seating is a breeze.

sggId-E-G8FFL1wFtgNTzA.text: The gand lux breakfast sandwich was ok.  The scrambled egg was very light (not enough yoke) - seems like i got the egg white option which i did not ask for.  Still good nonetheless.  Good portion and a decent quick hearty breakfast before heading to the pool.

1SOw59Jk3v8WuHvcye4pqQ.text: In a sea of gourmet restaurants sometimes you want something ordinary. For a cafe, it's not bad. We just wanted something "normal" for a late lunch. Alot of places weren't even open yet, many others had a limited lunch menu. It was Sunday with football games on so, alot of the bar type places were packed. It really reminded me of Cheesecake Factory. Lots of menu choices. Staff was nice. I got Fried Chicken with Mashed Potatoes, it wasn't greasy, but it was a bit salty, I've had better, I've had worse. The potatoes were a bit bland, but my salty chicken helped even things out. I ordered a Pear Martini and they were out of the ingredients, so I had a delicious Strawberry Martini. My husband got a Cheeseburger and fries, the fries were good, I didn't try the burger but it looked good, he devoured it, and said it was better than he expected. I would eat here again if in a pinch, but with so many better restaurants in walking distance, it's doubtful.

ZmmS2-GXRzhLTjx695LYww.text: My hubby and I went here and ordered the buffalo chicken balls app, chicken parmesan, turkey and brie wrap and skillet mac and cheese (ok).  The portions are large for the price.  Its Vegas lol.  We also ordered breakfast one morning from our room at the Palazzo (check my review), and picked it up.  We had caramel pancakes and a omelet.  Very scrumptious food.  They have a limited menu for late night after party snackin as well.  As you can tell we enjoyed it. I like it better than Cheesecake Factory, their sister restaurant.  One star lost for price...I know...its Vegas!

Yki3fytjcCSwT82VZGTOhw.text: Fantastic!  We had to try real hard to not eat all our meals here. It is conveniently located right by the room elevators of the palazzo. They have a breakfast buffet for about $15 until about 11 am.  The best part is the unlimited fresh squeezed orange juice, I have never had better juice in my life. The buffet includes an omelet station , and the usual scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon and an assortment of breads, pastries and fruit.  Excellent value for money.   This is a part of the cheesecake factory group and they share the same ambience , menu etc.  They are open late until about 1 am and the grand lux at the Venetian is open even later .  I will be back,

n-I-17s3ZSxykw6Q4reoUA.text: I had the buffalo chicken roll which is good. I think I like the cheesecake factory buffalo chicken wrap version better in the crispy wonton square pastry. The duck dumplings were alright. It could be any type of dumpling it tastes really soft and just like a normal dumpling nothing to special to make it stand out as duck. Their bread was terrible. It had the taste of plastic - not that it was chewy I really mean the flavor of it was plastic rather than bread. Really weird.  I have to give a shout out to the chocolate chip cookies in the bakery! Sooo freakin good. Best cookies EVER! no freakin joke I would just go back to get the cookies. They make bomb ass cookies there.

t3XlaqluCYT0r95InRPHqQ.text: I made a reservation for brunch for 14 people one month in advance of my birthday. We showed up on time (actually 5 minutes early) but when they seated it us, it was at two large back to back booths. Meaning we were separated and couldn't even converse with half the group. When I asked to be moved to a different contiguous long table, they said they didn't have one for us. There was a long booth and chairs to the right of us that could have easily sat 14 but they had seated a party of two right in the middle of the row of tables! I asked them why couldn't we have gotten that long space (and why didn't they save it for us since they knew I was coming and had a res). They said making a reservation doesn't guarantee you all sit together. But that really doesn't make any sense!
