Why would I make a reservation one month in advance for 14 people if I didn't want to secure a table that could accommodate the whole group?! And if that was the restaurant policy, then they should have informed me of that when I booked because that might have changed my decision to have my birthday brunch there. I didn't find the management not staff to be very friendly or helpful. Food was decent but not worth the less than ideal seating arrangement despite my advance planning.

3-7vu8yBou3zGGauf9lCoA.text: I have to admit that I had no idea that this restaurant was a sister to the Cheesecake Factory. So basically, that's exactly what you are getting. I came here after accepting a dinner invitation for a business dinner, but this isn't something I would have chosen myself. The food isn't bad, it's just mediocre Cheesecake Factory food, and there are far better options on the Vegas Strip.

FntSDCFQTc7OqUTSAyY9ww.text: Decoration reminds me of Cheesecake Factory. Turns out, it was inspired by it.   The service was a little on the short side. She wasn't pleasant just wanted to take our order and leave.    Best Eggs Benedict I've ever had. With mushrooms and bacon. Topped that off with fresh squeezed orange juice and my breakfast was amazing.   The hollandaise sauce was sooooo good.  My sister split my plate with me and she returned and got the same thing the next morning. And she was also in town the following week and got it again, it's that good.   I would definitely return when I'm in the area again.   They also have a $20 breakfast buffet that's good. Not a full on buffet but like a continental breakfast on steroids.

kd7BsvoHjzMMzw8WF4pkyg.text: Located in The Palazzo, Grand Lux Cafe is a must try!! Great variety of food and drinks that kept us coming back again and again. Portions are large, and surprisingly inexpensive. Loved both the Cucumber Mint Lemonade and the Vanilla Honey Latte. French Toast, Chicken & Waffles, Carbonara..... Every dish was absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So GOOD!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty Carbonara
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A different, but delicious take on Strawberry French Toast--center is more of a &#34;custardy&#34;y than &#34;bread&#34; texture. Mmmmm!

mJd4DL9t_IDITjH7Du5a5A.text: 4.5 STARS  The Grand Lux Cafe is the go-to place to eat for people staying in the Palazzo hotel. I've come here plenty of times and knew that it reminded me of a restaurant; it wasn't until this last trip that I realized it was the Cheesecake Factory. Apparently the two chains are "sisters" so if you are a fan of The Cheesecake Factory you will most likely enjoy the Grand Lux Cafe.    I ordered the pastrami burger and it was solid. The pastrami was cooked perfectly and the bread wasn't cooked until it was burnt. After eating at the Bachanal Buffet the night before, I was in the mood for something light, and although this burger was on the heavier side, I was still really satisfied.  The waiter we had was really personable, and Las Vegas is all about feeling like you're on vacation and I definitely felt relaxed here.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Burger

nRTWPKkAAhBcxJS61WjACQ.text: This is always our breakfast joint in Las Vegas... good selection that is always tasty and service has always been great for us.  Our preference is going to sit at the bar.

IcKeqwnB8IjJt9AsVAKbOg.text: This Grand Lux Cafe in the Palazzo is the same as their twin restaurant in the Venetian hotel next door. It is equivalent to a Cheesecake Factory to me.   I ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was good! Their batter was very crunchy and crispy. You can taste the shrimp and the dried squid rings.  The 3 way salmon I ordered came with mushrooms, mash potatoes, asparagus, and three different sauces-it was all delicious but the mash potatoes were okay.  The indo-China meal was my families favorite. It was brown rice and marinated chicken that had an Indonesian scent, pineapple and herby. It was comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indo-China chicken with brown rice
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon 3 ways style
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

3UMM_6lx7M08hRwG6fF5pg.text: When in Vegas, I always make a trip to Grand Lux and only eat one thing of theirs: the Zen Noodles.   Yes it's totally a rip off ($15) spin of "pho" and also pretty white washed version of pho. But I like it! The broth is lemongrass flavored (not beef) and they use chicken. You add bean sprouts and spinach and ask for sriracha and you just made yourself a healthy pho! The broth is sour so don't expect a beef flavored. And you don't really need sriracha but I love it spicy. It's a really good spin on pho. My GFs and I always get this late at night! Since grand Lux is open 24 hours, we eat here after clubbing.   You don't know how many times zen noodles saved me from a nasty hangover!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zen noodles
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zen noodles
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary $10

w9q45_AwKIVjc5p7iVORjw.text: Great food and awesome prices. Probably the best breakfast in Vegas and most affordable. They have a huge menu and I haven't asked them for anything, they didn't have. Eat here!

uoVjMK0kbfO61TdaVGau2g.text: Just wanted to give a shout out to our server - Alex! He was prompt with his service and was very friendly and attentive. Alex recommended his favorite dishes and we took a chance due to his confidence in suggestions. We got the buffalo egg rolls(mouth watering), steak and eggs (perfectly cooked) and the teriyaki beef and rice dinner (very flavorful). We had not waited long and Alex offered fries and bread while we waited for our meals and that was something we really appreciated. All around wonderful experience and thank you Alex! I wish I could write more about our superb experience! Definitely a place we'd go back to!!

6Esv_JdyeT7uzzx10WxQTw.text: Food: 3.0/5.0 Service: 3.0/5.0 Value: 4.0/5.0 Decor: 3.0/5.0 Overall: 3.0/5.0   I'm a fan of the CAKE enterprise and this spot delivers.  I wouldn't prioritize a trip in the daytime but it's a great option if you're close by and it's in the wee hours.

9w-SjIpsEv6fnHamuD-L0Q.text: There used to be a Grand Lux in Beverly Hills but they closed down so I have to hit up the ones Vegas to get my fix. My family and I were wandering around looking for a place to eat when we came upon the Grand Lux.  They are a sister restaurant to the Cheesecake Factory so you know the menu is extensive.   After the old folks poured over the menu we all decided on something. We ordered a variety of items including soups, salads and sandwiches. I ordered their quesadilla which was excellent and a cucumber lemonade which was over the top delicious.  Everyone enjoyed their food and we ordered beignets for dessert...which in my opinion is reason enough to come here. They were absolutely delicious and came with three dipping sauces.    The service was good and I would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious quesadilla

BibpJ_M8NBcN3ZgFL_6dOA.text: The Grand Lux has it down. There menu has almost anything you could ask for. wWhats really impressive is they make it well. My wife & I stopped in for a late lunch & the following morning for breakfast. We both had salads that were both tasty & almost to big. Service is also first rate. Servers are knowledgeable about the food & suggestions.

j70lXNECUFB6m0EQ5Nn51A.text: Worst cafe! Our food took 30 mins, never saw our server to refill our drinks. Finally get the food and it's cold and then the server has an attitude with my poor mother. Drinks weren't made right. This place is shit! Servers are a bunch of bitches and the food takes forever. Don't bother with this place.

o3ItfP4TvX-0J3ia4pwwsg.text: Reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory. Bread and butter is served before your meal. I had the grilled cheese with prime rib. It was super GREASY. Drenched in oil. Dripping in oil actually. The food was cold because they took 45 minutes to bring it out. And it was onions overload. I had two bites and didn't finish the rest. I don't know if anything else was good or not...

zyvAwj9YFp2vRG-qJeuoIQ.text: I felt bamboozled that this place had good ratings. I got so excited to eat here because it had such good reviews at both of their locations (Palazzo and Venetian).   We ate at the Palazzo location thinking that the food would be amazing..but we were completely wrong. After looking at the pictures that were posted by Yelpers, I figured I couldnt go wrong with ordering their Salmom 3 ways, while my other friends ordered the beef wellington, jambalaya, steak sandwich with fries, and the asian lettuce wraps as an appetizer.   First dish that came out was the lettuce wraps. Maybe I had such high expectations because the Cheesecake Factory lettuce wraps are pretty darn good. BUT GODDAMN.. they served the chicken lettuce wraps in a luke warm dish that seemed microwaved and for dipping sauces was hoison sauce and MUSTARD. I never felt so offended in my life over an asian dish, but holy crap. Mustard for my lettuce wraps? Thats like eating spring rolls and dipping it into mustard sauce. I was so shocked and disgusted that I couldnt even touch it anymore. So forewarning, DO NOT GET THE LETTUCE WRAPS.   The salmon 3 ways was lukewarm as well and my friends jambalaya wasnt even hot. The steak sandwich was mediocre and the fries were literally the only thing they did right. My friend liked her beef wellington, which comes in 4 small pieces of cubed steak inside little small puff pastries. I guess that was cute, but that doesnt forgive on how bad 4/5 dishes were horrible.   Maybe we ordered the wrong thing? I honestly dont know..   PORTIONS ARE BIG THO.. but Im more of a quality of quantity kind of girl.   + One star for the waitress being semi-attentive and friendly.

Y9rXU_xzkR1hdDU1iEaoaA.text: We ate there twice and the food was excellent. Considering it's the Vegas strip the prices were very reasonable as well. The Menu was loaded and had a bit of everything. The staff was hit and miss but again it's Vegas. If you're staying at the Palazzo and want something quick but good this is the place.

VoA1tToEM19TapyWVpNopQ.text: I've been to the Grand Lux a couple of times in the past with my family and they generally favor the place as a good breakfast option. I stopped by Grand Lux with my girlfriend today on our way to Arizona for breakfast. Having been here before, it was a reliable choice for good breakfast food. I ordered the bacon and mushroom eggs Benedict as I wanted to try something different other than the typical English Benedict. The poached eggs were laid over thick-cut, crisp bacon, which were served over slices of toast I believe, as opposed to English muffin. Served on the side was a big slab of crispy hash-brown.   The hollandaise was just as good as I remembered: rich, creamy, and also earthy from the mushrooms. Overall, I liked the dish. It definitely got me full which was a plus since I was afraid two poached eggs over bacon wouldn't fill me up with my appetite. Although, there were negatives. The thick crispy bacon made it very clumsy to cut with fork and knife. I ended up destroying both of the benedict's structure. The eggs were not as runny as I hoped they would be and were slightly overcooked. The service we received was nothing special; he didn't bother checking up on us and we had to wait quite a while before our orders were taken.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and mushroom eggs benedict

VqSogldMU02onuO2E7xGJw.text: Best lemon chicken piccata I ever had. The chicken melted in your mouth and the seasoning was perfect. I had a large glass of white wine with it that paired well. The service was great, and very attentive.

n0Ft8rtV43i4Z6etQ1zMUA.text: Horrible I ordered a house salad. I was with a party of four,. How is my salad the last item on the table AND it was wrong. 10 minutes later no replacement still. Everyone at the table is eating me. Cancelled the salad . Will never ever ever be Back. It's plays cost too much money for horrible service

JXmDVAQpcfeDLS1CfG2ODA.text: Despite the 4 stars, which is why we decided to try this place, my husband and I were highly disappointed with their breakfast. I ordered the supposedly "best eggs Benedict" and my husband ordered the breakfast sandwich, both of which were bland. The hollandaise sauce on my eggs Benedict had absolutely no flavor. The only thing I liked were the hash browns. My husband didn't really like his breakfast sandwich and his hash browns were only crispy on one side. Grrr found the eggs on his breakfast sandwich bland as well. Overall, not a place I would revisit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior by the bar

E9X1J5p6_UD9ySXKEMACKw.text: Really surprised I hadn't done a review for this place yet considering I've been there a bazillion times.  I absolutely love the food and the location.  This restaurant just oozes luxury.  Our favorite thing here is the Asian nachos.  They are out of this world with a good peanuty / wasabi flavor.  Everything else we've had here has been delicious, and the service superb, including the chicken and waffles.    We've had breakfast also and have no complaints.  If you are staying at the Venetian, this is a great place to go.  If you aren't staying at the Venetian, it's still a great place to go.  Go there.

3jIC8BkFUWZN8UOBU5Oehw.text: Omg! What can I say?!! Everything was so good! The complimentary bread was FRESH! Rib eye steak was delicious!! Fries were fresh and Hot! Literally everything was perfect! And the server Jennifer; such an amazing sweet person!!

U-UpZ6JrKKC9r6nV3I6-Ng.text: Nice Feeding Spot In Vegas!   I really like the Grand Lux Cafe, it may in fact be my preferred spot for breakfast or lunch in Vegas.   4.25 stars for The Chicken Jambalaya, as it is pretty tasty, a good portion and leaves you ready for more walking around, or hanging out by the pool.   Chicken and waffles are a solid 4 out of 5 stars as well.   Don't go here for orange juice though, it's like $7 and even thought its fresh it is crazy expensive!   Nice Italian style place. Cozy spot to eat and talk with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Jambalaya With Brown Rice
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles

7lgkSbIyxlLRujJrEzqTvQ.text: Great place to eat but beware breakfast is not served all day.  Initially seated at a table for 2 but way too close to others already seated in the same section, had to asked to me moved to a booth.  Our waitress was helpful and professional friendly.  Food was good but wish they served breakfast all day.  Definitely a place to try out when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham on the side...FYI 2 can share.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambled eggs with bacon and hash browns breakfast
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white omelette with ham, peppers, tomatoes, asparagus and harvarti cheese.

CHfCvs13U5TC0vCoZApI6g.text: Every year I come to Vegas, these chocolate chip cookies are a MUST!! Freshly baked, worth the wait (~25 minutes). Best cookies in Vegas. You get a dozen fresh out the oven for less than $10!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshly baked Chocolate chip cookies

NAo7ZPkgrQ53bZUCpRnXeQ.text: Review is for the PALAZZO location.  Grand Lux is conveniently locqtioned at the bottom of Palazzo in the casino floor open 24 hours. Food is similar to Cheesecake Factory so what you'd expect: big portions, decent food but nothing truly amazing or groundbreaking. A good standby when you are hungover or need something late.  We dropped by here before a show for a quick bite in the bar. The bartender never offered our group bread, he also rang in an order wrong for one gal in our group. He never once apologized and instead said I rang in the wrong thing so your food should be out soon. It took 20 minutes after all of everyone else's food arrived to be remade. As a server, I believe she should have been comped her meal. Especially since she had to box up the entire thing since we were all finished eating.  My second visit here was for take-out. I came in 15 minutes after I ordered and paid. I went to the side and waited 30 minutes longer, so I went over to the counter to make sure my food wasn't ready. The guy working the register just looked at me and looked away. So I waited another 15 minutes, and I went back and asked him. Turns out my food had been sitting there, ready, for who knows how long. He completely forgot I was even there waiting and I had already paid. When I got back to my room, the food was cold. Ugh.  In my opinion these two negative experiences could have been avoided with just simply better training and support from management.  I do highly recommend the chicken piccata, my favorite pasta here.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Service at the bar was poor

QRJFBjJUGxurHo4-2cK8wQ.text: This cafe in the Venetian Hotel is not your ordinary coffee shop!  Our server was attentive and friendly and the food was great!  We ordered the Belgian waffle, breakfast quesadilla, Sunday pasta and market avocado salad.  Portions are huge and prices are reasonable.  We especially enjoyed the Sunday pasta which is made up of spaghetti and shortribs and meatballs, so tasty!  The salad was humongous and we split the Sunday pasta and salad!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Market avocado salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belgian waffle
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast quesadilla

fShJRMmDD7LmEhE1Z8G5Ng.text: This review is for the desserts only, I've actually never eaten the main courses here, but I would never skipped the desserts everytime I went to Vegas, even though I was already full after eating buffet.  My top two desserts are Beignets (only in this location) and Bread Pudding. Those desserts might take a while to be made, but mann those are the best. The beignets are warm, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, perfection. The sauces that come with the beignets are also to die for, especially the vanilla and chocolate ones. The bread pudding is amazing, beyond this world.   Never ever go to Vegas without tasting the yummy desserts from Grand Lux.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best beignets (even better than Cafe du Monde in NOLA)

y1nDS1StzKHuZXvWEGuEFg.text: Warm Butter Cake amazing !!!! Definitely recommended we love this restaurant. We always dine here when in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake   Amazing!

jnF3VamdFSRpMarGSdDt2g.text: Came here on a whim for something "small" before the encore beach club day ahead of us.  Let me tel you... worth every darn penny:). French toast:  moist innards, not overly sweet, and thin crisp on the outside.  Garden omelette: fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qeklUooRk0xmeJrXGwd40w.text: Nice restaurant inside the casino with good service. There's a few grand lux location.   Came to this location as it was later in the evening and many other restaurants in the casino all had 30-40 min waits. This place seated us right away.   The restaurant had the Italian Vienna look and feel to it with the ambiance it was giving off.   You can get many different kinds of food. From Italian, Chinese, American, etc. it's literally a 15 page menu. The after midnight menu just goes on.

OYZOCXApQmNHHpMWurWyCQ.text: Love my Grand Lux Cafe! I miss it being in LA so it is a must every time I'm in Vegas. Had dinner here after seeing Ms. Jackson in concert and the staff was so nice. Our server and the manager couldn't have been friendlier.  I got the jumbo fried shrimp dinner and some baked to order cookies, to go. BOMB. Don't come to this location if you want the beignets or molten lava cake as they are not equipped for that. For those desserts, go to the 24hr location on the other side.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Fried Shimp

wnThs9gOkOBG8a0qtBuE0A.text: I think it says something that I was here for a 3 day vacation with my boyfriend and we came here for breakfast EVERY single day! Shannon and Deborah were our servers and they were GREAT. Shannon was so sassy (in a good and fun way!) and Deborah was very sweet!  If you haven't had the beignets.... they will change your LIFE. They're warm French doughnuts dusted with powdered sugar and served with various types of sauces such as raspberry, vanilla, and a maple/butter house sauce. AMAZING. Just a heads up-- the beignets are made to order fresh so order them ASAP with your morning coffee.  We also ordered the delux breakfast sandwich to split with hash browns. It was tasty! The eggs were fluffy. The tomatoes on there were fresh as can be and the havarti cheese was an exquisite taste that made this unique compared to other breakfast sandwiches. This sandwich was a 4/5 just because their hash browns on the side that came with it were not seasoned very well. They were crispy though!  We also split the Short Rib Benedict. O-M-G. My boyfriend got me out of my comfort zone here... it is short ribs with a poached egg, hollandaise sauce and sauteed mushrooms on top of a crispy potato cake. Those flavors were so harmonious and amazing!! We got this dish 2 days in a row because of how great it was!  Regardless to say, you've got to try this place. And the good news is they're open almost all the time...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib Benedict
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets

Ie90ScsALAZgp1BDAs3bEQ.text: The convenience of this restaurant is by far my favorite thing about this place. It's late night hours are perfect for dining after a long day, and the food is all very quality. The menu here is really large; dishes are served based on time of day but the food is very fluid in terms of when they are able to be served. Along with a large menu, the food options are very versatile and can fulfill any craving!  I ordered the spinach & cheese dip and it was phenomenal!!! The flavor it exudes is very top tier. By far one of my favorite cheese dips. I also got a side of sauteed mushrooms and they were amazing.  The wait time for food was only about 30 minutes; I was here around 12 AM and it was still pretty packed. The ambience, menu, and food resembles that of Cheesecake Factory for reference!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed mushrooms
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi ceviche
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken piccata

0XNyjoeNDJf5IjtPufJQ9w.text: What a fantastic dining experience! Looking for a "medium-nice" place for dinner with the family during our stay at the Palazzo. I wasn't expecting much for what is essentially the house restaurant, and was completely caught off guard - this place is sneaky. The review is for the Palazzo restaurant, not the Grand Lux in the Venetian.  The atmosphere is reminiscent of a grand train station in Vienna; it is physically a very large space, while being cozy, and you could make it whatever you wanted - come in casual clothes with kids, or dress-up, it's suitable and comfortable for either. The menu is extensive; American, Italian, Asian - you name it, they got it. Started with some fun tropical cocktails that were huge when they arrived at the table, then a couple of glasses of nice red. I had a beef wellington dish that was out of this world; the sauce had the richest, beefiest flavor I ever tasted, with some crispy roasted vegetables that had me in tears they were so good. My wife and one son had the ribeye ravioli with a nice cream sauce that was also Devine. Other sons had a burger and a steak, cooked to perfection. Finished with a couple of (large) desserts - a good cheesecake, key lime pie and coffee.  Throughout, the service was prompt and professional, and the bill was a real surprise considering it was a bit over $200 for the 5 of us - it felt like a real value compared to so many other places we have been to, and being half as satisfied. Highly recommended if you are looking for good food, experience and value, in a humble, non-celebrity chef establishment while in Vegas.

neO82l4PZdmD_albrRpUsw.text: Breakfast was very good. Recommend the lemon pancakes and the French toast was like cake. Super rich but excellent for sharing. Heard the buffet was good from my cousin's husband. $24.99 in Vegas is not bad and he raved about the biscuits and gravy and juice was included, which is nice when considering prices overall. I think the buffet is only available on weekends.   4 stars for food and price. 3 stars overall due to service and ambiance. Ambiance is nice but not special enough for 4 stars. Bathroom is outside of the restaurant which is kind of annoying too when you just want to wash your hands before your meal. Not a bad thing place at all if you are staying at the Venetian. We liked it so much we ate there twice and also due to convenience. Smoke in the casino getting there was not good though for the kiddos.

sG_-tAcP6wa0skrSctg0QQ.text: Stopped in here on my last trip to Vegas in June. We were seated right away, place wasn't crazy busy like most places in Vegas. Our was DELICIOUS, but it took forever!!  My table ordered: an omelette- yum The shrimp salad - SO good (the dressing is amazing - you can definitely split this one) BLT - huge portion also.   Overall - food amazing. Slow service.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty coffee &amp; 45 minutes later still waiting for food...

u3OqgnytsKY5LF8mipInAg.text: I did not even realize that their was a Grand Lux in the Palazzo although I have been to the one in the Venetian many times. Where have I been?  A group of us came here and we squeezed eight people into a long booth. Honestly we thought it would be six people but two more arrived and we just made due. Honestly, their booths are quite large because we did have elbow room!   With the added two people, our servers were very accommodating and friendly. They made sure everyone ordered and received our food promptly, all with a smile!   I ordered the clam chowder, the fish and chips and the Asian Pear Martini. I thought everything that I ordered was very tasty especially the fish and chips. We also shared a bottle of pinot noir and the server made sure that the first six at the table, had enough wine in our glasses. Very nice wine pour!   I do like Grand Lux, not only for the food but for the prices. Restaurants on the strip can be pricey but Grand Lux has excellent On The Strip prices for good quality food. Pretty delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Pear Martini
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam Chowder
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Butter Cake

VMrTxy-yf5sl24mPAANKYA.text: Huge menu and extremely diverse.  Great option in The Venetian or The Palazzo.  Always a good meal and service is good too.

pP1NnH9pUbqNsaiLb8rJfg.text: This is the vegas version of the Cheesecake factory!! I ordered take out twice since we were staying in this hotel. I got a burger one day and a quesadilla the next. The inside looks huge and elegant. Highly recommended!

wrRPIHmA3CV-zl8E-r_YmQ.text: This restaurant has one of the best burger menus I have ever seen. The "drive in delux" burger was one of the best I have ever had and I highly reccommend it. Other members of my party enjoyed the shortrib grilled cheese and the garlic bleu cheese burger. Overall a fantastic meal and we will be back!

cNJGbheQk26R7ljkyn8bIg.text: Totally affordable, excellent food that is very similar in style to the Cheesecake Factory, it's mother restuarant. The service is excellent, the food honest and well-prepared, and the portions are huge. Breakfast is a fun treat.

sBuhAdGgY4LSSisYcEsYLg.text: this is the 3rd time ive actually gone.  twice for breakfast but this timme for a later meal.  my girlfriend and i arrived here after watching mystere at treasure island.  my girlfriend and i were buzzed so we dreaded waiting but thank god we got seated immediately.  the server was super nice and the atmosphere was super chill.  i order the seared ahi and she got the duck dumplings.  the food was thoroughly good and i'm definitely going to go again.  i recommend this spot for people who want to eat a nice meal in vegas without hitting up a buffet!

9fA9kFI5u2nJz5kAvjBi1w.text: Just returned from our stay at the Palazzo (December 21-23).  We received complimentary Continental Breakfast tickets for breakfast at Grand Lux Cafe with our reservation.  Had the option to upgrade to their breakfast buffet for $8.50 per person and did.  There were 8 persons in our group and everyone enjoyed the buffet.  The orange juice was freshly squeezed, oat meal freshly made, and the eggs, ham, waffles, bacon, sausage, fruit, hash browns.........everything was delicious.  For $8.50 per person, it was a bargain.  I understand that the regular charge for the buffet is $16.  So if you are staying at the Venetian/Palazzo for your stay in Las Vegas, be sure to ask them to include the complimentary breakfast buffet.

77zPOR6lwD72DQ_f7xREzA.text: Wish we'd found this place earlier. Good food, good drinks, big portions, GREAT prices!

KEOyQrh1G8OpMlJVWN_pAg.text: are you seriously telling me this place is affilated with Cheesecake factory??   we stayed at the the Palazzo, so naturally we choose to eat within our hotel. BAD F-EN mistake. everything we order was awful or nasty. Zen Noodles, YUCK!!!!! NO! bland bland bland. better off with chicken noodle soup but THEY DON'T make that. Chicken and Waffles, my friend said it was 'horrific' and 'nasty' i didn't try it but looking at her expressions tells me im better off NOT trying it. seared ahi... wow, is this seriously "AHI"?!?!? I had the Pasta with Chicken Tomatoes and Garlic over creamy sauce, the pasta itself was overcooked!!! :( My friend had the Caramel chicken and Sauteed Beef. we aske dher, hey what did you ordered? She said "awful" practically renamed her plate. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Soup. CREAMY is a understatement, i took 2 spoonful and gave up! GROSS, creamy... well it was WAY THE HELL beyond creamy because when he cooled it looked like BUTTER! i think they only good plate that no one complained about was Shrimp Scampi. So if you're as unfortunately as us and was forced to eat there because Palazzo and Venetian didn't have any food places opened after 3AM, then order yourself a Shrimp Scampi.. because everything else on the menu is "HORRIBLE, AWFUL and NASTY"   Service was great, well, how can it possibly be NOT GREAT being that it is in the the Palazzo?? but food wise, walk to DENNY'S!! You'll be better off eatting there.

T8TxHjoFsA6gRghPXKox4g.text: Came here with my hungover buddies to grab a hearty brunch before we hit the pools during the busy Memorial Day weekend, and this place was top-notch! Knowing that it was owned by the same company as the Cheesecake Factory, I had high expectations. I ended up ordering a full size pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza for about $13. Wow... the size of the pizza was so overwhelming! I split half of it with my friend and I was still very full. The meats were tasty, the pizza dough perfect, and the sauce was fresh. This was the perfect hangover food to have in Vegas. I also tip off my hat to our waitress, who was dealing with a still drunk buddy of mine and had to fight off my friend's marriage proposals. She was a champ and played with him, which made for an entertaining meal for the table. I'm glad I got to try this place, I will for sure stop by next time I am in Vegas, maybe when I am stumbling along the casino floor and stop by this 24-hour joint for some terrific food.

puybczEmPCbpJ1nxDF21Ig.text: After a long day at a convention my whole family was tired. We did not feel like going out. We saw this nice little restaurant in the hotel. We went to try it out and this was a great choice for food. It was conveniently in our hotel with GREAT food. I liked their salads but also their flat bread chicken sandwiches. They are pretty expensive for a sandwich but the sandwich was huge! It made up for the price because of its amazing taste. I also loved their juicy angus burgers. They tasted like they were made with high quality beef and I wish their was one of these restaurants in Sacramento. Next time I head to las vegas, I know where im heading when i get hungry. Overall Convenient, Tasty, & HUGE. They also had a good staff and the wait was about 10-15 minutes. But its better than going to the restaurant side of it. I just went in the togo side and went and ate the delicious food in my room

Gk21gbvNPfn7a0yxG4ANYA.text: Elegant looking restaurant and great tasting food! We got the BBQ salmon that was absolutely delicious and the other entree was a cheeseburger with the best fries I have ever tasted in my life. Prices weren't too bad especially for being on the Strip. The total bill came out to around $40. I will definitely go back every time I am in Vegas.

vqVqZ5JDOvsObCffNROUZA.text: Me and my husband recently got married in Las Vegas and were looking for a good, affordable place to have a reception. We had about 40 guests in a private dining room and customized a private dining menu from the regular dining menu. We must say we were extremely happy with the food, as were as our guests ( and we have some picky eaters!) We had a four course menu and everything was hot, fresh, and great tasting! We loved the double stuffed potato spring rolls & fried calamari & rock shrimp. The wedge salad was great and so flavorful. Many of our guests ordered the filet mignon and all were very satisfied. Since Grand Lux is affiliated with the Cheesecake Factory, we choose their fresh strawberry cheesecake for dessert, giant piece, not too sweet, and very tasty. We were extremely happy with our food and our experience at the Grand Lux Palazzo. Portions were huge and affordable for the size. You will leave beyond full, with food to take home!

ZrdHGjzh0ZWGYifQ6l5Taw.text: Needed quick dinner before seeing Jersey Boys. In and out in less than an hour with party of four. Had the best shrimp scampi ever. EVER! Six huge shrimp and a very pleasant sauce with the pasta. Also had great warm sourdough bread. Everyone in party was full and happy.

BsBzI3UPD89kud9SCUSTWA.text: This review is for breakfast only. I ordered the basic eggs, hash browns, bacon and toast breakfast which was pretty lame overall. The eggs were slightly undercooked and completely flavorless. The hash browns were burnt and dry and way too heavy on the pepper seasoning they used. The bacon was good and was the only good part of the meal. My server was good, but since was the only one working the service was very slow.

SUMci0SwoyDkhMl8ZElJlg.text: Was staying at this hotel and I ordered to go. It was about 11:30 pm and I ordered a truffle burger and chicken Alfredo. The man working at the cafe was super friendly and had excellent customer service. Our food came out perfect and I will definitely come back.

tLcWbNDTBTmcbsUU7tM9aQ.text: Yum yum yum! Stopped in for lunch and had the salmon piccata with brown rice. It was melt in your mouth good! Great service and beautiful atmosphere!

7G26Mi0YzNFpfhwO8izSkQ.text: The worst service I have ever had, and I've encountered many rude waiters. This man threw stuff. He came only once to fill our waters. At 1 point, we waited for the ice to melt to become water. We were never asked how our food was and it wasn't even busy. The waiter was like this with other tables around us too. Now the food came... The burger was very bland. The meat was not to my liking at all. I figured it would have value from how thick the meat was, but it just tasted like charcoal. The pastas are pricey. The 18inch margarita pizza was more of a flat bread that's could feed two, but as an appetizer. Definitely wouldn't be back.

nVYoCJLdpX-rfgl_jcl_Og.text: This ended up being a great spot to start our days in Vegas. We stayed at the Venetian for our 3 nights in Vegas and went to breakfast here for two days. The service both mornings was excellent! The menu was very impressive! Both breakfast meals were served hot and fresh. The coffee was free flowing and also delicious. We will definetely return on our next visit!

tDUS3FMJJhuozl1Kkj7X0g.text: This place is me and my wife's go to spot for late night food when we stay at Palazzo. We usually order a burger and fries to go. We've had the calamari as well, which is really good too. This place reminds me of Cheesecake Factory with the decorations inside the restaurant. We used to be able to order garlic fries at night but lately they say they don't have it. But for the most part this food is really good when you've been out drinking late and craving food as this place is probably one of few food places close by that's open late.

fhopY9xfltmlolWZfeKkJw.text: I use to come here for their chicken and waffles,  it was great,  the chicken was crispy and tasty and came with pecan honey and maple syrup. Unfortunately recently, they change the recipe,  chicken was not as cripsy and they only give you the standard maple sauce... Very sad!  :-(  Luckily, out of random luck,  I  tried their Beignets and they were so fluffy and just so YUMMY ! I hope they don't change it!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets with vanilla,  dark chocolate and raspberry dipping sauce.

z9GcGuedJhJrIL33UhAROg.text: Grand Lux Cafe is the sister restaurant of Cheesecake Factory. I feel like it's exactly the same, just displaying a different name. Located in the Palazzo and very close to LAVO, this is a good place for pre-clubbing large groups and those late night drinkers who desperately need to eat.   Every time I've come here the service has been hit or miss. This place tends to be busy no matter what time of day it is. It took our waiter about 45 minutes just to get us waters. It took just as long to get us extra silverware and napkins. Our waiters were switched out twice, which is something that somewhat bothers me when it comes to service because our last waiter had everyone's orders mixed up and even brought the wrong drinks at one point.   The food was decent, but nothing really to rave about. Neither were the drinks, although fancy sounding lowered my expectations. The portions were plentiful and matched their fair prices. Presentation was done well, but completely overshadowed by the service.   Honestly, this place is never my first choice when it comes to restaurants in Vegas, but mostly a last resort. I've had better service at a Cheesecake Factory.

il4yeNuLUXxkQKqk0IO6BQ.text: Had dinner with the family.  The artisan pizza is very good. On request the made a Hawai for our son (wasn't on the menu). The spaghetti Carbonara was excellent and the salad was huge and good. Nice atmosphere, good food and good prices.  When staying at the Palazzo (as we did), it is very convenient and a good experience

VvCBB2_yHS5aV8oEvSRw8Q.text: The Grand Luxe Cafe in the Palazzo is so awesome that I almost don't even want to review it because I don't want to spread the word so it can become overcrowded! I don't think too many people have realized them or how awesome they are, based on the small crowd that was there while we were there.  First of all, it's a nice little place. It is a classy looking joint (although they definitely feature a large TV for sports). I found this place on the internet before embarking on our Vegas vacation and knew I wanted to eat there. We enjoyed it so much the first time, we went back for more! It is a best kept secret...  They have the most amazing Happy Hour I have ever seen. They have a ton of $5-$7 appetizers and drinks. The first time we purchased a total of 5 appetizers & 4 high end drinks for about $50.  My husband loved their fried buffalo things (I guess I should look up the actual name). He ordered them more than once. We ordered their macaroni skillet twice. We tried several different things and all were delicious. I definitely recommend only ordering the spinach dip if more than one person wants it! I was the only who wanted it and it was far too much for one but delicious. As far as drinks go, I am a super fan of their raspberry cosmopolitan. I often check menus for those now based on this experience.   Their staff is also beyond polite. Super nice guys & very accommodating! I will return to this place during every stay I have in Vegas.

fJimuu07D7Qn8NntW7zr6A.text: We went last night to the Venetian location and was told that only the Palazzo location offers a great Happy Hour (appetizers & drinks) selections from 4:30-6:30pm, M-F , so we decided to head to the Palazzo instead.  This is a great place to spend some time right after leaving the convention and avoid all the traffic, plus it was bigger & quieter too.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood Grilled Ruby Trout
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso Glazed Salmon
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Lettuce Wraps

_y9e1xBgUS5aD39SDd7l0A.text: Went there for the beignets , the Potato Egg Rolls  anything  with Niman Ranch Bacon. It was late....too late to eat food, just needed some finger foods. Found out the only  Niman Ranch Bacon is available on the salads. Not sure why the BLT's do not have the Niman Ranch Bacon? Nevertheless, the Chef fried us up a bunch of Niman Ranch Bacon Pieces. This photo may not look like much, but these are pure bacon pieces of heaven in your mouth. There is nothing like Niman Ranch Bacon EVER!.... this is not on the menu, but should be, I would pay $10-15 just for these Niman Ranch Bacon pieces....YUM!     I have had Cafe Du Monde and I love them. But, New Orleans is a little to far just to get some beignets. The beignets at the Grand Lux are very, very, very delicious. They give Cafe Du Monde some competition.  For the potato lover, I would definitely suggest the Stuffed Potato Egg Roll It is stuffed with gooey cheesy mash potatoes and off course bacon, sour cream and more cheese on top. Skip the buffets....come here, open until 3am on weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

54CvnqeXSiYJdm_-BSV7KQ.text: Best thing to eat after a night of drinking. They have a late night menu and I'm not sure what the dish was called but they were these egg roll things filled with boneless buffalo spicy chicken  and it came with a side of ranch for dipping that just tasted amazing. It may have been the best egg rolls I've ever had. It says they're open until 3 am but I'm pretty sure it's even later than that.

bHqDnya6ZM1n7lDr9JEkIg.text: Fantastic.   It's similar to Cheesecake Factory in terms of ambiance and menu. The bread was delicious. There was SO much to choose from but I opted for the chicken salad sandwich with a side salad. Very good. I wish the Grand Lux Cafe was as strewn across the nation as Cheesecake Factory.

3bJYKISRTL6Km97qTlwCGw.text: I have to admit i'm not a fan of the cheesecake factory so this was no different.   The food was reliable, plentiful. I had the chicken royale and everything was cooked perfectly. My buddies had the Jambalaya and Max burger both of which they liked. The service started out great but then fell apart when our food was not coming out for quite sometime, and a couple different people came out to apologize even though we didn't complain or ask about the situation.     It's not a very exciting place to eat but it is fine and I'd come again

JNEwgn15k6CYcQx3IOHdOg.text: Terrible service ordered eggs over easy they came out over medium I sent them back a minute later he brought the same eggs out rotated on the plate I asked for the manager he never showed.

z78yi0TRcGR3kIR9hJ4qMw.text: It was hard for me to be ok with eating at what is essentially Cheesecake Factory. It's commercial and not great and the menu is full of too many options that are usually just ok, as it often is when you generalize instead of specialize.  That being said, we needed food and we needed it ASAP. We ordered the steak and eggs breakfast with wheat toast and crispy hash browns, the avocado chipotle burger, a side of fruit, 2 coffees, and 2 spicy bloody Mary's. Turned out that our order was a serious case of the good, the bad, and the ugly.  The good: the steak was decent, not too much fat, and decently medium rare. The bloody Mary's are delicious- the pickled asparagus was a great surprise for flavor. French fries were decent. Eggs were perfectly scrambled.  The bad: we ordered our burger medium well. It came medium rare. I don't mind, but my boyfriend hates how it makes the bun soggy.   The ugly: it took an insane amount of time to get our food and our drinks. The hash browns had to be sent back because they were soggy. The most amazing was how hard it was to get wheat toast. We had to send our toast back THREE times, no joke. We got sourdough twice and then white. What the hell?  For the price, this was a massive pain in the ass. Never again.  **update: both boyfriend and I got sick three hours later. Definitely from the food. Never going back, for sure.

ZM2TD6oGfou7edoeNJxzfQ.text: Everything is great here. Portions are good sized. The salads and crunchy and full of flavor. Filet mignon was delicious and very tender. Melted in my mouth!

Abxjyq7CYKPbXA4bdDncQg.text: Yum yum yummy! Great variety on their menu something for everyone, you want it they most likely have it. Ive been hearing for years about Grand Lux Cafe here in L.A.,after years & years at the Beverly Center it just closed i thought i had missed out, i didnt know it was a chain restaurant. We went here with just a bit over an hour to eat, we were going to a show. So we didnt have alot of time to totally enjoy the place but our time there was good. It was about 6:30pm so the dinner crowd was there not packed but getting there, we got a table right away.The decor was beautiful. The hostess & our waitress were both professional & attentive. Since we were pressed for time we ordered 3 medium plates from the menu. We nibbled on the bread basket while we waited for our meal which didnt take long at all. All 3 meals were perfectly cooked & just the right size portion. We had a great meal and made it to our 8:00 show on time. Next visit we will make sure and have plenty of time the dessert menu looked scrumptious.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT and Gazpacho soup
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado chipotle burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woodgrilled bbq burger

XME9TvGw8zDwQvwm9ca6kg.text: Korean chicken burrito was awesome!  Cuban sandwich also very good.  But the best part is the red velvet cake!!!  The best!  And the service is always wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken burrito.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban sandwich

pxUf7cYJGXTb8j3uXTifdg.text: Had breakfast here after waiting in line for a while.  Don't like buffets(which they offered) and instead ordered eggs and bacon.  Nothing was memorable food wise but the service was good.  They should stay out of the breakfast business and stay in the cheesecake business.

At7d7QmnVZfBy7wwVNGCuQ.text: Ate at this restaurant three times while in Vegas this last weekend (twice for breakfast and once for dinner). Very reasonably priced and high quality food. Very large portions with a very big menu with just about everything. Restaurant is owned my the same company who owns The Cheesecake Factory so it has a very similar feel and atmosphere. We had the chicken and waffles for breakfast, the Deluxe sandwhich, crab and asparagus omelette and beignets for breakfast across the two times we visited. For dinner, we started with the small portion of the calamari. It was good but nothing different than your standard fried calamari. For our entree, we shared the Cobb salad and the bbq chicken pizza. Thank goodness we shared as the portions are huge and we couldn't even finish what we ordered. All the food was very good and service was also good. Only reason for four stars was due to the wait time for the food. Each time we waited for our food it seemed much longer than expected. Would still highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried waffles.

7ugg49NHit_NrDQCKOBp-A.text: For a late night cafe that serves a killer breakfast buffet, this place is awesome! If you can somehow make it when the breakfast buffet is being served, I'd highly recommend it. For twenty bucks you enjoy all you can eat and drink which includes fresh squeezed orange juice.  Their omelet bar is on point and so are their waffles! I had two omelets and two waffles! Make sure you try their orange juice if you're a fan of OJ...

bREO-lvKWnVzA2yiZOga5Q.text: This restaurant was amazing, you have to try steak and desert here. Also one of the best server we had in the US was Jennifer E, Nikki. She is so kind and amazing . Big A+ for her. Thanks.

eZySidXLl6f2R8XipikDnQ.text: If grand lux cafe and the Cheesecake Factory were sisters they would be those sisters that you swear are twins but they're not.   From the menu to the decor, this place is very similar to the Cheesecake Factory, and they /are/ from the same creators, so they really are sisters.   Try the red velvet cake, it's got either cheesecake or cream cheese in between the layers.

nqlUgZAB8BzE-JLcJdAnSw.text: I've had a lotta memories here at the Grand Lux... some sober ones, some drunken ones, some nauseatingly sick ones, and even some hungover ones. No matter how I felt, Grand Lux has always been there for me 24 hours a day and I'm truly grateful for their comfort food that soothes my soul.  Okay I may be a little dramatic, but since this Grand Lux is in Vegas, there are crazy drunk and hungry people coming in around the clock. The menu is extensive so you can pretty much satisfy nearly any appetite. Typically if I order off the pasta section, another girl and I could share it pretty easily. There isn't really much of a difference between Grand Lux and The Cheesecake Factory except maybe a slight menu change. All the food is still very similar and much like The Cheesecake Factory, everything you order will be pretty good. If it isn't, I don't think they'd have any problem changing it for you since their customer service is always very good.  I typically frequent The Grand Lux in The Palazzo, but keep in mind there's also one in The Venetian. Confusing, I know. But if you're meeting people just make sure you specify.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grio
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni, Sausage, and Mushroom Pizza
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Tacos

ytB70qUqLFaRMiwr3y3axA.text: This has to be the very best 24-hour restaurants in Las Vegas. The bagel & lox, the fish tacos, the mini shortrib tacos, and every other main dish are always, without exception, the best.  My fiance says the mini short rib tacos are to die for!  She says she could eat these every day!  Besides the food, the service is always fantastic!  The servers are always  polite and attentive.  We hate leaving this restaurant behind when we leave Vegas.  Wish they'd open a Grand Luxe in California...we'd be their best customers.

ezZenktP7n-z7IQt1BZmoQ.text: Went here 2 nights ago. Great service, atmosphere and food! The chicken avocado salad was life changing. The dressings that came on it were so good! It was fresh and filling but not heavy. The bread served with dinner was delicious. Prices were good. We will definitely be back!

P1Ti7NIFj3qtmM8USYqxyw.text: A coffee shop with decent food and ok atmosphere.  For a once in a lifetime experience I would go elsewhere. The service is good as well

vRbEn2bczmWtwaQTkKBnsw.text: If like me you are a truffle and mushroom Lover on quest to find the best mushroom burger out there, you have to try the Truffle Burger, affordable price, and definitely worth the wait. Of course there are other mouth watering options on the menu that I haven't tried yet but that burger...MaMamia!! You rediscover the burger at each bite, first you taste the bun -a tasty brioche (and trust me, I know what a good broche tastes like I'm french)- then comes the juicy patty and finally you discover the mushrooms, there they are, so yummilicious. It's a very pleasant experience. And you can't stop until you've had the very last bite which is the best. Try it, it's a must. You'll thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This burger is to die for. Truffle Burger with brioche bun

lFfwvE0y5Lq_BfqvwIRqwg.text: For the best pancakes you have ever tried in your life- lemon poppy seed pancakes. They melt in your mouth, are fluffy, and have a perfect balance of sweet and acidity from the lemon. The breakfast omelettes are quality and Bloody Mary was decent for a hotel cafe. The serving staff was incredibly nice and portions were huge. It's busy but the wait is shorter than It looks and service is fast. It also is priced according to the quality and proportion. 12/10 would recommend

Ghn-Auw3bO-okqAaqSre3Q.text: The manager and supervisor named Marty is very disrespectful and rude. Read the full story on @VivianHovsepian

3atzZxS2oPHSiaS1GGOmkA.text: Grand Lux is always good.  One of the best places to eat in Vegas over and over for variety.  I'm here for 2 weeks so I already know this will be a frequent.

ev345bz_m6pVX0FsQfagnA.text: Breakfast was perfect! The menu choices or buffet is fairly priced and delicious.  But, the dinner was huge disappointment. Manhattan salad with jumbo shrimp came with three large shrimps cut in a half and placed on top. Jambalaya shrimp with chicken was tasty but 30% onions!!!! Since when onion in  jambalaya is a main ingredient and not for flavoring?

WqDY6U3SMOv6HkNXoj2VzA.text: By far one of our favorite spots on the Strip.   Most recent visit was on Thanksgiving. We didnt have time to cook before work, so took the family here.  They had a nice Thanksgiving style menu including a ton of traditional side dishes. Mashed potatoes, brussel sprout etc.   We split the buffalo chicken egg rolls to start. HOLY YUM. I could have just ate 4 orders those....by myself.  Like, I want to go back right now to order them.   I had the Chicken Pot Pie. It was so delicious! Wasnt served an actual pie crust, but instead just the pasty puff at the top of the dish. Different twist, but too damn good. Brussel sprouts as a side. They were cooked just the way I like them, softer.   Service was great. Will always return.

hFc3VT73arSkMUZLGLgbNA.text: Best omelette I have had in Vegas, it was just super good with ham, onions, mushrooms, and cheese. Service was perfect and hash browns were perfect. Menu is awesome. Like a better version of Cheesecake Factory

rZWfcuv5ClWt5N7nlEJVow.text: The good: -It was fairly easy to get a table for 8 here. -Service was decent.  -Convenient if you are staying at the Palazzo. -My friends didn't really bitch about anything so I guess their meal was ok.  The bad: -The scrambled eggs from the all you can eat breakfast was a little runny.  (Although, the omelets you can make are ok.)  -Bloody mary was pretty horrible.

TrPt4WMz5juXCMYHgyU5TQ.text: So we didn't know where to go for dinner and the valet suggested this place to us. Think Cheesecake Factory with a bigger menu. They have something for everyone and the food is really tasty. We ordered the steak sandwich and one of the pasta dishes. The sandwich came with a little salad and the blue cheese dressing here is AMAZING. The pasta portion was huge and my hubby and I both left full and happy.  Service was a little slow BUT our waitress was sweet and we are on vacation so in no rush! Chances are good we will be back tomorrow! Oh yea... This place is HUGE. If you can't wait long for a table this is your establishment!

cUO6XIhF5iv9lApbD6ZVVA.text: Very good restaurant, we tried the chicken piccata and chicken enchilada, also butter squash soup, everything was amazing! Big Portions considering we did the lunch portion. Service was excellent

37zE_QQc5LjzIoH82LXHYg.text: Wonderful service. Me and my friend went around 3am just to get some late dessert, and the staff was nice and helpful. The manager stopped by our table and introduced himself and asked us how our night was going. He gave us his business card and invited us to come back. The food was delicious as well.

tdmrrah9Iq-Y1lRozgZGRQ.text: I always enjoy coming here  Big portions and for a cheap price!   I ordered the Grand Delux sandwich.   Without ham and bacon, though since I am a vegetarian.  The sandwich is on Brioche bread very thick bread! Inside: Scrambled egg (perfectly formed), fresh yummy tomatoes, and havarti cheese.   A must have.   It comes with hash browns on the side.   I was craving breakfast during lunch time, and this did the job!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand delux breakfast sammich no bacon or ham

WNTypGnnsUQikWQ7dAeY8g.text: Good food just takes forever for to go orders. Expect 30-40 minutes for your to go order. No ideal for 30 minute lunch. Even when you call ahead.

j9ZajUJeatOSl9NcCLN7cQ.text: This Grand Lux is for the one in the Palazzo (there's another one next door in the Venetian). It's owned by the same company as Cheesecake Factory, and it definitely shows. Similar decor, ambience, and menu. (yelp.com/biz_photos/fHM0...) My friends and I came here for dinner and was seated almost immediately. I split an order of pasta with chicken, sundried tomato, and mushrooms with a friend. It might've been because we were all super hungry, but our food seemed to take a little longer than usual to arrive. In the meantime, we were served some complimentary bread, which was pretty average. When the food finally arrived, we dug in. The pasta was good, but standard. (yelp.com/biz_photos/fHM0...) It was on the greasier side though, and the pasta tasted pretty heavy. And portions were huge, so even though I split with my friend, we both couldn't finish it! Decent place if you don't know where to eat. It's open late at night too, so if you get hungry in the morning hours like my friends did at 3 am, you can stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pasta

GEow6SuawWLWbIPRStGZNA.text: The gm Pablo is an absolute prick of an ass  Will not be coming here any time soon after this f......king joke of a general manager  Thanks for f....king up my birthday dinner and causing a huge embarrassment

Me1bJD2bAO8XieytkFU7Gw.text: We come here quite often and will continue to come back. This last visit we were there on Saturday afternoon. The Asian Nachos are amazing, must try. I always enjoy the Strawberry Martini, yum. Sometimes the service can be not so great at the Venetian location so we prefer the Palazzo location, usually less busy too, just not open as late. Have not been disappointed by most things on menu, huge menu, can't go wrong.

LSrplsttM53MrYcKHrdnwg.text: We have always loved the Grand Lux Cafe and always stop when in Vegas. Tonight it was not good and service was slow. Ordered salad and it didnt taste fresh and only lettuce. It was disappointing. Maybe just an off night.

oiHpkl6Bq8FmKiukIleB_w.text: Incredible assortment of appetizers and entrees.  I had the Cafe Beef Wellington which was absolutely awesome.  3 small filets done perfectly with a nice puff pastry on top.  Great sauce, nice veggies.  My wife had the waffles.  Really great syrup, she wants to bottle it and bring it home.    We also had breakfast here the next day.  Small, but nice buffet selection.  Also can order a la carte.  I had the eggs Benedict which was good, but not great.  But certainly we will be back for any meals here whenever we're back in Vegas.

W9sKToWnwDni8XeXnEk82Q.text: I LOVE this place!!! Its great for lunch, dinner, and late night eats! The caramel chicken is the best thing on the menu by far. The bread at the beginning is warm and very good too! Amazing amazing :)

ViZ92HFEjl_BiQrLgKYd4A.text: While the service was quite spotty (we only had 1 good server  in the 3 times we dines for breakfast) the fare for breakfast was fantastic. Skip the buffet and opt for their regular breakfast menu. It's spot on and beautifully done. I really loved the crab omelette and the bowl of berries (can't go wrong!). We had the breakfast included in our stay via the AMEX offer and were able to enjoy every morning. It was quick and easy (if you get there at an early time!) but, if there is a line, don't worry it will go quickly.

SXKBYnJLUXXl3BOgdVmMZw.text: This was an easy rating to decide, because Yelp's suggested interpretation of 3-stars is exactly how I feel about this place: it's A-OK.  The food is decent; the staff is competent; the portions are generous; the menu has enough variety for all kinds of groups; they can do every meal of the day and then some; and the hours are great for almost any level of jetlag or partying.  Usually when I travel, I like to eat at new places every time, but the reliability and convenience of the Grand Lux Cafe in the Palazzo made me a repeat customer.

RgpMr3Y1VfSXJw34OUKrdw.text: The server was not well trained in proper serving etiquette.  Reached in front of us to serve. Reprimanded us for using napkins for our water glasses when she wanted them for drinks. Was older lady who informed us she is of German desent . The food was good,  waitress. Not.  We would go back but would refuse to be served by this lady !!!

rGgIFiONlDNi-iCGQVElTw.text: I ate here today! Never disappoints!! No matter what location I visit, the service is always the same. Love the food here and I appreciate the quality of everything. When I visit the Palazzo, I prefer to eat at the Grand Lux Cafe!!

jcVsu23v193jXr4tD7xT2w.text: Food was great. Service was excellent. Shout out to  Iliana our server, she provided exellent service.

u7V-huI00ZlXd3PLLkagqw.text: GREAT restaurant! My friends and I went for brunch at the one at the Venetian and loved it so much that we went to dinner again on the same day at the one at the Palazzo!  The brunch is very reasonably priced. I think I had the breakfast sandwich and it was only around $10  For dinner my three friends and I ordered from the "Big Small Plates" menu and boy were we stuffed (plus we all had leftovers)! All three of our dishes were recommended by our friendly server. I ordered the Salmon with the pea puree and veggies (delicious). One of my friends ordered the steak with fried brussel sprouts and let me tell you, THIS STOLE THE NIGHT! OMG this hits my top 5 in fried foods. Basically they peeled the leaves of the brussel sprouts and fried them, simple as that, but it was surprising very delicious! I would highly recommend ordering these! My other friend ordered the dish with gnocchi and loved it as well.   Our server was an older lady and was so nice! She was like a mom to us when she came over and was worried as to why we didn't finish our meals (but it was because we were stuffed, not that we didn't like the food!)  Drinks: I ordered the pineapple cocktail recommended by our waitress and it was sooo delicious! Would definitely recommend it!

xt8Ku59F9TwNUGWO5uCUOQ.text: Really good food! Service was ok. I ordered the Lemon Chicken Piccata. The dish is huge and enough to split between two people.

2_evlV6z9HrmTnnDwGq20g.text: This was my first time here and it won't be my last! We ordered the lunch salmon piccata and a lunch pizza and it was full of flavor! It's almost like Cheesecake Factory( probably because it's owned by them) but I like this food a lot better. The staff was friendly, the service was really fast thanks to our waitress Nikki and the food was good! That's a win win for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Salmon piccata and pizza!

bhhuHmZt-DwfyNLmHtIFOQ.text: Great food! Love it here me and my co workers always order from here! Staff is always friendly.

7gnXLyn2R3Zr6aujTWTnDw.text: Always have had good dining experiences.  Been here a number of times and will certainly be back.  Friendly and attentive staff and the food is top notch.

fbnWJutiB9QLJ4R5QDXRaQ.text: ***Grand Lux Cafe is conveniently located on the casino floor at The Venetian/Palazzo; their brunch menu is priced similarly to Las Vegas 24-hour cafes; I did a build-your-own omelette, which consisted of bacon, cheddar cheese, onion, and assorted peppers (you have the option to add up to 4 ingredients); the omelette was good (nicely cooked and all of the ingredients worked well together); the omelette came with crispy shredded hash browns and good and hearty wheat toast (a toasted English muffin is available as an alternative to the toast); the brunch was decent and filling; you can get a more upscale and more delicious brunch at Bouchon (also located at this hotel), but that restaurant is harder to get to, not as filling and more expensive***  Like almost all of the major resort hotels on The Strip, The Venetian and Palazzo offer complimentary self and valet parking.

1KHpMg1v4p9aCQpc-ErX0Q.text: We love this restaurant. The waiters are friendly and are hard working to make you happy. If you get a waitress or waiter that doesn't make you happy ask for a different server because their are plenty that will. The food is fantastic. Huge portions and great prices. They have an  exorbitant amount of delicious food on the menu. The ambience is extraordinary beautiful. Their open late for those hungry after work or out all night dancing. The Grand Lux is one of our favorite places and just wish they had one in our town.

_OXvxnQQnkZrjqhhFTtlUg.text: Fantastic breakfast food!! I recommend the French beignets!! The food is a great price compared to most nice restaurants inside of Hotel/Casinos at the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets!! With several dipping sauces/syrups to choose from!

66_RMpYWGgWxBF8rPBfkXQ.text: This was an amazing lunch place. Drinks and food were delicious and the menu was huge. It was so busy, but we never felt uncomfortably crammed or rushed. Our server Kim was AMAZING! Of all the things that made our lunch great, she was the best part. She was so sweet and very personable; an overall phenomenal server. If you are in the are stop here and request her section!

53E-lJ-EPrLX0CX2Zlh2aA.text: Cheesecake factory's sister.  Things you need to know: - open 24hrs (and you can order pretty much the entire menu at all hours). - SLOW SERVICE - moderately priced (entrees in the $12-30 range) - CONVENIENT

J1e2tl1ii54CIGIoLXbRhw.text: Food was decent, I had the BBQ Chicken Pizza and salad for their lunch special. Everything I expected.  Service was seriously lacking though. For some reason, one which I assume to be descrimitory in nature, we were the only table not given any bread. Our food also took twice as long. Our appetizer didn't even come out by the time the table next to us got all their food. We arrived about the same time as them.

MKCBzLboXHYjKAnDHpANSA.text: Matt is an awesome server! he made our evening even more enjoyable.  Then he went a notch higher and chased us down in the Casino because I left my cell phone on the table!!

WLxO3OBI324imhpGMr7pWw.text: A great upscale Cheesecake Factory style restaurant. It is, in my opinion, a lot better than Cheesecake Factory. We love especially their:  -Buffalo Wings  -Seafood Salad -Manhattan Salad -Sunday Night Pasta   We also tried their BLT Sandwich and that was very good too. The service is efficient and friendly. We have been here many time since we always stay at the Palazzo or Venetian and everything has been great so far.

aorwOKRa1XjGScX6CWzo1Q.text: Had one day of good service with an attentive waitress. Then I had really bad service in their to-go area. I explained my allergy 4 times to the attendant there, and at the end they get nothing right on that customized order.

SFdc2-gRgnSgA6dHtsz-iw.text: Huge variety of a menu to choose from, everything taste good, unique options arty great prices, I can't get enough of this place

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full Bar w/ TV&#39;s to watch the games

5IkV2tC53o3OrG7Jiv03kg.text: Sorry, but not sorry... food service was VERY slow. Took about 20 min to get our food from time of ordering. Quality was just ok... 2.5/3 stars. But when you're starving, as we were, the time factor was a big deal!

5DEdc2khfIIkD0f6m0b9qg.text: A line out the door was unnecessary because there was plenty of open tables.  I asked servers for water once I finally got seated and they responded with "I'm not your server".  Really?! Give me a damn water lmao!  I ordered a coffee and never received it. But the food was good, aside from being room temperature lol.

-wSnBHqq6OasmbX1CjNBgA.text: Great place for take out in the Palazzo. It's menu is identical to that of The Cheesecake Factory, so if you're from an area with this restaurant chain, you're probably better off trying somewhere new to eat in Las Vegas. However, if you're staying in the Palazzo and are craving something different than room service, this is a great option! It's just a few steps away from the guest suite entry. They tend to underestimate a bit on order time, so be prepared to wait. Also, after midnight they stop serving most of the menu and only offer burgers.

yJ3kQTrGiHhdOPMnglaM3A.text: 24/7 - large menu divided by time of day/night. I would advise to stick to things cheesecake factory (if you haven't read already, same owners) are good at such as pasta and specialty salad & "American Food".   The chicken wings were DELICIOUS. We got the asian flavored one. Perfectly crispy and flavorful. I ordered the half soup, half salad. The soup was not good. Too much cream & sugar (makes it sound like I'm drinking coffee doesn't it haha) but it was not tasty at all.   Large portion sizes but the price range is also higher, once again like cheesecake factory.   Oh and quick tip for the gals, I don't know why their floors are so slippery! But only in Vegas would you find awesomely maintained flooring. If you're wearing heels, be careful!   Restrooms are outside the restaurant, across the way inside the casino.

tYrLBPAczTR74d9Ex42pGA.text: Grand Lux Cafe reminds me a bit of the Cheesecake Factory in it's decor and food options. I was pleasently surprised at the prices though. For Vegas, this restaurant was one of the lesser expensive options. For $13.95 ordered the Alfredo noodles - which were excellent. Simple, but the sauce was creamy and delicious as though they made it from scratch. Also got a Warm Goat Cheese Salad. The 'fried' goat cheese balls were delish but did not enjoy the dressing as much....it had apple chunks drizzled with honey which made the salad just a but too sweet. Not bad though.   Everyone else at my table received their meals - all looked great and large portions. I would definitely come back!

3dKquroa1G84vMz0XETZng.text: Chicken & waffles, BRO.  After a long night, we were searching for food -- and TA-DA! GrandLux to the rescue. I am not really a huge fan of this place, but it was the best option of the time since many places were closed already and we didnt really want to eat at the food court. I was excited to see my favorite on the menu-- chicken & waffles! drooool. It was definitely no roscoes, but it did its job. Breakfast is always a good option for any meal of the day. Overall the restaurant is pretty big and the menu is good for large groups with people with different tastes. It has something for everyone!

6QBJBsCaZYaECe44vIj0lg.text: It's the Grand Luxe - I love this place.  It's basically like the grimy diner of vegas.  You're not their expecting amazing food.  You go there to get food energy to go back to pounding drinks and gambling like a degenerate.  The salads are surprisingly good, otherwise you get the fried crap that you eat at TGIF or a diner.  It's not great, but certainly not bad.  ++ It's open later than other places.

qkji0xpngwARoXXxSVy5MA.text: 5 stars for the staff.  Packed throughout the day during warmer months. Basically Cheesecake Factory with a shortened dining menu but an extended drink menu (wonder why). Breakfast / Brunch service is highlight of morning options.  You do get some of the showbiz locals who still think Cheesecake Factory is something miraculous -- had a short-term General Hospital actress gone internet soap acting go a little diva on us. She clearly wanted the attention, however, as she prominently sat at the end of an aisle booth...in a chair.  Manager is nice enough to come by when they are running out of something -- but they should probably prep the servers on this as it was a line used every day we dined there.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And this Calamari salad is on their smaller size plates.

KoQMiQbaki3BzJb6NPJO4g.text: We had to come back to this wonderful Cafe situated in the Palazzo. There is another location bordering to the Venetian.  We ordered the following items off the menu (during lunch time):  - Kobe Meatballs Kobe Beef Meatballs Covered in Marinara Sauce. Served on a Bed of Creamy Cheese Polenta. Two super big Kobe Meatballs that were juicy and flavorful, yet light enough. It is a meat-heavy meal, so you should order a salad to balance it out. It is an excellent plate to share.  - Chicken Parmesan A Chicken Breast Coated with Parmesan Bread Crumbs and Covered with Tomato Sauce and Mozzarella Cheese. Served with Pasta. This was a huge plate of spaghetti and Parmesan breaded tender chicken. Very delish.  - Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich Grilled Chicken Breast Topped with Avocado, Pepper-Jack Cheese, Corn, Lettuce, Tomato and Black Bean-Mayo on Our Grilled Flatbread. Ordered with a side salad which came with the Roasted Tomato-Caramelized Onion Vinaigrette.  Every single item was beautifully prepared and served. The price and food ratio is perfect, since it can be shared, but also consumed if you're really hungry.  Since this was our second visit at the Grand Lux Cafe, our server tipped us on a secret gem on the menu which is the Mediterranean Mahi Mahi. We will definitely be back here and try out more items from their huge menu.  NOTE: The restaurant/cafe is owned by Cheesecake Factory, thus not allowing the usage/redemption of the Grazie Player's Card points at this location.

5YH6Qj6TiynNfRzQQ92bPw.text: I don't always right a Yelp review but whenever I do it's because it was either very good service or the worst you could possibly get. I don't have anything to say about the food it was okay. But the customer service is horrible. You have to ask multiple times to get a water refill and send your food back three time just for them to get the order right and even the third time the order was wrong but how many time can you send it back.... On top of that your waiter just decides to disappear and not come back to your table so then you have to track down another waiter to just get your check. Considering this restaurant is in a five star hotel the service was very unprofessional.

wLUc6Es3Z7h_y9B4gtenyw.text: Grand Lux Cafe is my GO TO restaurant. Perhaps it's because I visit Venetian/Palazzo more than any hotel/casino.  My visits are quick and painless. There are MANY tasty, consistant menu items. The Grand Lux Cafe is similar to, and associated with the Cheesecake Factory.  There are 2 Grand Lux restaurants on the Venetian/Palazzo property. The Palazzo Grand Lux tends to be less busy and crowded than the Venetian.

XzcrDDpFiUzINEERzUtM8w.text: Every time I'm in Vegas, this is definitely my go-to spot. It's open late, and it has everything I want. From breakfast to dinner to dessert! What more could a girl ask for?  It's the cure to a hangover and for a starving girl after a night of partying or gambling! The smoothies ARE THEE BEST! Hands down! It rejuvenates your body!  But I must admit, I ALWAYS order the Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomatoes & Mushrooms. It's the best pasta ever. I don't think I've ever tried anything else, but maybe I should. haha.  OH! They have the best cookies ever. They're made just right. Crispy and moist...just how I like it!

t6W9ZU_0q-LZQ0uTArg4Gg.text: I like this place. $13.95 for a USDA Prime burger is great. Open late, and good service.

opZIEXg5iQ1l0F5pqPxx9Q.text: Good late night menu. I was happy they were open until 3am. I had a slice of the red velvet cake. It was a good place to catch a meal before we headed up to the room to bed at 2am!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XoUVD7OB1YlbgAIL7at-gw.text: Man everytime I come it's always a great experience. Tried the short rib grilled cheese and it was  . The food is always cooked to perfection.  #vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib grilled cheese

n7M0PA8pAfaQij2A6sOHKA.text: Extensive menu. This resturaunt is often packed with a long wait and doesn't take reservations unless you have a party of 6 or more.   Portions are huge. Meal was tasty. This place is modeled after the cheesecake factory.

DIpSpKsZcUjdHxO774ETaw.text: The sister company of Cheesecake Factory. I pretty much live for Cheesecake Factory. Unfortunately, Grand Lux just wasn't on par. They were just average in my opinion. I dined here twice on my recent trip to Vegas, as I stayed at the Palazzo. It is a quick and convenient restaurant to have inside a hotel.   My first visit was for take out. I ended up getting a lunch portion of their half BLT with a soup and salad. It was A LOT of food. Portions here are HUGE. The chicken tortilla soup was very tasty and very filling. I could tell there was a lot of sodium though, which is expected. There was so much bacon in the BLT and I am not one to waste bacon, but I just couldn't eat it all. Salad was ok. The balsamic dressing was odd but tasty I guess. Even though I tried to get something "healthy", I still felt very bloated after. Obviously all the sodium.
