x1IB31-T4XWs7keEw4w-rg.text: A night of gambling and drinking calls for FOOD... and PRONTO!!! Didn't feel like sitting inside and wanted to just kick it in our suite with the grub... so I opted for take out. Since we stayed in the Palazzo... I went to the Grand Lux Cafe downstairs.Kinda like a Cheesecake Factory. The menu had the same sort of feel. I wonder if they're sister restaurants??   I ordered take out from the bakery around the corner... ended up choosing a bacon cheeseburger with fries... no thousand island sauce and no onions with a side of ranch. The cute young cashier told me it'd be about 15 minutes. I went into the casino to gamble and pass time... and guess what?! I won $127 on the Wheel of Fortune $1 machine. AWESOME!!! Cashed out and went back to the bakery and the cashier told me it'd be a little wait longer... no problem! I called my Mom to tell her the good news and then called my boyfriend as well. We were on the phone for quite some time... and the employee started fixing the chairs and closing the door so I had to ask if the bakery was closed?! He said yes but that my take out order was coming. I hung up with my boyfriend... walked around the casino to eye out a machine... went back, and still no food! By then I was hungry and frustrated... looked at my phone and the ticket and realized it had been almost an hour! WTF?! Went in to the restaurant and spoke to the host and said I wanted a refund... even he was trippin that it had been almost an hour! I guess since I was gambling and on the phone the time just flew! As soon as the manager came out and I gave him my ticket the employee from the bakery brought my food out... almost at the exact same time! Once the manager looked at my ticket and realized it had been almost an hour he gave me the food and said "keep it and follow me for a refund". Score!   Got my refund, got my burger and fries, and enjoyed it upstairs in my suite. JUICY burger! HUGE patty. I mean HUGE! I love me a good burger and lemme tell you... it was ALMOST worth the one hour wait LOL! I'll be back again, but no take out!

QKwHHCS5INjT4DgPNH5QhQ.text: Small line, but the restaurant was packed. The service can be a tad slow, but I'd say it was worth the wait. The warm sourdough bread keeps you occupied, but consider an appetizer for extra entertainment. Might I suggest the Asian Nachos? You get several deep fried won tons about 4 inches in diameter topped with chicken, sour cream, guac, and the obligatory Asian sweet/sour sauce. Don't forget the upside-down bowl-molded heap of fried rice in the middle for your [dipping?] pleasure.  Now, to the main course items. It took me a while to figure out what types of food this place served, because they had a little bit of everything which leads to a menu that's too big for their own good. Nevertheless, the food tasted good--a bit simple, but full of flavor.  Giant portions, so they were definitely catering to the American crowd.  I had the cedar plank bbq salmon. A big fillet of salmon coated with a bbq glaze and then cooked atop a cedar plank, which is then lined with mashed potato and dressed on the side with a corn succotash and 3 sad looking onion rings. The salmon was delicious, and I could barely finish the mashed potatoes because there was so much.

NP1zimVu2yjmyRvspsKpYA.text: I always heard that the Grand Lux Cafe was the same owners at the Cheesecake Factory, so I was a little disappointed when I didn't see the Crusted Chicken Romano on the menu. Nonetheless, I ordered the LUNCH portion of the Chicken Piccata. I capitalized the word "lunch" because normally, it would be smaller than the full serving. I was wrong. It was HUGE. Plus it was a few bucks cheaper which was nice as well. It tasted pretty good. Plus the serving of penne was quite generous.

aCzjkd9FEkxXONP-KBHZzw.text: We ate here twice during our stay. They stay open very late so it was one of thr few places we had to chose from. Glad we did! The food is excellent, great menu selection. Definately a great choice to eat and very good service as well.

sBPCaeMEnk8r_luTI7PlGA.text: The MUSHROOM CREAM SOUP saved me many times during late nights!

GTWTxNbsYCp8eAGznVswig.text: Service was great, the decor was nice, the steak fries were the bees knees but my short rib grilled cheese was rather bland. I'd give it another try and just make another menu selection.

67YUgBf5nwLlM3y4r8Xomw.text: I really liked this place.  Apparently it was created by the creators of the Cheesecake Factory (I think).  The one in the Palazzo isn't 24hours, but the one in the Venetian  is open 24hours, and it is totally only a hop, skip, and a jump away.  I went there once for a very late night "snack", and once for brunch.  I have to say that everyone needs to try the sloppy joes, because they were amazing.  It reminded me of when we were in elementary school again, but it tasted 100x better!  For brunch, I had the express brunch, which is basically a little buffet of breakfast foods.  It wasn't bad, but I mean...who can mess up breakfast foods, right?  Overall, I love this place, and I want to go here everytime I'm in Vegas...and you should too!

KfZIGvvkCg86xYQDISLJeg.text: For a chain this place is kinda good (original is in LA and owned by Cheesecake factory) and I hate admitting something like that.   I like the Indochine Shrimp and Chicken- very mild flavor curry and has dried cherries and apricots. This is my favorite dish here.  I've tried an extensive part of the menu and all have been nice, but I still stick to my favorite Indochine.   I come mainly for the beignets. The other location in Venetian doesnt do beignets so you have to come to the Palazzo location for them!! I found that out the sad way of being psyched for some and I had to settle on cakes for dessert at the Venetian one. Beignets are crispy outside and soft and eggy interior  with 3 sauces: raspberry, chocolate and vanilla cream. I tend to like doing the creme mixed with raspberry sauce the best. Chocolate is good and rich so I tend to mix it with the creme sauce as well. To me the combo is better than eating each sauce by itself. Takes 20 minutes to make so order this when selecting entrees or youre SOL at the end of the meal unless you sit and wait.  Long time ago they had bomb napoleons with fresh fruit and all the locations took it away. Boo! They did it right so its a shame they pulled it.  I think for the dessert alone I will say I'm a fan and give it 4 stars.

8sb9CJ8Te7wxNFMStjgTXw.text: I've heard lots of good things about this place and I finally got a chance to check it out. Their menu is very similar to the Cheesecake Factory's menu (I think they may be sister companies?) and prices are VERY decent considering the portions and also considering the fact that you're in VEGAS where everything is expensive! My boyfriend ordered a bunch of tapas - calimari, duck triangles, and ahi ceviche and I had a breakfast sandwich which came with a generous portion of hash browns (yum!) I only finished half the sandwich and half the hash browns. They also have a weekend brunch that I will probably want to try next time... Def will be going here whenever I'm in vegas from now on!

qAGC5XO4fDgek1YsEUGwNg.text: Fresh hot coffee, generous portions, delicious foods, lots of selection & fantastic service.

KFrtAe_AaY4MPXU_16y-dA.text: Pasta Carbonara. Best dish, everything else is just overpriced American food. But the pasta is gooood, tastes even better when you're drunk and tired.

EoPyZ1rCI9JV3h1tL9Kk-g.text: Holy crap. I dunno why, but I really liked the Grand Lux Cafe.  I was expecting nothing special after seeing that it was essentially just a fancy version of a Cheesecake Factory. And our waitress seemed a little odd at first... well, she was a little odd, but maybe that was just cause she was psychic. She was really on the ball and knew what we needed before we did.  The bread they bring you at the beginning was REALLY crusty. Which I am all over, but if you are not a fan of crunchy things, you may want to just go for the moist center and leave the crust.  The food was excellent. I had the Pizza Margherita and Salad lunch special, and my wife had the Pasta Telephono and salad lunch special. The bleu cheese and vinaigrette dressings were fabulous. Good bleu cheese is hard to come by, but this place nailed it.  The pasta was cheesy and delicious. Came in a pink sauce (tomato + cream). If you are a fan of mac and cheese, you will probably like the pasta telephono.  The pizza Margherita was really fantastic. I'm the kind of person to be disappointed by pizza since we make it at home from scratch, but this pizza lived up to my standards.  And, did I mention the entire meal was vegetarian? We didn't even notice until afterward. I love that! Vegetarian without being in your face about it.  And, did I mentions the portions are generous? More than enough food!  So color me a fan. I really didn't expect it to be that good. I'm tempted to go again, so maybe I should try the Venetian location next time.

mByz2BrOORCa51dLWlcmFg.text: Found this place on yelp and it definitely lived up to the reviews.  It's so hard to find a place with great food and well priced.  I had the sante fe chicken burger at  $13 and my husband had the kobe meatballs $14. Both were fantastic and were so flavorful!  What a great find in the Palazzo!

cfM2qkY1aA_4vmm7DnWoOg.text: The veggie burger was a disappointment. It was mushy and fell apart. To their credit, they did take it back and got me a burger instead. Unfortunately my replacement showed up after my friend was finished eating. The server was friendly and really tried to help.

qOq2XGC-NZzROW9u28fqdw.text: One of those places you just go when you are staying at the Palazzo or Venetian because it's so convenient, has that menu item that every person in your party wants whether it be fake pho noodle soup or a burger, and you can crawl into the restaurant at 1:00am to satisfy your drunk hunger....   The bread basket they give in the beginning is probably the best part of the meal. The service is really slow....

vK7YY7CFiIWe3FLq70pUIQ.text: Ordered the pasta fresca. Very bland flavoring, pasta under cooked, veggies were not from the best gardens for sure.  This place scores lower than the average cheese cake factory.

G0zBmnLic5NjudYYstU_zg.text: I am in Vegas for a convention and I ate at GLux 3 times for breakfast. The service was horrible every single time. The first, just a bad day for the server. Second day, hmm well not good. This morning, it is systematic. Totally horrible, from the hostess who completely robotic, to the severs who have to be asked 2-3 times for everything to the slow service of the food. So disappointed.

janlcebj_ofPOOeqTACxsw.text: My wife and I ate here twice during our most recent trip to Las Vegas.  Yes, this restaurant is very similar to the Cheesecake Factory.  We both loved this restaurant.  If you're looking for a great place with some great food for a great price, you will not be disappointed here.  Like the Cheesecake Factory, there are lots of options for everyone on the menu.  The portion sizes are really good.  You'll get enough food, don't worry.  The free bread was really good.  It was a kind of wheat bread as well as some sourdough.  Loved them both.  Below is a list of what we tried:  Penne alla Vodka:  this isn't on the menu but my wife asked for this instead of the gnocchi with vodka sauce.  It was excellent.  One of the best we've had and we've had a lot.  This is one of my wife's favorite pasta dishes and she loved it.  Caeser salad:  Excellent as well.  Great portion size.  Chicken and Shrimp Jambalaya:  Really good flavor.  I really enjoyed it.  Pasta Tropheo (or something like that) with chicken:  Also very very good.  Delicious.  During our trip, we ate at several Italian places, and we both though the bread and pasta here were better than those other straight up Italian places.  Sadly, if we were staying closer to the Venetian, we might have eaten here a third time.  If you're debating, give it a try.  Also, we never had to wait for a table.

UuEC8d1uANr0BbnkP-rLcw.text: We have had breakfast there two mornings in a row.  Service has been great and food delicious!!!  Best hotel breakfast I have ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Loaf French Toast!!!  Delicious!!!!

oL5RV6l2D0EfTXgYOgiz4A.text: This is probably the only decently good quick place to eat at when staying at the palazzo. I've had a couple of things here before on the togo menu; the fettuccini alfredo which taste dry and thick, but the chicken is good if you add it in, could probably feed two people, any of the pizza selections are pretty good, chicken bites are satisfying and will do your stomach some justice before heading out. While dining in, the menu is huge, honestly there is so much to choose from, I kind of see that as a bad thing, makes people take a long ass time to order, but I ordered the Zen noodles which was like thai noodle soup, it was ok, soup was pretty decent, they don't pour all the soup in and leave it in a cup in case you want to poor the rest, it isn't huge, but I didn't expect that it would be.

7agsx_eGiEE7eF-qc2oXPQ.text: It's near 3am, we've had lots of drinks, pounded some ill-advised shots, and need food.  It's open and there's no line.  Already, we have a winner!  Being more objective though, this place is ok.  Owned by The Cheesecake Factory (which explains the massive menu, representing foods of all types), Grand Lux has a little bit of everything, and probably does most of it in an acceptable fashion.  Shared the: -Spring Rolls (Vietnamese Chicken Summer Rolls): pretty tasty, but poorly wrapped.  The paper kept tearing and the food spilled out all over our hands and the plate.   The Max Burger- Their "greatest hamburger creation!"  Burger, cheese, bacon, mushrooms, onions, and short ribs. This was the husband's ideas. it was ok. The individual ingredients were hard to single out as far as taste goes.    Even though the restaurant tries to be a fun, hip place, there were still the standard 3am Las Vegas servers.  Our waiter must have been at least 65 and wanted to be anywhere else but there.  What really surprised me about this place though, was the next morning (and by morning, I mean around 11am) there was an absurdly long line!  Those people should've gone to Dos Caminos (see review)!

pFx4FTdvInJCVkVe_vJ19g.text: One of my family's favorites!  Consistently excellent. Tonight, the boy had Sloppy Joe made w/ beef short rib!  Outstanding texture and flavor.  Its served in a New England roll (like a lobster roll bread) that is soft, tasty, toasted to a nice crisp on the outside and buttery.  Served w/ diced white onions.  Awesome. I had the chicken parm / shrimp scampi combo w/ angel hair pasta w/ marinara.  Outstanding and for $19.80. My wife had the spicy calamari salad.  The calamari was fried to perfection with a puffy, crisp batter that enhanced the flavor of the calamari. Be warned that the serving sizes are large!  We will be back!

V0U4hqKxiQKq3abJ53qqIA.text: I had to update my review after my lunch break yesterday. The food is still great but our service was horrible!! She kept forgetting to bring accompaniments that we had asked for with our food. She would never stop back at the table to check to make sure everything was okay either. When we finally had been waiting for ten minutes with our empty plates in front of us, she came over. I explained that we were already late to go back to work and needed our check right away. Mind you that we were late because we were always waiting on her to show up. When we gave her our payment, we watched her drop it next to a register and then go to another two tables to refill drinks and check on them. So clearly we were late getting back to work and got the crap end of the stick on service yesterday. Needless to say that when we return for lunch, I will make sure to not sit in her section. Horrible!!

6cUXFdNkfjJTAgYiKw2NyQ.text: We came to this location twice. The first one was for dinner before seeing "Jersey Boys" and the second was for a late dinner after a day/night of gambling on Fremont Street(where food is kind of ass).   Same bread as the other Lux, and the same menu except for desserts (they make home made beniegts and pineapple upside down cake). I also had Asian nachos both times which I swear are ingenious and DELICIOUS. Yes, Asian nachos-wonton skins (instead of chips), a light amount of cheese, scallions and a delicious spicy/sweet peanut sauce with a little wasabi "cream" which wasn't very noticeable but made a for just enough heat to send these over the top. Our first night, a bunch of us shared different things from calamari to said nachos to salad and burgers.   Our second time here, we were seated next to folks from San Angelo and Fort Worth Texas and started sharing butter/bites of desserts with the other tables and seemed to talk and talk for a long time about having teens, etc.  Desserts are worth it here for sure and though we had the same waitress both times (she was a bit weird), we would come back here again for sure.

L9gezC3EpyGzqdeFrdrorg.text: Always a stop on our Vegas trip.  Whether it's hang-over fulfillment or a start-your-day breakfast, or even a snack before the night starts all over again... this place is versatile and one-size-fits-all kind of joint.  Probably has one of the larger menus with variety compared to other places on the strip and best of all the amazing food is on the affordable side.  Open late, the Grand Lux Cafe makes a great Plan B too if you run out of daylight and still need to get your food fix on.  For much less and a much shorter wait, the morning buffet has good stuff...though probably not as much as the Bellagio Buffet.

ts8ZIBbVFLTZrCPto0dIKQ.text: We came here at 10:45 am and ordered two burgers and a sandwich and our waitress Christina told us that they might not have them available since it was still a breakfast time. Then we switched to some breakfast items; however, my kid started crying that he doesn't want eggs and I went to another waitress to ask if I can order burgers. She checked with the kitchen guys and told us that we can order them and it's gonna take them about 15 min to make. Then our waitress Christina came to us and I told her that I wanna switch back to burgers. She said I cannot do it since they've already started my order. What?!?!? You gave me the wrong info in the first place and now you don't wanna do anything to keep your customers happy? She was very rude and unprofessional with a very bad attitude that is not supposed to take place on the 5-star property such as the Venetian/Palazzo. She literally ruined my good impression about the whole experience at the Palazzo.

lWGemj0b-DxV0cz08fik5A.text: Lovely dinner after seeing a show in Palazzo theater. We all tried a variety of appetizers and sandwiches/burgers. Everything was if good quality. Not great but definitely good food and good value. Not overly priced. Our waitress was in a bit of a mood initially but that improved quickly and she provided great service.

zuOf4qNG4AtC7UayhQyhYA.text: I would have given them no star for service if I could. We live in Vegas, meet up friends for dinner at this place a lot for happy hours and catching up. We came here with a few friends recently, and they had completely forgotten my husband's order. Waitress never came back to check on us until we question where his food was. Poor guy was hungry and watching everyone eat. We came back a few days ago thinking that's was just one incident and these things have never happened here before. Oh boy! Were we wrong. The same waitress was servicing us. This time no one got any food. We waited for over an hour. No one came to check on us or realize we were there for over an hour. We asked a guy who brought food out for the table behind us. He went to check for us. Maybe 5 minutes later a manager stop by saying our food was coming. The waitress came back to take our order again. Really? Seriously? We walked out of this place after waiting for over an hour with an empty stomach. Horrible service. We were a regular, frequent customer, and they just lost our business and our friends too.

ZmkM70DgcMH6QScCzwRJyw.text: Grand Lux is good, fairly priced and service was spot on.  My complaint is that all the food is pretty salty.   We ordered the Fried Calamari with rock shrimp and that was awesome! super good!  Fish and Chips were good but salty.   Turkey Club was good but the bread was too hard and I had to remove the crust to finish eating it.  Bloody Mary was too salty.  Overall, it's a great generic restaurant with a mid-range price point.  Open till 3am too which is AWESOME

KKwtWRNYKRF5-5QYgtZKwg.text: Something has gone really wrong here.   I lived in Beverly Hills for a long time. The Grand Lux at the Beverly Center is a 5-star restaurant...therefore, it is staffed with only the finest servers and hosts. The servers at the Beverly location are trained to know the menu by heart, give recommendations, and even engage in conversation to make the dining experience more memorable. This location at the Palazzo has none of that. Yes, the food is still really good like at the Beverly location, but the service just plain sucks.   They always forget to bring out the free bread that all the Grand Lux and CheeseCake Factory locations ALWAYS provide for free.   The servers don't even say anything and even seem like they have difficulty articulating words in their heads. I know places like WalMart will hire mentally disabled people because the government pays them to do so, I have recently come to the conclusion that this place does the same thing.   I know that the Cheesecake Factory owns the Grand Lux and that the Grand Lux is supposed to be their high end restaurants, but in my opinion the Cheesecake Factory is far superior in food and in service. I recommend going across the street to the Cheesecake Factory at the Forum Shops, it has much better customer service and food.

5up9Q2NFdb050irreq8YaQ.text: I see a lot of comparison to the Cheesecake Factory and I can see some of that.  The decor is quite similar and maybe some of the dishes are comparable, but the prices are a bit steeper.  Since it was kinda late morning, I was still in the mood for breakfast.  I ordered an all meat omelette and some coffee.  The waiter was quite attentive as my coffee and water was always topped up.  When my food came, I couldn't believe the omelette that came from this place.  The egg looked like a sheet if yellow plastic wrapping around chopped pieces of meat.  It looked like they were cooked separately rather than together as it should be.  After a few bites, I couldn't take it anymore and had to tell the waiter this was unacceptable.  It was also missing the shredded cheddar and he recognized it.  When the new omelette came out, it actually looked like egg this time.  The sad part is that I'm not too stuffed to eat any of it and wasn't about to take this home or back to the room.    I give the service 5 stars, but the restaurant 3 stars.  The meat was quite delish, but how can you screw up an omelette AND forget the cheese?

vBczHqj_IJdPNmsP-oPrBw.text: This place is somehow related to the Cheesecake Factory of which I am already a huge fan. Although the line looks daunting it is actually a huge restaurant and you get in pretty fast. The food was yummy and reasonably priced. It came fast and service was good. We had the lunch specials with pizza/salad combo. The ranch dressing is really good. I would definitely recommend this option as a relaxing alternative to the harried food court.

7LM1ab1bss9Aq6pWRG_NZw.text: Driving to vegas, you can definitely expect traffic.  We had dinner reservations at 7:00 and there is a grace period of only 5 minutes.We ran there and got there at 7:04pm!  We asked the hostess if our reservation was still available and she said yes!  We were so excited we made it on time, yet after that, we had to wait because I heard the hostess mumbled to another girl that "She totally forgot" about our group -__-.  How do you forget if people made reservations?  We had to wait about 5 minutes and was then seated.  Our waiters were attentive with our group of 8 people.  This is a higher end than Cheesecake Factory and beware, when you look at the menu, it is massive which will make you very indecisive!!  I wasn't too hungry so I ordered the   Tomato and Fresh Mozzarella  Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic, Mozzarella, Fontina and Parmesan Cheeses. This was only $5.95.  I asked if they could add basil on it as well and they were kind enough to do that and it was the perfect size for little me!  Seafood Salad  Lump Crab, Shrimp, Avocado, Tomato, Corn, Green Beans, Egg, Celery and Green Onion Over a Bed of Crisp Romaine Tossed with Our "Louis" Dressing.  I had some of my friends salad and this was super refreshing and filling!  Potato Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce  Simply Delicious Housemade Gnocchi Tossed in Our Creamy Vodka Sauce and Fresh Basil.  Omg this was delicious....after a few bites!  I recommend ordering this but please SHARE with all the people at your table!  It can get kind of sickening after a few bites because it is so rich!!  Asian Pear Martini  Absolut Vanilia Vodka, Pear, Passion Fruit and Sake. Great martini if you want something refreshing and sweet!  A little pricey though...about $13.  Overall, great place to eat with a  variety of choices!!    NOTE: -Opened late for all you drunkies ;) -5 minute grace period if you happen to be a tad late

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mini pizza: Tomato and Fresh Mozzarella ...added basil :)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-0CHMqAh6DukE0s8AdJJCg.text: The Cheesecake Factory of Las Vegas! I believe there is an actual connection between the two, but stepping in here, you'd really see the connection for yourself if you're familiar with the Cheesecake Factory. The menu is very diverse and huge, with a variety of items to choose from. Grand Lux Cafe is located inside of the Palazzo Hotel, which was very convenient for me and my group since that's where we were staying. Great place for us to dine because we were able to just get ready in our hotel room, then go downstairs for dinner before heading out to the clubs or walking the strip. Price is great for what you get; just expect Cheesecake Factory pricing with the same big type of portion size as well! Great for sharing entrees, which is exactly what us 10+ girls did. Everything was really good. I tried a little bit of everything and was quite pleased with it all.

CdBeRd9al1UeNuhgtoUUig.text: Always the best spot for breakfast, lunch, and dinner when at the hotel.  And right off the casino floor.    Great service and selections.   I highly recommend.  Enjoy!!

qiF8MBDdUvi3rroXdhnVUw.text: Decent food, very reminiscent of Cheesecake Factory (I think someone said they were owned by the same company.) That being said, if you've been to a Cheesecake Factory you know what to expect from the food and from the prices.   Good if you want to dine on some nicer food without spending too much money.

8SLcld1WsqiQYFgW3eir_w.text: The hostess at the front desk was extremely rude (Nov 6, 17) 9am. She simply doesn't know what customer service should be. Very surprise a restaurant in 5 stars hotel hired employee like her.

njonApNmooVSfjGnk5nKvQ.text: I've been here many times over the years.  It's no surprise that this is owned by Cheesecake Factory.  Same type of menu (lots an lots of choices) and similar quality and taste, which is not to say it's bad but very standard.  This meal, I had the Sunday night pasta which was a solid 3 stars.  Knew exactly what I was guessing.  I'm sure I'll be back on future trips.

lCwXf9oBZLOscq0tx0DkvA.text: Nothing to complain about. Line to be seated moved fast. Breakfast was very good. Crowded conference morning but waiter was friendly enough.  Key is prices reasonable for the quality of food!  Good people watching if you sit along edge of hallway. Crazy place to find anything but worth the made!

0iEJ_Gi6Jj8EraWnGiAorA.text: This is a 24-hour / 7 days a week restaurant  in Las Vegas which is great if your hungry all hours of the day. It's affordable and has a wide selection of foods to choose from. It's an American Asian fusion cuisine and I've eaten here several times. The Asian nachos is unique and is a crispy wonton with mozzarella cheese, wasabi, chicken and a sweet goner sauce. The garlic shrimp pasta is good too and does not feel too heavy. The Indochine shrimp and chicken pasta is a curry dish with rice and comes a bit spicy. There's burgers, sandwiches and an alcohol list to choose from. It's in a nice Hotel and casino too.

ltOcwrB9lFxZ6OYooBJcrA.text: Always a great place to have a meal and drinks.  I would recommend this to anyone. Service was very good. The lunch menu was quickly process making this great for lunchtime stop.

E8ezqx-Yirsk4TOYZZ6YjA.text: One of the more convenient places to eat when you're at the palazzo. It's literally right down stairs. And the quality of food is pretty decent.  The servers here are pretty friendly. You get free bread for meals. They bring it out warm in a basket. We liked the sourdough bread but for some reason when the waiter came by she took our half finished break basket and said she'd come back with more... But she came back with wheat instead. Heart break. But overall the meal was decent. I had the clam chowder which was a little bit too salty but over all still good. Especially when you dip the bread in.   In the morning we came back. They have breakfast buffet until 12:45. It's just a basic breakfast buffet but I rather order off the menu. The Spanish rose is really good.   Service can be a bit slow. Especially when they're dealing with a crowd. So I guess if you care you should just go with the buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder

RVx9f9wFYwjwe927FVwoWQ.text: I always go to this grand lux at the palazzo because I work here, usually here during my lunch breaks, or if I need a quick bite to eat.   The reason I'm writing a review on them is because my most recent visit was not so pleasant. I usually sit at the bar because it's fast and convenient for me, I'm usually in and I'm out within 40 minutes. This time around wasn't the case. Although their food is amazing, always so filling, their customer service was not all that great today. Maybe our server Christopher (Filipino, with glasses) is new that's why he wasn't so attentive, but regardless, you're working at a casino on the strip.  Anyways, as soon as we ordered I let him know we work at the casino and he asked for our ID cards. Which is weird because they never really ask us, because we have our casino badges on.   Got our food, we ordered the lunch special of a small pizza and a side of salad. Mine was perfect, I had the bbq chicken pizza and my coworker ordered the margarita pizza, which was a little burnt. Oh well, it happens.   Soon as we got the check, we left. I normally like going when my regular server John is working. He's always so helpful and even suggests new things on the menu. I hope Christopher improves his services, that way it won't matter which server I get.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita pizza, a little burnt on the edges
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq pizza with a side of salad

Rg6aTwZ9Jw755srXWmo1ZQ.text: We had our wedding reception dinner here in the Grand Lux's private room. We coordinated the event with Rich over emails and twice in person (we live in LA). Rich was warm and accommodating but most of all reassuring as he has clearly dealt with nervous wedding couples before.  For the price, there really is no comparison. They are one of the most reasonably priced restaurants for large groups on the strip. But that doesn't mean their food isn't good. On the contrary, it satisfied our notoriously hard to please Korean and Chinese families. It truly was delicious food that wasn't overseasoned or too heavy or portioned too large (or too small).  The fudge cake dessert was the real topper and people couldn't get enough of it.  The staff that night was incredible. Extremely helpful while staying completely out of the way of all the action.  If you are looking a place to have your wedding reception dinner, I'd definitely check out the Grand Lux Palazzo. We are over the moon satisfied with our experience on all fronts.

DgsO1mYHQeYH0lMsEuMGlw.text: You know that problem you have when you go to Cheesecake Factory and you simply cannot decide what you want because everything looks good?  Multiply that by five when you come to Grand Lux Cafe.  Literally, the menu is a Cheesecake Factory menu on steroids.  It's always great to have choices, but I was literally looking at the menu for 10 minutes because I just wanted to eat everything on the menu!  American, European, Asian food is laid out to bare.  After finally deciding that it was probably a good idea to not bomb myself to death since I was going to Marquee later that night, I settled on the shaking beef and caramel chicken combo platter with some roast beef cheese fries.  Beef was cooked very well, chicken was tasty.  The quality of the ingredients was top notch, you know you're getting freshness here.  Typical large Cheesecake Factory portions.  Obviously not the cheapest, but it's no more expensive than a regular Cheesecake Factory and it's about on par with affordable Las Vegas Strip dining.  Just like Cheesecake Factory, if you want to have a good meal and not feel ripped off, Grand Lux is definitely the spot to go.  Whether I'd come here for the sole purpose of eating here is another matter, since I only came because I was staying at Palazzo.  But if I had to placate everyone in a party, I'd probably take this.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shaking Beef and Caramel Chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot Roast Cheese Fries

eMML2P56GsvEfM4L1MCQ_Q.text: 5+ stars for our server Maria! She was really genuinely kind. Remind me of a motherly-figured.   - She brought out soup for my friend and saw that she didn't already have her napkin towel on her laps yet so she kindly did it for her.  - spoke to us very kindly, respectful - followed up literally on everything she recommended.  - great recommendations (my favorite is chicken pot pie!!!!! I always get this in Vegas) - our drinks were never empty  - reminded us at the end to have a great day, and to have lots of fun! - etc....  Palazzo is lucky to have her!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets with dipping sauces!! Yum
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portion of chicken pot pie! Perfect for hangovers

t0eE6Vq6ofuhUD6cetlg_A.text: Justin give us amazing service hes a great guy I had the avocado burger and it was off the hook the girls ordered a seafood salad that I think possibly was one of the best salad I've ever had in my life I just wish there was a little more shrimp on it

wYkE7M1EcFj7j0qrlY9OAQ.text: My friends and I came here for brunch twice during our recent trip and were disappointed both times. The quality of the food, presentation, and ambiance were all good, but service and selection were a problem.  The first time we came, we arrived at 11 and ordered breakfast - we had our hearts set on the chilaquiles and the churro french toast. Our waiter didn't tell us that breakfast was over until he went to put in our order and the computer wouldn't accept it. We had to go through the whole process of reading that 10 page menu twice. We thought breakfast didn't end under after 12, but apparently that only applied to the buffet, not ordering from the actual menu. Fine, ok, misunderstanding and we were willing to let it go.  The next day we came back with more than an hour to spare before breakfast ended. We ordered, and again, our waiter (different one than the previous day) told us that he went to the computer and they were completely out of french toast. He couldn't have told us this when we ordered?? So we had to go through the whole ordering process again, twice. What kind of restaurant runs out of food with more than an hour of service left to go? Apparently they order supplies based on last year's orders...but if you run out, and you can't record someone's order because the computer won't let you, then your order is always an underestimate? We were really annoyed by the way this was handled from a staff and administrative level.  I would not go back here. If you're not picky about what you want to eat, you'll be fine. I know what I like and I'm picky, so it's not easy for me to be flexible when they screw up.

sxd0IwtXntcuMaEH3xnAng.text: Grand Lux Cafe (Palazzo) Las Vegas Strip, NV 5:30pm Monday 5th August 2013 Five Stars  This is the Cheesecake Factory of Las Vegas.  The menu is intensive, the prices are reasonable, and the portion size is huge.  Sara had the Crispy Sesame Tofu Stir Fry ($13), which was gigantic and very tasty except there was not a very sesame flavor to it.  I had the Cobb Salad ($15), which was fresh and delicious.  The Chicken was plentiful, shredded throughout, and moist.  The Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, and Hard boiled Egg were all great.  Overall, this place is the perfect spot for an inexpensive but tasty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Sesame Tofu Stirfry
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb Salad

J0-DQC3MDozIMM7X4s0FuQ.text: The Grand Cobb Salad.   Enough said!   I honestly think deep down this meal alone makes up to at least 5 to 10 percent of the reason I even go to Vegas.  Always a must have for me!

WVYp77_TCdA5xKpoDp-Y5Q.text: If you want a filling and enjoyable meal in Vegas but aren't quite sure what you want, come here and you'll find something to like. Their menu is huge and quite varied. I had the spicy carnitas sandwich (shredded roast pork with avocado, cilantro, black beans, onion, and a freshly made red chili sauce sort of like salsa on ciabatta bread). I wasn't sure what to expect due to the varied menu but this tasted like something out of an excellent Tex Mex restaurant and the chili sauce had the right spices and flavor. It comes with fries but after several days of Vegas eating I figured a salad might be a good idea so I subbed a side salad w their vinegar dressing at no charge. I also tried the fried pickles which were okay but nothing special and I'd probably skip them next time.  Service was friendly and I'll come back here to try more of their menu. It's the perfect place for a good meal when you don't want five star Vegas prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried pickles
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy carnitas sandwich with side salad

6xXF8o8G2-iKfobqzqz1Pg.text: I love the Pastrami Hash, it's available all day long and you can't beat the quality.  Service has always been great and the kids love the Molten Lava Cake for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Hash and Eggs with Bloody Mary

zDaTsODdLjIBC2s6kWCg2w.text: I'm not giving full stars only because I'm big on healthy food options and I'm not sure I can call grand lux that - it's heavily processed food but dammit it's delicious! Got takeout from here a few times as a convenient option while staying at Palazzo. The prices are decent, portions are huge. I enjoyed every dish we tried - enchiladas, jambalaya, tacos, chicken fingers kids meal ... my fave was the crispy caramel chicken! Reminded me of PF Chang's so good. Gigantic portion. Highly recommend.

ESemfYcCCVs2Tl2WvG4zJQ.text: I work in the spa and frequently order food from here to go. So far everything that I have preferred has been very good and reasonably priced. I met the manager(Tony) and he was very personable.

5Z-OjYHj_tqvqBPDsqNIgQ.text: This is based on their breakfast buffet. It's not a huge selection, but it has all of the important items. I went to the omelette station for a bacon and cheese omelette. It was great. The bacon, hash browns and english muffins were as well. Great orange juice and service. I'm glad I came here and I will be back.

Lx9HKI9UR_1LjVNO7AM7eQ.text: Loved this place! They have 24 hour dining and the menu has tons of stuff to choose from. Free parking and great service too!! I ordered the Jambalaya and my husband had the Miso glazed Salmon. Both very good.

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bourbon Smash

GHi6wlUXo0kjjoLe5Vpmcg.text: I've been here a couple of times, more recently for breakfast.  I don't remember my first experience too clearly, so this review will be based on their breakfast.  I came here on a Tuesday morning around 8:30, so there wasn't a wait for a table.  To eat, I ordered their egg white omelette with spinach, mushroom, and Swiss cheese, and it came with hash browns and choice of toast (English muffin for me).  It was alright, worthy of three stars.  I'm bumping Grand Lux Cafe up to four stars though because of their sweets.  I had their salted caramel pudding, which I very much enjoyed since I love me some salted caramel!  I also had a coupon for free beignets which came out warm and very tasty :)  Their entrees get about three stars, but their desserts take it up to four for me and are the stars of the show here!

s3_EYHGVVwEkf-cv7ic1tQ.text: We dined here for breakfast because we were staying at Palazzo. The breakfast selections were decent, although a but pricey for basic items. I am giving the food a 3 out of 5. Service was less than 3, about a 2. Our waiter Donato was very slow and took a long time to bring items to the table. By the time the regular maple syrup arrived, one of the people in our group had already finished their waffle. My toast also took awhile to come out. My eggs were cold by the time it arrived. Tip...when people already have their plates, do not stop to do other things or stand behind the computer. Bring the items needed for people to eat their meals while warm. I am sure we will come back for the convenience, but make sure to not have that particular server.

njTiqtZ0g-8WRxu7rrzfgg.text: This is a great place to grab a bite if you're staying at the Palazzo (or Venetian, they have a location there as well). They have a huge menu. Service is a little slow (takes a while for food to come out).  I come here purely for the Belgian Waffle. I swear it's the BEST waffle ever. It's very crispy on the outside, but so soft and light once you bite into it. And the sauce! Oh my, it's to die for. It has a kind of caramel-y + butterscotch taste. Not your typical maple syrup. The waffle is the same if you decide to go for the Fried Chicken & Waffles dish instead. Chicken is also very yummy.  I can't comment much else for their other dishes, since there are just too many options to choose from. This is always a must stop place in Vegas, even if I'm not staying at Palazzo!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CSchXtwpVnt8H_7dX9k2KA.text: I was sorry to see that Shaking Beef no longer appears on the dinner menu, but nevertheless enjoyed a very good substitute entree of Salisbury Steak that was slathered with a really thick mushroom-laden Brown Gravy and topped by a high ridge of tasty Mashed Potatoes.  The steak was about 8 inches long, and surrounded by somewhat hard but fresh broccoli, green beans, and sweet potatoes.    But before I dug into the chopped sirloin, I reveled in buttered slices of the Grand Lux's renowned complimentary sourdough bread; enjoyed a few of Diane's addictive Pot Roast Cheese Fries; and at length polished off a large app of Crispy Thai Shrimp & Chicken Spring Rolls and a Mini Luxor Salad with Garlic Croutons and Blue Cheese Dressing.  The Spring Rolls were filled with thinly diced shrimp and chicken that tasted great joined with a few carrot slivers and a single mint leaf before being enveloped in lettuce leaves and then dipped in a very vibrant Thai Sweet-Hot Chili Sauce.  The salad proved unnecessary, but was otherwise a good small lettuce and tomato-based dish.  Another night savoring fine comfort food at this grand establishment!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salisbury Chopped Steak with Mashed Potatoes and an Array of Fresh Vegetables
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Fish &amp; Chips

o0jmRjQrSmAePRAupiSMrQ.text: I'm only writing for the desserts take out, I didn't eat in. I was in the mood for sweets (that's my sin in Vegas: gluttony!) and came here for take out since my room has a great dining table in it. I got the strawberry short cake and they had it ready and deconstructed for me to put together on my own. The molten chocolate cake is made to order, so you have to wait 20 minutes or so. It works out since there's the casino right outside of the restaurant so that's how we killed time.   Desserts were delicious and worth the wait. I'll have to try the restaurant the next time I'm in Vegas.

oYE5BS6bNk8E80ZQFFDK0A.text: I was a bit disappointed with the food.  I do enjoy myself some good Cheesecake Factory but thumbs down for grand luxe.  Our waitress, however, was awesome and attentive and was very welcoming.  I got the artichoke spinach dip to start and had the chicken Madeira for my entree, per her recommendation.  Needless to say I had to send the Madeira back.  It was just drenched in the sauce and the flavors were a bit too overwhelming.  This is my brothers favorite place and would probably give it another go, but with something else.

oCH_SQik_uLAsvEBX6lmOg.text: If Neo from the Matrix and Rob Schneider had a lovechild, it would be our waiter. He was nice enough but was definitely a wanna be aspiring model/actor. In his own head. Slightly arrogant, a little geeky yet still helpful. He was an interesting character to say the least.   Service aside, the Grand Lux is a sister restaurant to Cheesecake Factory. Similar menu items and always large portions. The co-habby and I often opt for the "small plate" version and my favorite dish is the Salmon Picatta over a bed of mashed potatoes served with a caper-filed, tangy sauce. I can't remember what the co-habby had because he was too busy laughing at our waiter while impersonating him. He's going to hell, lol. But great comedy relief...we truly thought he was acting in a starring role and we were the extras. But I digress.  The menu is vast and if you do order a regular entree, I suggest splitting it with a friend as the portions are monstrous. Beautiful decor, plenty of options for different appetites and reasonably priced plates. Definitely one of our favorite stops when in Vegas.

x306Gbkt4Y48Ta-vSMVQWA.text: The food here is amazing!!! The service is even better! Our server/waitress Mariella, was a joy to be with! She was attentive, gave great suggestions and custom made my asparagus!!! Loved her! Thank for a great bday experience!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie pasta!!!!!!

v-tSutSwzO4tY0s3I5HM7g.text: Really loved the food here. Didn't expect it to have generous portions for the price. Food was awesome  my family and I loved it so much we came her two times in a row for dinner. Thankfully they were 24 hours and also kid friendly. Families do appreciate it especially staying in this part of vegas with young children. Servers were on top of it for the late night service.   Only thing I didn't care too much for was the Asian nachos the peanut sauce was just a bit over whelming a little less goes a long way. The depth of flavor is strong so it took over more; than tasting the other ingredients as a blend as a Asian nacho.

EzwgvoqY9sTcHLaSA2aGig.text: Simply 5 stars.  Open 24 hours.   Great food.  Big menu with everything made perfect.   Prices are good, especially for being in the casino. Lots of room.   They also offer a breakfast buffet that is small but real good. Fresh omelette bar and breakfast basics are done well. Fresh squeezed orange juice refills.   I'll be back for sure.  Enjoy!

JNIcMnJr9MA5k37HqMLOQw.text: I had Filet Mignon with mashed potatoes it was great. The steak was well seasoned and it's my favorite cut I can be kinda particular about it. But they did it right. For desert I ordered the Butter Cake w/Vanilla Ice cream delish. I have been here before and it's always been good.

82Vu3xG7IBZn2LYf_oTvKg.text: one of the my favorite chains. I love everything on this menu. This is the same brand as Cheesecake Factory. This restaurant has huge portions! It's located inside of the Palazzo! I love this location a little bit more because they have fried pickles on the menu which are a 10! Super crispy and comes with a great dipping sauce,  going  to want to ask for extra sauce! All of the pastas are great, I fell in love with the eggplant fritter! They close earlier than the other location inside of the Venetian. Service is always great here! The staff does wonderful and the food is always out fast even though the place is packed! n9vsN57LvQTYj4WpydvGOA.text: My family and I were looking for a nice breakfast place. We came across this through the high rating on yelp. The food was great, we were satisfied with our waitress as well. The wait time for the food however, took a while to come out. That's the only downside to it. Everything else was amazing. I would go here again, maybe try their lunch menu instead.

G2VhaOAwR0IB2GTqmrWuEg.text: We've dined at this 24-hour restaurant located inside the Palazzo hotel several times and the food and service are consistently stellar. The menu offers lots of options as you would expect from a restaurant affiliated with The Cheesecake Factory brand. Dishes we've tried and would recommend include: Double Stuffed Potato Spring Rolls, Poke Tacos, Sunday Night Pasta, Pasta Carbonara, Sausage, Pepperoni & Mushrooms Pizza, Southwestern Salad, DeLux Breakfast Sandwich and Bagel and Lox platter. Portions are always plentiful and likely enough for two if you're in the sharing mood.  Tip: If you can, be sure to visit during their happy hour for great prices on cocktails and appetizers. They also have great lunch specials.

8l3tBYiEAJzA7kp_yP2BJg.text: Awesome place to eat!  This one located in Palazzo hotel in the casino.  HUGE selection, always great service, large portions, delicious variety of  drinks & open 24/7 !!  I've been to this location twice now. I have had the chicken lettuce wraps, steak sandwich, and peach bellini.  This was enough food to eat, then take left overs big enough for my husband and myself to eat the next day.   This morning I had coffee and baileys, and we split the breakfast sandwich (came with hash browns which were exceptional! ).  The only reason it lost a star ( four not five ) was the drinks. They were  bit too sweet and lacked any alcohol taste ( the cocktails ) and the coffee was so strong it took 2 sweet n low plus a sugar in the raw. No worries - this happens a bit too often in Vegas so keep a mini bottle handy to top it off !

0SmWuE0k7UmZ0ZddRCE26Q.text: Ordered sausage with chicken mango apple sausage. Added bananas and strawberries to the fresh toast.  - French toast was crispy on the outside and soft from inside, not your traditional French toast but I liked it. 2 thick big pieces and was enough to share. -mango apple sausage was good. Perfect addition to the toast.   Friendly server and nice ambiance.

UDyYVagztAayulGygQV3Sg.text: Came in trying to find a inexpensive place to eat some late lunch after traveling all day.  Everything around me is expensive but I remember getting a good, reasonably priced breakfast sandwich last time, and just came in to check for breakfast options the next morning, BUT, they were serving breakfast, limited at 5pm, but they had a standard eggs, hash browns and some great toast! Came with 3 eggs, a large qty of delicious hash browns and awesome sourdough toast.  All of hot and fresh, for $9.95.  That's it!  I guess I'll be eating here three times a day!!  Just refreshing to find sone good food, inside the palazzo, that was still a good price!

_TPMLikMgtYp0-qx5qE09A.text: You can't go wrong with anything here!  1. I'm so wowed by this place. I came in thinking that because it's in a hotel, it's just okay but the reviews are so right. 2. Menu is extensive, which can be a warning sign, but there's something for everyone. 3. We got Asian Nachos, Margherita Pizza, Wood Grilled B.B.Q. Burger, and a Roast Turkey and Brie Sandwich. 4. Asian Nachos are so weird to me. About 8 fried wonton wrappers topped with random ingredients, including black beans and fried rice. Honestly, skip this. But do get the Margherita Pizza and Roast Turkey and Brie Sandwich. The pizza was made perfectly and I loved the crust. The sandwich had thick slices of turkey and the flavors were well balanced. 5. Service is superb. Kitty checked in on us multiple times to make sure we had everything we needed. 6. Don't forget to order your dozen chocolate pecan cookies and have one while they're hot!

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and butter
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos

o207GycneuNhAlUpiX8-Rg.text: Grand Lux Cafe is amazing! After spending the day at the TAO day club, my boyfriend and I wanted to dine at a decent but reasonably priced restaurant for dinner. We looked up various restaurants and decided on the Grand Lux Cafe.   The restaurant is dimly lit and provides a romantic atmosphere for your meal. The staff are very friendly and service is exceptional. We were given detailed explanations of each dish we were interested in and our waitress had a great attitude throughout her service. We ended up deciding on Crispy Fish and Chips and the Cafe Beef Wellingtons, Wellingtons as a suggestion by our waitress. Their portions are extremely large, making the prices very, very reasonable! The food was absolutely delicious and it hit the spot after a long day at the pool in the sun.   The Fish and Chips were fried perfectly: crispy on the outside but extremely tender and moist on the inside. Once we took a bite of the Beef Wellingtons, we knew why the waitress insisted we try this dish out. It was one of the best Beef Wellingtons I've ever had - The pastry on the exterior was mouth-wateringly flaky and added a wonderful crisp to the Wellingtons. However, the steak on the inside was the real winner of the show. It was cooked medium-rare and was juicy and flavored with just the right amount of savoriness without taking away from the meaty flavor. Even the sides of the dishes were great. Fish and Chips came with fries and various dipping sauces and the Beef Wellingtons came with sides of mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts, both delicious and paired well with the Wellingtons.   Service was great, the waitress who served us was very light-hearted and made our dinner very pleasant. Atmosphere is great for a casual dinner with family or significant other. I really enjoyed my experience at Grand Lux Cafe and will make a point for me to visit next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellingtons

xLn6VkZebZJBBWJMSyYalw.text: Pork chop was AMAZING!!!! our server pierr provided excellent customer service!! Definitely reccomend this place

2CNCwvEIIvPQhrObF_ikfQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! This place is consistently amazing. I tried the "Nashville Hot" sandwich for lunch and it was truly mouth watering! Fries were fresh and crisp, service at the bar top was impeccable and friendly. Will make this a regular spot when in Las Vegas for lunch!

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar area. Lisa was awesome! Thanks, Girl!

RTjgsNZXsaqNOJ3mQVrGsA.text: We were searching for a good breakfast spot one morning. We were originally looking for another restaurant in Palazzo but after 15 mins of searching and not being able to find it, we asked a security guard if he knew where it was. He gave us directions but recommend that we go to Grand Lux instead because the food is better and less pricy. I'm glad he gave us the recommendation because the food was great.   Grand Lux is like a better version of Cheesecake Factory. The Breakfast menu is pretty large. You can either go with the breakfast buffet for $20 or order from the menu. We chose to order off the menu because I wanted waffles and my boyfriend wanted a crab omelet and never was an option on the buffet. The chicken & waffles are EVERYTHING! It's served with pecans and maple butter sauce. It tasted like butter pecan! My boyfriend enjoyed his crab and asparagus omelet. The portion sizes are huge and we couldn't even finish our meals.   Service is great as well. We were seated and served promptly. Our food came to the table within 10 mins. I liked that it was open 24 hours. If we wanted food late at night and other places around us was closed, this was a great go-to option.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and asparagus omelet with hash brown
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles... convinced God himself cooked this dish!

fqwSCcfRyxiMhSiAsn7U_A.text: Great food and prices in the midst of much higher pricing. Ate there twice on this trip.

Ac6ME_wm7j-phxX2rXlqsQ.text: This is literally my 2nd or maybe 3rd review ever on Yelp. This is the 3rd time that I've tried the Grand Lux Cafe and I felt the need to write an honest review. This place sucks. Unless you get lucky and get a booth, the tables are packed in so tightly it feels as if you are eating at a communial table. Kind of awkward. Server seemed in a hurry and aggressive. Joes Scramble for breakfast was incredibly bland and sad at $15. The ground beef clearly had no seasoning at all and just made for lot of chewing boring food. At least it came out really hot but I had to douse it with Tobasco to get through itm My gf now questions my choice of restaurants lol Yeah never again.

prE_LI0TzpMermxe8eSbZA.text: Got right in. Food was great! Reasonable prices for Vegas. Wait staff was professional and courteous.

FROFjZdpas8C3gaDBcmiMA.text: My favorite place to go and have a guaranteed delicious meal! My go to would have to be the Salmon 3 Ways! I first learned about this place in Vegas! I'm so glad that Atlanta brought one here! They won't disappoint!
