j0-WT7U3Ya30J-n_PDPYRA.text: Breakfast quesadilla: 5/5 Breakfast sandwich: 3/5  Waiter was great, I loved my breakfast quesadilla but the wife's breakfast sandwich was bland

zP9E2EwQSkYgikVrCd5ndw.text: The service was excellent. The food was meh...plenty of other better places in Vegas. It was just convenient at the time.  (Update) Thank you for your kind response. Yes, we let our waitress know in real-time as well.

M5xyTsMIe4JPL-ViwSkfeA.text: My wife and I went there yesterday when we sat down the plate was dirty which we understood happens sometimes. But then there was a FLY in her Mai Tai, A FREAKING FLY!!!! The manager was so laissez-faire about it that we just got up and left. Check your food and drinks, health isn't of importance at this place.

P08Za7JBqkW9SVDQuuFUCQ.text: This Breakfast Brunch is a must-try if you're staying at Palazzo or Venetian!! Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, macaroni and cheese, breakfast hash, chicken and steak dishes, chicken pot pie and a plethora of sliced fruits! Everything tasted wonderful and fresh.   The service is lacking if you're seated out on the patio but all other times we've eaten here it's been very good.   Will definitely be dining here again in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Buffet plate. Happiness!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini chicken pot pies! Cute and flakey!

nZCUx3UUpjWjpVYlUCM-UQ.text: Brunch here was delightful. We selected the buffet and I had no complaints. Omelet was delish, juice selection was great and fruits and pastries were fresh! I'm glad we waited the 10-15 nights to be seated. Our waitress was wonderful too!

ZImkNqLJPzvETgPl4dhtUg.text: Review for their Beignets only. My friends and I were craving something sweet and decided to order the beignets. Oooo this hit the spot! Beignets were crisp on the outside, soft and warm on the inside and the dipping sauces were amazing!! I definitely recommend!  *Please keep in mind they only serve beignets at the Palazzo location and not at the Venetian.*

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets

GswlqO66cqYDRfvXhDkFGg.text: We went here for breakfast a few times while in town and it was good. They have a huge menu and everything was very fresh and reasonably priced. I had a garden omelette and the eggs Benedict and both were delicious! The service was great. They are open super late at night too which is nice if you want a late night snack.

v6QzeWQD9b-Otb7BOvSFxw.text: This spot is a great sit down place in the Palazzo where you don't have to be super fancy or spend $100 per plate. Offering breakfast lunch and dimner, and even pick up options they are convenient.   The menu is large similar to Cheesecake Factory as they are the same company. But without the cheesecake assortment lol. Usually spot on with freshness and correct orders although they are quick to fix issues if there is anything incorrect in your order.   I really enjoy them for lunch, the club is delicious and a must try!

JGnxoLLnOyMry1bnR4e8vQ.text: Always enjoy coming to Grand Lux Cafe for special occasions! We enjoy the menu and trying new items, the kitchen is consistently serving the best meals. Never left disappointed. & the servers are very timely and attentive. Constantly clearing plates and checking for refills. We love bringing our guests from out of town who are staying on the strip here. I believe it is a sister company of Cheesecake Factory, so delicious. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My all-time favorite calamari!

kUWaxuoLM-1pSMLGAWfj1Q.text: We love eating here when vegas. Open 24/7 and love love love their shrimp scampi. Today came in the morning and got the chicken and waffles. The chicken tastes super yummy. I love the breading and the meat is very moist. Also here they have beignets. The Venetian one does not. They are really yummy right out of the oven when they are warm. They come with 3 sauces. Anyways I recommend it. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iTuPPclbYQZWNyptG-4sNw.text: It is hard to find bad food in Vegas, but you won't be disappointed if you eat at Grand Lux Cafe. This was my first time to eat here for breakfast and it was very good. I recommend the Biscuits and Gravy!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and Gravy

eobDikU9x9CiGEPWPvE3CQ.text: Dude I wish I took a picture of my cobb salad, because it was bomb. I've read reviews saying this place was just your basic go-to place to fill up on food and sustenance before/after partying at Vegas. I admit I did not believe it would be that great when my group walked into the restaurant. It was 12am midnight and we had just come back from a concert, hungry and tired. Grand Lux Cafe is literally inside the Palazzo. We sat outside with the great view of slot machines and the smell of cigarette smoke wavering around us. mHhmmm deliciousness (sarcasm).   SERVICE -Not too shabby. We had a huge group and they quickly accommodated us. It was also a weird time to eat so it wasn't crowded or anything, but it wasn't like we were the only ones there either.  -Food took 20+ minutes to get but our party size was around 12 people or so. Keep your group small if you are in a hurry.  LE MENU -Cobb Salad was perf. Lettuce was juicy and sweet. Bacon was amazing. Loved the sliced cherry tomatoes. Avocado portions were generous (that's what I'm talking about). Chicken wasn't too dry. Salad dressing was perfection. It came out on a huge dish and I ate it all!  -Friends ordered off of the breakfast menu, so your standard hash browns, potatoes, corn beef, etc. -Jambalaya, Asian wonton tacos, pastas, just to name a few of the other dishes my friends ordered.   PROS -Good easy access food when you're hungry -Portions are generous  CONS -the smoke X__X

l72XSJaG9fDd5D9Yx6yFBA.text: Ok, we had the brunch buffet and the hash browns were cold... we were sat in the bar area against the wall.  Not to say that we should of asked for better seating shame on me for not asking to be reseated.

y4_NVqIrCx4mJZmerKFk8A.text: The buffet room was a little small for the capacity of the eatery ; and selection (when we were there) was mostly breakfast eats and various and sundry edible doodads. What we did sample, , was good--not exemplary, not drop dead delicious, or terribly toothsome--but just fine for a buffet. Ambitiously, I ordered the southwest salad and the presentation was quite pleasant, the proportion of ingredients perfect and the taste was fresh uncorrupted by slathered dressing. The citrus thousand island was unique and noteworthy. Acoustics were just fine and the decor was pleasing and uncramped. Would come back again

3e9S0j1p1XBYrDu1NNkWHA.text: Almost choked on a piece of paper in my salad, all the manager had to say is "I'll take it off your Bil"

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N2MCREnAhyQQIUVKrEtHSg.text: Only had take-out from here for their dessert but finally went in for lunch...had the pasta and salad lunch special which was extremely good and a lot larger than I thought it was going to be...my kid had their fish and chips and loved them...five huge pieces of fish however he said the fries weren't that great and he's a fry kid so he should know...ended the meal with their New Orleans Beignets which could have been cooked a tad longer since they were slightly raw in the middle...overall a good place to eat

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Orleans Beignets
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pasta &amp; Salad lunch special

MzCXydcPqHjHSB6cXw3sWg.text: Can't stand large breakfast spots typically but this didn't disappoint. A. Good service b. Total cost $17 for omelette platter and coffee c. Fast d. Not too noisy as it's at end of casino...it worked...since I'm not a big breakfast person I think I need to go back and try it for lunch food, we were with a party of 12 and the pace and service was good. Heads up that a bacon slab is not traditional bacon..it's a slab of fried fat...had to return that for normal bacon.

MxQYJ7gdY-CjKFDEr5T5Fw.text: This is my favorite place in Las Vegas for breakfast, especially if you are staying in The Venetian or Palazzo.   Their menu is full of the typical breakfast meals, like steak and eggs, pancakes, French toast, and different types of scrambles. I really like their mocha lattes and beignets :) Anyway, the customer service is always great-the staff is friendly, quick and welcoming. Every time I've been here, I have left with a full and happy tummy!

G86elHAzFsJsF5zB4hoTFA.text: This was my second time at this restaurant. I was so impressed the first time I had to come back. The food was amazing, I had the Garlic Shrimp Pasta which was to die for. My server Ms. Ethel was very attentive with exceptional personality. I would definitely come back here due to the quality of food and service.

prQj2NhEHIMDYBmkTkxTYw.text: Excellent service, reasonable price and great food. Ask for Amelia...she is a fabulous waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The breakfast here was the bomb!

rYLQ4fDgXXS2J4u-xcmNPQ.text: This place has become my go to restaurant when leaving Las Vegas. It doesn't matter which casino I stay at, I make sure to head to the Venetian to eat at the Grand Lux Cafe. They have a large menu and everything is really good! If you're craving breakfast but make it in afrer 11 AM, the lunch menu still includes a few breakfast items.

-nak2p0WAq_Y2c5cM8Vh4g.text: 4 1/2 stars. I came in for breakfast since I know how consistent this place is. Park in the underground parking next to the casino elevator for easy access to this Grand Lux.  I arrived later then normal for bfast and there was a line 8 deep during the week. I passed on the buffet and selected the ham and eggs. The ham steak was yummy and contained just the right amount of fat on the outside of the steak to give it an awesome flavor. The potatoes, scrambled eggs and English muffin were all excellent also.  My waitress was friendly and attentive and must say - I've never had a negative experience at the Grand Lux Cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jlZJhA3PyjJZQqCJ0nHhow.text: Wow, wow, wow.   I did not think this place was going to be good because of the horrible Cheesecake Factory in Plesanton, CA- they are sister companies.  However, I was comply wrong !!!  Vegas needs help out plesanton that's for sure!!   Their food is made  from scratch and it is obvious they care about what the customer wants.  Our server Kim made recommendations that were perfect for my BF and me!!  The food came quick and the atmosphere was delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xhCWPyJR7JpZfN0SCXHJrw.text: Came here during Halloween. The best PRO to this place is that is 24-Hours and that makes it convenient. The place is loud since it is on the edge of the casino and near elevators for the guest rooms.  Now to the food, it was good. Nothing out of the ordinary. I would go here again especially if I couldn't find anywhere else. It is a great go-to spot when you can't decide on anything or find availability elsewhere.

9w5l7vxd33LOL3VRDMWfXA.text: My review is based on just one visit. So, the 3 stars is based on the two dishes I ordered. With that being said, I'll be back here when I make it out here to Vegas again. It's a pretty large menu, and there's a lot more for me to try :)  Wait time was not long at all, though we had a party of 7. Service in the beginning was ok. We waited quite a while to get waters and the menu. But after our order was taken, everything was smooth sailing from there. Our waiter checked up on us quite often and didn't take long when we requested for things.   I ordered the clam chowder. It was really good. I didn't have to add salt or pepper or crackers either. It was so creamy and thick, and perfect for a hang over. Well, it worked for me ;p   The second dish I ordered was the Kobe meatballs. Comes with two. They were HUGE! As it being Kobe beef, my expectations were high. But, the meatballs did fall short. They were good, but could've been better. The meat could have used more seasoning. The marinara sauce that came with it was ok (kind of tasted like spaghetti sauce from a jar) and the cheese melted on top of the meatballs lacked taste. The portion was quite large, though. It's perfect for sharing!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe meatballs... Looked good, but did fall short -_-
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder... So good!

S2bFxo9Oc5ItzMOUV9UPXA.text: To start, the Mrs., ordered the: Pot Roast Cheese Fries - French fries topped with chunks of tender pot roast, smothered with gravy and creamy cheddar cheese sauce - $7.50.   I ordered the buffalo chicken bites - chicken breast, cheese and spicy buffalo sauce fried crisp with blue cheese - $6.95.  For dinner, the Mrs., order crab cakes which are served with mustard sauce - $13.50.   I ordered the shrimp scampi - sauteed with white wine, lemon, garlic, fresh tomato, basil, parsley and a touch of cream over pasta.   The buffalo chicken bites were stellar. They were really flavorful and the blue cheese sauce was nearly angelic and that's coming from a guy who doesn't particularly like blue cheese. The pot roast fries were equally good and we were happy to see that the restaurant was generous with the pot roast, which was quite tender.   I was disappointed with my first order of shrimp scampi, as quite a bit of the noodles were hard and stuck together. The waiter changed it with no problem. While I did get another fresh plate, it wasn't bursting with flavor like the shrimp scampi I had at their sister restaurant the Cheesecake Factory. The noodles and cream sauce was good, but the shrimp was a bit of a let down. They just seemed really bland. In my experience shrimp scampi can be pretty hit or miss. I'm guessing the seasoning of the shrimp lacked enough salt.   My wife really enjoyed the crab cakes and I love that we like to share, because I did as well. The outside was really crisp, but the filling was really cakey and you could taste the crab meat.   Service wasn't stellar, as there were a couple of hiccups with our drink order and silverware wasn't on the table to start, but that was quickly alleviated. What we did learn was that a lot of waiters here in Vegas don't hear the word "seltzer" when it asked for that type of water. When I said "soda" water, they knew what I meant. So I give my waiter a pass on that.  All in all, it was a good experience and the food was great with the exception of the shrimp scampi.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fs48JI1ZCeIZH_54KgifIw.text: You can't go wrong with the Grand Lux Cafe.  They have something for everyone and the portions are big.  I love that you can get breakfast at dinnertime!  On our last visit, we had everything from pasta to burgers to chinese chicken salad to scrambled eggs and toast.  All delicious and all reasonably priced.  Just curious to know if it's related to the Cheesecake Factory?  It sure looks like it!  We will be bake.

PZRzuKjaIntFmTeADFLj8Q.text: Food was great! Service from hostesses was HORRIBLE they were so rude ugh!! but JINE made it up for us! This lady is so nice! We told her we were in a rush to catch a pool party and she made sure we got our food FAST!  She also checked up on us multiple times and made sure we're having a great experience!   Thank you JINE! We will definitely be back!!

qsocA3Fh9RQ3SqXUKIINAA.text: Love this place for breakfast! Good buffet, waffles, pancakes. Oj and beignets to die for! The salmon & bagels are good too! Love the Egg Benedict. Casual but so yummy!

tVDhuWkLwMrvWbaxnWO4yQ.text: I ate here six times on my six night stay at the Palazzo. It's cheap, it's convenient, it's open late, and the portions are HUGE.  When I say huge, I mean HUGE (like you can have one portion for two meals huge).  I recommend the chicken and waffles as well as the pasta with sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms and chicken. In case you're wondering, they use witchcraft to get their chicken that moist - I asked.

ipFhxKszlwMf96Juypt49Q.text: Grand Lux Cafe gets 4 stars from me for the convenience and value.  Staying at the Palazzo, it doesn't get much easier than going downstairs for a meal.  Grand Lux is always busy, but they seem to keep things moving pretty quickly.  The menu has plenty of offerings.  The only thing I ordered that I really loved was the Calypso Mojito.  It was delicious!  Everything else we ordered was fine, just not something we would ever find ourselves thinking about or craving.  Portions are a good size and price is accordingly reasonable.  Although I will say the dinner price for kids meals was too high.  It was $11.  We went twice and both times our waiters were not good about checking on us, probably because this place stays so busy.

uarJUw26YwXfJ2Eo2N8k4w.text: This place is great! We were seated within 5 minutes on Christmas. The waiter we had was attentive and helpful. He was supposed to get off and another waitress was taking over but he stayed until our food came and made sure everything was right. The waitress was great too. My family shared our food with each other because it was so good! Their fetuccini alfredo and bistro steak were especially delicious. I will definitely come back here again whenever I'm in Vegas!

J-j3UYcytpB93TZnCrvN1Q.text: I ate here for breakfast twice while I was staying at the Palazzo. They have two Grand Lux Cafes, one at the Venetian and one at Palazzo. This review is obviously for the Palazzo. The Grand Lux is from the makers of the Cheesecake Factory. The decor, the outfits, even the to-go bag look just like the ones you would see at Cheesecake Factory, except the restaurant name has been changed. Also, the menu is just as big. I ordered the chicken and waffles one day and the scrambled eggs with hash browns on another day. Both were excellent. Waffle was crisp on the outside and nice and soft on the inside. It came with a maple syrup which wasn't too sweet, which is perfect for me. I don't like syrups that overpower the flavor of the waffle. The waffle was also topped with pecans. The chicken was not your ordinary chicken strips, it was very good, white meat chicken strips. Lightly season and breaded on the outside, fried to a crisp and very juicy on the inside. The salty and sweet combination of the chicken and waffles is an amazing combination. For those of you that haven't tried it, you might think it's crazy, and I did too, until you try it. Do yourself a favor and try it!  The second day I had scrambled eggs with hash browns, which comes with your choice of toast. The eggs were perfect, not too runny, not too dry. The hash browns were nice and crisp and not too oily. Both the waffle and eggs were pretty big too, very cheesecake-esque and although the meals are a bit pricey, it's a lot of food too.   We didn't have to wait more than 5 mins to get seated on either day. Day one was Friday morning at 8:30am, and Saturday was at 10am. The restaurant looks pretty big, so I think that helps alleviate congestion. The also offer an all you can eat buffet for breakfast, but I'm not a big eater in the morning, so I stuck to the menu.   I went to breakfast with my brother and he ordered the Continental Breakfast, which is for $8.95 and it comes with a bowl of assorted fruit pieces, a small croissant, 1 muffin and 1 danish. The croissant, muffin and danish look like something you would get at a gas station convenience store and also tasted that way. I would highly recommend that you stay away from the Continental Breakfast. He only chose it because it was free as part of his room rate. He was staying as part of an American Express Fine Hotels and Resort rate. Check out my pictures for prices on each item!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles $13.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Continental Breakfast $8.96. Included in Amex FHR rate

pTVvxSsEbS7pob8ZWBYkBw.text: Excellent service  Good breakfast buffet  Very similar to cheesecake factory

t2y9ejsYPdTjPNkIcfVd2Q.text: While staying at the Venetian, I went to the Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast. I tried the breakfast buffet they had available. It was pretty decent. There were eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, and various parties and fruits. They also had a omelette station.   I ordered an omelette with bacon, ham, sausage, and cheese. Additionally, I loaded up on bacon and pinapple making the buffet worth the price to me without feeling bloated.   The price of the buffet also came with a drink of choice.

ws51QcMq7i8QfxUmt2Migw.text: Was it good? I'm not quite positive... After a few free drinks, we decided to order to go and take it back to our room.   We got their Asian Nachos-  Crispy Fried Wontons Covered with Chicken in a Sweet-Hot Peanut Sauce and rice in the center. Topped with Wasabi Cream and Melted Cheese.. The rice sure made it an Asian Nachos... this was surprisingly tasty.    Fried Calamari- With Rock Shrimp, Zucchini and Onions. Served with Dipping Sauces, this was ok, kinda on the fishy side.   Food here was good, nothing special.. well for those two there wasn't, but I'll give them a try again next time with a few other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari With Rock Shrimp
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Nachos

XZKFAhD_AhJRO7w4YeCakg.text: The pasta was overcooked. Ambiance and food are both a notch down from the Venetian counterpart.

Exf69xAHPQUnysirE7jzBQ.text: I'm a huge fan of The Cheescake Factory and have been to the Grand Lux at The Venetian several times. We needed an appetizer and drink before The Jersey Boys show at Palazzo so we tried this location.   Great service. The waiter asked if we were going to the show so he was really quick with the drinks and food. Delicious Mai tai and martini.  The potstickers were large and delicious with a wonderful dipping sauce. A super fresh and tasty small chicken Cobb salad was passed between us as well.   This was a great convenient find.

YeyurXytihsBV41UysbhEA.text: Love their shrimp scampi and their cheesecake! Service is always very good! I come here all the time. I recommend everyone have a tea or coffee after the meal. Completes the whole meal!

JKSov6VY73_lJ13DxjMwMA.text: What can I say?  I adore Grand Lux...especially the Palazzo location.  When menus are as extensive as the one at Grand Lux, it can either be a good or bad thing.  Here, they do a wonderful job of maximizing a diverse variety of menu items, while still maintaining the highest standard of quality.  You can order anything from breakfast to Asian to Italian to American gourmet influenced meals. Some of my favorites include the Avocado Chipotle Burger and the Wild Mushroom Burger.  The atmosphere and decor is lovely.  High ceilings and a clean open feel make for a very pleasant ambiance.  The service has always been excellent each time I've been no matter how large our party was.  The best part is....you get all of that goodness for pretty reasonable prices.

ZYA19jKLbVpQL2Hdo0wLeg.text: This one doesn't open 24/7 but the one at the Venetian does.  I've been to Grand Lux almost every time that I'm in Vegas.  The service SUCKS - it's worst than Denny's.  BUT THE FOOD IS SO GOOD.   This past weekend, I found out that you can order your food to-go.  So bypass all that shitty service and just order it from the side cafe!  The food comes packed up; you still get your complementary table bread; and just take it up to the room and feast in private.    Anyway, the mashed potato spring rolls are a MUST.  And the pasta telefono is good too.

JuazsBfe81HgJJe50Z3fEQ.text: Please avoid ordering an omelette here. It looks like a styrofoam frisbee that's been folded in half (stuffed with your favorite diced meats and/or veggies). It tastes like styrofoam too because I don't think they use real eggs (eggs in a carton, fo sho). And the omelettes are steamed...yuck. I have visual evidence posted here for those who doubt me.   Other than that, they have decently priced food. The portions are big and you don't leave here still feeling hungry. I went here twice for lunch and I didn't have to wait in line at all. The service is polite, prompt, and accomodating. Overall, this restaurant is a good place to go to eat for convenience (if you're staying at The Palazzo) and decent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Styrofoam&#34; omelette

vEWVlW5T9C13XICsElmwBg.text: Confession: I'm in love with Grand Lux Cafe. In one trip to Vegas, I ate at Grand Lux four times. Oh the SHAAAAME!!! The shame of eating at and LIKING a chain restaurant, the SHAME!!  I kinda hate Cheesecake Factory's food. I feel like it's gone down over the years and the novelty's worn off. But Grand Lux's food..everything amuses me. Especially their chicken lettuce wraps. I don't like chicken much, definitely not lettuce, but man.  Reasons to jump on the Grand Lux bandwagon:  -chicken lettuce wraps -never a wait -they make me grilled cheese's when I'm drunk even though it's not on the menu -the one actual restaurant on the strip with good food that doesn't cost a paycheck -unlimited bread - short rib grilled cheese sandwich  Confession #2: One tme, when I was so hungover (still drunk) and alone in my room at the Palazzo I called down for takeout and ordered for myself fried calamari, salad, 1/2 sandwich and soup combo, and chicken lettuce wraps, all for less than $30. If there's a cure for the morning-after depression it's laying out a helluva lot of food on my hotel bed and lying down and resting whatever I'm eating on my tummy while I watch tv. BOOM. Sexiness reincarnated.

hPr2H1B5UFfUIjv9QgFFGA.text: Went for lunch.  Slow service, ordered the Cuban. The bread was so hard it could not be eaten.  It is not a "Cuban". There was no pressed bread, the meat was so dry it was like beef jersey.  Also it had a really hot relish.  This is just a mislabeled Menu item as it was not anything similar to a Cuban sandwich.  Decor reminded me of Cheesecake Factory.  Tea was good.

nOMXn32avqjd56AQojBuqQ.text: The food here is pretty consistently good and being open 24 hours definitely has it's benefits.  The service is hit-or-miss.  The specialty cocktails are my biggest gripe: they don't post the prices and they cost more than the food, so beware because it can be a bit of a shock  when the bill comes (particularly since they aren't anything "special").

tjCsajNwBpmbewizmx1xrA.text: Not bad for breakfast, but a little overpriced.   Extremely slow service - when I pay $5 for a cup of coffee I shouldn't have to keep asking for refills.   The Baja omelet and hash browns were very good!

_S7NWDwwqTo394EeG5D_1g.text: I've been here a couple times over the last couple years, including the one at the Venetian.  Went to this one more than once this past weekend. Never really ranked it as one of my favorite or go-to restaurants in Vegas, but it's definitely a favorite for my friends especially the Venetian one since it's open 24 hours.    I always thought of this place as a more expensive Cheesecake Factory.  In general, all of the salads are good here.  It wasn't until this weekend that I actually thought it was memorable enough to write about.  Why?  I discovered the Asian Chicken Nachos! SOOOOOOO Delicious. While eating this, I kept thinking... must write a yelp review.  Order this!

BZZ1f1jq1kdHW0njodD27Q.text: Yummy. I got the lunch special, which consisted 1/2 sandwich, a bowl of soup and a side salad. All the portions were small, but overall, it was a filling meal at ~$10.   I got the tuna sandwich, which was a lot smaller than I expected. Basically, it was a tiny piece of bread (what you would eat with bruschetta) with a small scoop of tuna salad on top.    The tortilla soup was yum. I liked that there was corn in it.  The waiter was extremely nice and busy!

0cMk_BzQkKjvkzbbMiiDaA.text: It's okay.... Generous servings, taste was good, but service was not.... Too busy and we were seated "outside" and it was super noisy as well.  For being in Vegas, it was kinda a bummer we didn't get what we paid for....

1vD6YD3VdMGltUJuyQQ8Pg.text: Dont know where to start.... Even their ice water is awesome ha Must say everythin there taste amazing! And the service is beyond great:)

cKZsXpypOqL-mo8cEBAl2w.text: You cannot go wrong at this place! Had an amazing burger that featured beef, short ribs, bacon and cheddar. On vacation, calories dont count! My buddies tried some of the other burgers on the menu and everyone loved their choices. Great food, fun place, pretty reasonable prices.

TKD37rRrcewN0IbhLrJd2A.text: The new Grand luxe cafe at the Palazzo is a little more updated and fancy.  I'm not sure if this location is also opened 24 hours but it's a definitely go to place to eat.  It's basicially the same as the Grand Luxe in Venetian (Check out the reviews there).  They have great service, food and is appealing to the eyes.  I haven't had anything I didn't like.  Portions and food are all the same as the original location.    Try their Seared Tuna Salad for the first time and it was delicious.  I usually come here and get their Reuben sandwich or one of their fishes.  They are definitely a place to eat if you're shopping at the Palazzo stop on by or come here before you go to Lavo.

eYG0cRyVF_gJCGqXsJ-5kw.text: Love Grand Lux. Corned beef hash is excellent.    One big problem during his visit was the Mrs found a hair in her fries. Waiter and manager handled it properly tho. Took it off our check and profusely apologized.   Desserts r fantastic.

Tm4xPbWKkGmJuc3vKhCkzw.text: The review is retro as I was reminded recently just how bitter I was about Grand Lux. We went there TWICE in our weekend trip and, for the life of me, I cannot fathom why. Vegas is the land of seafood buffets and supposedly *good* buffets in general. Yet, somehow, we ended up in Grand Lux. TWICE. So bitter.   The food was ... well, it was Grand Lux. It wasn't horrific, but it wasn't anything that you would remember or even think about a day later. Also, since the portions are unnecessarily huge (and, I assure you, you are paying for every ounce of it), we had leftovers so we jokingly asked the waiter if we could put it in the Grand Lux fridge. He said sure and that we could come back and get it later. Total fake-out.  We came back the next day and asked a different waiter for our food. He looked confused and told us that wasn't allowed at all (health violation?). So, I ask, First Waiter, why would you trick a bunch of tourists with promises of potential leftovers? That's just wrong. And mean. And I don't like Grand Lux. Go eat at a buffet. I heard the one at Rio was good, but I wouldn't know, because I was eating at Grand Lux *sob*

JEwM2jRgIEMNnR_vnbkxGQ.text: Discovered this restaurant in LA and found out this is where it originated! I LOVE this place! This restaurant in particular has a breakfast buffet. :) Just a little tip

sEY-OoOmzbjbgqiGI1-JWQ.text: Very good food and the breakfast buffet is nice for a hotel, but nothing special.

PZg6sxtcavWRg9uq1kka0w.text: Came here with the fam on our recent trip to vegas... we didn't want to do a buffet but couldn't decide on what else to eat.  Since we were already at the Venetian.. we decided WHY NOT! We were seated at their "patio" area that's basically on the casino floor (too smokey for our kids)  You can be asked to be seated inside the GIANT dinning room. The menu is very similar to the cheese cake factory (TCF) BECAUSE it is OWNED by them too! The complimentary bread was a crusty wheat different from TCF's two loaves. We ordered the caramel chicken, taste exactly the same as TCF. Kid's menu is exactly the same as well.    Ending to this story- if you want TCF on the strip come here! same portions, similar menu, it's a little less glamorous than the plethora of famous chef establishments but it's a sure thing for a modest price.

tGgJcWb-gnDF5PYakmBHhg.text: Great casual place. Huge portions.  YUM.  We loved the breakfast here...wonderful scrambled eggs that were not over done. Tasty hash browns. Crunchy wheat toast. Potent and fresh tasting mimosa. Kid loved the banana pancakes. Good service with good coffee...sure beats room service for a short walk down.

fFCbG-cECVvp8x7ae3FuDQ.text: This place is average at best! How can so many people give it 4 stars? The chicken I had here was overly seasoned.

GC5I1rNhW-Nn4XjX7b660A.text: YUMMMMMMM. I love almost everything i've had here, and it's all delicious and reasonably priced! Very big portions too, so you always leave here stuffed with leftovers for the post-clubbing drunken munching! =)

aJ6qVHpTHQgvhF8GHwFweA.text: simply AMAZING.  great food at excellent prices.  we had a $100 food credit, and we ordered a ton and only made it to $85.  our server was patient and fast.  went last Friday around 4pm and it wasn't too crowded.  we ordered 3 apps, sliders, quesadilla, and brie wontons.  all were very good.  for entrees, I got a small salad and their rustic cheese pizza.  YUM!  my dad got some Kobe beef thing, which he loved.  my hubby got chicken pot pie, which was HUGE and very good.  we will be back, if we are in the Palazzo again.

7pGzzezy8HCldwdpE3Gf-g.text: I'm in Vegas for the MMS 2012 conference.  It's weird because I'm usually here with a group of people.  For this week, I'm on my own.  Left to my own resolve and no agenda whatsoever.  WooHoo!!  I saw the Grand Lux Cafe in the in-room publications for the hotel and saw that they had a miso glazed salmon which I totally missed from The Cheesecake Factory (miso glazed SESAME salmon).  Those were the days.  So I ordered it up along with a Jack and Coke.  That was what caused the one star reduction in my rating.  Too much Coke and not enough Jack.  :)  Not too many people in the place during lunch.  Granted it was 3:30PM when I got there and there are obviously other places to eat but whatever, they all missed out.  The salmon was prepared perfectly.  Moist enough to flake off at the slightest touch from my fork.  When it met my taste buds, it was like they were old friends getting reacquainted again for the first time...they just melted into each other.  The perfect amount of miso glaze topped off the experience but it didn't end because there was another forkful on it's way.  The filet was a very generous portion and by the end of the meal, I was stuffed.  I opted for the brown rice which was perfect.  The usual nuttiness didn't accompany the rice.  I've had this before at home.  It was a jasmine brown rice which, judging by the size of the grain, it seemed this was jasmine or a member of the same family.  The meal also included stir fry vegetables which were awesome.  Lately I've been in a veggie mood so I'm not sure if this influenced my experience.  Whatever it was, the veggie medley was perfect.  Yellow and red bell peppers, sugar pea snaps, edamame, onions, shitake mushrooms stirred up to perfection!  Make it a point to get here when you get to Sin City and can't decide where of the thousands of choices you have to eat.

Jo4DufS-eRaLAVwt_PM86w.text: Great food, but the whole place needs an update.  Loved the staff though!

4zF1YAl9W9w7pqzJ8RWBIw.text: Average brunch fair with runny scrambled eggs, greasy bacon, but a good omelette. Poor and crowded buffet layout. For the price? Ha. You're better off heading down the street to Denny's.

xyL7Lc3d_GHQFf2HBgbU0A.text: Consistently good food, open al day and fast service... what more can you ask for while staying here at the Venetian???

fX3JDnQOTS8M6RF6tr70Uw.text: My husband and I wanted to grab a quick yet filling breakfast before flying out. We arrived about 10:00am on a Wed morning and had no wait at all. The menu has lots of breakfast options as well as a breakfast buffet. The prices are very reasonable considering it's located inside the Palazzo. We both ordered the biscuits and gravy and it was delish!!! And being from the south and making homemade sausage gravy myself, I can say it was the real deal!!  Our total bill was only about $35. We were able to get in and out in about 45 mins. My only regret is that we found this restaurant on our last day in Vegas!

JU3GondA-xppTbDVdbSHjA.text: Really excellent food from the creators of the Cheesecake Factory.  Actually, I like this more and wish they had more locations or would put some of this food on the Cheesecake Factory menu...like the shaking beef.  Went here 3 times in 3 days, couldn't get enough.  The best part....no queue like the CF, walk right in.  Watch out for the portions though...huge, and yummy.

HqyRjY9yUR2-YRrOa1h_vg.text: apparently a friend of mine said that this was a chain that is a part of the Cheesecake Factory franchise. after partying hard for NYE at Surrender in Encore...we shuffled over to the Palazzo to get some late night grub. i felt bad for the waitresses since most of our party were completely wasted and two of them spilled their water all over the floor...LOL.  i ordered the mini sliders, which were presented nicely and were quite tasty. i was honestly too drunk to really enjoy the atmosphere, but found the place quite chill and accommodating...even for our rowdy party.

-1KKsBKC4lkAlA2sSkaQbA.text: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL.  Let me preface by saying I have eaten at both Grand Lux Cafes and I will NEVER go to this one again. This is purely based on service.  My friend and I went there around 8pm on a Monday night. Not busy at all. We were seated right away. Then we waited 10 minutes for our waiter. He came, didn't introduce himself (is that a Vegas thing? I've realized not that many people do that...), and took our drink orders. My friend ordered a Sprite, and I ordered a berry fizz.  Yes, I realize that it does not take the same amount of time to make a berry fizz as it is to order a Sprite. However, I wasn't expecting the waiter to bring out my friend's Sprite, and then 5 minutes later have my berry fizz come up at the counter, and then watch my berry fizz sit at the counter for a good 15 minutes before he picked it up and brought it to my table. I would have asked him earlier, but he was too consumed watching Sportscenter highlights.  I wasn't eating, but my friend ordered the pot roast. He said it was ok.  Our waiter never checked in on us during our meal, and finally brought us the bill after forever. We learned then that his name was Scott. So Scott, if you're reading this, me and the table next to us thought you were fucking awful.  In the future, I will go to the Venetian and deal with the drunks there before ever going back to the one at the Palazzo ever again.

z7asFozgK5a6mPcAdRPAng.text: This is suppose to be an eggs Benedict, not well done eggs after they screwed my order up twice! And they did nothing for me. The guy took my order wrong inside and I talked to a guy manager after... Three orders later and 45 min later my order comes over cooked again.... Thank you chef.  The worst service from manager.  There was a girl manager who was nice after I called but the guy manager was just an airhead totally oblivious to what was going on. Not happy

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bad

aCwcEdgZzDgoV9O37RQ1YQ.text: Went to the breakfast buffet on a Sunday for $25. Omelette was good, but thats it. Was sorely disappointed by the lack of variety. Pay. Just a little bit more, and get a lot more bang for your buck. I don't eat much meat, so my options were extremely limited. There are so many other better choices in Vegas.

qJzeWen7KlGRznwcKhqzjA.text: Great service, nice atmosphere, and good food. The portions are large enough to share with another. Large menu selections.

Ig9e0MQJ7s-fTJrqCKQwkA.text: If I could only eat at one place in Vegas....Grand Lux just might be that one place! We dined at some very "high end" places on this trip and they all paled in comparison to GLC in quality, food choices, service, ambiance and of course pricing! This is one of the best places to eat on the strip where you can fill your stomach and not break your bank!  I ordered the turkey club which quite possibly was one of the best ones I have ever had in my life! I had a side of fries, and ordered the sandwich with avocado! They were so delicious, fresh and hot!   My whole meal was under $30 and I ordered a sandwich with avocado, a mimosa and a dozen of the chocolate chip pecan cookies to go! That is a deal anywhere let alone Vegas! Can't wait for the next trip so we can dine there again! I just wish they had them in California!

yjkzX9haCklFDfrWp1MIJg.text: So I remember going to this place a long time ago and thought it was only okay, but my friend convinced me that it was yummy and that I should return.  This location had no wait on a sunday afternoon and we were seated right away in the corner of the restaurant. Although we were tucked away in the back corner, the server did not forget about us and attended to us immediately. WARNING: portions are big! The three of us ordered three appetizers and three entrees... lets just say we were extremely full and food coma-ing for awhile..   Appetizers: Asian Nachos- Who even thinks of this stuff! crispy wonton chips with chicken, wasabi cream, cheese, and sweet hot peanut sauce with fried rice in the middle. I don't know if these were made for asians or something but damn were these good! The slight hint of wasabi cream really added to the nachos, and adding the fried rice on top of the chip was super asian and delicious.  Brie Wonton with creamy brie cheese, fresh pineapple, and caramelized onion marmalade- this was okay, i expected better. I didn't taste the pineapple in the wonton, and they left the rind on the brie so the taste was kind of bitter. Sauce was good.  Crispy Pepperoni Mini Pizza- they added parmesan slices on top which really added to the pizza in terms of texture and and flavor. Other than that, regular pepperoni pizza.  Entrees: Lunch special salad and pasta carbonara- the pasta was bomb. Yeah you can make pasta at home but the bacon bits, chicken and cheese was super flavorful and tasty. The noodles were also cooked well.   Housemade Pierogies- Pierogies are basically potato dumplings which they made by hand, and they added roasted short rib with mushrooms and onions. Yum. Yeah pierogies are plain and heavy and basic, but it's good comfort food and perfect after a long night.   Avocado Chipotle Cheeseburger- this thing was giant. I asked for medium rare and mushrooms instead of peppers, and it was a giant stacked burger. The cheese was melted all over the place (perfectly) and the meat was cooked the way I wanted it. The avocados were chopped (I expected it to be in slices) and it kept falling all over the place. Really messy dish, but good burger and good fries.   Overall this restaurant is perfect as a heavy lunch or dinner. Definitely exceeded my expectations from what I had last time (which I don't really remember). Total came out to be $71, which is pretty fair as we did order a lot of food.. Would definitely come if staying at Palazzo or Venetian after a long night.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos and crispy mini pepperoni pizza
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House made pierogies, Brie wontons, pasta carbonara, avocado chipotle burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stacked.. So hard to eat!

9h8zXZOZujbMteNS5auN7w.text: Absolutely love love love the beignets! Hubby had the warm yellow cake that was very good. Save room for dessert!

MkssyQaRUKI6p9VvO3_YTg.text: I had the Lemon Chicken Piccata for dinner and it was probably the best chicken piccata I have ever had in my life.  It had artichoke hearts and mushrooms in the most delicate and delicious lemon sauce with capers.  My friend had the Jambalaya with chicken and shrimp and it was also extremely good.  We both substituted steamed spinach for the pasta and that was fresh and steamed perfectly, still very green.  I also ate breakfast at the same restaurant and it was equally delicious.

s-gTf7eP8hTuvw_NSphYNw.text: Grand Luxe always comes through for us! The service was exceptional and the food was great! We look forward to returning in the future.

kthGew9_B3OyWtgHktHhXA.text: What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, right? Well, I'm definitely not keeping my love affair with Grand Lux Cafe a secret! Every time I'm in Vegas, I HAVE to dine here or at the Venetian location since they're opened 24/7... It just depends on what time I finish drinking and dancing at the club! They also have a take out mini-shop on the side if you'd rather dine in the comfort of your hotel room.  Pasta With Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella is my go to dish. It's a huge plate of deliciousness - whether you're sober or drunk! If only I could make this dish myself...  Sorry, Chris Brown. This girl is loyal! ;)

KOLrlamqIq4oTQ-YlIKNwA.text: This is a great place to eat for lunch. There's usually a short wait for the times we have been there. The menu is huge and have just about everything for everyone.  I ordered the chicken and waffles. It was great. The waffle is light and airy. Chicken is fried chicken, but that maple sauce is so delicious!! It's not just regular maple sauce. Ask for extra!   My wife had a breakfast entree. The usual eggs, hash browns and bacon. Cant mess that up.   We noticed that some people were going to a buffet inside the restaurant. We overheard when they sat the table next to us that they had that. The lady never mentioned that to us however. I think they need to be better about that. Also , the front hostess wasn't the friendliest. She barely looked at us and seemed like she hated her job. Thats not so great for the first person you encounter when you walk into the place. Middle aged lady with her hair tied back. Didn't get her name, but she was working lunch this past Saturday.   Other than that, this place is good. Fast to sit, a whole variety to decide from and easy for lunch.

tsb880Wm_WbgMSXNrck37g.text: Large portions with complimentary bread.  Beware, Asian nachos (app) is on the salty side and the Cuban sandwich (main) was dry as the Sahara dessert.

6KbhWiI2KludvwbE2-gY7w.text: My gf and I returned to Las Vegas Cafe for our second trip. We had eaten here once before and enjoyed the meal. This trip we ate here 3 times because we found that the restaurant really lives up to its guidelines of fresh ingredients, extensive menu, and good prices.  The restaurant is very large, seats up to 728 people, but is divided into 3 areas: street cafe, bar area and main dining room, and the main dining room has a high ceiling, but is well designed so not truly "noisy". They do designate non-smoking areas, which seems to help. It is owned and run by the Cheesecake Factory, but is elegant in its design. Although I have not been to the Cheesecake Factory, it is my understanding that the menu is rather different than that of the Factory.  It is located on the same floor as the casino in the Venetian and is open 24/7. There is a breakfast menu, lunch dinner menu, and late night menu, the latter which, for obvious reasons, is smaller than the main menu, but still quite good.  The portions are substantial, so we were able to order one salad and one entree and split them and feel adequately fed. The ingredients were extremely fresh and flavors were understated.  I consider this restaurant a True gem of a find in Las Vegas.

N9NR47Um93jhvOAifXNDNg.text: I ordered a grilled chicken and avocado salad from their lunch special menu and their portions were hugeeee. The staff were friendly, the restaurant itself was beautiful.

Qz0Cbxkj_qsdgqKD05vlQw.text: I was here for a work dinner with a very large group (over 300), and we had the entire establishment rented out for about four hours. The waitstaff were very available to hand out beer, wine and water, and were friendly for the most part. We had a buffet instead of a prix fixe menu, and the food was decent, although not amazing. The meat carving station was the only part that really stood out to me- it was fantastic. The salad was also above average in tastiness.   This rating is completely based off of my experience as a part of a very large group here; I have not visited and ordered on my own. I do know this place is owned by the same company as the Cheesecake Factory, and the menu is very similar. In general I'm a cheesecake factory fan, although I think the menu is too large.   I might change my rating if I pay this place a visit on my own, but for now I'm going to go with A-OK as my experience here.

OaQX2ZBPC4dHIo6jhupsrA.text: This restaurant is basically The Cheesecake Factory just with a different name.  It was decent for a "chain" and pretty much dead on a Tuesday night around 7:30pm.  I was expecting it to be a lot busier.  We were a party of 6, 4 adults and 2 kids.  The bread basket was good, I think I prefer it to CF.  A rustic sourdough, although the butter wasn't softened.  They also carry coke products   I don't eat beef and my most favorite turkey burger is the turkey burger from the Cheesecake Factory.  So, I ordered it here, and it didn't disappoint.  The bread they serve it on isn't really conducive to the burger( its long and rustic), so I just removed it and enjoyed the burger.  Very moist, tasty turkey burger.  Served with fries and not that many of them too.   We had lettuce wraps and ceviche as an appetizer.  I didn't taste the latter, but the lettuce wraps are similar to the wraps at PF Changs.  Not the same lettuce wraps as CF.   My friend had the kobe meatballs and she raved about it.  Her son had a filet mignon and not one morsel was left on the plate.  Another son had a kids cheese pizza.  Not much to say about that.  Friends husband had the caramel chicken and he seemed to enjoy it.  They liked their alcoholic drinks.   Service was pleasant and not too overbearing.  A good solid choice for a hotel, especially if you don't want to taxi it someplace else.

0Bn7XzdZ1Sb1sjGCSTb1eg.text: I like the Grand Lux Cafe.  The menu is extensive and you can spend a good ten minutes deciding what to order.  The food is good and the portions are generous.  Some favorites of mine: Sunday Night Pasta Creamy Chicken Vegetable Soup Fried Chicken with Yukon Gold Potatoes Cheesecake (ala Cheesecake Factory)  Because the restaurant is in the casino of the Palazzo, it's very convenient for hotel guests and players to grab a bite.  The waiting time to get a table is usually short because of the large dining room.  Speaking of the dining room, it is one of the nicer ones I've seen because of all the marble, polished stone and metal they use in the design.  Service is generally good.  The server will check on you at least a couple times during your meal.  Drink refill service is hit or miss depending on your server.

n3VHuByc2g-_Av_Qbcjivg.text: I came here for lunch on a Sunday and it was busy. We didn't wait to long to get a table. The waitress didn't automatically give bread instead we had to ask for it.  She seem quite busy with other tables and found time to refill on my Coke. The wood fire bbq burger and fries were tasty and juicy. My only wish they have different ice tea flavors.

pRj6GXuU_ki26QSdvTBKXg.text: Compared to everything else here, the prices are pretty reasonable. Good service and casual atmosphere, the big portions and generous menu choices make this place an easy pick if you're stuck and can't decide on a place.  I would recommend the Mediterranean Mahi Mahi and the Shrimp Scampi.  For drinks the smoothies are sure to fill your sweet tooth and fruity cravings. I really like the Mango Swirl Also, this place is open 24 hours and is conveniently located in both Venetian and Palazzo. Would definitely recommend!

89oCa1hQYUZ-q46xTJd1Zg.text: Grand Luxe Cafe is a Cheesecake Factory all dressed up and located off the casino floor at the Palazzo. Now I've never actually been to a Cheesecake Factory, but perhaps I should try one sometime. This certainly isn't the most obvious choice for dining with all the world class Vegas restaurants nearby. But for me, after 12-15 hour days on my feet running around the event floor, this is my go to dinner spot. It's located not far from the guest room elevators (less walking!) they have a nice bar it's easy to tuck into a corner and enjoy a drink, and they have an excellent take out menu so I can hobble back upstairs and relax in my suite.   My favorite items here are the chicken lettuce wraps, and the beet and goat cheese salad. The menu is overwhelming in options-pizzas, pastas, burgers, breakfast, and can't forget the dessert. While I wish my job hours and energy level allowed me to venture out for some of those famous Vegas restaurants, I am always happy to get fast service, reliable food, and retreat to my room to enjoy.

nq9Z-z4eKtUWqH38s4d8uw.text: Looking for a place to grab some top notch grub?  this is it...late night or afternoon this place has the food that will sit right for whatever your looking for.....  there chicken fried steak is awesome

m7HBynUjsZEraESQkcc0iA.text: To be fair, I wasn't very hungry. I just needed something in my stomach for the night to come. And I wanted something small.   Some reviewers have said this place is like Cheesecake Factory. of vegas. And pretty much yea. nothing spectacular on the menu, but they do have everything. pasta, pizza, asian-ish noodles, etcetc. Given that I'm not a huge Cheesecake fan...yea.  I ordered the Crispy Thai Shrimp and Chicken Spring Rolls. For some reason I thought it would be spring rolls..with crispy shrimp inside..but no...it was an egg roll. with mushy shrimp and chicken inside. I liked the sweet sauce, and how it came with lettuce and carrots. But other than that...pretty pricey for some egg rolls...  My friend got the Crispy Sesame Tofu. She didn't like it. I tasted it and didnt really like it either. The sauce was...very strange. Had a tangy citrus-y taste, but also a little wasabi-ish spiciness...all with the look and consistency and sweetness of teriyaki sauce.  Zen noodle = pho.   Pizza: looked ok. I think pastas might be the safest bet...those in my party who got your standard pasta were pretty happy.    Willing to give this place another try though! chicken and waffles sound amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Thai Shrimp and Chicken Spring Rolls

PmAVkr-VUv_S9wub7LB98A.text: So we went to the Grand Luxe Cafe here in the Palazzo hotel for breakfast. The food and everything was great! We had the beignets which is always spot on and so delicious!^^ I think that was the best point out of this experience. However our waitress, Brendida T(?), she did not make this experience as great. The service was the only problem. She seemed mad or irritated. While she was taking our order (party of 6) and when my mom would ask questions about the menu (since we never had breakfast here before), she was very rude and cutting my mom off when she was talking and she took the menu away from me when I was looking at it still and she rudely pointed for the menu next to my sister for me to hand to her! Later when my mom asked for a couple of cups of coffee for my grandmothers and aunt, she yelled at my mom when asking if we wanted cream when my mom couldn't hear (accident)! This was the (first) worst experience...

-E3UQorXuUggyA-ts1T4ZA.text: My boyfriend and I wanted to go somewhere nice for dinner on the strip without spending a few 100 dollars.   We had never been to the Palazzo so we decided to check it out. When we noticed they had a Grand Lux, we were pretty excited.  Small tangent: We both work at the Cheesecake Factory and hear about the Grand Lux all the time but this was our first chance to check it out.   Although similar to CCF, there were some key differences that we appreciated. Being a server and bartender, we tend to be more aware/sympathetic when we dine out.  On this occasion, we had nothing to comment on except for how amazing the service really was. Our server, Nick, made us feel comfortable the entire time, made suggestions, and notified us of all the specials.   Back to the experience:  We were seated promptly to a nice quite booth in the back. Nick greeted us right away but allowed us a little more time after telling about the specials and baked desserts.  I decided to have the Clemetine Crush and my boyfriend had the Blood Orange Mojito. Both were delicious but we were excited that the Mojito had a floater of our fave rum, Sailor Jerry.   For an appetizer we decided to try the Asian nachos which we thought sounded original and interesting. And they did not disappoint! They were full of flavor with the right mix of spicy and sweet. The peanut sauce was amazing and the wontons were nice and crispy. Definitely a new favorite of mine for sure.  For dinner, we decided to split the Pasta Pomodore with the chicken meatballs. This was also delicious. The bread was warm and fresh.  We were sad that we didn't have room for dessert but it will be something to look forward to next time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Pomodore with Chicken Meatballs
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Nachos
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blood Orange Mojito

K11pWEiiQ2Xswfn-rnXTUw.text: Deliciously delicious!  I love their spinach and artichoke dip, drive in burger, egg white omelet, spicy calamari  salad, edamame, chicken and waffles, and the bread.   Best place to eat brunch, lunch, dinner, and very late night dinner. Service is awesome!   BUT they close at 3 a.m. The one at the Venetian is 24 hours.  It's like Cheesecake Factory but I like Grand Lux more.

oBQ3X7JbIRfyKXj_xgYl3w.text: Excellent service, great wine list, and giant portions of very well prepared food! I ordered the wedge salad off the "small salads" section and it was enough to feed four people!!! I also order the lasagna - which is prepared in a non traditional way, with grilled chicken, spinach, mushrooms and a savory cream sauce. Yum yum. The menu has everything from fried chicken and pot pie to pasta and hamburgers... Price is decent considering the atmosphere and food quality!!

keC2ekMS74obmlG_f763OA.text: I really like how I can come downstairs and just get food to go and eat back in my hotel room. With the exception of the wait, of course. For some reason they take 30 minutes to complete a to go order. All I ordered was a simple burger.  I got the Max Burger. For approximately $15 dollars, it better be a darn good burger. And yes it was. The cheese was ooey gooey and the bacon was a great addition to it! I was really shocked by how large it was. It was huge! I had no idea how I was going to finish this and then get into my clubbing clothes without looking bloated. Maybe next time I will just opt for a salad, the portion for that looked pretty generous too. But anyway, the burger will definitely satisfy any hunger or craving you have. The fries were perfectly cooked and seasoned. And I love the sauce that it comes with!

vfBgLEoY5hHapftmHFEjtg.text: Enjoyed out BBQ ribs, tender and fell off the bone.  The sides coleslaw and amazing corn bread were an added plus.  So good we returned for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ ribs

SLfqEmdDteXxJUZtGtGTzA.text: The buffalo chicken bites were AMAZING. I also had a salad of which the chicken was a packaged chicken which was not good. I had to ask for a fresh grilled piece like on my friends salad. Otherwise our server was super sweet and excellent.

DwYprEWazIN01_ZDMvVnhA.text: Giant portions. An appetizer is the size of two entree big. But the vibe is great and the food is solid. We had the Asian nachos (good) and the buffalo rolls (very good). Would love to come back when I am man v food hungry.

lNodiUJ44Fe9k2DEBe0ciw.text: The food here is amazing. Impeccably amazing. The first time I had cerviche was here and I love it. It's the best appetizer I've had in such a long time. The pasta and sandwiches are so good here. The staff is super friendly. The only exception is the host or maybe she was just having a bad day. I don't know. She had a bit of an attitude but the good outweighs that.

i72187_xHfxMJ1EfHsZtUw.text: I have eaten here three times in the recent past because I prefer to stay at the Palazzo when I visit Las Vegas.  The ONLY reason this restaurant gets anything above a 1 star is because the food is pretty darn good.  I've had their Korean short rib tacos, tuna ceviche, chicken wraps, various entrees...everything is very good.  Then what's the problem???  THE SERVICE SUCKS.  My most recent stay was the worst.  Stephanie was our waitress.  I honestly think I knew more about their menu than she did.  I asked her what gluten free options there were and she didn't know.  I asked her if she had grilled shrimp, she said I can order fried shrimp and not have them fry it in breading.  (Uh, what?)  I asked if she can make the salmon piccata without the sauce and she said they can just cook a chicken breast with no seasonings and sauce.  (What?  I just asked you about salmon, but you're telling me to eat chicken?)  Then I asked her if I could use the rice noodles in their "Zen" noodle dish with a butter, cheese or cream sauce for the kiddo, and she said I could use Spaghettini or Fettuchini instead.  (What?  I'm trying to order gluten-free!)  So needless to say, all we got were french fries for the kiddo.  Yeah...because she didn't know if anything on the menu was gluten free or not, nor could she tell us if the kitchen could make anything gluten free except a season-less, sauce-less chicken breast.  Sounds tasty.  (roll-eyes)  Anyway, when I was ordering food, I pointed to the Korean short rib tacos and said I would like to order the Korean short-rib tacos.  They bring out Mexican chicken tacos.  Um...  Then it takes them forever and a half to get us the right order, despite "the manager" putting a rush on it.  "The manager" never stopped by to say a word to us.  Then as we are trying to leave, we had finished all our food and we're flagging her down, and it takes her about 15 minutes AFTER we were done eating for her to bring us the check.  Then it takes her another 15 minutes to come back to take payment.  So basically 30 minutes of our lives were wasted for no apparent reason.  Worst waitress ever.  She reminded me of Phoebe from "Friends."  P.S. We overheard her taking the order of the people behind us.  They asked her what sodas they had that were caffine-free.  She said, "um, Coke Zero? We also have iced tea."  Really?  BOTH of her recommendations had caffeine in them.

uHgfdSJZjl2jWKg9DTfUsw.text: HOLY Chicken Parm!!!  This thing is outstanding and HUGE!   We all snagged bites of it when it showed up at the table. I'd go back just to attempt to tackle this thing!  We went for appies and drinks before hitting the tables. Our waiter was very nice but kept messing things up.  But we weren't' in a rush so it was no big deal.  My friend got the Reuben and didn't like hers. I got the lettuce wraps they were just OK in my book, I didn't even eat half of 'em. Sliders looked pretty good.  Drinks were good.  Shots were better.

iWoIiHBtj2lddIr6-lwxJg.text: I'm not the biggest fan of Cheesecake Factory, so when I heard Grand Lux is from the same people, I was a little hesistant. After lounging by the pool in the morning (don't know how people spend so much time out there, it gets boring... and sleepy), we were starving for some lunch since we didn't really eat any breakfast. We decided to check this place out.  Decor is immediately recognizable, a bit of an upscale version of Cheesecake. No lines, so we were seated immediately. I was in the breakfast/brunch mood, so I opted for the corned beef hash while my wife had the seafood salad. When the food arrived, my eyes widened. I was happy that the large prices corresponded with large portions.  I had requested that my hash browns and corned beef to be extra crispy, and it didn't disappoint. The corned beef was plentiful, in toothsome but tender chunks that complimented the fluffy scrambled eggs. The crispy texture of the hash browns was a nice contrast. All I needed was a few dashes of ketchup and I was good. I wiped the plate clean.  I had a few bites of my wife's seafood salad and it was pretty good. Everything is nicely lined up and cut up into uniform pieces. There was a good amount of seafood chunks. Service was prompt and easy going, and we were in and out of there after finishing our food. I would definitely return if I'm in the area and in the mood for some American comfort food with an upscale twist. 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash, scrambled eggs, and extra crispy hash browns

27USz6YFkcUNsWMpezQTig.text: One of my fav 24 hour cafes in Vegas.  My go to item on the menu: Buffalo Chicken rolls.  YUM.  They have a vast selection of eats on their late night menu... so you might have trouble deciding.

Kwri0tBBR4hnM94V67Fwmg.text: This was the go to place for our trip.. breakfast lunch or dinner.. prices can be a bit high but when you taste the quality.. it is totally worth it!

vDep8h0K3brw49HF2ONwOw.text: For a Vegas Buffet, it is awful! It is $20 for what you would get at a Holiday Inn with a free breakfast coupon. Don't bother waiting on line order poolside and relax for same price.

TXz5cQEZh2v85qjdkKeSjg.text: We've been here three times and were consistently served with fresh and delicious food. The beet avocado citrus salad is to die for as well as their minibite fried calamari. Great pizza and pasta. The restaurant staff are very professional, the wait staff in particular they are very attentive.

6l-9ffFTlookd07Bg10ktA.text: I had a full day at the convention center so I was hungry and this place is convenient. My feet didn't feel like walking far for food and being a chain you know the experience should be predictably good.  The server handed me a card with some additional items on it. The potato pierogi with short ribs, mushrooms and onions immediately caught my eye. But, alas, the server informed me they were out. They make them from scratch and once they're out, they're out. So I ordered a gnocchi dish. But they were out of that too.  I finally settled on the Sicilian pasta which the server assured me was available. It had chunks of Italian sausage. I could tell the sausage was made from scratch because I kept getting fennel seeds stuck in my teeth. OK, Grand Lux, with the Sicilian pasta you made up for teasing this Polish lad with pierogi.

zI7CN1CqxpSb1chYEbvtuQ.text: After having terrible experiences at several "fine dining" restaurants on our Vegas trip, we were thrilled to have wonderful service and great food at Grand Lux Cafe.  We wanted a convenient and relatively inexpensive meal before our red eye flight home.  We had a wonderful, attentive, friendly waiter.     My husband and I each order the cream of chicken soup and a salad - the wedge for me, which is considered a "small" salad though it is literally half of a head of lettuce, and my husband had the roasted beet salad.  Everything was very good and came out quickly.    The waiter had alerted us to their made-to-order desserts when we first arrived, so we order the beignets.  The were amazing!  The came out super hot with three dipping sauces - raspberry, chocolate, and creme anglaise (maybe with bourbon in it?).  There were so many beignets!  I ended up over eating because they were so good I just couldn't help myself.  The server (also friendly) who delivered our dessert recommended mixing the sauces and boy was she right - the raspberry and chocolate together were to die for.    This was also the only time on our entire trip that a manger stopped by our table to see how things were.  We made sure to tell him what a wonderful job our waiter had done and how happy we were after having bad service at so many "fine dining" restaurants previously in the week.  He was also very nice.   The entire meal (with drinks) ended up being $70 (with an almost 30% tip), money well spent!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. delicious beignets
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;small&#34; wedge salad

iFtttjUd6YzYRJoJuMZtYw.text: This place is always open and always serving the same thing, which is anything that you want to eat. The menu scales down late at night, but the choices are still crazy. I've never really been impressed with the Buffett, but everything ordered off the menu has been tasty and huge. Just keep in mind that this sister restaurant to the Cheesecake Factory is just about as healthy. So, not really.  The salmon three ways is my favorite and their cocktails are strong and huge. Oh, and if the Grand Lux at the Palazzo is too busy you can walk over to the other one at the Venetian.

d_qlb-VJiW2ZNpiRD3cfrA.text: After a night of fun at the clubs or on the tables gambling, the Grand Lux Cafe hits the spot. I usually get here during the early hours of the morning, before heading back to my room. They have ample choices on their breakfast menu but I strongly recommend the Breakfast Buffet, I always get the custom made omelet, just the way I like it. I simply pair it with the Mimosas and it's a perfect end to a fantastic night in Vegas. You might run into a celebrity here... you never know!

f6zuOK20DIKF4xmgON3l3A.text: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night.  Arrived at 6pm, there were 12 of us and did not have to wait.   Clean restaurant.  Definitely has the Cheesecake Factory feel. Our waiter (can't remember his name) was very courteous.  The menu is so extensive.  So much to choose from.  I ordered the scampi and chicken parmesan and the shrimp scampi was in this garlic/butter sauce which was so good. The kids ordered the upscale mac n cheese which they did not like (I guess they prefer EasyMac).   Wanted to try the beignets since it got good reviews and only at the Palazzo location, not the Venetian location The beignets did not disappoint.  There were about 8 big ones and comes with 3 sauces - chocolate, vanilla, and raspberry.  The vanilla sauce was the best.   Would definitely come back here again.

uf0Oj7jnoSH056QsN5y3Bw.text: Great Sunday brunch menu. Super selection, delicious food.

dPLXFkcQtrvQqGU9Z-pdjA.text: My friend and I decided to get a drink after watching Jersey Boys.  The staff was very accommodating when he requested a booth even though that area of the restaurant wasn't open.  So we ordered wine and ended up getting a vegetable flat bread for some late night munchies.  It was yummy.  Of course at the end of the night you can't NOT order some cheesecake.  :)

KQ6QSV18yODMazb12J1OrQ.text: Grand Lux Cafe is in the casino at the Venetian, or the Palazzo... I am not sure, technically, where it is located... anyway, I really liked this place. The ambiance is nice- not fancy, but not casual, but somewhere in the middle, the service is good and the food is pretty good, as well. They have a varied menu with all kinds of dishes including pastas, salads, sandwiches, omelets and some "world" dishes like jambalayas, enchiladas and stir-fries. It's a pretty straightforward, simple menu and the prices are all very reasonable. I would recommend the Grand Lux for breakfast or for lunch, but for dinner you may want to go somewhere else.

-fJ2LPvfDYega1uiKWcQGg.text: Went here for a snack and grabbed the potato spring rolls. They were pretty good. They were filled with cheese, sour cream and god knows what else. Pretty much a baked potato in spring roll form. They were good. Nom nom nom.

x61YkkaVCJb3PLpNg8UhDw.text: If you like Cheesecake Factory you will love this place. From what were told the owners of CF also own this. It wasn't quite as expensive and the menu was great. The buffalo chicken rolls were great as an appetizer. I had the carmel chicken and my wife had greek salad. As you probably know CF portions are HUGE and this place was just the same. We sat on the "patio" which is really just out in the middle of the Venetian. It's crazy and very loud, but what do you expect in Vegas.

9EKYBBmlhTACvYm8a9ji6Q.text: Affordable dining on the strip, especially for the Palazzo hotel. We were surprised at how big and cheap the meals were. Service is good (our waiter one night was David T. and he was as good as they come). Great for big groups, they'll get you in & out real quick so you can get back to losing your money in the casino!

J8Mjpnii1g0WELUome-9tw.text: This place is awesome. I'm upset that we only got to go here once during our trip to Vegas. The food is amazing, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the location in the Palazzo can't be beat.  We ordered the Sunday Night Pasta and the Jambalaya. The pasta sounded like a strange combination (braised beef and pasta), but it was amazing and the Jambalaya was the best I've ever tasted. The portion sizes are enormous so you definitely wont leave hungry, and for the price (about $15/person), you can't find a much better place to eat on the strip.  The wait staff is extra friendly and always seem to come by at just the right times so you never really have to wait long for refills or anything like that. Definitely recommended, wish they would open one up near where I live so I wouldn't have to go to Vegas to eat here.

6c22n6aDsiBUcJep4lyIiA.text: Philly cheese-steak springrolls!!!  Even better at 2 in the morning.

2XVr2Dc5i7nAdMgQueBHNQ.text: I was in the Palazzo and figured I'd stop by the newest Grand Lux for a lunch before skipping town. I ordered the Burger Max and replaced the fries with sweet potato. The service was a little below average but the food was great. The Burger Max is a big burger (10 oz?) with bacon, cheddar cheese, and short ribs. They cooked the burger perfectly, which is nice because most places won't do a medium-rare burger despite it being a scientifically proven fact that medium-rare is the only way to consume a burger for maximum taste. The burger was amazing. I'd easily put it in my top 10 burgers of all-time. And even though the thing will probably cost me several days of my life, I don't regret eating it at all and would do it many times over again. The sweet potato mash was pretty tasty as well (although I had actually ordered sweet potato FRIES). Food was a 5. Service was a 3. Overall 4.

ODsM6-_BvHt6-cqNylJn7g.text: A little oasis of sanity in the surreal world of Vegas. Offers a full takeoit menu, a real plus in this town - sometimes you just don't want to sit in a cliche casino restaurant. Service was quick, cheerful and I got 15 minutes of peace, waiting on my soup and salad. Food is always good at Grand Lux (my personal favorite is just off the Magnificent Mile in Chicago). Prices are very reasonable - normal entree pricing ranging from 10 to 25+. Skip the "name" joints, go to Grand Lux for good food that's not going to break the budget

wxt0YkGn9hNV1MbuDjt8EA.text: This place is great! This was our 2nd time and we sat in the bar again. There food selection is great, and there portions are HUGE. We split 2 appetizers and we were full! Customer service tonight wasn't that great but we will definitely go back.

pHzRP8kaZJcqi2vJzrm61g.text: Breakfast at the bar really works. Service can be a bit slow but the quality is very good. Would rate it higher if they left the coffee pot at your table. Gotta keep an eye out for the server to get a refill. They have an ample breakfast buffet plus a menu with many options. Price point is reasonable. This GLC has a more attractive atmosphere than the one in the Venetian.

2jh1ChyKwT88RBw7NZY92g.text: I think we ate here 3 times while staying at the Palazzo!.  It was good and the portions were big. So worht the money.  I've been to other more "big name" resturants and the food and service didnt come close to this place.   I do Agree with the other osters, The mashed potatoes spring rolls are AWESOME!! we had them the first night there after a long flight and painful shuttle ride.  The and teh calamari/vegtables.  It was all soo good and enought to share.  Breakfast was also great. 2Eggs, bacon, toast and hasbrowns for 9.99! very good and too much to finish. I aslo went there for my bday dinner with my 8 friends and had a great time, our waiter(tim) was so sweet and funny.  the birthday decorations they did on my dessert was really nice and the recommendations he gave were right on. LOVED the Snitzel!   And its a plust that they are open late, or 24 hours right next door.

jCiqop0umNwDkZI8aI0r3A.text: Want a late night snack at 3am?  Feel like breakfast after you get up at 1pm?  This is your place.  Always dependable.  Never had an issue with the food here.

VYs1xJei9t6ujQbk-If4DQ.text: We ate here because it was the only thing open after our show. I was very surprised at the quality. I had the Vietnamese Lemongrass noodles and the wife had the mushroom burger. We eat at Vietnamese restaurants frequently and this had some of the best flavor I have ever had. Definitely worth going again.

WReRW5EaDNAPBC6OeqBImA.text: if you like Cheesecake Factory, this is def your spot.  the drinks are ok and the food is ok.

DDP2CazMkLDDBgN5GNQfiQ.text: If you like The Cheesecake Factory, then you'll like the Grand Lux.  The hours are great, the menu is huge, and the food is tasty.  It wouldn't be my first choice among strip restaurants, but still a good option.

jIwowicvsGMfGV1rhwhd_w.text: The bread served at the table was good: crunchy crust and tasty. The lentil soup is excellent (a bit strong on the black pepper). My wife enjoyed her Santa Barbara chicken sandwich: chicken, bacon, and avocado.  Good food, good service, good value.
